The high point in the film for me was when Hemsworth speaks in Bangla asking for evidence, "Promaan Dao" (show me the evidence, for those who didn't know), not once but thrice stunning the original captors and the dumb struck audience - I am almost certain that the looks on our faces would have mirrored those he was addressing on screen. Well, after a couple of hours of mayhem Ovi is indeed rescued but not before almost everyone dies. The film gets full marks for the fight fest and zero for anyone's acting - actually no one needed to act. Shataf Figar makes his presence felt inadequate small role of a sniper in Dhaka.
Some solid acting all around. Great combat scenes, mostly one on ones, Why kidnap the kid when father is in prison? But who needs a solid story when you have action scenes galore! Great city scenes!

reviews.review_title: Bangladesh is not a violent country.
reviews.content: This Film represent Bangladesh as a violent, drug mafia its totally misleading. i don't know why, as a director or story writer you should more research about Dhaka/Bangladesh.

Ok, I usually don't write film reviews, but I kinda had to come down to this after watching this horrible film.This film lacked any real storyline. It failed to draw audience attention INTO the film. The action parts were great I'd say, but what good is a film without a proper storyline and gross misrepresentation of the site itself? The plot looked to me as though it was 1960 or something like that. They couldn't have made Dhaka look dirtier. Needless to mention how ridiculous Bangla accent was. I couldn't even differentiate whether the actors were speaking Bangla or Hindi because their accent was pretty much same.

reviews.review_title: Awesome plot line and AWESOME ACTION SCENES
reviews.content: It is one of the best action movies i have seen since 2019. And for those that are saying the plot was weak they are talking out of their asses. For once the plot is not about a mercenary contract that has to do with war, this has to do more with organised crime.And i trully hope there is a sequel for this movie because Tylers story is something to behold in awe if developed correctly, it could make the greatest action flick since taken.

Chris Hemsworth to the rescue! An action packed film taking place in India that looks and feels like a shooter video game. The legions of heavily armed yet easily killed enemies, the switch from shooting to stabbing to sniping to reckless driving that seems to happen to everybody at the same time, the evil mastermind, the henchmen and you, the killer of dozens, saving the life of a kid. It's a nice action film, but completely pointless otherwise.Bottom line: I am glad that after 20 years from Way of the Gun they rediscovered how to do shooting scenes. As an action film it's a success. Don't look for anything above that.

Look mate ... bangladesh is not kolkata .... here in each and every household we dont play hindi songs like you showed ... and dont get me started on the accent ... we dont talk in that accent dude.... thats kolkata accent .... also you couldnt have make the roads much more dirtier could you ? ...... just making some banners and some of our police dress doesn't make it bangladesh ........ you have shown a gangster of dhaka ... well gangster of dhaka doesnt live in old town . the only reference you have of bangladesh ... trust me ..... not offended or something.... just the cast of this movie have previously been in films where attention to details was a big matter ...... just one consultant from bangladesh would have clearerd out the problems ....... expectation was much higher

As a mainly Hollywood/English movie fan, this movie took me by surprise. This was by far one of the best action movies I've seen in a very long time.
Of course, what could go wrong when Chris Hemsworth is on the scene. Chris simply nailed it, and not to forget the young Indian actor Rudhraksh Jaiswal and the more experienced actor Randeep Hooda who both did not fail to deliver.
The end was really emotional and brought me down in tears.
Overall amazing performance by all and every single moment of the movie was intense and I did not feel board or fall asleep even once.
I would have given it a 10/10 if only all the action scenes were realistic, but of course it's only a movie so you would have to expect at least a few out of the ordinary scenes. LoL

reviews.review_title: Finally, an original Netflix film is good enough to sit through
reviews.content:
My two favorite actor in Chris Harmsworth, and Randeep Hooda shines in this film with the great support from Golshifteh Darshanik and Rudraksh Jaiswal, even Priyanshu Painyulli was decent, I am saying decent because I've seen him do better. Action sequences are just the way they are supposed to be although one can say there's nothing new in the story, because there's enough source material go make a film like just by watching Die Hard series, but it doesn't affect the film but instead helped it cause the audience have felt the same emotions before too.
Watch it for the well crafted Acton sequences, and all the bloodflow if you are a fan of it.

reviews.review_title: Zero Plot, Very Average Action : Absolutely Mundane
reviews.content: There's no proper story, the action is below average. Stooped low by targeting too high, trying to get a John Wick kind of feel but failed miserably.

reviews.review_title: Very violent, and yet so sensetive
reviews.content:
I cried my eyes out at the end.
I think the biggest statment of this movie is about children- boyhood to be exact, and the moment it ends.
I steared my eyes away from the screen in the rough patches, and loved the underlayer of it all. Some will enjoy the former, alone no doubt.

There are times in a man's life when a straight-to-video / -Netflix / -Redbox action drama is just what the doctor ordered. This poor-man's John Wick is a sweaty, adrenaline-fueled adventure-thriller full of male bravado (and admittedly a heap of white-savior complexions). Forgettable? Sure, but something this easily accessible and simply engaging is always a welcome distraction...if nothing else, it's hard to deny the action, especially that one chase scene.

Extraction is an action thriller film directed by Sam Hargrave. The film stars Chris Hemsworth, Rudhraksh Jaiswal, Randeep Hooda, Golshifteh Farahani, Pankaj Tripath, Priyanshu i and David Harbour.A fearless black market mercenary, embarks on the most deadly extraction of his career when he's enlisted to rescue the kidnapped son of an imprisoned international crime lord.To summarize this film in short, high octane action thriller with minimal plot followed by fast paced screenplay.As mentioned the plot of the film is very simple but terrific action scenes and superfast screenplay of the film will keep you engaged to the film through out.Acting is superb and Chris Hemsworth was spot on with his character. He did the job perfectly. Randeep Hooda an Indian talent was also spot on, Rudhraksh Jaiswal was impressive. Wished Pankaj Tripathi and Priyanshu Painyuli could've got more screentime.Overall a decent action filled film and if you are a lover of hardcore action film then this is a must watch for you.
Great action movie. Cam angles and scene plots provide great action scenes

The story has no depth but is interesting and keeps you hooked up to the end. Worth watching for sure.Excellent acting.Typical new era movie that you need subtitles to be able to understand the dialogue, even with the best sound system at high volume.I don't usually write reviews... But there are some truly amazing scenes in this movie.I can not express how much I hate the "shaky" action camera in movies. I hate it so much that when I see shaky camera I say: Bye bye next movie, I'm not watching this.However in this movie, whoever edited those scenes and especially the car chase scenes, should be awarded a Nobel price for reinventing how to edit scenes like those. Truly amazing.

reviews.review_title: Bollywood meets Hollywood in a bullet ridden, pyrotechnically elaborate, action flick......
reviews.content: Extraction is an interesting proposition. Maybe its not the first time but certainly its one of the more notable times, where Bollywood and Hollywood collaborate, on what is, a functional action flick."Extraction" has lots of points of comparison but probably the most obvious is military action series "Strike Back". A Sky series that's been a roaring success. Why? Because this film, like the series, adhere's to its military action formula.This is a simple film, that's essentially a well rehearsed and choreographed, mercenary "run and gun" affair. Its exposition driven, frenetic and pyrotechnically elaborate.Its back story is basic too yet still has enough heart felt moments to actually be touching. Better still, it makes no effort to over moralise. Really there are no perfect outcomes, as is typically the way, in the world we all live in.Decent acting and solid cast choices from the East and West, round things out.A simple but entertaining winner.8/10 from me.

If its action and violence you're looking for, look no further. This movie features plenty of both. Yes, the story is far-fetched and predictable, but execution-wise it's better than most movies in the particular genre. And Chris Hemsworth is very good in the lead role. All things considered, it's a pretty decent movie.

reviews.review_title: Great action movie. Wish they could do sequal
reviews.content:
Sam Hargrave made an excellent movie with his Stunt Man experience. the action scenes in the movie puts you in your seat pretty tense. i didnt realized i was squeezing my fist during the non-stop car chase - fight scenes. you will understand the reason when you will watch. just that scene enough for me to increase couple of stars
Chris Hemsworth did a great job and his action scenes were great. he gave a new nice breath of action character. and it was great to see Randeep Hooda catching up with him. they really made a great rival team.
i cant explain how great the movie was better go watch. you wont believe how fast the movie will pass

reviews.review_title: The last scene is worth staying tuned to the end
reviews.content: I enjoyed the movie. Pay no attention to the negative Indian, Bengali (wherever) and Bangladeshi comments. You can't do anything right with them anyway. They always give their own movies 10 points for that. I always give points for new interesting original locations. Great actors. A bit underwhelming. I give them an extra point for the penultimate final scene. It was worthy of James Bond. Minus point for starting with a scene from the end. Netflix has had that since Breaking Bad. I always find it annoying. That's when you don't want to shoot a firecracker entry. But I still like to keep going.

Extraction has an unrealistic but acceptable plot, a few decent characters, lots of enjoyable fight scenes, ok visual effects, and a solid pace throughout. There is a bit of handheld shaky cam, which is a shame, but otherwise the cinematography was fine. Chris Hemsworth put on a good performance, the rest of the acting was reasonable, the hand to hand combat was well done, and the soundtrack was pleasant. The plot is what lets this film down, and ultimately it is a generic type of action movie. If you have Netflix, then this is worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: Chris Hemsworth action movie? I am in.
reviews.content: I can't turn up a chance to watch a film with Chris Hemsworth in it. The movie is enjoyable as long as I turned off the logical part of the mind and just enjoyed it for its fast pace action sequences. But I might have enjoyed it more if they ironed out the inconsistencies. The plot is meh but if Bruce Willis and Arnold were considered for the part, then I can understand the choices made. Hemsworth, for what is worth, definitely lifts this movie much higher than it would have been without him. Some of the CGI was good but some of it was pretty bad too. Mixed bag.Conclusion: It's worth a watch but don't have great expectations.

A good action thriller film. Action is the main usp of this film. Story is simple and can be described in only one word "EXTRACTION".Go watch it on Netflix. Waiting for the second instalment of the series.

reviews.review_title: Extraction is the right dose of medicine to get out of Lockdown blues. Go for it
reviews.content:
Cinema halls are shut down, movie shootings has been stalled while the upcoming action flicks like No Time To Die, F9 and Top Gun have been
postpone due to COVID-19 impact across the globe. At this time, the only saviour is digital platforms like Netflix which aired its one
of the most anticipated film, Extraction, at least during this lock down period. I just completed watching Chris Hemsworth and Randeep Hooda
starrer and felt a real action flick has arrived that will pump up your adrenaline especially on Friday evening.Extraction tells the story of Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth) who is a dreaded mercenary and supposed to rescue the son of warlord in Mumbai
from clutches of his competitor in Bangladesh. The rescue operation goes haywire when he is interrupted by unknown intruders.From the Avengers directors Russo brothers - Anthony and Joe Russo (who also wrote the Graphic novel "Ciudad", on which film is based),
Extraction is directed by Sam Hargrave who has done the stunts in some 80 films, including the Marvel super heroes flicks like Avengers : Endgame
and Avengers : Infinity WarThe movie starts with a bang as Tyler Rake goes all the possible way the moment rescue operations initiates. Tyler he faces the goons where he fights with knives and guns which is brilliantly choreographed followed by an eye-popping car chase scene as Tyler drives through the busy streets of Dhaka.
I would like to highlight that this probably one of the best car chase scenes which an outstanding camera work. The street-fight between Randeep Hooda is another spectacular treat to watch out as both actors does well in the hand combat.If you think this is enough, hold on as there is a high-octane climax scene with jaw-dropping stunts. The movie traverses through a wafer-thin plot and yet
manages to keep you on the edge of seat with some of best stunts. Screenplay does falter in few places but I will not complain as Extraction kept me glued to the screen for 1 hour 56 mins.This is a movie for those people who love action films and should be respected as each and every choreography is worth clapping. The movie goes very
well with electrifying background score. Art direction is superb while Cinematography is wonderful, especially during the action scenes.
Writing by Joe Russo is engaging and does not let blink your eye for a minute.Tyler Rake could only be played by one and the only Chris Hemsworth. The actor not only emotes well with his expression but is
fantabulous with his hand combat and action stunts. I loved Randeep Hooda as he brings in spark once he enters the scenes. Rudhraksh Jaiswal
and Golshifteh Farahani were good in their part while Pankaj Tripathi has one just scene in the film.Overall, if you are in need for some kick-ass action film, Extraction is the right dose for you. Electrifying 3.5/5

Easily meets the Jason Bourne level of fight choreograph - some of it is stunning.Nice story and copious amount of action, blood and guts replete with some extremely good camerawork.If its action you are after then look no further - top drawer entertainment!

reviews.review_title: Actor Rndeep Houda a very talented & verstile indian Actor impressed once again
reviews.content: Loved this series sooo amazing ,but best part was Randeep houda in this series he act awesome hope he got lot of work as he deserve & yes pankaj tirpthi was Awesom too

reviews.review_title: Basically a balls-to-the-wall Modern Warfare mission
reviews.content: To put it bluntly, this is some of the best action from any movie in recent memory. There's a ten minute-plus seemingly one-shot action sequence that is absolutely outstanding. The fights are so brutal and each more creative than the last. John Wick showed that having stunt coordinators direct action movies could be a winning formula. Extraction is another example of this as the Russo Brothers hired their Avengers stunt coordinator for this project. It's lacking the sleekness of John Wick, but goes in a different direction with a raw, gritty approach to action and a real Call of Duty vibe. Chris Hemsworth is great and this is easily one of his best performances outside of Thor. The story is pretty by-the-numbers, but Extraction's incredible action makes this a worthwhile watch.
It was graphic but made me feel like I was playing call of duty! All in all an intriguing movie with tons of action.
Kinda had a Korean super action movie type of feel to it. Some scenes were over the top and I still wonder how he avoided getting gun residue on him. Worth a watch again at some point.

Extraction
18
2020
Director: Sam Hargrave
Starring: Chris Hemsworth, David Harbour, Rudhraksh Jaiswal, Randeep Hooda, Pankaj Tripathi etc
Overall rating 92/100Extraction is based on a black-market Mercenary called Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth) who must go on his riskiest extraction yet where he has to save a young boy from two feuding gangs. I thought Extraction was excellent and there is so many good things to talk about so let's get started.First of all, the cinematography/visual creativity and set pieces were fantastic. Having the film set in India was a really interesting choice for an action movie and for me it really worked. The cramped streets were perfect for action sequences and the temples being beautiful to look at which is something that directors of action don't usually do. The film's cinematography and visual creativity was fantastic as well, the rich colours of yellow and orange were fantastic and the camera work was also excellent with the camera following the characters through some of the scenes and in the car chase scenes which created a great effect making you feel like you are in the movie with them.My next positives would be the film's tense tone, gore, and incredible action. The film managed to execute an excellent tense tone throughout, with the film managing to even make you jump on multiple occasions due to it's deliberate lack of sound making you on the edge of your seat for a large portion of the movie. The film's gore and action for me was some of the best parts of the movie. Due to the film's constant nonstop action you were consistently entertained throughout and never bored, the variety of different action scenes and the creativity within them were as good as John Wick without a doubt. And the excessive use of gore was fantastic as well and added to the impact of the action scenes with even me having to look away on a couple of occasions.My Only two nit-picks with the movie for me would be the lack of character background and the slight lack of depth to the plot. The film just went straight into the action in the beginning without any background information on the main character which I always find slightly annoying, we learned more as the movie went on, but it's always nice if you feel partly connected to the character before the action kicks in. And the movie did suffer from a slight lack of depth to it's plot, this is largely because the movie largely went for style over substance which fortunately for the movie is fine and perfectly acceptable, but it was very much one objective throughout leading to an end you were largely expecting so it would have been nice if they added a few more layers to the movie.My next two positives would be the character depth and the director not being afraid to cross near the line with child gang members. The movie went into a surprising amount of character depth with Chris Hemsworth's character that I wasn't expecting. His whole background of losing his son at a young age was truly heart-breaking, but it also made you understand his character more by how much he was willing to sacrifice in order to save the child that he became connected to, so this was well done. The director also was not afraid to cross near the line with use of kids in gangs. It was shocking to me how many of the kids were in the street gangs, but it also portrayed a more realistic portrayal of what gang culture looks like which I found interesting. The fact that the film was so willing to kill off the children was also shocking but made you dislike the antagonists more therefore doing a successful job.My final two positives would be the film's excellent performances and emotional weight. Chris Hemsworth was excellent in Extraction. He pulled of all the action sequences excellently which as an audience was well aware due to the marvel cinematic universe. But he really got his moment to shine here, but he also showed versatility with his acting as well with his characters more sensitive side. The debut performance (at least for me) of Rudhraksh Jaiswal was exceptionally good as well considering he is a much younger actor. The movie also had a surprising amount of emotional weight which I was not expecting as well, When Tyler opened up about losing his son it got to me emotionally which was a welcome surprise, and the fact that he saw his son in the kid really showed after he sacrificed himself to save him which I thought was powerfully executed, also with a clever link back to the beginning with the underwater scene with the kid at the end becoming like Tyler.Overall despite perhaps not having as deep of a plot as it could have had. Extraction is an excellent movie, with excellent creativity with its action and visuals, excellent performances and the blending of action and large amounts of emotion which is rarely used and was executed excellently proving that Chris Hemsworth definitely has an acting life outside marvel.

reviews.review_title: A generic kidnap and rescue story kept involving by its well shot action scenes and consistent performance by its main star
reviews.content: Extraction is an action thriller film based on the graphic novel "Ciudad" by Ande Parks. Starring Chris Hemsworth in the lead role and directed by stunt coordinator Sam Hargrave, it is a generic kidnap and rescue story kept involving by its well shot action scenes and consistent performance by its main star.In Mumbai, India, Ovi Mahajan Jr (Rudhraksh Jaiswal), the son of a notorious Indian drug lord, is kidnapped and held to ransom by a group of gangsters working for Amir Asif (Priyanshu Painyuli), Bangladesh's most ruthless drug kingpin, and brought to the capital city of Dhaka. As Ovi's father is currently in prison, he is unable to properly pay the ransom and time is running out over whether or not Ovi will be brought home in one piece. To ensure Ovi's safe return, former soldier and black market mercenary Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth) is recruited to travel to Dhaka to extract Ovi from his kidnappers and navigate through the dangerous city with Amir's gang and corrupt police officers hot on their tails.While this genre isn't anything new, Extraction still proves that with the right amount of creative action and star power, there is still some entertainment value to be had. The story follows the typical plot line of an important individual being kidnapped and a tough macho protagonist attempting to rescue said individual. Cliched and silly? Yes, but if that's what you enjoy, then this is for you. The strong violence and gore will certainly be off-putting to casual audiences, but for the most part I think it looked stylised in the vein of the graphic novel from which it was based. With that said, some of it did feel excessive at times and served little purpose other than for sensationalistic action scenes involving the two main characters. In terms of the screenplay, some it felt confusing near the beginning as it didn't do that good of a job establishing the differences between the Indian and Bangladeshi characters to the viewer. We are shown that there is something of a rivalry amidst the two countries involving their drug empires but it isn't really communicated that clearly how severe it is over the course of the film. Also, we see how some of the police forces in each country are in cahoots with the drug lords as they have been bribed to work in their favour but they only really show up in one or two scenes and aren't ever mentioned again. This felt like a missed opportunity to offer a commentary on police corruption but instead it was brushed aside for some more action.Stunt coordinator Sam Hargrave, making his directorial debut, showcases his talents for cleverly choreographed fight scenes and single take shots that keep the viewer on edge. There were parts where I was reminded of some the action-packed moments depicted in the John Wick films, in that the lead character made good use of the surrounding environment to take out his adversaries, even using simple everyday objects as weapons. He also shows how claustrophobic the densely populated cities of India and Bangladesh can be when trying to maneuver through the large number of people to get to where one is going, especially if you're being pursued by dangerous gang members. I still think he has a long way to go before he can be taken seriously as a storyteller, but he has certainly nailed the action and cinematography side of things.Chris Hemsworth plays his usual badass action hero self, shooting, stabbing and punching his way through a seemingly endless number of foes. At this point, it's pretty much confirmed that this is the only type of role he is capable of playing but still, if it ain't broke. I particularly liked his scenes with the young Ovi Jr and how he becomes something of a father figure to him throughout the course of film. There is a nice back and forth dynamic between the two, clearly reflecting on Hemsworth's personal love of India and its people. Unfortunately his interactions with the rest of the cast felt lacking, save for a scene or two with David Harbour, who plays an old army acquaintance of his. These were the only parts of the film that offer some kind of emotional connection with the audience, as the rest is merely bullets flying and things being blown up.As I mentioned earlier, this film offers nothing new from the kidnap and rescue genre but a great deal of its appeal comes from the action rather than the story. Reportedly, there is a sequel in development and although I don't really see this whole thing becoming a franchise, I think it does provide an opportunity for further world building and the ironing out of some this film's issues. If you have nothing better to watch on Netflix, then there's not much else to say but sit back and enjoy this for what it is.I rate it 6.5/10

Literally non stop action very decent watch. The fight scenes were very fun to watch, the camera work wasn't the best at times but i got over it. I'm Abit annoyed at the ending though when the kid came up out the pool and someone guy is standing there couldn't they have just shown whether it was him or not would've been a lot better if they did.

With new movies few and far between at the moment we have to take them when we get them and there is a new film from Netflix starring Chris Hemsworth called Extraction and here is my review for the film. The premise of the film sees a special agent sent into Bangledesh to rescue a gangsters son from his rival.Main Character
As mentioned above Chris Hemsworth is the main character in this film and he does a really good job. He is great in the action scenes, he is believable and is probably only second to John Wick in terms of his action skills, it is just really entertaining to see him go through multiple enemies and kill them in pretty gruesome ways. His character takes some time to be developed but he has enough depth to him to make you care and you do understand his motivations towards the end of the film.Supporting Characters
David Harbour is probably the most recognisable supporting actor and he does a good job with the limited screen time he has, I bought into his character and Hemsworth's having a relationship and it worked. There is also a character called Saju who is hunting Hemsworth and he is like a Terminator in the action scenes taking down everybody in his path and he has a bit of character depth aswell. Unfortunatley though I didn't care about the boy as much as you are clearly meant to and I thought the villain of the film was incredibly basic and really had nothing interesting about him.Story
The best parts of the story are some of the arcs that the characters have, they develop nicely and you understand their motivations, I also thought the ending of the film was well done and left you guessing as to what could come next. Though as you can probably tell from the premise this film has a very basic plot and one that you have seen plenty of times and it does very little to make you think you have seen anything new.Script
The script has some heartful moments to it and some well done dramatic moments but it doesn't have anything that reall stands out to it. Plus a film like this doesn't really have any humour which may have been better at times to help humanise Hemsworth and other characters.Style
The style of the film is awesome, the action scenes are pretty incredible. They are really well filmed and well choreographed, every hit feels brutal and seeing the inventive ways that people are killed is a joy to see. As mentioned it can be a bit gruesome but I thought it worked for the film an allowed them to be more creative, also it was nice to see Bangledesh used as the backdrop as it provided some unique action sequences.Overall
Overall, this is a good action film, if you want to see Hemsworth take out tonnes of guys then this is a film for you, it doesn't do anything to stand out too much but is an enjoyable film for sure.Rating - 7/10.

"Extraction" is a well made movie and a perfect one to watch at summer. Another great action movie produced by Netflix that people should watch this summer and have fun. This movie draws a lot of inspiration from other movies like: The Bodyguard, Mile 22, 3:10 to yuma and etc. All these movies have the same features: the relationship between two very different characters and delivering a "package". Extraction has the same features as well, only it is done in a perfect way and without flaws. The relationship between Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth) and the target Ovi is intense and draws the attention, most of their scenes together are good and create the sort of drama this film has. One of the most memorable sequences of the film is the 11 minute action sequence throughout the movie that looks like it's a one - shot. No cuts but just a full one shot sequence that is perfection with a lot of camera movements and scenery. I think I might watch the movie again just for that sequence. Chris Hemsworth is good as always, not only as a professional assassin but also in giving a real acting performance. I highly recommend for those who love action and there is plenty so enjoy.

Trails of the sands. Secrets of the women. In ancient Somalia a cat climbs a ladder with thousands of tiny steps that leads up a tree and then into a soul field. Just the other day i saw a watermelon in the middle of the road waiting to be seen. Took a good glance, said hi.
This is pretty much exactly like you'd expect. The action is frequent and good. I won't remember this movie at all though.

Decent plot,amazing music specially at the climax felt intense,great acting it was impressive by chris and randeep. the most amazing thing is action it was skeptical to watch the fast paced hand combats between saju and tyler,the snipping at the end,the little chase in street in that camera moments were amazing,the whole climax was great and that satisfying,The blow at last in washroom was awesomely satisfying.overall amazing entertaining movie!
Plot is very bad, except the main character everyone's acting is terrible. Just some random shooting through out the movie.

reviews.review_title: Afterall, there is such a thing as selfless relationships and sacrifices
reviews.content:
What worked:
It's a beautifully crafted movie with commendable cinematography, good action sequences and beautifully visualized South Asian countries. The movie is fresh in regard to its location although the theme may not be so much unheard or unseen of. Chris fits the role effortlessly, Randeep playing a supporting role is fresh and interesting. It's an engaging action movie with some fine long shots and enjoyable action sequences
What did not work:
Even if the movie ended with showing the lead actor( not wanting to spoil the movie) visually, it would have worked as well. One thing that is not bad for the eyes but less convincing is the idea of one man army destroying the army effortlessly. It's one of those movies
Final verdict: recommended

reviews.review_title: Kickass Action Movie! Ignore the negative comments here
reviews.content:
Just finished watching this bloody hell of a action movie! Loved it. Throughly enjoyed the movie, not a boring moment.
Ignore all the negative comments here from all the sore Bangladeshis here, not a realistic take on the actual merit of the movie. Moviemaker did not make a movie for Bangladesh, it was just a background for the story setting. Don't you dice the movie to even insult Indians or Bollywood, we are way bigger and ahead than you.
Technically the movie is brilliant, especially the continuous action sequence in the 1st 30 minutes. Chris Hemsworth has acted well, the stunts are realistic and Randeep Hooda deserves a mention too.
Watch the movie if you are a sucker for action movies, this one is one of the best action movies with latest techniques lately. Cheers!
Just an excuse to make action sequences. They aren't that bad but nothing special either. What a waste.
You could write the plot of this movie on 2 pages, it's 85% action and 15% story.Well photographed and the stunt work is excellent.
I had high expectations from this one. But it turned out to be a dull affair. Story is boring and execution is terrible. Heavily disappointed.
It wasn't John wick or anything but Hemsworth and cast delivered and it was good to see hopper! Well done Netflix you've finallly figured out how to make a quality action movie

reviews.review_title: Delivers what it promised in the trailer
reviews.content:
Extraction felt to me like Donald Trump. What was promised in the trailer, was more or less delivered in the film. And the purists be damned.There is relentless action. I didn't count but I believe Hemsworth would have slayed 200+ soldiers in the 100 minute run time. The action set pieces are designed to blow you away. There is one in particular, a 10 minute long, one - shot sequence that should make watching this worth your while.The story is as long as it's IMDb summary. There is nothing more to it. It is meant to appeal to the lowest common denominator and that it does in almost every frame.Hemsworth doesn't have much to do, in the acting department. He has to sling a machine gun or draw a knife and kill/maim every living being, be it a boy or a man, that he comes across.
Randeep Hooda gets a surprisingly long bit and does as good as he can.There would be detractors who would cry about the lack of aesthetics and a deep storyline, about big wasteful budget. But, that is what was promised in the trailer and that is what it delivers in dollops.If you are in the mood for mindless action, look no further.
Don't listen anyone.. just watch and give see how good this is....

Extraction gives exactly what you expect- nonstop action with chris hemsworth in his thor zone without hammer but guns. Action scenes are well choreographed though violent. But the story is nothing new, scenes are predictable and lacks logic. For example, a dreaded don is very easily killed in a bathroom. Randeep hooda's double crossing is also not convincing. But if these things don't bother you, then you can enjoy extraction as a timepass film.

reviews.review_title: killing half of that country's POLICE. to save the kid whose father killing others.
reviews.content: Good action movie, good performance and really good action production quality. But.. killing half of Bangladesh police? seems illogical . if this movie is mexico or any other country , then maybe they will use drug cartel members or goons, but presenting Bangladesh WHOLE police?.. thats ,low.

10 put of 10! Fantastic non stop action from start to finish! A must watch. This show deserves a higher rating than what it has. Chris Hemsworth delivers exceptional action fight scenes. Definitely worth watching.

reviews.review_title: Brain dead plot surrounding rock-solid action
reviews.content: This film made me finally understand that achieving mindless action that is actually entertaining is a skill. Even if you shut your brain off to enjoy the exciting shots and punches thrown, you will eventually wipe the drool away and realize that the plot is ridiculous. The character motivations turn from questionable to directly contradictory. The protagonists clearly become the bad guys, but not in a way that feels like the director wants you to think they are the bad guys. I am surprised Russo wrote this screen play and even more surprised that he let it materialize. Great action though.
Non stop gunfights, he probably has a higher body count than Rambo.Action and fight scenes are well done but they are just too over the top

This movie is an non-stop action one.The story is simple: the son of a druglord (behind bars) is abducted by a rival druglord. Mercenaries try to rescue him but are cheated of the money. Now a whole city is trying to kill the last merc and the boy.Of course the action is over the top. A single merc would be dead within minutes....a single white merc in an Indian city would even get close to the target. Also hey, how many spare rounds did he take? And with so many shootings and explosions the sky would be swarmed with Network helis.Anyway it is fun to watch and the only downer is....well the boy.... I wouldn't mind if he was killed in the first minute.

reviews.review_title: I just can't stand lack of realism in this movie.
reviews.content:
This movie is ridiculous in many aspects but how the hell one guy is able to kill 100+ people is beyond my understanding. Sometimes he fights with 4 armored people and they can't even fire one shot at him while he is killing them.
I really like good action movies but this certainly was not one of them. Below average.

Ovi (Pankaj Tripathi ) is the top drug lord in India. He is in jail with his accounts frozen. His son Ovi (Rudhraksh Jaiswal ) is kidnapped and ransomed by the top drug lord in Bangladesh (Priyanshu Painyuli ). He doesn't have the money for the ransom so he plays Tyler (Chris Hemsworth ) to extract him. Tyler grabs the package, but all exits from the city are block with the largest man/boy hunt in history.It was an interesting film. Fighting scenes were half decent. The background on Tyler could have been done better. Why do directors think they should play a game with it?Guide: F-word. No sex or nudity.

If one has to see an action movie only once in a decade this is it. Growing up in 1980s & the 1990s we were fed with a high dose of action movie offerings from Hollywood on a weekly basis and by the end of the first decade of this century almost all action movies had become very boring as it all revolves around the same plot, boring bad guys, trigger happy shooters, stale car chases, stuff blowing up everywhere and illogical storytelling.
But Extraction though it involves a very tried and tested plot and the the same characters played again for the zillionth time, the making is absolutely next generation stuff. Photography and stunt scenes were outstanding along with the story moves on a breathtaking speed. Some characters though a little exaggerated, were enjoyable. Chris Hemsworth did an excellent job in the high octane action scenes. Forget Logical loopholes in the story line and just watch it for its action sequences which is really outstanding. The makers I believe have taken a great amount of pain to not repeat stuff we have been seeing all these years and the result is refreshing. This one is a gem for the action fans out there.

POSITIVES:1) The action scenes are fantastic, it's very impressive the amount of one-take action scenes that there are
2) I'm glad the film is full of graphic violence and swearing rather than trying to be family friendly
3) There are two good character moments, which is two better than zero I guess
4) David Harbour shows up for 5 minutes and looks like he's having fun while presumably picking up a very large amount of money for a very small roleNEGATIVES:1) It's half an hour longer than it should be, that extra half an hour is complete dross
2) Hemsworth survives so many impossible injuries; at one point we spend about 5 minutes with him putting a cast on and then as soon as the action restarts he just rips the cast off and suffers no consequences??
3) I just didn't care about any of the characters, at best the film is just emotionless action
4) I hate films that start with a scene from the end for absolutely no reason whatsoever
5) There are so many times where foreign characters are speaking their native language and then just randomly switch to English halfway through their conversation just so the audience don't have to read too many subtitles

reviews.review_title: Great action in an okay film
reviews.content: Extraction is a solid film in terms of action but not in terms of plot. The story is fairly simple and been done before but it doesn't really bother me in this case. The action makes up for it.The action scenes are really terrifically. Whilst they aren't on the level of The Raid movies, The John Wick trilogy or even Atomic Blonde. The film does deliver some pretty good action sequences. They are filmed really well without the over use of shaky can and quick cuts. The choreography is very good. There is a really great 11 minute sequence which is done in "one take" and it works marvelously well.I thoroughly enjoyed it. It's around 102 minutes long (excluding the credits) and there is very little downtime. That's because of great actors and a decent script. Chris Hemsworth is great here. He did a lot of his own stunts which is great to hear. Everyone else from David Harbour to Randeep Hooda are also very good.If you're looking for mindless fun, look no further. Extraction is everything you've been looking for in terms of action. It may be predictable but it seriously delivers.

reviews.review_title: Wow Netflix actually made a good original film
reviews.content: When I first saw the trailer for this movie I was quite intrigued. I love Chris Hemsworth as Thor in the MCU is I was interested in seeing how he could do outside of the MCU.Now this movie is actually pretty good I didn't have high expectations as Netflix doesn't have the best track record for their original movies but this one actually surprised me and I really enjoyed it. The best part of this movie is the acting and I thought Chris Hemsworth gave a great performance and really goes deep in the role he is playing. Chris Hemsworth and the kid in the film have some good chemistry in this film. Now the action was mostly good it wasn't perfect that being said. The one thing I didn't like was the villain as he didn't have great motivations.Overall I'm going to give Extraction a 8/10.

reviews.review_title: It would have been better if there was a plot to follow
reviews.content: This was a fairly decent movie to watch despite the clichés of a grieving warrior who lost his own son to cancer. The kidnapped boy acts as a surrogate son whom he creates bonds. The plot seems to be a bit lame because one of the protagonists wants to stiff the bill by killing the people he hired in the first place. The movie is quite realistic in the fighting scenes and the abject poverty of the two countries. Of course what made this movie laughable was the impossible death count that seemed like something out of a computer game. Also the movie relies too much on the star power of Chris Hemsworth. The movie is only watchable because of a few good actors and the action scenes.

reviews.review_title: Wow... some real idiot reviewers on here!
reviews.content:
Are some of you seriously rating this a 2 because the accents of the people in that area aren't accurate? Who cares! This is an action movie and was done extremely well from start to end. It's been a while since I've seen a action movie this good. I give this a 10 out of 10 as I believe it was that good. It kept my attention and me entertained the entire time. Chris Hemsworth was perfect for this role and he killed it. We need more movies just like this one. Well done Netflix! Keep em coming. Don't listen to the bad reviews on here for one minute. This was a bad ass movie.
I was texting friends and family halfway through the movie recommending all of them watch it. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Does what it says on the tin
reviews.content: Great action film that has the feel of a role playing shooter game for parts of it. Pretty well done.

This is action packed, guns blazing, black ops style warriors movie. Nothing deep to follow, simple story. Camera is excellent, close combat makes you feel like you're part of it. Director did a perfect job.

reviews.review_title: This is the combination of that i like to watch again, especially randeep huda
reviews.content: This movie is well coriograph, the blast, car chasing, the figh scene, the helicopter scene, all of this 10/10. I'm not new to bollywood, and to see this kind of combination is really make my heart pump (not saying that this movie is bollywood based). The producer of the movie has done really great job in the way of how its filmed, especially in the car chasing scene. The actor, especially criss, and randeep have been actualized their characters in a very best way. Beside of the greatness, this movie does have a minus in the plot, i would be more solid 10/10 if the writer rethink about the backstory, and what climax should be really focus on.

reviews.review_title: OverHyped and No way it deserves 8.1 rating 😂
reviews.content: I'm a Chris Hemsworth fan too but honestly this movie wasn't great at all. Die hard Girly fan of Chris Might like it and i was surprised to see Joe Russo involved in it and it still sucked. It wasn't filmed in Bangladesh Dhaka and it was a poor adaptation of Dhaka. What is wrong with their accent?? Can anyone tell me why the entire army is after that kid just because his father is a Mob? what's his fault? Poor acting even from a guy like Randeep hooda.Advise? Don't waste ur time

Extraction features some good action sequences and a charismatic lead in Chris Hemsworth. It's cool and a little different that the plot takes place in India. There is a backstory to Chris' character so that he isn't just "generic action man", and it's OK, although it did feel to me like they just put that in for the sake of him having a backstory.The first act is the strongest in my opinion, we get to know some of the characters and we see a good amount of action while the plot progresses. It's simple and to the point: Chris Hemsworth and his team have to extract this kid from the hands of kidnappers that work for a drug lord. I think the movie does get weaker towards the second act though, as it slows down a bit too much for my taste, and the third act is also a bit too long because a) people are getting shot all over the place and there doesn't seem to be much plot development and b) the movie opens with what happens here on the bridge, so there's no intrigue behind what's going to happen.Anyway, Extraction is a good action movie and although I will probably never feel the urge to ever watch it again, I enjoyed it for the most part.
Very good movie. Good action and storyline. Chris Hemsworth plays a great Character and HOPE it becomes a sequel.A movie that everyone should watch (Inc Gav + Ben).

reviews.review_title: For This Genre It's Well Done
reviews.content: If you don't like this genre, you probably won't like this. But, if you accept that you're gonna see action and violence, you'll find that this is very well directed and performed.

reviews.review_title: Count your f*&$ blessings and watch this amazing movie
reviews.content: I don't give a shack if the movie gets the local dialect wrong or culture is misrepresented, I am in a bloody quarantine lock down and there are few things that distracts me from this apocalyptic situation. It is an action movie period .... not a discovery channel country and culture tv episode or a tourist promo video about a country that is one of the unsafe countries in South Asia. Count your blessings while the movie theaters are closed and all movie releases are cancelled for a good three to four months you get this star packed action, thriller movie. It is more than 10 stars and thank you Netflix. Definitely recommend this.

I felt a bit sorry for the actors having to go through all that makeup and action sequences to produce such a forgettable result.
The story is very thin and unrealistic. Some characters are pointless and are just added to pad it out. Mostly, it's about the hero shooting people. Quickly. Then shooting some more people. Then having a pause from shooting people. Then shooting some more people. Quickly.
A few of the action scenes are excellent and the locations are wonderful.
But just wasted in this film.

reviews.review_title: Video Game Cut Scene style movie
reviews.content:
It was like watching all the cut scenes from a video game put together with the same campy dialog. ZERO plot, no imagination there what so ever. The extraction plan was no plan at all. Everything was highly predictable. Half way through the movie we we thought it was over, we were wrong. You do not care about any of the characters. May of the firefight scene reminded us of Arnold's Commando movie - the good guy shoots and never misses, the bad guys cannot hit their target even at extremely close range.
Not worth the time.
So the drug lord of Bangladesh can't even speak in proper bangla? Very insulting lol

reviews.review_title: One of the best action films.
reviews.content: Chris Hemsworth kicks butt in this film. They wouldn't of picked a better man for the role. Great story and fight scenes.
This is undoubtedly a pure dose of entertainment during the pandemic.

reviews.review_title: WORTHY OF A CINEMA SIZE SCREEN
reviews.content:
If you enjoy the John Wick films, then you will certainly enjoy Extraction.
It does have a plot, regardless of what some reviewers have written but it is definitely the action scenes that make this a 8/10 movie.
Chris Helmsworth is the lead but the directing, stunt & camera work are the stars.
Not as good as The Raid films but high octane entertainment indeed. Only wish I could've seen it on cinema sized screen.
Maybe, this could be the start of a franchise?!
8/10

Compelling and involving.Really good plot and story line with plenty of twists and turns.
Excellent.

There are good movies, average movies and bad movies. This is just an average movie. Chris Hemsworth trapped in a mediocre script, which is not only shot in India but looks and feels like a bollywood movie. Not to say that all bollywood movies are bad. But, this looked like a wannabe mission impossible made in India. Action is good, but there is nothing that keeps you hooked and make this an enjoyable ride. Only recommended for bang-bang action lovers.

...is the last thing I wanted to see....
Hemsworth played great, but in that environment, I could'n watch until the end.

reviews.review_title: Want an action film? Here you go.
reviews.content: Look, I like to think I know my cinema.I like good films.I like honest films.And this is a good, honest film.It doesn't pretend to be anything it is not.I loved 1917, and because of some of the the visuals - namely the one shot sequences, Extraction is being compared.The more apt comparison would be something like The Raid meets a better scripted version of Proof of life.It's an action film but doesn't condescend the viewer. It's intelligent enough to have some good humour interspersed between the mayhem (and boy there are sequences in this that are jaw dropping).It really is a well written and directed film.Chris Hemsworth does a great job.It ends well and if you had paid for it, to watch it at the cinema, you would leave thinking, ah that was money well spent.But the commodity, nowadays is time.And I, along with my wife, thought it was cinematic experience worthy of our time.It's a good solid film. A good Saturday evening watch.

Gonna keep it short. The plot is crap, but everything else was pretty great. Particularly the cinematography was very fantastic in my opinion. It's one of those movies where you just gotta clear your head, forget about plots or anything of the kind, and just enjoy the show.

Wow this is very good! The centrepiece is the one take action scene that lasts for almost thirty minutes, encompassing car chase, gun shots and jumping off buildings. It is intense like you cannot imagine.
Just endless killing over and over again. I usually like movies like this one, but there was just no plot and it was a waste of time.

This movie was great .... it was so exciting it really gave me, I love action movies.The actors play great, I like all the actors.The story of the film is such that it mixes excitement with complex human emotions.
I know he didn't directed this but the whole film reminded me of him

Extraction is a film that reveals itself in the trailer itself.. what u get to see in the whole of the movie that is not revealed in the trailer is just truckloads of action.. beautifully shot action scenes.. at times it gives u feeling that h r actually playing a video game.. few things miss out here and there.. the main antagonist in the film seems to be absolutely powerless.. couldn't figure out the reason behind it yet.. randeep hooda's character was not portrayed in a very meaningful way.. apart from that there is nothing else in the story that u can bank upon.. it's a 2-hr long action packed junkie!!!

Extraction is not a waste of time. The movie makes us engaged with its spectacular stunts and a very good titular performance by Chris Hemsworth. However, the plot is not good enough with respect to the production. A sequel is official and I think this might be Chris Hemsworth's Mission Impossible. That is if Tyler Rake is still alive.

Very weak storyline up.portaying Bangladeshis is a very negative way.Bangladesh is not like syria. I haven't heard that any army or police work under mafia gang.The accent in Bengali is not upto the mark . Nothig special in this movie except few stunt.

reviews.review_title: This is what we call a great Action Movie !! Chris Hemsworth Nailed it
reviews.content: Awesome movie with great action scenes, one of the best movie of netflix , every actor nailed it . Must watch !!! expecting this kind of action sequence movies

reviews.review_title: An out an out Action Flick!
reviews.content: With Sam Hargrave directing a film, it's going to be an action packed venture. Brilliant action sequences choreographed perfectly.
What an action pack thriller. Not a major story line but it finishes so fast. Worth the every minute. Awsomely directed and the stunts are so real.

I was actually intrigued by the film from the trailers and even though the story was straight forward and even generic it had some well done camera work and locales that feel reminiscent of the Bourne films. The action sequences are top notch with the whole "one take" fluid style that was captured nicely. Hemsworth's character (Tyler Rake) was a little different than I'm used to as in he feels more human and so does the villain which makes for some great back and forth between the two. The movie was not overly complicated like a Bourne film nor was it nearly as good but some of the chemistry between characters and the cat and mouse aspects and a couple of twists really engage the audience. It also does set up for a potential sequel if the writers felt compelled to do so. Definitely a very good actioner.7/10.

Movie was great, had tons of action. Really good acting by Chris Hemsworth and Rudhraksh Jaiswal. Really good gun fights and pacing. My only issue was some of the chase scenes had a bit too much shaky-cam and made ma a bit nauseous. I don't know if this just a Netflix exclusive but if this were in a theater I would watch it in a heartbeat.

reviews.review_title: We Need More Movies Like This
reviews.content: Honestly this movie is one of the best action movie in recent year. It's simple, raw, and packed with great action. We need more action movies like this.The plot is quite simple. A mercenary soldiers were tasked to save kidnapped son of a drug lord. At first the mission looks like it will run smoothly until they found out they were betrayed. Now surrounded in a city full of enemies, our protagonist and the kid have to survive and find their way out.I like the camera work here. The way they shoot close to the main character make us feel like we are included in the action. Feels like this happened just besides us. We are not movie goers, we are witnesses.And the action is top notch. The fighting sequence is brutal. From hand to hand combat, gun fighting, and sniper fight they all well executed. No wonder the body count is so high.The acting is also good. Even with the full action. The writers put nice background stories to the characters that make us sympathize to them. The actors delivered their best performance here.I don't really have big complain here. As an action movie, The Extraction is one of the best.

Denzel Washington played a burnt out and guilt riddled CIA operative in Man on Fire. Set in India/Bangladesh rather than Mexico this film is rather similar. A young boy in need of a guardian to survive and a guardian in need of a young boy as a means to forgive himself... it's a simple story line so the action can be the star.Most enjoyable film.

If you are looking for action that would make Gareth Evans and Chad Stahelski blush then I highly recommend this film. One of the most memorable action sequences of the last few years and a surprisingly well rounded group of supporting characters highlight what I think is the best Netflix action movie to date. Well acted, well directed and exciting from start to finish. The gun violence becomes excessive in the final act but the hand to hand and Gun fu combat scenes never fail.

The dialogue is horrible but that's not a surprise since russo's wrote it. The ending is embarrassingly horrible and the action is average at best. Chris hemsworth is the only thing that's good in the film.

Great Action flick which keeps you captivated till the end. Acting was good, pacing was good, action scenes are excellent, great production value. Maybe the plot and some characters could have been a little more elaborated but this could have impacted the pace of the film. Obvious this is no National Geographic documentary and why would you expect that? Go to NG channel if you do. Anyway, at the end hallucinating and seeing his dead son indicates he is dying. Yet, hoping for an Extraction II which is not completely out of the question. Remember start of the film, he is used to jumping from high heights into water and staying submerged for longer periods.

reviews.review_title: nice action for a beer evening
reviews.content:
Good and would be even better if it didn't try to be ambitious which it fails. Script is rather poor, as well as main character but action scenes are nice. I expected more from Russo bros.
Don't even check 1* comments written by offended Bangladesh guys.. just Google if you don't think these cities really have poor districts like in movie.

Who knew some random Netflix movie from a first time director would end up being one of the best action movies in the last few years? I didn't. The best thing about this movie, without a doubt, are its action scenes. The action scenes in this movie are brutal, exhilarating, and tense. The fight choreography is off the charts, and the action is clearly presented in all its glory. This movie also has a surprising amount of heart. It's not a masterpiece of cinema, but Chris Hemsworth gives a great performance and the ending is genuinely effective on an emotional level. Great movie!

reviews.review_title: A really slick and stylish Action Film with multinational star cast
reviews.content: It's so good to see a film with such a diverse cast of actors. Honestly, this is what it means to make a truly International Film.The things that work for the film -1) The diverse cast and crew - only a dull person would not appreciate such diversity!2) The Action - The fact that Sam Hargrave was on the Director's Chair I expected nothing short of brilliant action sequences. After all he is the Brain behind the action stunts Of many Action/ Superhero Films.3) The background score - It's edgy, it keeps you active and engrossed in the film.4) The story - it's engaging, I like the character development. Of course there are things that could be improved on but I'm in no mood to complain today. So I'm just going to appreciate.I really enjoyed the chemistry of Chris Hemsworth and the young Rudraksh Jaiswal. A job well done there!5) Location - This film proves that you don't need the Swiss Alps and Dubai skyscrapers to make a good film. The premise is focused and it's good to see that the makers didn't compromise on it by trying to make things look pretty.Also, I am so happy for Randeep Hooda, I read in an old interview of his (think it was in 2013) that he went to university in Australia to pursue a career in Acting in Hollywood but things fell apart. And here comes Extraction - with an Actor from Australia and a Hollywood based project! How perfect to see someone being able to accomplish their dreams. ( I hope his mentor Naseeruddin Shah is really proud of him too).I'd give this film a 9/10 because well there is room for improvement and I'm also feeling really good about seeing a thoroughly engaging action film, that isn't a super hero movie.

Review by Ayush Sen TMSL DEPT-FT
UNIVERSITY ROLL 13003419025If you are an action movie lover then this movie is for you. Extraction is a 2020 action thriller movie directed by Sam Hargrave starring Chris hemsworth, Rudraksh jaiswal and Randeep hooda. It involves a black ops mercenary who must rescue an Indian drug lord's kidnapped son in Dhaka, Bangladesh. You can stream it if you have a Netflix Subscription. The movie has one of the best action scenes of recent memory and a very interesting plot twist quite early in the movie. PUBG lovers can relate to this movie as it has loads of street gunfight scenes. Chris Hemsworth definitely steals the show with stunning action scenes and dialogue deliveries. Overall its a must watch for anyone who loves action movies with a bit of thrill and excitement.
Both Chris Hemsworth and Randeep Hooda have some amazing action sequences. The plot is quite straightforward. A fun watch overall.

reviews.review_title: I thought I would hate it, but....
reviews.content: I ended up getting into it pretty fast. I'm really not one for action movies, but for what it is, it's definitely well done. No matter what you think about movies like this, it will certainly entertain you. Well worth a watch. Chris Hemsworth doesn't excellent job, as does the kid. It's one of those movies were you just have to let go of Reality and let the action do its thing. I can't imagine how hard it would be to choreograph all of the fight scenes, non-the-less film it, or act it - there is so much happening At any given moment; it's actually pretty mind blowing. Just sit back and enjoy the ride.

reviews.review_title: If you're looking for an action movie
reviews.content:
It's a solid action movie with everything you'd expect. There's a great scene with what appears to be a single uninterrupted fight scene that is worth watching just for the camera work alone.
If you're looking something "meaningful " or artistic then it's not for you, but if you want an action filled yarn to pass a couple of hours, then you won't be disappointed.

2hrs but 14mins taken up by end credits.
An action film shot mostly in Dhaka (Bangladesh) and a bit in Mumbai. Cast: Chris Hemsworth (Thor), Rudraksh Jaiswal, Randeep Hooda (good role), Pankaj Tripathi (very short role), Golshifteh Farahani (lead actress). Simple story with a few twists plus plenty of graphic violence. A Non-glamourous movie but a big screen entertainer.

Enjoyed watching Chris in an Aussie role, he needs to do much more. Would have loved the story on the two fella's he was downing beers with in the beginning of the film.Noted that the viewers from Bangladesh felt that the film should have been true to life regarding their hometown, but would argue that 99% of all Hollywood films are a total work of fiction. This movie wasn't a documentary, its fiction. Eye candy, explosions and gore.And if it makes the Bangladeshi people feel better, Australia is nothing like what you see in Mad Max, Razor Back or Croc Dundee!Relax, let it go, just enjoy the art. I did.

Here what I call a true action movie, no time for whining skimming sleeping just do the job end of conversation.
Riveting captivating great movie, I loved it

reviews.review_title: Too much controversy and weak plot movie
reviews.content:
This movie last part and some active sequence this movie totally worsted......
If you have lot of time and love action without story you can see this movie

A perfect 7.5 and 2.5 for Bangladeshis for criticising and giving it 1!! Oh common rate the movie low because they did not show Dhaka in a way u wanted ..the film is not about DhakaNow the movie it's worth every penny when you are sitting at home ..a movie worth the wait for lockdown however do not expect anything higher but will suffice your hunger for a good movie ..Can't have every movie to have a plot ..it's scenario based and it has it sub elements of emotions .. good entertainer overall ..

Best part is that the movie is directed by Sam Hargrave who is a reputed stuntman coordinator and he nailed it with Russo brothers. Indeed a Powerful act from Hooda and Hemsworth watching the duo was a treat to me.Once again Randeep proved his versatility.Worth a Watch this Powerful Action Packed movie.👍👌

reviews.review_title: Why tagged Bangladesh when there is nothing related to Bangladesh?
reviews.content:
Sorry, but during watching the movie, the only thing I was thinking is someone's paying a huge amount of money just to humiliate Bangladesh. After watching the trailer I was really waiting for something fantastic, something logical though I knew most of the shooting done in India. As they added Bangladesh so it can be expected that there will be something real about Bangladesh but where is that? Even the main character from Bangladesh is not even Bangladeshi. That accent they used, as a Bangladeshi even I can't recognize where they came from. in every house, some Hindi song is playing.
it's ok if someone wants to make an international movie but I think they could just cut out Bangladesh from this because there is nothing "Bangladeshi thing" in it. its all about India and India pretending to be Bangladeshi. its a shame for an independent nation.

reviews.review_title: Call of Duty : The Movie, basically.
reviews.content: Just a good action movie and pretty unapologetic about it. If you are looking for something badass this is it.

The action scenes are great. The storyline is very predictable from start to finish. No real dialogue in the movie but then again the action scenes were great. If you love action movies, you have come to the right place. Overall, this is a great movie for you to relax, watch, and enjoy. Chris's acting is quite good btw.

reviews.review_title: Time to blow bunchful of notorious asses!
reviews.content: There was no idle point the whole time, made me engage deep with the powerful play of three of the full time characters (Chris, Rudhraksh and Randeep) Action all the time, indulgence of Hollywood personality with country like Bangladesh which feels more like of India because of the crowd is always a treat to watch and makes it very lively as if it is happening somewhere for real. Great sniper involvement.

The story-line is nothing amazingly creative, but a solid concept. There is some emotion to be had to draw you in to the characters enough to make you care.The violence is off the charts...excellent for those who love intense close-in hand to hand combat combined with close-in gun-fighting.The ending is not conclusive for me, but it may be setting up the beginning of the next one. I read someone say there is another one in the works. If so, I'll watch it for sure.

This movies features some awesome action scenes. There isn't much plot, barely enough to string between action scenes. It slows down in a spot or two, once pretty bad. It's kind of a throwback to the action movies of the 80's, without the tongue-in-cheek humor. The acting is very good, especially for a straight action flick based on a graphic novel.
No one can deny the genuine amazing GIS work in this movie. However, the plot is redundant and expected. Therefore, it's fair enough.Y.A

I'm easily entertained and this movie checked all the boxes. Story wasn't deep but didn't need to be, acting was very good especially the boy being saved, and action was GREAT! Obviously not perfect but never once was I bored or not interested. 8/10 go stream.

reviews.review_title: MUST WATCH BEST ACTION MOVIE IN YEARS.
reviews.content: This is absolutely the best movie Chris as put out outside of marvel movies ever EVEEEEEEEER I MEAN JUST JAW DROPPING GOOD MOVIE I AM LITERALLY SHOCK IT WAS THIS GOOD. THE ACTION WAS AMAZING THE EMOTIONAL PULL WAS THERE the story line was good could have taken more to explain his back story on how he do what it do but I know its a time thing the fight scenes was mind blowing good I can't lie if Netflix movies counted towards the Oscars this movie hands down deserve best action movie hell I'll give Chris a chance at the best actor award then the ending left you on edge like the beginning of the movie left you like wow wait what happen lmao Chris has proven he can have great movies outside of thor.The only bad part about this movie to me is the smoke scenes that CGI was horrible down right mind blowing bad thats the only reason why its not 10 stars in my book I was omg omg wooooo wooow the that happen I was like ok now that was just bad.
A movie that has great long shot action scenes but with a plot that seemingly failed to keep up. Also a movie that tries too hard to teach a moral lesson (and failed).
Chris done his job fantastically..action is also very top notch..overall a mind blowing action movie for all action movie lovers.

reviews.review_title: An exciting action packed make believe movie
reviews.content: I am astounded at the low scores that is movie got. Have we forgotten that movies are designed to entertain thrill excite and be different to the reality of our existence. This movie is a wonderful impactful shows that leaves you thinking at the very end what actually happened to the boy. Did he drown or did Chris Hemsworth's character actually survive. The amazing action packed solo with just the right of excitement and storyline brings this as Chris Hemsworth best movie so far.
Tooth extractions,more like it,generic and bog standard

reviews.review_title: Nollywood meets Hollywood and they party hard on Netflix
reviews.content: Beautifully choreographed fight scenes, detailed enough to synchronise every neck break, stabbing and gun shot wound to the actual sound effects.Moving on to the actual plot, I like the duel approach of mercenary against mercenary and a kidnap rescue going absolutely wrong unleashing terror in the city with everyone trying to kill you and the kidnappee. Both trying to save the kidnapped but seemingly on the wrong side of who wants him alive or not.Full throttle action sequences leaving you at the edge of your seat from start to finish.Well worth the watch

If you want to watch an action movie this movie will not disappoint you. I'm happy that Randeep Hooda character is written good and he has been given a major role. And this movie is not about Dhaka so don't bother if you want to watch art and culture documentary of Bangladesh. This is a good action movie, which surely you will enjoy. Try to watch it on big screen. Avoid it watching on mobile cause then you'll not be able to appreciate it.
A captivating film, with well-choreographed, thrilling fight sequences and great performances by the cast, and an engaging, but cliched and predictable, plot.
This movie got so hype here in sub continent, but gotta say i am much disappointed. As for action, the movie is great but the plot is so weak that i had to forget the good action part.

reviews.review_title: Watched it again next time with parents in Netflix.
reviews.content: Watched it again next time with parents in Netflix. Even showed them part 2 confirmation. A must watch. A must watch. A must watch.Imagining how he is still alive.

I usually only watch horror genre. I saw when it popped up on Netflix but I rolled my eyes and continue to watch scary movies or scary shows. I finally decided to watch it and I must admit I loved every second of it. Except end of the bridge scene. But I had to give this film 9 out of 10 Stars because to give it 10 out of 10 Stars the person on the bridge had died but I didn't see that.
Action packed with an ending that didn't leave you wanting more. Probably the best movie Netflix has ever made!

reviews.review_title: CHRIS HEMSWORTH IS EXCELLENT IN THIS EXCELLENT EXCITING & GRIPPING ACTION THRILLER
reviews.content:
Chris Hemsworth has proved he's now one of the best leads in Hollywood, we know he's fantastic as Thor from the Marvel universe but here he's taken on the type of brutal, gritty fast paced action hero lead role that Jason Statham or Liam Neeson might've done!!!
Hemsworth is excellent here & gives a fantastic tough as hell performance as troubled mercenary Tyler Rake & he's one extremely deadly & well trained Black market mercenary with a nothing to lose attitude & a fearless warrior instinct, a great character. Tyler has been hired to find & rescued a kidnapped boy who is held for ransom but the kid is the son of a crime lord. This is set in the dangerous & violent underworld city of Bangladesh & the action is bone crunching, frantic, gritty & full of realism. The town is locked down & full of gangs out hunting for Tyler & the boy (a good performance by Rudhrakish Jaiswal) & these two are ferociously hunted by not just the criminals of the ghettos but also by a deadly Assassin played by Randeep Hooda, a fantastic performance & one hell of a great character who is just as good as Chris Hemsworth here!!!I loved the scary & dangerous atmosphere & the frantic explosive action that bursts out of nowhere & makes everything feel on edge & intense. An exciting survival Thriller that feels real & intense as hell. A wild thrilling ride with great performances & gory blood soaked action.

reviews.review_title: Fight scenes are superb .Good action movie with less story
reviews.content:
The movie s fight sequences are superb . Movie dosnt have a story .its a mission .kinda of John wick .
If you like john wick kind of movie you will like this too.
I thought this movie had some great action scenes. The whole movie is pretty much all action scene. John wick esk

reviews.review_title: You'll like it even if you're not into action movies
reviews.content: The action sequence was brilliant and well thought out. I would not mind if there is a sequel.

Chris may as well have been Thor in this movie because he had the strenth of 10 men, throwing gang members and soldiers around like rag dolls! I have yet to see better action in a Netflix movie. Way better than spenser and underground combined. If your an action flick buff then u will love this film!

A really great movie created in my country and im happy to see that. Only thing i missed was that Chris Hemsworth came here to shoot the film without knowledge of many MCU fans in Bangladesh. Like people really love the avengers series here the ticket line for Infinity war screening was so long that the people from the 7th floor of the shopping mall came to the streets with no interruptions. So imagine if they knew thor was here back in 2018 they'd be crazy.Love the action scenes also the talented cast like randeep hooda and pankaj tripathi. Amazing performance from others as well except the villain was too lazy and young to portray a powerful drug lord of this country. Plot wasn't much but awesome action sequence.

It was great to Hemsworth other than in a super hero costume. Flim was awesome to me. Only thing i would say story line flipped a bit as other body guard could've said about saving the boy from the start than fighting against them. Still the action scenes one me over.

To all the people who complain about the plot.....have tou ever seen the expendables, crank, or the transporter?!?! This was way more believable and heartfelt than any of those movies. Chris Hemsworth delivers a memorable performance given the few lines of dialogue he had. The cinematography was top notch as well as the sound editing. If you want an edge of your seat action flick this is definitely one of the best ones I've seen in quite some time.
All around just a great action movie. I absolutely love how well the fight scenes came together. Not a big story line. Just a bunch of action and violence.

Who cares about the dismissal of the culture of host city. It's not about that. It's about becoming absorbed by a seat of the pants entertainment spectacle. This film is that and more. Chill out you lot and admit you like enjoying yourself, along with the common folks.The spoiler - this is a great film...

The action in this movie is fantastic. at one point my jaw was dropped for like 6 minutes. entertaining and intense. my only downsides are that the best action scene was early in the movie, and even though they do a good job of making you care, it also hurts the movie when they are mowing down "bad guys" (1 viewing, 5/4/2020)
Great combat sequences which made me think of The Raid + a bit of Man on Fire. Highly recommended!

After watching this movie almost for two hours, I couldn't care less about Tyler and the kid. Zero character development on Tyler, kid and their relationship. Why would he sacrifice himself for someone he talked no more than a few sentences? Because he lost his own child? Plus, what was about that scarface kid focused on killing Tyler. "Ohh he humiliated me". Makes no sense at all.The biggest mistake probably showing Tyler fatally wounded in the beginning. Because obviously it was shown to let us wonder his situation. In the end it was all for nothing. (After killing dozens of people why would I care about this one)Honestly it was really difficult to finish watching. Only upside was the filming / cgi technique at car chasing scene but it doesn't save the rest.

"Extraction" is an Action - Thriller movie in which we watch a man who is a member of an elite team trying to save a young boy's life after he was kidnapped by a crime lord.
