The boy's father who is also an international crime lord but he is in prison hired them to save his son but he does not know everything about them or his opponent and what they are both capable of.I have to admit that I did not have high expectations from this movie but I was happily surprised by it. I liked it because of its plot which was very interesting, it had plenty of action and much of suspense. The interpretation of Chris Hemsworth who played as Tyler Rake was very good and he showed us why it was the right choice for this movie. Some other good interpretations that have to be mentioned were Rudhraksh Jaiswal's who played as Ovi Mahajan and Golshifteh Farahani's who played as Nik Khan. If you are a fan of action movies then you should definitely watch this movie because you won't be disappointed and you will enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: The movie was cool, but it could've ended 30 minutes ago
reviews.content:
Action scenes were good, but I felt like one fight scene lasted an hour LOL. I was like "ok wow, he still killing people??"
The movie could've been shortened by 30 minutes and still get the point across.
I still would recommend this movie to anyone who loves action!

This is a film worthy of a theatrical release, and one of Netflix's best action flicks. Some the camera work is unique and better than I have ever seen in a realistic fight sequence. You will feel like you a right there in the action. Some of the shots are one take, and clearly took incredible coordination to pull off.. Hemsworth has shown himself be a superb, top tier action star, and I foresee him in many more to come. He has the emotional and physical acting chops to make every scene believable, and his character is both complex and relatable.This film is also much more realistic in its gun use, characters actually reload repeatedly, check weapons for bullets, and constantly use cover accurately. Enemies actually take multiple hits and shots to go down, they don't just take one kick to the chest and die like in the majority of other action films.The plot overall could have some improvements, but it does not take away much from the film. The primary villain needed some more motivating factors, but the film will make you hate him enough to root for anyone who stands against him.I've seen the vast majority of negative reviews are solely based on the fact that the negative aspects of life in Dhaka might be slightly over emphasized, but doing research on my own, it is not significantly different than reality. So I would recommend disregarding the majority of negative reviews and give this film a watch if you enjoy action films. I guarantee you will be amazed by the action sequences and come away impressed with the film.

reviews.review_title: Chris Hemsworth is excellent in this ACTION film
reviews.content: Was WAAAAY better than I expected it to be, Great delivery of some action sequences. Refreshing to see its not based in another Middle Eastern /Asian country. There's a follow cam sequence that shows a "whole shot" for about 11mins!I haven't enjoyed an action film in ages.

Extraction is a type of film that is zero brains and all muscle,blood and bullets,sometimes that kind of films are fun to watch,and they can put our brains on rest but extraction even if it does have that staff it still has a lot of problems in it,maybe im taking this film to seriously but i must,hemsworth was solid in a film nothing special,but he had some good fight sequances and gunshots duels ,but except him and good choreographed fights this film doesnt offer nothing new to us,plot is seen billion of times and acting and villain were completly out of focus and honestly not very good,expecely from said villain and the kid,extraction was a watchable popcorn film but if you want something more skip this one for sure
Watch it yourself😍 chris is better in action.. great movie / must watch..

reviews.review_title: Good, but apeing a bit too much from John Wick.
reviews.content: Sold action flick. Better fight movie that we're use too. Worth watching if you liked John Wick.

reviews.review_title: Action okay but It's not look realistic
reviews.content: If I am talking about the action sequence of the movie it's ok. But storyline of the movie is very weak and extremely poor.Everything look like Kolkata but Telling It's Dhaka... The Accent, Actor, Location set, and Police Uniform definitely it's not Dhaka,,,it Kolkata bro...All Bengali actors from Kolkata, they are not from Dhaka Bangladesh. They failed to bring Dhakaia.Everything Kolkata...not Dhaka... how funny isn't it?

reviews.review_title: Fast action and lots of adrenaline scenes
reviews.content: I really enjoy the movie, good story, Chris had great moments and he did a good job in every scene. All the other actors were good in their roles and superb stunt scenes. I hope they make another one with Tyler Rake. Netflix please continue bringing us such good movies. It is entertaining from begin to the end.
Chris nailed it in this movie. Very short words and short dialogues but many actions shot with extreme care and accuracy. Well done

Extraction is the directorial debut of Sam Hargrave who is best known as the stunt director for a few of the Marvel movies.The movie follows Chris Hemsworth as he takes a break from the Avengers to step into the role of a hardened mercenary tasked with rescuing an Indian drug lord's kidnapped son.Extraction is at it's best where Hargrave is most comfortable, creating intense action sequences and gripping car chases through the tight streets of Dhaka, Bangladesh.While the action is thrilling, the overall plot is thin and I found myself less interested in the predictable outcome as the hour and fifty-seven minute mark approached.

This is one of the best action movies I've seen from a long time. I loved every moment of it and I was impressed by the shots and by the incredible long shot. The director nailed it, and I knew him from Atomic Blonde. Here the scenes are even better.

reviews.review_title: A good movie in the end
reviews.content: Mr. Hai is really impressive. Throughout the whole movie, I always felt that he was going to change. How about the thunderhammer? Why hasn't it come? Hahaha, this may be a common problem for actors to fix their roles. It's like I'm used to watching wolf uncle's singing and dancing plays. I think wolf uncle's paw can't be drawn to an actress. Mr. tonestak is even more deeply rooted. Apart from Sherlock Holmes, any movie he sees is full of the feeling that he is pretending that he will come back with a click of his watch. In fact, this feeling has a great impact on the experience of watching movies. What do you think about Harry Potter when you watch the escape from Billy toria the other day? Where's the magic wand? Say the mantra. It's too far away from the topic. Continue to talk about this amazing rescue. First of all, the actors are very good. Other actors don't pay much attention to it, because brother hammer is enough. He is handsome enough. The action scene is also very exciting. The same halo of the protagonist is also very obvious. Although he died in the end, in fact, several rockets sealed the bridge and finished. Why bother? But since it's the fans who are basically fluent in the plot, it's fair to say that they can justify themselves. The editing is reasonable and not controversial. The only problem is the setting of the young man. It's a bit like Taiwan's master of success, the chicken soup is too full to swallow.
Loved the one shot action sequence in the start.Don't know why people are mad about Bangladesh,Its a movie people relax.

What a waste of talent. I was really excited to watch this movie after watching its trailer and got even more excited knowing that Joe Russo has written it. But all my excitement just changed to disappointment after watching it. Why wasted so much talent on such a lame movie. Direction has been really poor.

Got lost the first 15 minutes, but then the movie started. It was good looking for for a A movie, I continued watching. After 38 minutes the movie acton starts, the camera guys runs into the building and at 42 min it's maybe the best scene i saw since the bourne. What a great camera guy. And after this action it started to loose it. The1amgonebetrayunowwherestillbestfriends and Ididnotwantdotoitbuttheythreatedmyfamily guy walk in. Picking up at 1.25 some bridge shooting, but i hoped it was over. 1.42 credits rolled over. Giving this a 9/10 for the camera work. Actors did extremly well also. Story/writers lost it in some parts. Not recommending shooting again in india, "the police uses clubs people" weliketogetpaidoffandhitpeoplebysticksjustbecausewerpolice

reviews.review_title: Only action , no story and lack of research
reviews.content:
A misrepresentation of Dhaka city . There are no such forest situated beside Dhaka city . It is Bangladesh , an independent country . Goons do not walk with AK47 specially children. How come a man can do such brutality is an independent country with a strong military .
The logic is you may kill 100+ military personnel and police to save 1 child . The accents is not right , it.'s not India ,people talk in different accent in Bangladesh . Just imagine you are in England and everyone is speaking in American accent.
And again , it was just an action movie with no story . You may see some really good action but can not think of a reason. The main attraction was Chris, not the story or anything else.
There is no plot, great action, lot of blood and 5 stars is only because of Hemsworth who is awesome.

reviews.review_title: Good action, a little too much.
reviews.content:
The first 45 minutes is fast paced all action, before it finally slows down. It needed that break a little sooner. There is not much of a story, but the filming is done great! Hemsworth is perfect for the role, as well as Jaiswal.
For everyone who complains about the portrayal of Bangladesh, take a look again at the Holland scene in Spiderman Homecoming, and come back to complain again, I dare you.
I don't want him to die,How dare you guys kill that legend.

reviews.review_title: Wow... hyped action with no substance
reviews.content:
After the trailer i had high hopes for this movie. And normaly Hemsworth are connected to good movies.
But as far as i can tell. He was the only A class actor in the movie, rest was collected from B rate Bollywood studios and the quality of the movies are thereafter.
Total waste of time. Hope Hemswirth got a big payday, for this sure made a dent in his actor reputation as i see it.

reviews.review_title: Well it's good for one time
reviews.content: I could easily say that this is an above average action movie, it's worth watching. It starts great, with fast pace, great and dynamic action, some pretty cool shots and fighting/shooting scenes, but at the end they've lost it.The enemies looked like walking dead people that are just waiting for the bullets to hit them. I hate it when the movies are not trying to be at least a little bit realistic and the good guys kill hundreds of people easily, while the enemies are wondering around like idiots. I understand that the good guy should kick ass, but it could've been a bit more balanced.As for the story well it's a typical action-movie story, what do you expect? It's decent.Just watch it.

reviews.review_title: Amazing action and fight scenes. Exceptional acting by the boy.
reviews.content:
There are some amazing action scenes in this film - to a certain extent it feels like one long fight scene. There were some continuous shots that were mind blowing - no cutaways or edits, just one long action scene! One of them is 11 minutes long! Unlike lots of action films I found myself literally sitting on the edge of the couch. The acting of the main character - the boy (Rudhraksh Jaiswal) who played Ovi- so impressive! It was completely believable that he was experiencing every emotion from the very beginning of the film to the end. As for the complaints by some reviewers about the locale, music, etc. I am not going to base my impression of a country on what I see in an action movie! Besides - all you have to do is look up the filming locations to see where it was filmed which - by the way - DOES include Dhaka! It is like any other film - locations are selected in order to suit the narrative and the ambience of the story. Would it have played as well in a more up-scale neighborhood? Doubtful - they needed to have the mobility in and out of apartments to move the action forward which would not have worked in another neighborhood. And again - FILM. NOT REAL LIFE.Last thoughts before spoilers - This is not for someone who has a problem with violence in film. But if you are a fan of action films with lots of fighting, you should enjoy it!*****SPOILERS*****

reviews.review_title: I Guess This Will Have to Do
reviews.content: Extraction comes out at a time when a lot of people could use some extra action in their lives. Sadly, Extraction only provides the absolute minimum. Sure, it has all of the requisite explosions and killing, but it lacks any sense of style. If you have seen an action movie from the last 20 years then you have essentially already watched Extraction. It is a shame that the film could not have more of an identity of its own. I was hoping Extraction would help break up the monotony of quarantine life, but instead it fit right in.

A fun action movie with superbly directed action scenes and a good cast. The cinematography is good, and the action is brutal, tense and bloody.Extraction is a surprisingly good action film that doesn't pretend to be anything else. The cast is solid, and the choice of characters is interesting. Chris Hemsworth is excellent as Tyler Rake.The action scenes are tense, superbly choreographed and the direction is excellent. Chris Hemsworth is definitely the right choice for this role.We also have some background stories about the main character, Tyler Rake, and so we reveal some details from his life and what makes him who he is. This is skillfully incorporated into the story without the film losing anything of the suspense and quick sequence of events.Most movies today are thrash, especially those made for streaming services, but this one is surprisingly entertaining, with great action scenes and a good cast. Excellent directing, tense and brutal action scenes, solid cast and constant action.A simple, brutal, adrenaline-fueled ride with great action scenes.

There are a few things that held this back from getting a 9 out of ten in my book but overall a fun show. Definitely needed some work to get a 10 out of 10, but let's be honest not many straight action flicks can pull that off.

reviews.review_title: Full of well-choreographed, brutal action sequences
reviews.content: Characters worth rooting for help the serviceable story resist giving way under the immense pressure caused by the brutal action sequences.When a mercenary (Chris Hemsworth) is hired to rescue the kidnapped son of an imprisoned crime lord, events quickly spiral out of control as the relatively simple extraction mission turns deadly. Hemsworth must protect the boy from many enemies as he tears through the Bangladesh concrete jungle with kinetic force.As indicated, the story is propped up by its action. Containing one of the best long takes committed to an action film, the scene looks as complicated technically as it is viscerally intense. Directed by stuntman Sam Hargrave, he directs with an efficiency that belies his filmmaking experience, delivering a furious amount of John Wick-inspired violence that is certain to get the adrenaline going.Overall, this is a solid thriller that demonstrates how to execute action for maximum impact, delivering all the pain with enough skill to make for an awesome experience.8/10

reviews.review_title: An Exciting but Forgettable Action Flick.
reviews.content: "Extraction" follows a black ops mercenary Tyler Rake (played by Hemsworth) who must rescue an Indian drug lord's kidnapped son in Dhaka, Bangladesh.Being an action film, the strength of this film comes from the director being a stunt coordinator himself, which is evident in the film's excellent action. In addition to the fight choreography and action sequences being riveting and gripping, the stunt-work and physical performance by Chris Hemsworth and Randeep Hooda is the highlight of this film - who manage to convince the audiences of them being skilled and trained military men.The films opens on its strength of great action and close combat sequence, hooking me within the first act itself without spending too much time in the exposition. However, the midpoint slows down in pace, in an attempt to build on the relationship between Tyler Rake and the kid he has rescued. The relationship doesn't come across as genuine - but rather a sentimentality that seems falsified, contrived for narrative purpose, which makes this portion all the more boring.The weakest aspect of this film are its subplots. Particularly, the plot-line with David Harbor's character ends up being inconsequential, without revealing anything important about the character or his past with Tyler. Another plot-line - about the kid's father being a drug lord - establishes an arc of their relationship that ends up abandoned and unresolved. Overall, the story of Extraction feels incomplete, with its resolution rushed for the sake of finishing the plot - which makes the screenplay of this film weak and forgettable."Extraction" makes for a good casual watch, with exciting action but an unremarkable story that you probably won't remember in the coming weeks.

reviews.review_title: If you like John wick, you'll like this. It's action
reviews.content: Most action movies are cheesy but this was pretty cool.

reviews.review_title: A must watch for action fans
reviews.content: First, you have to talk about the action. It's just fantastic. I've seen comparisons to John Wick because both movies were directed by former stunt coordinators and have a distinct style. John Wick is a little bit smoother, polished and stylized. This one is more brutal and visceral. Both are shot excellently and choreographed wonderfully. This one has more brutal intensity with the way it plays out. There's also a lot of variety in the action. There are close corridor shootouts, big open city setting shootouts, car chases, hand-to-hand fights, knife fights, sniping type action, RPG's, one take shot action... Because of the way that it's filmed with the long takes, there's an about 30 minutes long section that basiclly plays in real time. You just feel you are right there in the movie.The other thing the movie does really well is handeling it's story.The basic plot is very straight-forward. A mercenary is trying to get a boy out of the town alive. His objective is very clear from beginning to end. However, it adds complexity, nuance and intrigue with the different characters involved and their relationships with each other.The movie does have sraight-forward and uninteresting villians that are just evil, but it also has characters that are allies to the main the mercenary, but antagonistic to the boy and allies to the boy, but antagonistic to the mercenary. There are a lot of interesting character dynamics that add tension to the action sequences. The plot is straight-forward, but it's executed with intrigue because of the characters and their dynamics.The movie has more emotion than you would expect from a fim like this. There are not any big character arcs, but you learn enough about each of the characters to care about them and their relationships. We also dive a little bit more into the side characters than you'd expect. Even some of the henchmen and assassins are given more depht. There are scenarios of why they are doing what they are doing so you care when you see them in action. Some of them you don't want to die and some of them you do.Chris Hemsworth was great in this movie. We know that he can handle action and be a leading man. This movie ups the stakes of being the here because he's doing real stuntwork. There's no green screen. You see him actually doing fight coreography. When it pauses for the character moments, he gets to really act as this broken man on a mission that's starting to see the humanity in the events. He doesn't rely on his humour or his bag of tricks to make him likeabe. It's al just about the performance and I really think he was the right man for this film.This is not a movie for everyone. This is a hard R action movie. There is violence against children that can be pretty gut-wrenching if that's not your thing. If you're looking for a deep character study or a plot driven movie this isn't that. It's an action movie for people that love that visceral expirience of watching an R-rated action movie. I love that this film got brutal and heart-wrenching. It feels like a gut-punch. Some people won't like it.The thing that holds the movie back the most is the bond that forms between Chris Hemsworth and the boy. It feels sudden. It feels ike from one converstaion to the next there's a big gap that isn't fully earned to hep us understand that transition. It needed a bit more dialogue to build that bridge from one place to the next.This is exactly the kind of movie I want Netflix to make more of. There is talent in front of and behind the camera and they took a risk on a new first time featured director. Since we're in lockdown, I think people a re going to very much enjoy this movie.9/10

I'd always loved to see Chris Hemsworth in a full fledged action movie. And was glad to see him in Extraction.
Now First about the cons of this movie, it defies logic and not sure about the body count though. The major negative is wafer thin story and script. The lead antagonist is completely miscast.
The major USP of this movie is the '11 Minute' fight sequence. It's one of the best action choreography I've seen in recent past. It was wild, raw, realistic and quite intense. Thanks to Netflix release, the censor less leverage is rightfully used. Not to mention about the cinematography especially in the stunt sequence, kudos to the legend Newton Thomas for his live cinematography.
Finally our very own Thor, we see him here as Tyler Rake. Chris's portrayal of Tyler rake was great. And it was indeed fresh to see him as such.
This movie would sure cater for adrenaline pumping movie lovers!! Grab a bucket of popcorn for a Saturday night movie!!!

The movie has great action and direction. Any fictional movie has scenes shot in space or have unrealistic things doesn't mean they exist. Similarily, its a movie. Not a movie taken to represent any country or their culture.

We have a white dude killing an impossible amount of "browns" (arabs) gangsters, showing how superior he is in both, skill and smarts, but also being the better person (a criminal, but a good one, with a past yes, but haunts him because he is in fact good), when compared with the diabolical enemies.To get there, the writers had to force alot of scenes, losing every bit of the realism gained by the setting and production. In the end, this movie is as realistic as any superhero movie (and less than many of them, even).Having said that, the action is superb. While the characters aren't more than avatars and the story as thin as possible (rescuing X, in the hands of X in the City X), the chase sequences and shootouts are insane. Some are "one take" long shots. Not in the ridiculously boring 1917 way, with minutes and minutes of nothing BUT IN ONE SHOT. And not in the unnecessary Birdman way, that brought nothing to the story, but more in the "Children of Men" way (even if that movie is way better).For the action? 10 pts. For all the rest? 0 pts. Result? 5 pts.

Sam Hargrave! His first long picture and he's teaching the best how to shoot an action flick! Boy, what a directorial debut. That's some smooth camera work! At last, a director who turns the camera into the direction of the action! For example when the camera is nicely tucked in the backseat during a car scene and makes for some amazing shots. Don't forget the fight during the extraction! Especially the scenes in the apartment block where the camera follows a cop entering the compound during the pursuit. At one point it's too much! Agreed. But it's too much finely executed. It could've been better storywise. Yes of course, especially the ending. All that being said I can't wait for his next film. With all the bad movies shot these days I just hope Hollywood realizes this guy is a gem. Get him a great script and let him roll. He'll be fine. If this is the quality we get when Stuntmen become Directors than they all need to change careers, fast!

Chris Hemsworth significantly beefed up his action movie chops with this debut from Sam Hargrave, a former stunt double for Chris Evans/Captain America.Hargrave crafts action scenes that are exquisitely choreographed. Plot is nearly non-existent and things get repetitive as the movie progresses.But if you like your action intense, you'll enjoy this a lot.

It's a good action movie. But not a great one. Fast paced action sequences are the highlights. A one time watch.
Just in short, over hyped movie. Storyline too much poor, if you just exclude Chris from the cast, it doesn't even worth watching

reviews.review_title: More like a GTA mission or a Call of Duty game
reviews.content: The movie has some pretty good action scenes especially the first car chase scene with the running cam was great. Other than that even the last fight scenes were just gun fights which are more like a shooting game and doesn't leave much impact. Chris Hemsworth is good. In the end another action flick which could have been done so much better.My rating is 6.7 to be precise.

If you're an action movies addict and want less drama, then my friend, we're on the same boat. Because this movie is perfect for that desire. Chris Hemsworth, again, you did an amazing and excellent job! The premise and plot is so simple, yet well-executed.For some people who don't really into action movies, you might find this sort of boring.

Thank goodness the action in Extraction is impressive, because the plot is overly complicated. It should have been a straightforward story, but I had a hard time following who was working for whom and why. The violence also feels excessive, as if they had a bunch of squibs lying around and needed to use them before they expired. Still, if you're looking for two hours of stunt work and gunplay, this will scratch that itch.

Other than the fact the bad guys seem to be in every obscure location they try to hide, the action is nonstop. Crazy situations with a new scene in which to play out this drama. I enjoyed it, great escapism & crazy situations.

reviews.review_title: Damn loved this movie. Hater gonna hate.
reviews.content: Very good movie. Thanks to Netflix for making this available here when we can't go out in this pandemic time. Well packed action. Chris nailed it as always.

reviews.review_title: Must watch! Ignore the self-proclaimed critics
reviews.content:
Finally it's out! Glad it wasnt a disappointment. Unlike most Netflix movies, this one tops on Production, Casting, Direction and even the story (though many would disagree).THE ACTION:
The action scenes are to look for. Nicely directed. The chase scene is the best,as it immerses the audience as a 3rd person in the event. Real action sequences between characters give it an authentic and grounded feel. Chris Hemsworth has done a great job. So does Randeep Hooda ( soo rooting for this guy! After the great hit he took for his previous release being shelved, this a great comeback! Underrated actor in bollywood). You get the works from choppers, to grenades- top quality action quite forget it was suppose to be an extraction not a warzone in middle of the city. Kudos to Hargrave who can bag this one to his high-profile stunt portfolio (with the likes of avengers etc)THE STORY:
Joe Russo (found out after then movie) does his best in delivering a new edge to an action movie. With audience saturated by so many movies and not to forget now are self proclaimed critics hard to please it's really hard to make a movie with a good story. But I think Joe Russo delivers. People will compare and be like "oh this part this part that". I'll just take your phone and shoot a scene at the most. Then let's talk.SIDE NOTE:
You got to give it these Directors, Writers, Production, Make artists a standing ovation as high stakes and efforts are put in. It's easy to sit back relax, watch and comment on a movie takes 3 mins at the max. But takes months of hard work, effort and times accidents just to make a movie.DRAWBACK:
It's sad but realistic avengers ending. 😭CHERRY ON THE TOP:
This is movie is available to you for just 10 USD/M (among a large library of entertainment). So stop complaining (lol). Also where would you get to see Hell boy and Thor battling it out.And no I don't work for Netflix or the Movie people. Haha.

reviews.review_title: Unforgettable Surprise - John Wick Action w/ Great Characters
reviews.content: Saw this film on a whim to fight off a stomach bug and can I just say WOW. The action was thoughtfully made to be realistic. That aside, what truly shocked me was the story. I was surprised at how much screen time and dialogue was given to even non significant characters, giving the world more flesh and mind. It was so well written and shot that even a few lines gave insight to the mind of the characters. Even better, I loved how the story focused on non-Western characters whose actors all brought freshness to their respective roles, making an old penny shine new. No one takes anything sitting down and makes no apologies. Overall, stellar movie with great commentary on organized crime life-style in Desi countries.
I don't know why but this film represents Bangladesh incorrectly.

I went into this movie expecting it to be another one of those Netflix movies that are basic and have no story. While the plot was lacking (just a little), the action sequences were amazing and all the actors killed it. I enjoyed this movie the whole way through and even though I understand it's not the best, it's definitely a guilty pleasure for me.

Story simple and straight forward. It's kind of a mad max in India style Netbuster. Non stop action, evil drug lords, Michael bay explosions. It's a good time with some really well done fight scenes.Hemsworth does a good job. The writing is decent enough. The kid they chose is a bit off though. Not the best choice.

This is another very good movie from Netflix.
The action gets going early on and it maintains the pace throughout.
The fight scenes and requisite stunts are very well choreographed and believable.
I have read some of the criticisms of it's depiction of Bangladesh, but I have to applaud the makers of this movie for at least setting it somewhere other than a major US or European city.
This movie is full of action from start to last but the only thing they lacked was plot.

reviews.review_title: Great Action but will not reccomend it
reviews.content: The action scenes were beyond good but there was no pot, i wanted the movie to end.

reviews.review_title: Brilliant action sequences meet a plot that is essentially the 2-line outline
reviews.content: Extraction makes a strong start and about half of the movie flies past before you get a breather. The action sequences have been shot to perfection, taking care to not overdo them. There's this one 11-minute long sequence which was filmed in one shot - it was really praiseworthy.Chris deserves praise for portraying his character so convincingly. Action sequences were already his forte; but he absolutely nails the rare emotional bits as well.The second half gets a little boring because of the lack of a proper storyline; there's only so much shooting and killing you can take before it becomes an element of gore. The nail-biting finish just isn't there. However, it's still a good film and definitely worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: Loved it, pure action. Zero SJW, what a relief a movie without politics....
reviews.content:
Well folks I'm so happy after watching this movie because the SJW's never won and movie studios are starting to realise in order to have a successful movie you need to keep politics out of it. Set in Bangladesh this movie rocks, a gangsters kid gets kidnapped and Hemsworth the mercenary has to save the day. Great shootouts, lovely locations, average script, but it's hardcore action near on par with great international movies like the Raid.
I congratulate the director and scriptwriters for leaving the politics out. I never was a fan of Hemsworth because he was married to that nasty piece of work Miley Cyrus. But now he's got rid of that feminist wrench his career is reborn, he really delivered as the tough guy, real solid performance, he's back in the big time.
Lastly, the libtards will be pulling their hair out about this movie, so you gotta support it then just to drive them nuts. :)

As far as action films goes this is below average especially if you're comparing them to the Bourne series. The oner was done well but it's so overused now that it felt extraneous. The story has also been done so many times that you sorta start rooting for the hero to get killed. Alas, that didn't happen.

I just can't understand all these negative reviews based upon the fact that the scenes don't represent Dhaka or even Bangladesh as a country. Do all these naysayers really think that Mel Gibson way back when crying "Freedom" really was representing William Wallace or, indeed, Scotland? Get a grip - it's a movie! And, it's a good movie at that!

reviews.review_title: Is this Dhaka or Kolkata or Kabul?
reviews.content: Are you guys mad or drunk? You called it Dhaka (BD), but accent looks Kolkata (IN) and kids are fighting like Kabul (AF). Final outcome JOKE.Really disappointed. So, 1 star for you guys.

reviews.review_title: I dont like action movies but this one was actually good
reviews.content: Usually i dont enjoy action movies too much but this one was acceptable because the story behind it was great. The acting from Hemsworth was beyond amazing in this also

It's an action flick and I went into it expecting nothing less. I gave it 9 stars as an action movie. If you like shoot'em up's then this a great one. Can a guy really waste that many armed men, well no, but then what fun would that to be watch.

Sam Hargave went above and beyond to produce an action epic. I wasn't expecting much in regards to story, but since the dawn of time, when has action meant character development? A lot of amazing one-shot takes, choreography and stunts. Seeing as the director is a stuntman himself, he managed to pioneer some amazing action scenes, POVs and perspectives. I got a big John Wick feel from this film and enjoyed it throughout.

Brilliantly shot, this action movie has some of the best camera work I've seen in a long time. There is a sequence going through an apartment complex that is made to look like one long take, it feels like you are right there with the characters. Great action movie, regardless or culturally accuracy or thin plot.

reviews.review_title: Their is nothing match with Bangladesh
reviews.content: Action movie fans needn't worry that Netflix's Chris Hemsworth-starring vehicle Extraction wastes much time on such niceties as character development. When first seen, his character is nursing a hangover while lying outside with a couple buddies. To clear his head, he makes a death-defying leap off a cliff and then calmly meditates for a few minutes at the bottom of a lake. That pretty much tells you all you need to know about Australian mercenary Tyler Rake - yes, that's his name - other than that he's clearly struggling with private grief and numbs his physical and emotional pain with copious amounts of OxyContin. Oh, and that he eventually kills somebody with, you guessed it, a rake.

Hemsworth's best film that doesn't involve the name Thor.. It had some of the best choreographed fight scenes that I've ever seen that didn't come from a martial arts film and it even added gunplay into some of the fight scenes which put those two together and you've really got my attention.. It's not packed full of a back story or big on character development but the action and ultimately the revenge totally makes up for this films shortcomings.. It ended with me feeling giddy and smiling..!
Fun watch

My Rating : 3.5/5

However, as a whole, you can almost tell that this film was directed by a stunt man, as the action seemed vivid to the extent that you could almost feel the sweat of Mr. Hemsworth body, as he took out half the country of Bangladesh's crime syndicate.

In which I watch ten minutes of a truly awful film and write a review.Just because movies no longer make it to the cinema these days doesn't mean that runtimes should be longer, yet most Netflix films go way over a sensible time limit. There is no way this thing needs to go over 1h30min but clocks in at 1h56min, or in technical terms, too long. It's sort of the flip side of the old joke in which two people are talking about aa restaurant with bad food. "And such small portions," one of them says. We have lousy movies that somehow think they will be better if they go on 20% longer.Yet another bloody kill-fest of wonton slaughter in which the protagonist seems to be immune to bullets while everyone else around him is a bullet magnet. Does this movie have as many senseless homicides as John Wick? Some other fool who can be bothered to watch all 1h56min of this piece of trash will have to answer than question.
The cinematography and the dialogues are like real to me. The direction is obviously awesome. It's must watch flim.

I thought it was great am impressed by the first-time director. Great action, great story, damn good acting team.That said, I was a bit confused with the whole plot hole of the assassin turned good guy. Regardless, it was good enough to overlook.

You can't compare a movie like this to a movie from another genre. It's an action flick, and a great one at that. Chris Hemsworth plays the bad-ass good guy really well. The action scenes are tremendous..and there's enough black humour to keep it ticking over. If it's a knockout action movie you want, then this is for you (and me). I loved it...totally recommended.

reviews.review_title: A good example of cultural appropriation
reviews.content: The movie had no substance, only had fight scenes. The alleged kidnapping had no relation with what happens next; Chris Hemsworth's character could have been a deranged psychopath who kills law-enforcement officers for fun, and the movie would have remained the same. An apparently righteous hero cannot justify killing law enforcement officers who were probably just following orders. And those orders were justified too - especially after Chris Hemsworth's character killed dozens of uniforms.The trailer said it was a fight between two drug lords. We never see any of the alleged drug lords to be involved in any drug business. None of the drug lords command a big army of their own.The drug lord of Bangladesh was not believable in his role, not sure if he was a bad actor, or he simply could not pull off a foreign language.Next, there is the issue of the Dhaka city. Except for some aerial footage, none of the scenes were from Dhaka. They portrayed a city in some dirt poor country, war-ridden African country - and Dhaka did not fit the bill.Also, the movie does not show anything quintessential Dhaka - if they claimed to be taking place in Colombo, Kathmandu, or any other city - they would have to change only a few props. Moreover, no actors spoke in any Bangladeshi accent. In fact, it was obvious they were all from the Indian state of Bengal. This is why directors should not use a cultural reference without understanding it. The saddest part was, they could have hired one or two actors and screenwriters from Bangladesh, and do this better.However, no amount of cultural course correction could have made the movie better. This was the very definition of a cliche movie - which was probably fine as long as the movie did not claim to be something bigger than that. In the end, I did not even remember the name of Chris Hemsworth's character, nor the name of David Harbour's character, and I never cared for any of them.Netflix should make better investments in the future!PS: if finding Bangladeshi actors were that difficult, then they should have flipped the story. The Indian drug lord could have kidnapped Bangladeshi drug lord's son.

reviews.review_title: Good action but too weak story
reviews.content: Just because you wanted a action film and you have to grab the market of india,you shouldn't disrespect Bangladesh and the way they represented Bangladesh in this movie is hilarious.Yes,Bangladesh is not a counary of terrorist and we are not that poor and weak.
Great film, Great Story once again not sure where the hate is coming from. Awesome performance from all of the cast and Hemsworth is once again fantastic!!

Netflix should apologise for misrepresentation of Bangladesh. Bangladesh is not a terrorist country. Netfliz showed a terrorist run our army its never happened ever. I love Netflix bt ftom now its bad feelings for them.

Who you going to call? A White Savior.Chris Hemsworth is basically Punisher in this installment.The movie is about a guy trying to save a boy from the slums of India. It's full on war. Why? I have no idea. Don't know much about the main guy other than he is a very skilled combatant. that mean development isn't perfect.The acting is fine. Most of the Indians don't speak English.There is a lot of bullets and bloodshed. This is the first time children get harmed on screen. Which makes it realistic and unPC. Children are used as fearless mercenaries. Thor isn't afraid to harm them either.This movie is not made for children of these days. They'd get puny nightmares.The movie showed a lot of the slums of India. As well shown how corrupt the authorities can be.1 fault I dislike movies that start at the end then goes back to the beginning. I've known Chris Hemsworth as Thor Almighty only. Now I've realised He is great in action Also...
He nailed it ✊🏼✊🏼✊🏼✊🏼

An Afghanistan veteran who has become a mercenary and a suicidal alcoholic after his child has died, gets the mission to rescue the boy of an Indian drug king whom another drug king has kidnapped. U-hu. Who cares?The father of the boy is imprisoned and tells his right hand guy to get the boy back at all cost. All right. He just has forgotten that all his assets have been frozen. (Except for his villa, his luxary cars, his huge staff, the means to send the boy to a private school etc.) Anyway, they got the boy not for money but to humiliate him.His adjutant hires a mercenary troop from the USA (?!) to do the job. A dozen professionals with high tech equipment and a private satellite. Taylor, our hero, gets into the den of gangsters to "negotiate". The kidnappers want the money. Huh? I thought it was about humiliation? Anyway, he grabs the boy and shoots his way out. By the way, the gang members seem not to know how to load or use guns.Taylor sends proof to his contractor that he has the boy. But, alas, he gets no money! They were played! And they were obviously that stupid not to demand half of it up front, as any good contract killer would do. Instead the father's adjutant, a former special forces guy himself, kills all mercenaries on the field and tries to snatch the boy from Taylor to present him to his boss and save his ass (which was threatened by him, although he has no more men out there nor money to hire any).The other drug boss controls all of Indian's army and police forces who hunt now both of them. Much shooting and killing. Taylor refuses to give up the boy, although he won't get paid. He wants to bring him back. To whom? On the way to a bridge they must cross to get to safety (what exactly makes it safe, except for the "game rules"?), he gets attacked by teenage gangsters which he spares, again. Why? Because he has such a good heart as a contract killer? Unprofessional.Then the big final at the bridge! Taylor gets shot several times, among others by the corrupt general. He has the ability to sharp-shoot from all sides at once! He even gets Taylor's friends on the other side of the bridge! Amazing!The boy gets over the bridge and is save (game's mission accomplished). Taylor gets shot by one of the teens he had spared before and drops into the water.Epilogue: The other drug boss gets shot by one of Taylor's buddies and the once timid boy jumps from a dive board into a pool. Maybe Taylor is watching from afar?Woah, what a bunch of crap! It's a first person shooter turned into a movie with the usual psycho killer who has actually a soft heart. Only teenage boys who get a hard-on when they play Call of Duty can praise this junk.Sad times.

Great action sequences and I like that it is set in Dhakar.
Unfortunately it is very unrealistic, why kidnapp the boy in the first place? Why be prepared to ransom the back? Why expend all the resources to get the boy back? Why is the main character so overpowered? Why would you try screw over a mescernary company? All so silly.

reviews.review_title: Another cookie-cutter Netflix actioner with some above average set-pieces
reviews.content: Currently one of the most savvy and successful businesses in the world, with a model that knows exactly what its audience wants and delivers entirely too that, Netflix have been churning out sleek and fast-paced action films ad nauseam over the last few years, with their new adrenaline fueled tentpole Extraction fitting the modus operandi perfectly.Backed by Marvel hero's the Russo brothers, with Joe penning the script and directed by long-time Marvel stunt coordinator and performer Sam Hargrave, Extraction is an instantly familiar action experience that sees Chris Hemsworth's downtrodden but Thor-like Australian mercenary Tyler Rake end up in Bangladesh trying to rescue the son of an Indian crime lord who has been kidnapped by a rival operator.Anyone that has ever seen an action thriller with a seemingly cold-hearted and depressive central figure, whose also a one man killing machine, will know exactly where Extraction is taking us, as the mission Rake is on goes sour and he is forced to take down what feels like a city worth of bad guys to protect his new mate Ovi.Similar at times to Man on Fire, Mile 22 and filmed in a way that feels like a direct rip-off of The Raid franchise (in what is becoming the normal now for Hollywood films trying to replicate the energy and frenetic nature of those action classics), Extraction fails to bring anything new to the table as Hargrave ticks off a serious of boxes on his way to an all too familiar conclusion.It's not to say there aren't little action delights along the journey Rake takes, with a clearly CGI'd but none the less impressive unbroken action set piece around the 30 minute mark of the film one of the candidates for the best action showcases of the year but there's far too much of Extraction that is forgettable, unbelievable and tiresome to bring it home with a bang.This forgettable film nature is a trend that Extraction lead and beloved Aussie icon Chris Hemsworth needs to pay close attention to, with his work outside of the Marvel universe and the well-liked but financial failure Rush is cause for concern.Films like Blackhat, In the Heart of the Sea, 12 Strong and Bad Times at the El Royale might not be the worst films going around but their far from the type of products you'd want littering your career for too many more years to come.Final Say -Some nice action moments are to be found in Extraction but outside of that this charmless and unimaginative action thriller is the exact type of Netflix outing that is still too prevalent for a company looking to reach for the low hanging fruit too often.2 garden rakes out of 5

reviews.review_title: You make movies when you have no knowledge abut the culture
reviews.content: I can say thousand things in the movie why its worst. The most disgusting thing is the action happened on Dhaka, Bangladesh. reviews.review_title: Life is too short to watch such bad movies!
reviews.content: You never expect one 'Marriage Story' from the Russo brothers. This is a truth. Another truth is the whole Avengers series has literally murdered the careers of a number of stars. Scarlett Johansson may be an exception. The role of Chris Evans in Knives Out could be played by anyone, as the story and screenplay both were so tight and there were plenty of powerful actors to sail the boat. Extraction is another sad tale of how you play with the expectation of the common people after a gargantuan success like the Avengers. Chris Hemsworth has been portrayed as a mercenary who has literally killed more than a thousand soldiers in this movie. Was it that necessary to forget every logic while making an action film? If you have ample time in your hand and your Netflix subscription has been lying unused for a month, you may watch this. But never watch this piece of ... with any expectation. Because that is not going to be fulfilled. No plot, no screenplay, no meaningful dialogue- this movie literally offers nothing. Even the sets look pathetic. Do yourself a favor, stay away. Very, very, very bad movie.

Extraction was a gripping downhill run on a vertical 3,000 ft drop. When I see a movie I know I'll watch at least 6 times, I buy it. So, of course I have The Raid: Redemption and The Raid 2. Going to get Extraction when it goes to DVD.Director Sam Hargrave's Extraction action is a direct child of Director Gareth Evans: The Raid, The Raid 2 and the immersive single-shot work of Director Sam Mendes: 1917. That's not to criticize Sam Hargrave, it's to see who influenced his work.The 'epic' street fight between Chris Hemsworth and Randeep Hooda was lifted off the final fight sequence in The Raid 2 between Iko Uwais and Cecep Arif Rahman. The Raid 2 is still the high watermark for action pictures to date...

reviews.review_title: Best action movie I have seen in quite some time
reviews.content: I am surprised this one doesn't have a higher rating... I really enjoyed this film! I have been bored with action movies lately. I rarely finish one all the way through, or I may skip big chunks to the ending. This one really held my attention and I watched the entire way through. There was such fast moving action, and there were several times I was actually gasping out loud I was so surprised/shocked at what just happened. After the movie was finished I had physical "anxiety" pain across the upper back. I haven't had an action movie effect me like that since I can't even remember when. I would love to see a sequel.

reviews.review_title: Idiotic seems to be acceptable for an action movie, but slow?
reviews.content: The camera is good, yet I hated the editing. The story is slow and the action seems to be an afterthought, trying to salvage a silly drama and pushing it to a different genre. I know, it was intended to be action, but overall the action scenes look like added in post production.The story starts with a slow action scene. Somebody is fighting nobody on a crowded bridge. Oh, it's Thor! And Thor is about to die. So he looks into the camera and everything starts revealing: his young days as a rich Indian boy. Now, that is a good start. And from there it slowly goes down.

Entire shooting was done in kolkata but u displayed that it was dhaka! Police and army were saving a drug lord thats quite stupid.
dissapointed

reviews.review_title: Superbly choreographed action compensates for weak storytelling! [+59%]
reviews.content: Extraction offers the familiar action-movie combination of breakneck pacing, a paper-thin storyline, and dazzling set-pieces. As the title suggests, it's about a mercenary by the name of Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth) carrying out the extraction of a little boy (apparently, the son of a drug lord in India) from the clutches of a Bangladeshi drug lord. Aiding him covertly in his mission is a team led by Nik (Golshifteh Farahani, who's best known for About Elly). A subplot brings Saju (Randeep Hooda), the Indian drug lord's enforcer, into the scenario. What ensues is a series of ultra-violent, well-crafted (and tastefully shot by Newton Thomas Sigel) action-movie clichés.Hargrave chooses to cover up the fallacies in the script, some inane casting choices (Priyanshu Painyuli, for example, is a particularly bad one), the lack of locational authenticity (most of the film is shot in India, not Bangladesh except for plateshots), and disjointed Bengali lines mouthed by the gangsters, with neatly choreographed action. One such set-piece (shot like it's a single take) that gets going shortly into the 35-minute mark, is probably the best I've seen in recent memory (which is why it gets a 3 and not a 2.5). The action is punctuated by bullets whizzing past narrow alleyways, hand-to-hand combat that we've seen done better in Asian films, and a sufficient amount of blood-spilling.Heck, in what seemed like a minor nod to The Raid films, Tyler uses a rake (which is also his surname, mentioned later in a scene) to dispose of a thug. The single-shot-set-piece is straight out of the books of "Call of Duty", with the camera splendidly juggling between first-person and third-person action. Even for a hardcore action flick, Joe Russo writes in a few scenes that attempt to humanize the characters of Tyler and Saju. They aren't exactly acting showcases, but they get the job done. Plus, the presence of Randeep Hooda subverts the 'white savior' cliché to a certain extent.While the scenes involving the Bangladeshi drug lord (dressed in awkward costumes) were the weakest (in terms of writing and performances), I did like how Hargrave portrayed the plight of underprivileged kids in the Indian subcontinent and how they were being used as gun-wielding henchmen. It's a template action movie alright, but there's enough machismo, explosions, and gore to please fans of the genre. It, however, needed better writing, a (much better) baddie, and more heart, to rise above its surface-level coolth.

Every once in a while a movie comes along that makes one wonder how did they do that and do it so well? Here we are and this is that movie. First off, Hemsworth is finding his niche and excelling in it. He has his body and his acting lined up and the audience likes both. The director took that and his skills and gave us a adrenaline rush of a movie so action-packed that not only makes the point of not giving up but things aren't over until they are. Good story, twists, special forces, weapons galore and the scenery or locations are impressive for their realism. The reasoning of which really isn't all that important, in fact, it is a designed adversity that he is trying to save a kid's life. Without even watching the movie, I could have told you it wasn't worth killing so many people to rescue one kid.The action is excellent and worth watching the rest of the movie: hell, you could even fast forward through the parts where they're not fighting. reviews.review_title: As a fellow bengali, please stop being so butthurt
reviews.content: This is literally a an action film, if you're expecting accuracy, attention to detail, and a realistic portrayal of Bangaldesh you might be expecting too much. A civilized society with warm and loving citizens doesn't make for a good rescue film.Now, about the movie, its good. The action sequences are great. Really hard hitting, guttural action. The camera work is a little disorienting at times, it does make you feel very close to the action but the constant tilting and movement gets annoying quickly. Also the story is sort of OK, the motivations of the bengali drug dealer aren't very fleshed out, and Chris Hemsmworths characters follows played out tropes of a soldier thats lost it all and finds his salvation in rescuing the kid. Despite all that this is a fun movie, even if some of the action is a bit intense. Definitely a good distraction during the quarantine.
Extraction is a wonderful object of activity filmmaking. Stunt and fight scene are so impressive ! This move is welcome during quarantine in France :)

In the 80s, youd have one-man-army films that worked because they we over the top or fun etc. So it still made sense if the plot was razor thin. The problem with making a film like this one so gritty and realistic and violent and dark, is that the plot and script must also represent this. This script and story dont even try.The entire premise makes no sense...they insist on saving one kid for an evil drug lord...but dont mind killing 100 or 200 other people with children of their own who are just following orders and are probably just decent policemen who have no idea what's going on.And they wont even get paid for it.And theyll all probably die.And, somehow, in the opener, one guy double crossed them and knew exactly where all his team was, even the guy in the woods. Such a bad lazy script all around meant only, one mist assume, to practice new stunts and choreography.Beyond that, it is obvious that you will know all the cliches and tropes. But. You wont see some of the car hits coming because they are well shot, but also completely nonsensical since they come one after another, yet no one sees are hears them coming...again and again. Are the streets in india or Bangladesh covered in silent and cloaked electric vehicles? How about a gun and knife battle with cars and people that see it and completely ignore it and just try to get in the way of it. I mean, it is action and looks cool, if not real all the time, but it makes you groan often.The acting is actually good all around, even the kid.Oh, and of course, a beautiful woman gets the last kill without warning or explaining any of it, including what exactly physically makes her equipped to be such a character or how she possibly gets near the villain.Frustrating. So much talent involved and it's just another one of these movies...

The action scenes are tightly shot, the camera work is really good. For me setting this movie in Bangladesh is a side show, this movie could have been filmed anywhere, and to all those who are upset that the movie makes Bangladesh look bad, I disagree, the movie is based on gangsters, they kept the kidnapped child in the slums and the rest of the movie is based on trying to get out of that area. Those who are saying gangsters don't behave in that manner in Bangladesh, well that's pure BS, homeless kids throughout the sub continent are taken advantage of by evil people, and we all know how the authorities can be bought, don't duck the truth face it.Finally, two negatives, I guess the movie could have been 15 mins shorter, the actor who play the kidnapped kid could have been replaced with someone better.Watch this movie, and ignore the scores given by the pro Bangladesh activists,

reviews.review_title: A nice action movie full of action scenes

reviews.review_title: Sacrificing the plot and characters for action
reviews.content: I didn't expect much going into Extraction. Since it's directed by stunt coordinator Sam Hargrave, I had a feeling the action would be impressive and indeed it was but everything else was lacking in comparison.Extraction follows Tyler Rake, a mercenary who goes on a deadly extraction mission where he has to rescue a huge crime lord's kidnapped son.The biggest enjoyment you can get from Extraction is the action sequences. I have to give a huge amount of credit to everyone who worked on the choreography of the action. All the action scenes are brutal and look very realistic. There is this incredible 10 minute sequence that looks like it's done in one take which is any action lover's dream. The camerawork and stunts during that scene are really well done. I can't imagine the amount of time that would've been invested just on that one scene. I wish I could say the same for the script.If you're going to watch this film for the plot and characters, then you will be disappointed. The Russo Brothers, who made films like Avengers: Infinity War and Avengers: Endgame, wrote the screenplay and it's pretty bad. Apart from the action, there is nothing else to it. We barely learn about Hemsworth's character and the relationship between him and Jaiswal was extremely underdeveloped. This made it so difficult for me to care about them especially the end where it mattered. David Harbour is in the film but he didn't get to do much. He was completely wasted. There wasn't much to the villain either. A movie like John Wick has great action scenes as well but at the same time there is a good amount of character development within it.Extraction is very forgettable. The action is commendable but I've seen better in films like John Wick and The Raid. Chris Hemsworth and Randeep Hooda were good but the material they had to work with had a lot left to be desired.
Really entertaining movie if you like fast paced action movies. Man on Fire but in India instead of Mexico.

The movie is yet again a great work from Chris Hemsworth. The storyline is a bit predictable but other than that... the locations. The stunts . The scenes are very well set. The close hand combat is the icing to the cake.

This Movie has Great Action And A good Basic Plot. People are Spreading Hate Just Because of Portraying The Dhaka City. Like Seriously.. You Cannot Hate A movie Just Because You Don't Like How City Have been Portrayed.This Movie Have A Very Good Action Scenes, And Most Importantly We Can Hard-work Of The Team. .....So Stop Spreading Hate Please.....
The dialogue method is traditional for action movies, but the directing and shooting method is excellent.

reviews.review_title: TOP NOTCH ACTION MOVIE, not for GIRLYBOY WHINGERS
reviews.content: To all the numbskulls whingeing, get a life you girlyboy trolls, this is an action movie, no one gives a flying fig about what country its in, its not a flippin documentary chronicling an actual event such as "lone survivor" or "13 hours", its a high quality ultra realistic ultra violent fictional action movie in the same vein as "Bourne" & "Taken" & its a refreshing change from the usual Eastern European location.The story/plot isn't weak its mearly simple & that's all it needs to be, it doesn't need to be complex because its all about the action.This is simply a 1st class adrenaline pumping roller-coaster ride.Cinematography is excellent.Camerawork is excellent.Stunt work is excellent.Locations are excellent.Acting is excellent, not just Hemsworth but everyone involved.Now back to the whingeing girlyboys, absolutely no one watching this movie is going to make a judgement about the country or its people that are depicted in this movie, just like no one made a judgement about the countries or people shown in Taken or Bourne or Rambo or any other fictional action thriller, its over the top, over dramatised made up for maximum entertainment.Now its a good thing to be proud of where you're from but it is utter lunacy to protest that crime & corruption doesn't exist in the country you live, it exists & prospers in every village, town & city on this planet.Have some common sense & review this movie for what it is, it isn't a documentary, it isn't a biography & it sure as hell isn't a tourism video depicting all the pretty sites with all its pretty people, it's an action thriller & a damed good one at that.
Loads of action drenched in cheese and that's about it.

I really enjoyed this movie. It was good to see a different backdrop instead of the streets of the US or Europe.The action scenes were excellent and very intense with brilliant fight scenes but for me the camera work was the star... I cannot even work out in my head how they did some of the scenesReally good move - grab the popcorn and enjoy

Mind blowing action , Chris hemsworth and good acting by support cast made this film a masterpiece. Storyline is gripping and not a single dull moment . It's a fiction so who are criticising that Dhaka is not represented good it's title lie

Extraction is worth seeing for the great action. It's brutal, well coordinated, tense, and exciting. There is an entire action scene where it's basically one take with hidden cuts and it is incredible. More stuntmen need to direct movies because lots of movies fail at interesting action. However, the sacrifice really takes this movie down. The story and characters are so generic that any scene that isn't action is downright annoying. For some reason they spoil part of the end of the movie in the beginning even though it didn't add anything to show it in the beginning. And speaking of the end, the action started to become stale by the 3rd act and it felt a lot more like just walk shoot, walk shoot, walk shoot, and it was hard to fear for any of the characters because they are so basic. Overall, there is probably a solid 30-40 minutes of excellent action, a mediocre 30 minute finale, and 40 minutes of a generic story and characters. I feel this theme is very common in the Netflix original action movies such as Den of Thieves and I hope the sequel to Extraction is better.
Loud, senseless, cheap feeble story with extreme violence and innumerable body counts.

The movie is full of fun and action. It is mainly set in Dhaka, the capital of Bangladesh as the story tells. There is a river which we can assume Buriganga river. Its north side is Dhaka and the south is Keraniganj. Some places shown in the movie may resemble with Sadarghat, Sawarighat, Islampur. Peoples of these places has their own dialect called "Dhakaiya". The Bangla language we found in the movie can not be Bangladeshi Bangla let alone Dhakaiya.

These action movies nowadays are trying to copy John Wick. Extraction is a borderline bad movie with just enough decent stuff to keep it from being bad. The one shot action set piece was admittedly kinda cool and Chris Hemsworth did do a good job with what he was given but everything else is so bland. The cinematography is bland, the action set pieces, minus the one take one, was bland and the characters were bland. The script was terrible and the story was so bloated and boring that I was scratching my head wondering why they made this movie 2 hours long. I would have been more lenient if the movie was at max an hour and a half long but 2 hours is pushing it. I would recommend passing on this unless you really want to watch it.
Netflix's Overhyped and Overrated and awaited Hollywood meets Bollywood Movie 'Extraction' Starring Chris Hemsworth 'The Thor" in Desi Action Movie.

Anyone who is trying to write a screenplay for an action movie will have a hard time coming up with novel ideas. But these guys managed to pull off a novel premise to unwind yet another action-packed Hollywood movie with an A-lister. and a low-budget cast. But that's about it. Great action scenes, great cast (including the amazingly beautiful Golshifteh Farahani), but with no surprises beyond the initial premise. Not even the fact that the seemingly superhuman antagonist villain/hero who can dodge bullets for 90% of the movie ends up being shot in the face when his deus-ex-machina batteries run out on the script...
All in all, a nicely done and entertaining action movie.

reviews.review_title: A Highly Rewatchable Entertaining Action Flick
reviews.content: Extraction is a brainless action film, which not only understands its identity, but under the competent helm of Sam Hargrave, is executed beautifully. Many action films feel the need to insert shaky hand-held camera (I'm looking at you Michael Mann), or worse still, frenetic cuts that are challenging to follow, but it's the use of steady-cam, and the smooth pacing, that really makes the film easy to watch.With plenty of shoot-outs, some fine looking explosions (though one is a little hit and miss), plenty of guys being thrown left and right by the protagonist, and the inclusion of the best knife fight I have seen since Jeong-Beom Lee's The Man From Nowhere, this film has virtually everything 'cept the kitchen sink. I had heard the film's violence was viscerally exaggerated, though I would disagree. It's no Freddy Vs. Jason, but it's no Jason Bourne either, so expect to see your fair share, but you won't ever need a towel to wipe it from your screen.A good action film needs an equally great villain accompanying it. Extraction, in this department, is rather lacking. Priyanshu Painfulli portrays drug-lord Amir, whose innumerable henchmen and child soldiers are enforced by Shataf Figar as the Colonel, who can authoritatively shut down the city of Bangladesh in a heartbeat when crap hits the fan. These characters are similar to The Voice in Man on Fire; rarely ever seen, yet their influence is around every corner. To exacerbate their ruthlessness, more screen-time was needed.The use of metaphor is well inserted on occasion, through dialogue and accompanying visuals, and it is this that perhaps gives the most depth to Chris Hemsworth's Tyler, other than the moments when he simply tells us his backstory to strangers, akin to Cruise and Foxx in Collateral (without the antagonism). He portrays a larrikin mercenary, his genuine Australian accent accentuating his tough guy image (because who doesn't like a good occa?), his boyish charms and poignant backstory making him incredibly likable. Ovi (Rudhraksh Jaiswal), the teenager he is assigned to 'extract' from Amir, who has had him kidnapped for not only a large sum, but to show his imprisoned father who's boss, is also equally enjoyable to watch, and though he receives the same lacking amount of characterization, his humanity is an engraved part of the film.Randeep Hooda joins the cast as Saju, a bodyguard whose intentions are initially difficult to fathom, though his limited characterization reveals a family-man buried beneath his grizzled exterior. David Harbour's Gaspar, who is in the film for probably all of eight minutes, portrays a character who believes the end justifies the means, while Golshifteh Farahani as Nik, is easily the only character capable of stealing the light from Hemsworth. A brilliant tactician, who can control any situation, and can wield all manner of conventional firearms - she is the ultimate waifu.At the end of the day, the story is pretty bare-bones; boy gets kidnapped and must be rescued, with predictable double-crosses abound, though that doesn't make it any less entertaining, or recommendable - at the same time though, it is forgettable, requiring little in the way of brain power. For a film that occasionally breaks the 'show don't tell' rule of cinema, the end is very much multi-interpretative, adding depth to an otherwise two-dimensional feature. I personally think Hemsworth should be in more movies like this; gritty fun action films that remind us of decades earlier, when movies were more concerned with entertainment, instead of politics, whilst Hargrave has equally shown us that stuntmen, much like Chad Stahelski and David Lietch, make for some of the best action directors in the business today.

reviews.review_title: Many people got hurt in the making of this film
reviews.content:
Acting: 9/10
Great cast with awesome performances from chris Hemsworth and the kid. The villains are also done well where you do sincerely dislike them. This isnt a drama so Rambo acting is good enough for me.Cinematography/fight scenes: 11/10
Absolutely the highlight of this film is the fight scenes and action scenes. The technical application is 10/10. The director of this is a stunt co coordinator for many famous films and he shows his skill here. Every shot, punch, death is immersive and feels powerful and real. They have long scenes that are blended and cut so insanely well. This is up there and imo better than "hitmans bodyguard" and "kingsman" when it comes to action scenes. I promise you many, many many stunt men were hurt in the making of this.Story: 6.5/10
As everyone states yes it doesnt have the best of story. Is it bad? Hell no. It's just typical. It's interesting throughout, you care for the main characters. The end is a nice send off and is symbolic/foreshadowed well. It's just nothing new but that's okay.Summary:
This is top 3 best ever action stunt movies out there. The story isnt anything new, but it's good.
if your a action flick fan then you should have a blast watching this!

reviews.review_title: There is Thor vs Hellboy- do you need anything else?
reviews.content:
In Extraction, Chris Hemsworth does not have Mjolnir by his side. He still manages to ratchet up a triple digit bodycount to save a drug lord's son. How ungodly of him.The plot is as simple as it gets- India's biggest drug lord's son gets kidnapped for ransom by Bangladesh's biggest drug lord, and the former enlists Hemsworth's group of mercenaries for the rescue. Of course, the obstacles start piling up, and Thor summons up all the thunder he can to save the innocent.Neflix may have thought a movie set in Bangladesh offers novelty, but their treatment is so formulaic, that you replace Bangladesh with any other 3rd world country setting, the movie would virtually remain the same. The 10 year old child soldiers, machete waving teenagers, corrupt police forces and simply high gangsters could fit in anything set in Mexico, Africa or Burma. There is absolutely no attempt to develop the precious few characters in the movie, including the leads.Seems Chris Hemsworth is saving his laughs for Marvel only. Here he plays Tyler Rake- a mercenary with a heart of gold and lot of bullets- you know the kind of characters Arnold used to play back in the 80s. Regular Netflix stalwarts Pankaj Tripathi, Neha Mahajan and David Harbour play side characters, but the one man that really makes every scene count is a buffed up Randeep Hooda. He stands toe to toe against Hemsworth in the action sequences, and gets a poignant send-off too. Rest of the cast are caricatures of the highest order.Irrespective of the genericity of the plot, Extraction is probably one of Netflix's most well-choreographed action movie. and why not- given that director Sam Hargreaves has been the stunts director in a host of Marvel movies. Mind you, this is no Chad Stahelski, or Gareth Edwards stuff. Hargreaves trades off Chad's style, and Gareth's art for effective brute. It is a cocktail of everything you see in action movies- manic car chases, exploding helicopters, sniper fire, close quarter gunfights, and car crashes, and from a first time film-maker, really impressive at that.Am sure he will only get better- and learn to nuance his characters a bit more, and make his movies a bit less predictable.But the two things that make up my price of my time cost of viewing are the epic Thor vs Hellboy fight (can you do that, Marvel?) and making Hemsworth speak Bengali 😊Indian don vs Bangladeshi don really? Whom did you think will win?
Extraction- playing on your phone.

This film is not perfect, yes there could have been more plot, but not for plots sake, rather to divert 5-10% of the action time which at the very end became slightly fatiguing.
But the action and single shot sequences, inspired by children of men, and the best Bourne films more than John wick, were staggeringly amazing. Very inventive with amazing pacing and Inventive.
For those rating this film 6 or lower, most likely a critique of the portrayal of the location, do you think Trainspotting is an accurate portrayal of Edinburgh, Training Day of Los Angeles, Ronin of the south of France? to name a few amazing films with very exaggerated Stereotypes of locations.With so much dross coming out over the last few years, let's celebrate a new benchmark for action films!

reviews.review_title: The action is the major highlight of the movie, not much plot but decent acting.
reviews.content: Extraction is better than I expected because of its gritty, and brilliant action sequences. Furthermore, Chris Hemsworth may be a no-brainer choice to play an action hero, but in here we can see he is a human who gets busted and injured. There is not much of a plot: hero extracts boy but things get messed up so he has to do the utmost to achieve his mission. That is the premise. But this mission also provides a character arc for Hemsworth's character, and in the middle of the story, he makes a choice. The real highlight of the movie is the action, of course. This movie pulls no punches with the action, there is a slight humor to it involving child soldiers too. I am surprised with the acting from the supporting cast. Randeep Hooda plays one of Hemsworths' nemesis in the beginning, and he is totally badass. I also rooted for his character. The style of shooting involves long shots, and immerses you in the story. The choreography is almost like John Wick, but in a more gritty setting. Thus, there are a lot of good things to enjoy from the movie. The weak point is the drama, and sometimes even the action drags down. The first part was great, but the action in the end was less exciting. But keep watching till the end anyway and you won't regret it.

reviews.review_title: Thor is saving drug lord's son from evil world but failed to reach the expectations.
reviews.content: Direction: Avengers fame stunt director Sam Hargrave turned into director first time. Look-like this will be cake walk for Sam as all big credentials are involved in this Netflix project. However he failed to keep the momentum in this action thriller.Performance: Chris Hemsworth(Thor) gave solid performance as action hero and emotional father. Randeep Hooda was surprisingly brilliant in his first full fledged Hollywood outing. Rudhraksh Jaiwal was also good in touch. Golshifteh Farahani was looking stunting. Good supporting role played by Priyanshu Painyuli.Script and Screenplay: This is the weakest point of this major project. There was nothing new offered by Russo brothers who directed magnum opus Avengers: End Game. They have placed one suspense which was quite obvious and it exposed quite early. When movie based on Indian backdrop, naming convention of father- son should not be western e.g. Ovi Mahajan.Action Sequences: Definitely this department will gave you some goose bumps. All action sequences were world class especially Chris and Randeep's 11 min long action sequence.Last words: If you can understand Bengali, you will enjoy it more.
