reviews.review_title: Terrific action sequences and camera work but meh plot.
reviews.content: Netflix original Extraction was exactly how I predicted it would be in content- High on action and camera work but weak on paper. I still don't get why action movies are always meant to have weak script despite of audience appealing genre. And also logic defying moments make it even worse like one or two mercenaries fighting against entire Bangladeshi police and Army to protect a child of an Indian Drug Lord. Also wasting talented actors for just one or two scenes or making them act like dumb makes it even cringe worthy show.Plot: Tyler Rake's team were hired to rescue son of an Indian Drug Lord from the clutches of Bangladeshi Pablo Escobar(That's how they mentioned him) who have hired some random local goons and kids to operate over the country(as absurd it sounds, it is a fact). While the action scenes and camera work is quite commendable, this wasn't expected to be that bad on paper. The Russo bros are regarded as Visionary directors after their stint in MCU but they're not visionary writers it seems(Joe Russo the writer has failed this time).Sam Hargrave is the captain of this ship and with a thin paper plot provided tried to make it at least worth a watch especially with cinematography of Newton Thomas Sigel especially the single shot scene of 10 minutes length(Though it wasn't exactly single shot but the team deserves applause).Performances wise Chris Hemsworth was leading from the front with one of his career best performance. The God of Thunder has proven himself to be a great actor as well besides being Thor. Rudraskh Jaiswal provided able support to Chris and he was worth mentioning. But the one who surprised me was Randeep Hooda! I've been a fan of his acting but never expected that he'll be such good in action sequences as well. The scenes between Hooda and Hemsworth were sparkling and wished more of them together. David Harbour had only two scenes and that too badly wasted it looked like he was there just as a distraction and unneeded speed breaker. Priyanshu Painyuli was also wasted in a rather unintentional comic role trying to make him look dreaded but ended up being a rather spoof of 'Bangladeshi Pablo Escobar' which didn't make him even remotely menacing especially if he uses local goons or kids to operate(besides the Bangladeshi army of course) the country and end up getting killed plainly. Pankaj Tripathi was there only in one scene that too for only 60 seconds and he exploded with his menacing look but that was sadly forgotten and avoided for no reason, those who know about Pankaj Tripathi and Priyanshu Painyuli(Bhavesh Joshi and Upstarts) would know how great actors they are. Amongst this all male led cast there was Golshifteh Farahani whom the makers tried to make it look important but sadly seemed disinterested.While the movie had its own moments but the overstretched climax and bizarre treatment to one note characters(except Hemsworth, Hooda and Jaiswal) ruined entire plot along with illogical over exaggerated moments. Watch it only for the Hemsworth-Hooda show besides the plot was disastrous.

reviews.review_title: Great direction with brilliant stunts and hand to hand combat scenes.
reviews.content:
I really liked the way camera was used to shoot the action sequences. Hats off !!
If you watch the stunts closely, you would definitely appreciate the effort of Chris and stunt team. Hand to hand combat scenes were pretty cool. I would watch them again. It reminds me off John Wick and Raid.
Plot is simple, which can be easily predicted from trailer.

As for the plot, loved it dearly but parts could've been improved, i.e. could've been made more emotionally engaging, and had the potential to be a real tearjerker. As for the action, I've never been a big fan of intense action scenes and bloody gore... BUT this movie really made me love every bit of it. As someone who has lived in Dhaka, Bd for majority of my life, lemme say this... This movie is NOT a documentary about the city and the lavish lifestyle in newly modernized "digital" areas. Hollywood's eurocentric views have been going on throughout decades as given by their representation of Central & North Africa, Latin & South Americas, AND South & Southeast Asia. So STOP with this oversensitivity and watch the damn movie.

Hollywood movie idea:
Show Brown terrorizing In yellow tint
Snow White man in blue clean tintThe end

Look! Don't get me wrong it's a great action film for a non Bangladeshi. But if you are one, it's a nightmare.Why on the earth would every Bangladeshi listen to Bollywood songs?
The accent of the Bengali actors was horrible.
The portrayal of Dhaka was horrible.Go search google if you don't believe me.The plot was below average.
You couldn't hire a Bangladeshi consultant! For real!Overall great action with zero plot and kudos to Chris.

reviews.review_title: WHY DO I WATCH A MOVIE?
reviews.content: It depends. If it stars Chris Hemsworth it is to be entertained. And does he ever check that box. People say it's not realistic...blah blah blah. Unless it says "based on a true story ", "documentary", or "non-fiction" that's fine with me. There is almost nothing "realistic" about EXTRACTION. But lots of action. Very clear GOOD GUYS and BAD GUYS. And a great ending. I loved it.

Movie is full of action, very good location, very good actors, story is common Hollywood Action movie story, Movie location is claimed India and Mostly Bangladesh.
BUT
A very poor direction by some stuntman and Poor editing and dialogues makes Stars like Chris and Randeep Hooda worthless.
In short movie is hardly 5/10Bagladeshis giving it 1/10 and Indians giving 9-10/10
rating showes is not correct.

This movie must have been written by a kid as there is no imagination whatsoever. Non stop unrealistic fight scenes for the first half which after five minutes become boring and monotonous, and then becomes slow and boring for the second half . I believe the only reason this movie gets views and reviews is because of the lead actor Chris Hemsworth who is always a good watch. Seriously if your over 16 years old this movie is not for you .

reviews.review_title: Hopper is not in Russia, he is in Dhaka :P
reviews.content: Great action flick. 9 points for the unique action scenes. Chris Hemsworth totally nailed his action scenes. Randeep Hooda was also amazing in the Bridge Action Sequence.Got to see Hopper as well, but Nelflix totally disappointed me as I thought he was in Russia. I mean what on earth he is doing in Dhaka. He should be in Russia for El and her gang. :P Jokes apart, David Harbour completely justified his smaller part in this movie.And the Kid, Rudhraksh Jaiswal was really good, carried emotional essence of this movie beautifully. Overall, a good release from Netflix! Go and watch it.
I prefer watching this movie if you love thor and india both. Thanks for the awesome movie.

reviews.review_title: The camera guy needs a raise
reviews.content: I'm giving this 8 stars, purely because of the cinematography and the camera action. That's some damn good stuff.The movie's pretty good actually. It's not revolutionizing, but it's still pretty good. It doesn't really portray Dhaka that acurrately, but I'll give it a pass.

If you are looking for the true depiction of a particular country then watch a documentary.Films are for entertainment and "Extraction" this film delivers on high octane action sequences ranging from hand to hand combat, car chases, gun fights, helicopter chase, close combat and much more.You don't need a script or a story that makes sense in a rescue mission film. Because if you are looking for a story, then stay away from the likes of John Wick 1,2,3, Polar, Spectral, Extinction, Etc.Watch the movie for what it is, a power-house of action scenes.Again, if you want to know about the country, watch a documentary and not a fictional movie.Enjoy :)
One of the best action flic. Don't go to negative reviews. Just watch.

The picture is like a TV film, depth of characters is like of a teaspoon, the decisions the hero makes 😂😂😂 like not killing the childworriors? Who the hell does that? He let's them live so they can kill many others??? 😂😂😂 They are not children, they are small murderers! Nobody in the world would let them small devils live. Mercy full soldier 😂 yeah right. He wouldn't survive a minute in the real world. Man on fire, 1987 and 2004 similar to this movie but million times better.
This is a total waste of time.
The best actor of the movie is the kid who "Thor" is trying to save.
Not often I have been so disappointed in a movie like this one.

reviews.review_title: Tries to be special but isnt
reviews.content: Okay so thor plays some guy who has to get some teen away from kidnappers in india. Hes haunted by his past or something... This movie tries hard to be meaningful but fails becauses its so artificial and insincere. Theres a big action scene in the middle everyone talks about cos its continuous but like... whats the point of that? I had to watch this movie in two sittings because its so uninvolving. And the way the plot is done... it comes across as being more confusing rather than clever which it tries so hard to do. By the time thor simply phones up the guy whos been trying to kill him for the entire movie I kind of lost my patience with it
Tyler and nik character was awesome. Story was fast paced.

"Extraction" is a big, mostly dumb and very violent action flic that has the common sense not to try to be anything else and is actually a surprisingly good example of its kind, providing, of course, that this is the kind of thing you like. The plot is simple; the action relentless. A Mumbai drug-lord's son is kidnapped and it's up to mercenary Chris Hemsworth to get him back. Neither he nor the film hang around. As I've said, it's both violent and relentless; a non-stop catalogue of killings and mutilations, choreographed to bloody perfection by first-time director Sam Hargrave. Of course, there isn't a frame that's actually believable. This is a live-action video game, based on a graphic novel, brilliantly photographed by Newton Thomas Sigel in and around Dhaka and with enough good guys and bad guys killing each other relentlessly to keep it on the boil for two hours. Brains may be largely in short supply but there's certainly no shortage of brawn.

reviews.review_title: Boring story, mediocre supporting actors. Even the action isnt up to much...
reviews.content: Weird movie with all Indian (mediocre) supporting actors and even Chris Hemsworth is speaking Indian now and then.The bad: the action is nothing special, I have seen it all before and done better elsewhere. And there is not much action to speak of, at all. Lots of talk and lots of watching Liam Hemsworth sitting down somehwere waiting for another assignment. Quite boring. Almost 2 hours of watching this I eventually got incredibly bored. Action movie? No way!Not any good? Only recommended for diehard Liam Nemsworth fans, for those it might be an okay movie, but dont get your hopes up...The story: Liam Nemsworth is a hired gun in India. He is hired to protect some Indian rich kid. Nothing much happens, AT ALL...
Extremely good movie excellent story line had fun watching with my family

Playing by the books, functioning within the confines & featuring all the tropes n clichés of its genre, Extraction impresses in the action department, thanks to its kinetic camerawork, spectacular stunts & no shortage of R-rated violence but its plot is too generic, characters are poorly sketched, dialogues pack no punch at all, and its dramatic portions lack the depth & resonance to sustain the momentum generated by the action mayhem, thus resulting in an action-thriller experience that engages at times but is nothing more than a run-of-the-mill effort for the most part.

A fine action movie with lots of well choreographed combat scenes - of course the killing capacity of Tyler Rake aka Chris Hemsworth (and some of the other mercenaries) is ridiculous high and unrealistic, but who cares? Extraction is a good choice if you like to watch such movies like John Wick, The Equalizer, Taken, or those golden oldies like Rambo and Die Hard.

reviews.review_title: Very enjoyable action movie and nothing more
reviews.content: Greetings from Lithuania.Someone looking for a 1 h 45 min pure action movie escapism should look no further - "Extraction" (2020) delivers. The plot here is paper thin, and you probably have seen it many times before, but hey, what is not broken don't need to be fixed! This movie on the other hand has very good action sequences with hand to hand combat and shootouts. Its like Born but much more bloody! The ending was also good.Overall, do not take this film to seriously, nor look something it doesn't have. What it does have are great action sequences, solid performances (and a one very good cameo) and stunt work on highers level. As an action flick, "Extraction " fully delivers.

Another Netflix original movie that believes it's better than it actually is. But perhaps, this is the type of film that is perfect for Netflix. Great action, serviceable story (but no true substance) with a movie star at the center. A movie you watch on a saturday afternoon while trying to relax. Hemsworth hasn't chosen the best projects outside of the MCU and this film is more of the same. I really do wonder if his career will veer more into comedy as the years go by, since that is clearly a major strength of his. Extraction is solid, but it certainly isn't fulfilling my desire for the summer blockbuster (which we've been lacking because of COVID). Oh well.6.8/10

reviews.review_title: MISLEADINGLY TREATED BANGLADESH, AT LEAST GIVE SOME DISCLAIMER!!!
reviews.content: Portraying my country as this, come on netflix. is that how you depict Bangladesh ? huge delineation of my beloved Dhaka city. I urge globally not to picture the environment of Dhaka like they showed here. highly misleading bangladeshi bangali pronunciation, that's how not we bangali do pronunciation. moreover zero plot, terrible story.I mean come on Netflix, you can do better !!!!!!!!!!!!!????????

As far as action is concerned, this movie tops it (all) and that's above all an action/thriller one.The acting is very good, especially by Chris Hemsworth with emotional moments that I didn't suspect he was capable of; the action is near flawless, the hand to hand combats like glimmers, the shootings a bit over the top but nevertheless lightning fast and more than good; the story though not very important was well above the acceptable range with good plus development.The ending was a little messy and imbroglio, he could have been saved but the plot was dramatically woven as to raise interest for a sequel which viewers at the time (of screening) didn't know about and weren't sure of. Extraction deserves a sequel, though I'm not sure it could be on par with the original big brother.P. S. The fighting special forces and soldiers were badly and incapably depicted and that was a tad unrealistic IMO. Number (of fighting force) always prevail even without sniper!Screenplay/story: 6Development: 8Realism: 7Entertainment: 8.5Acting: 7.5Filming/cinematography: 8Visual/special effects: 8.5Music/score: 8Depth: 6Logic: 6Flow: 8.5Action/thriller: 8Ending/closure: 7.

reviews.review_title: It's Like 50 Shades of Grey all over again :v
reviews.content:
Ignore the Critisim of Bengali people and Don't watch the Movie either because this god awful movie sucks. No proper story,Not enough characterization, Worst acting, Boring action scenes you don't even know why ur watching this film and what the plot is. This movie is so Yellowish that ur eyes start to burn.
As a regular Movie watcher i recommend that do something else or read a book instead or Re-watch John whick but don't waste ur time like i did

reviews.review_title: Full on Action on Asian Ground
reviews.content: Loved the work of everyone in the crew special mention goes to Rudhraksh Chowan, Cris Hemsworth and Randeep Hooda

First off, let me say if you love action movies and don't care much about plot, give this a watch. I did find plenty to enjoy, despite the average rating, but I can't score it higher because of the obvious flaws. Also, lengthy review and spoilers ahead...First scene, and we get the now overused flash-forward scene, showing Chris Hemsworth's character all bloodied and getting shot. This can be an effective way of starting a movie, developing a sense of intrigue or suspense. But it doesn't add anything here, and comes off a little cliche.The two lead actors, Chris Hemsworth (Tyler) and Rudhraksh Jaiswal (Ovi) do a great job, but there's not much of a script to work with. There's only one scene of any significant character development, where Tyler is the focus, talking about his past and his son. And there's not enough to make me personally root for him as a protagonist. It doesn't help that he's a mercenary who takes any job ("sometimes I rescue people, sometimes I do other things..."). He's just not a likeable protagonist.So... the final act, lots of confusing moments here. How was Amir's general watching the action on the bridge from miles away, and then a few moments later close enough to take shots at people with a sniper rifle? Why did Ovi nearly make it all the way across the bridge, only to run all the way back to Tyler when he got shot? Why were the team of mercenaries (who had already lost money after not being paid for rescuing Ovi) willing to stage an expensive rescue with several troops and a helicopter? Why did that kid from earlier show up to shoot Tyler? We know the kid was working for Amir, but everyone else involved in the shootout was either army or police, except this one kid. A lot of elements didn't really make sense and seemed quite contrived.Overall, like I said there are some positives. The action sequences are done very well, but if you like a decent plot and good dialogue along with your action, I'd look elsewhere.

reviews.review_title: Better Than Average Action Flick - Extraction
reviews.content:
No, this is not a film about going to the dentist. However, the relentless action sequences might give you a migraine. They are well done, but the acting in the film is left to the professionals; that would be the Indian actors. The lead actor, unfortunately, has less range than John Wayne, and I think we all know what that means. The direction and production values make up for this deficiency, and the Indian character actors actually steal the film quite easily.
Think of the action sequences as eye candy and the main course of steak and potatoes is being done by the Indian actors. The street urchins of this Indian city were quite reminiscent of City of God, where orphans run rampant in Rio, Brail.
This aint your flying down to Rio film of the 30s. And Extraction isnt your usual overcoming bad odds battle; it is a bit unrealistic to think one man (even with the help of a highly trained team) can overcome an entire city of police and soldiers. That being said, the film is still very entertaining; thanks to the Indian actors.

Extraction has a very short story which can be expressed in a line: a young boy is kidnapped; a mercenary is sent out to rescue him.
That boy is Ovi Mahajan (Rudhraksh Jaiswal), the son of a jailed Indian drug lord (Pankaj Tripathi). The one-man rescue operation is Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth).Ovi was kidnapped by Amir Asif (Priyanshu Painyuli), Bangladesh's biggest drug lord, who also controls the country's police and military,in Dhaka. Ovi, who lives in Mumbai with his father's underling, Saju (Randeep Hooda) who was in Indian Special Forces before,who knows a team that can bring the boy back to India.Tyler reaches the kidnapper's den: we get a longish violent showdown. Ovi and Tyler manage to escape: we get an even longer action set piece. The climax is expectedly more violent, where all the characters converge with an assortment of weapons.In the worst sceniario when things get complicated,all the world want Tyler to leave Ovi in Dhaka to save himself,he ensures Ovi that he will leave Dhaka only with Ovi though he will not get the money as he does not want to loss another child's life after losing his own child who was died by cancer.From then it was purely action sequence like car chasing in congested areas of Dhaka,fighting with cops,escaping from the guards etc with very limited story line.Based upon rural areas of Dhaka,it shows the effective power of Drug lord on the country's Security forces,Child labour including training them with varieties of heavy weapons from very young age to be extremist.From here on,someone attacks, someone counterattacks, someone monitors and plans.Screenplay by Joe Russo was good though the shots were too yellowish to show the impact of the rurality of Dhaka.When it comes to individual performances,Chris Hemsworth was outstanding at action sequences,dialogue delivering(specially those Bengali word "Proman Dao").The boy(Rudhrash) was equally good in screen but Randep Hooda as Saju was exceptional,his dedication towards the whole screenplay was fabulous,he hardly has left any fault to criticize.However for a pure entertainment and Action sequence adventure,You can surely give it a watch.

Heavily promoted by Netflix at the moment, starring an Avenger, written by the "Endgame" directors and directed by the Avengers stunt co-ordinator, you might expect "Extraction" to be a low key gem. It isn't. Unfortunately it's largely run of the mill, but it does have a few great action sequences that elevate it above similar straight-to-video nonsense.Ovi Mahajan (Rudhraksh Jaiswal), son of an imprisoned Indian drug lord, is kidnapped by Amir Asif (Priyanshu Painyuli) his father's Bangladeshi rival. Knowing that he'll be held to account for this, Saju (Randeep Hooda) a lieutenant in the Indian family and Ovi's guardian engages a crack mercenary team to extract the boy. The team, with Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth) on point, successfully rescue Ovi, but soon discover that Asif's massive influence of the Police, Army and his own street gangs make getting out almost impossible.As I said in the opening paragraph, there are a few action scenes in this film that are much better than the overall film deserves. The rescue scene is visceral exciting close combat stuff, but it was the later driving scene where I really started to take notice - particularly of the excellent camera work. The camera tracks the vehicle, circulates to the front when the car needs to reverse and then, in a bravura move, enters the car and sits on the back seat. There are a number of "John Wick" type gun fights for the remainder of the film which, whilst never quite hitting the heights of that franchise, are OK.That said, the rest of the film is a pretty predictable and generic thriller and you'll see the twists and plot points coming a mile off. I can understand why it had Schwarzenegger and Bruce Willis attached at various points. Chris Hemsworth is OK, better than either of those would have been, even if it does feel like him playing "sad action man" is a bit of a waste, given his comedic talent. Randeep Hooda is given more of an arc, and provides a better performance because of it.Perfectly acceptable way to spend a couple of hours, but I'll never watch it again.
I didn't like the movie very much,it seems to be low budget.

Yep, another Netflix movie, but that is probably because that is all we really have these days, since the cinemas are all closed, and all of the upcoming releases have been put on hold. So, what we have are these films that are appearing on Netflix, such as this one, not that I am stretched for anything to watch.This film confused me a bit because in part I thought that it was some Bollywood production, but it turns out that it is definitely an American film, though since Chris Hemsworth takes the leading role, I probably shouldn't have been too surprised. Yet, pretty much all of the other characters, with the exception of a couple of the protagonist's team, were Indian.The story is pretty straight forward, namely that the son of a drug dealer is kidnapped and taken to Bangladesh, and Hemsworth is hired to bring him back. As such, we pretty much end up having this huge action movie which is little more than Hemsworth verse the entire Dhaka police force. Yeah, it is a bit like though, though there are a couple of other antagonists thrown in, and a couple of twists as well.In a way it pretty much reminded me a lot of Blackhawk Down, namely that Hemsworth is attempting to get out of Dhaka the quickest way possible, and cities like Dhaka aren't the easiest to get around, especially when you have the entire police force after you, and being American (or in the case here, Australian), you do stand out quite a lot.Look, it isn't one of the best films out there, but it certainly does work well to keep you up with your weekly dose of action, especially since it is one of those films that is somewhat new. Look, the plot isn't that great, but the production certainly does work quite well, and it certainly does look a lot better than a number of other productions that have landed up here. The other thing is that the acting isn't too bad either. However, as I mentioned, it isn't particularly original.

Easy to watch but also boring too.
i didn see great acting and the whole 1000 kills for one kid didnt work for me.
if u have plenty plenty of time give it a try but dont epect too much.

I miss these types of movies! I feel like movies like this are becoming less and less. So I'm happy to see an honest to goodness action movie!Don't watch it for the plot watch it for the incredible action sequences! I'd put it up there with John Wick and the forever Classic Predator!

The movie have a pretty classic plot obviously . We just need to exctract the boy that s the mission of the whole movie and trough all the actions scenes we have also some revelations ( the Friend of Tyler Rake ) and some dramatic scene with the dead of Tyler by the young indian . Lets talk also about the big strenght of the movie : the actions scenes obviously : its pretty violent , dynamic and have some nice cameras movement with it and i really enjoyed it and find very pleasant to watch . It have also some moments more emotional with Ovi and Taylor . It dont have depth in the psychological of the characters but still have some and can make you pretty interested with it anyway . Nice movie if you want some actions scenes with some nice choregraphy and violent punches . Cant hurt to watch it i guess.

Good action sequences.
You can watch this movie for randip Hooda and Chris Hemsworth..

So, if you want to see only fighting without any legit plot, go for it.
100k budget films have better plot than this. Thanks

reviews.review_title: Excellent action, gritty, beautiful imaginery, a tad too long
reviews.content: Extraction is a great directing debut from Sam Hargrave, a former stuntman and fight coordinator in blockbuster films like Avengers and Captain America. Exploding, inventive and clear action scenes, awesome 11+ minute "single shot" -section and great use of exotic locations, colourful environment and sound effects.Chris Hemsworth fights his way through with effortless charisma and believability. All the other characters, from evil drug lords to lowly gang members are well written, and given some human background. Even if there are some stereotypes too.If the movie was cut 15-20 minutes shorter, it would have been even better - the brutal action gets a little repetitive towards the end. Bodycount is high.But overall, great action film and I recommend watching and following Sam Hargrave to discuss making of the action scenes - his enthusiasm, dedication and professional background shines bright trough! Looking forward to a sequel.

Tip top mercenary (Hemsworth) is hired to save a young boy who is being hunted by seemingly every good guy and bad guy in India, lead of course by a deeply unpleasant bad guy.Whilst this isn't wholly original - very Rambo, it is well conceived with top of the range action sequences and astonishingly strong star quality oozing from Hemsworth. Nicely ambiguous ending, although I found the scene with David Harbour and unnecessary distraction.
Chris Hemsworth + Russo brothers + Randeep Hooda = perfect ingredient to make something awesome...

Movie is your typical Mercenary rescues a hostage movie but with a twist. I think what made this movie was it was different in its diversity. The movie shows off a different setting and culture than you would normally see in the USA. Its a gem, really good action movie. Never slows down, lots of shooting, lots of action, and a sense of care. I just wanna know the body count, lol!

This is a faced paced action movie that is far superior to most tripple a hollywood action flicks such as grey men. The reason for that is, because its done by a director who knows how to orchestrate action set pieces, instead of just throwing cgi in post production at it.This movie is quite similar to the john wick series in terms of fighting and action sequences just with a military setting. It never matches the quality or style though.

reviews.review_title: I hope I get to see movies like this in the theatres soon!
reviews.content: The recent quarantine has me going berserk. I love going to the movies so much and I miss seeing stuff on the big screen, so when I see good stuff like Extraction, it makes me a little depress that I only have a 32 itch screen to watch this on.I herd that Chris Hemsworth was actually tapped to star in an American adaption of the Indonesian film The Raid. I don't know if that movie will ever happen but Extraction is a good alternative. Watching Thor brawl through an army on the streets of Mumbai is too exciting, and they do these single cut action sequences that make me feel like they are crossing 1917 with a John Wick film.Produced by the Russo brothers who directed Hemsworth in Avengers: infinity War and Avengers End game, it feels like the Brothers are into solid action movies as they did one last year called 21 Bridges which also stared an Avenger, the Black Panther, Chadwick Bosman.The plot does not cut deep enough, but this movie is all about the visual energy coming from it. That's why it saddens me that I did not get to experience this in a dark theatre looking up at a huge screen, trying to stuff my face with popcorn and soda without take my eyes off the action.The movie theatres were made for these kinds of flicks and I can't wait to get back in those reclining seats.

reviews.review_title: Tyler Rake is like the new John Wick
reviews.content:
The way this film ended, it did not leave much open for a sequel, but from what I hear a sequel is in development, and Chris Hemsworth will be reprising his role, so I'm looking forward to it.
A mercenary named Tyler Rake(Chris Hemsworth) Who is tough has nails, is on a mission to rescue a kingpins son from an old enemy. With people trying to kill them lefty and right, we wonder will they get out alive?
Chris Hemsworth gives a tough but vulnerable performance, shows his character not one way type of character. The India setting is also great, and action scenes are very intense, feels very real not just movie action. There are some surprises on who is on there side and who is not. So if you are in the mood for a good action flick, give this movie a look.

reviews.review_title: The positives/negatives level out to make for good viewing
reviews.content: I do have mixed feelings towards this film, but by the end I think the positives/negatives level out to make for good viewing.The cast are fine. Chris Hemsworth is obviously the standout, though Randeep Hooda and Priyanshu Painyuli are also noteworthy here. Those three, and a few others, give more than solid performances but I don't feel like they are anything extraordinary - mainly due to other factors.That also matches how I feel about the action. I enjoyed a lot of it in truth, a number of the deaths are pretty nicely done, though the editing/cinematography comes out odd in parts... yet it does still weirdly work.The set designs are something I, flat out, don't rate in 'Extraction'. All of the major scenes in that regard feel fake, like they've been created from scratch to look like a war zone... à la what you get in video games, comes across too rigged.This film's premise isn't the most original, you've seen it all before and it can feel dragged out, though this still makes for a mostly enjoyable experience.

reviews.review_title: GOOD ACTION (& NO HAMMER IN SIGHT)...!
reviews.content: A Netflix original from 2020 starring Thor, Chris Hemsworth, as a mercenary tasked to rescue a kidnapped son of a jailed drug lord. The boy lives his life simply; going to school, dreaming of girls & getting back to an empty home run by his father's partner who tries to keep a tight leash on him. One night however, after leaving a club & smoking dope outside, some cops pull up & the boys try to play the offense away but when guns are drawn & the boy's friends are gunned down, he's taken hostage but no immediate demands are given. It turns out a rival drug lord has taken the kid to a neighboring country so Hemsworth, an Aussie military man, all biceps & emotional chips on his shoulders, & his team, including his liaison played by Golshifteh Farahani, warns him about the tenuous nature of the job but Hemsworth pushes forward regardless & although the initial snatching up of the boy goes easily (for a seasoned professional!), backstabs & betrayals occur when Hemsworth's team start getting knocked off by the boy's father's handler (he's been warned by the father to get the son back or forfeit his own family) while the kidnapper sends crooked cops en masse in hot pursuit to stop Hemsworth & the boy from crossing a particular bridge to freedom (& where the same guy who betrayed them suddenly joins the cause) w/every shot bullet felt & every blinding explosion forcing one to turn away, this is a thrill a minute actioner w/some inventive camerawork (an extended knife fight between Hemsworth & the nominal baddie is a treat for action hounds). David Harbour shows up as an old friend of Hemsworth's to lend a hand when things get particularly tough.

reviews.review_title: Hemsworth is a commanding presence in this reasonable actioner
reviews.content: When an imprisoned drug lord's son is kidnapped by a rival drug lord he tasks a close friend with the job of retrieving his son from his rival. Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth) is a black market mercenary hired to bring the drug lord's son home in what proves to be one of his toughest assignments to date...It's probably fair to say that if you choose to sit down and watch Extraction that you're unlikely to be blown away by its story; however if you are a fan of action films with plenty of shoot em up sequences then you should find this film to be relatively enjoyable.Arguably the biggest flaw with this film lies with the story itself; 2 drug lords are at war with each other but we're never really given any explanation as to what their beef is with each other? Still as I've said this doesn't really matter in the moment as there is always something happening in this film (shoot outs and fisticuffs come thick and fast in this picture) which, in fairness, is what you'd come to expect with films of this nature.Hemsworth does a solid job (he's a good physical presence, but unlike some of his counterparts that we see in action films he also does well from an 'acting' perspective as well). The villains are a little clichéd, but nobody disgraces themselves here.Although it feels a little generic and underwritten the fast pace and neat actions sequences make it worthwhile.

reviews.review_title: One of the most poorly made movie

Firstly the plot and making is one of the poorest I have ever seen. The local dialogues and accents are way far from what it is in reality. They show location to be Dhaka Bangladesh but everything in the movie is shot in India less some drone shots. Ot would be okay if they could make it believeable. Anyone from this sub continent would know how poorly they failed in portraying one location while shooting in other. There are many other technical glitches and the list is long.
I never thought a Hollywood movie could be so poorly made.

Expectations could vary depending on individuals. Some of us will love this just because it's full of action and of course the inclusion of Chris as the lead. And some of us will absolutely loathe it because it has zero plot importance and weak characterizations!To be honest I find myself in the middle. Frankly saying; Most of us already knew what's going to happen with the movie. You can't really expect much in terms of depth from an out to out action piece! And it surely stands out on what it promised.This has some scintillating action set pieces, with breathtaking adrenaline rush. Although the same scenes could look familiar for Regular Action fans but they look pretty good on screen nonetheless. The camera work here is phenomenal in those particular moments. The screenplay might not be that great but certainly it shines the most whenever any action starts. The technical efficiency can be easily noticed. I truly admire the efforts that have been put in by the Debutant Director here. As far the production value goes this ought to be on the top tier as Russo brothers are behind it. Hence the Execution looks matured in thrilling moments. I must mention that 11 Minute long one take scene; that looks magnificent. The Hand to Hand Combats, the Gun Fights all looked great as well. It's apparent that The technicalities are the major highlights over here.The performances are decent enough. Considering it's the Action Genre. But character build ups failed to impress. The writing falls short on many aspects. The Kid Character, he acted pretty well but I wanted to see more from him and his past or daily struggles. Being a Kid of a Druglord must be a Burdening thing on a day to day basis. Pankaj Tripathi as Indian Druglord; Well he was literally in one scene. It's Unfortunate to see such a talented individual getting such a low recognition here. Randeep Hooda as Saju was brilliant. Chris Hemsworth as Tyler performed great. His dedication and hardwork pays off.
The Bangladeshi druglord, well I see him as more of a Cliched overpowered villain like we used to get in 80's rather than a more structured modern day one.In the end It's a fast paced entertainer that hasn't got much depth in it. But it's full of Gruesome, Violent stuffs that Action Junkies might prefer a lot. For an ordinary group of audience this would be a Fun, Popcorn flick. Nothing more.

reviews.review_title: Descent big budget R rated action flick

When the son of an Indian druglord is kidnapped and taken to Bangladesh, Australian mercenary Tyler Rake is hired to retrieve him. Yes, the plot is simple, but I don't necessarily see that taking away anything from the movie. With the intensity of 'Rambo', but the stylish precision of 'John Wick', this film is a perfect example of what an action movie should look like in 2020. The action sequences are simply breathtaking; each and every action sequence is wonderfully crafted and some camera angles during the fights are surprisingly awesome. There are incredible hand-to-hand combats, exciting chases and other fantasically choreographed stunts that makes this film the most exciting, and joyously violent, film of 2020. There's even some good dark humour in there too. Chris Hemsworth gives one of the best performance of his career. Not only is he incredibly physical in the role, but I actually believed the emotional side of his character; which with Hemsworth isn't usually the case. The supporting cast is also great; as is the cinematography; sound design and the excellent hair and makeup department. All in all, Extraction is a fun, action-filled film with little story but it doesn't matter.

The movie has some good actions but the plot is very poor. Locations were also misleading. I never knew that the army of a country work for the drug dealers. I also don't think that Indian/Bengali goons use AK47. The director was high on the weed and made this time waste film.

That is worse than the ridiculously high amount of people shot, stabbed, etc. At least it wasn't revenge motivated. More of a "who cares? type attitude from seeing too much death. Basically, a forgettable film. I should mention David Harbour turned a corner several years ago (which is not atypical). Now, he is aalmost always cast as an antagonist. Take "The Equalizer" (2014). I think he weakens an already thin plot. It would be mire interesting if someone actually betrayed him. Audiences are smart. Still, I gave it a 7/10 for the excellent stunt fighting choreography, squib work, special effects, etc. Although there are are outrageously unbelievable sniper shots made (several appear over 1 mile away) and hit dead on. I bet you $1000 the Kid who shoots Tyler at the end will have a prominent role as a "bad guy" in the sequel, which is already "in the works".

reviews.review_title: More like a 5/10, gets 2 more stars for the action

reviews.review_title: Pretty run of the mill as action films go
reviews.content: There honestly isn't too much to say about Extraction. I am slightly disappointed as I'd heard great things about an action sequence oner and it was Netflix's number one film at time of watching. It didn't really live up to this hype, but was still an enjoyable action film nonetheless.The action was fun although a tad repetitive by the end. I did feel like we were getting the same sequences just in different locations for some parts of the film. Saying that though there was some great camera work during the close quarters combat, particularly a scene in an apartment building following a car chase. The choreography was always tight, maintaining a gritty and dangerous feel. Pretty unforgiving at times in its violence and pace, Extraction does provide solid entertainment.With regards to the plot... it was so so. Nothing stand out, nothing bad. There are some action films driven by plot, far more driven by action, and this was definitely one of the latter. In this sense then the plot was good as it facilitated the action sequences and they all made sense and flowed within the world that was created. Nothing felt too out of place or fantastical, with the action remaining (for the most part) in the realms of plausibility.Overall Extraction is a fun watch but nothing more. Its not revolutionary or ground breaking in the genre, but is a good two hours of entertainment and well worth watching if action films are your thing.

reviews.review_title: Good performances and lots of action
reviews.content:
My Review- ExtractionAccording to Netflix we joined the over 99 million viewers to watch Extraction since its release in April 2020 which means it holds the record of the most watched Netflix feature movie so far . It's difficult to tell who watched the entire movie as Netflix registers anyone who watched two minutes or more of a movie as a viewer. Unsurprisingly, Netflix is working on follow-ups to both "Extraction" and "Birdbox."a dystopian thriller starring Sandra Bullock which rated 89 million viewers .
I watched it because I was interested to see Chris Hemsworth in a role other than Thor and I was impressed by his performance as Tyler Rake, a fearless black market mercenary, who embarks on the most deadly extraction of his career when he's enlisted to rescue the of kidnapped son in Dhaka, Bangladesh.
Chris Hemsworth obviously believed in this film as he's one of the Producers along with Joe Russo. Extraction cost $65 million to make, and producer/screenwriter Joe Russo argues that's around double the budget they'd have landed if it had released in theaters, and been funded elsewhere.
The entire ensemble cast are all very convincing in their respective roles but standout performance for me was 15 year old (at time of filming)
Rudhraksh Jaiswal as Ovi Mahajan, the son of Indian crime lord Ovi Mahajan Sr. who is the kidnap victim. He is excellent in his role and the quality of his performance reminded me of Dev Pate's debut movie appearance in Slumdog millionaire.
Reviews have been mixed Rohan Naahar of the Hindustan Times praised the performances of Hemsworth and Hooda, and wrote: "Featuring one of the most stunning action scenes in recent memory...
Violent thriller action films are not my favourite movie genre and believe me there is a lot of violence and blood shed in Extraction but I found it entertaining and the Action and stunt work is certainly well done and would have been even more spectacular on a proper Cinema Screen.
No wonder the film looks good it's Director Sam Hargrave an American stuntman, actor and director who is best known for his collaborations with the Russo brothers, including being the stunt coordinator for several films in the Marvel Cinematic Universe including all the Avengers films .
Script writers include Joe Russo and Anthony Russo and they keep the action moving along at a frenetic pace.
I can't say much more except after seeing Extraction I'm sure Chris Hemsworth will succeed in branching out for roles to replace Thor when he decides to put his hammer away. I've mentioned the violence ,is it excessive ? probably yes ,so if that bothers you Extraction may not be for you but perhaps like many I've become desensitised to it and I just look at it like a video game or 21st Century Cowboy film.

I'm pretty sure that no matter what, I was going to enjoy the Chris Hemsworth action flick EXTRACTION whether it was good or not. It is, after all, a NEW movie, albeit one that was made "Direct to Netflix", so those can be of lesser quality.I'm happy to report that in the case of EXTRACTION, that is not the case. This is a good (if by the books) popcorn action flick with a charismatic lead keeping you company throughout.In EXTRACTION, Chris Hemsworth stars as an Australian Mercenary (who knew there was such a thing), hired to extract the kidnapped son of a drug lord from the hands of his fiercest rival.This is a pretty "by-the-numbers" action film:1). The mercenary has "baggage" - will the events (and the subject he is to extract) help him come to terms with his pent-up emotions in order to move past his traumatic "baggage"?2). Will there be some sort of "double-cross" that screws up the extraction causing our hero to go "on the run" with his "Extraction"?3). Will there be a buddy that our hero trusts who will, ultimately, double-cross him?What do you think?The fun of this film was not the plot machinations (they are pretty basic), but the execution of these machinations - and this execution is pretty fun/enjoyable.Start with Chris Hemsworth as our mercenary - with the great action flick name of Tyler Rake. Hemsworth knows exactly what kind of film he is in - and he brings the goods. If he chose to, I think Hemsworth could be an action hero staple like Jason Statham or Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson - but I think Hemsworth is not really interested in that. But here, he is steely eyed and calm taking hits and doling out punishment to hoards of "red shirt" bad guys in his way. He has the action hero chops. He also has the acting chops to make the overwrought "emotional" scenes palatable. He makes weak writing enjoyable.Joining him is Rudhraksh Jaiswal as "the extraction" - and his interactions with Hemsworth are fun. Randeep Hodha and Golshifteh Farahani do a nice job in the roles that they play in the action and the always watchable David Harbour eats a ton of scenery in his limited time on the screen. All are fun to watch.But it is the telling of the story by first time Director Sam Hargrave that was a (pleasant) surprise for me. After doubling Chris Evans in the first CAPTAIN AMERICA film, Hargrave became the "go to" guy for Marvel action choreography, so (I'm sure) he got to know Hemsworth there. He brings a fast-paced style to this film that works. He doesn't stop to examine much at all (which helps the plot holes in the script) and his action work with his stunt actors is top-notch. If you watch nothing else in this film, check out the chase scene at about the 1/3 mark of the film. Hemsworth and "the extraction" are being chased - and it is filmed in the "shaky cam/cinema veritae/ make it look like one long tracking shot" style that I often criticize in my reviews - but here it worked and worked well. I'll be keeping my eye on what Hargrave does next (word is it that there will be an Extraction 2).All of this is brought together by Producers Joe and Anthony Russo - the Directors of many Marvel films (including INFINITY WAR and ENDGAME). Not only did they Produce this film, but they wrote the story from where this film came from. It's obvious that they turned the majority of the screenplay writing to others (most notably Ande Parks) and this film is based on a graphic novel...so it plays like an over-the-top comic book action flick (think John Wick-lite) where the dialogue is sparse and cliche-ridden. This part of the film was far less interesting than the action parts.But, the action is fast, fun and furious and Hemsworth is worth watching for the 1 hour 56 minute running time.All-in-all, a good time was had while watching the first "new" film in over 6 weeks.Letter Grade: B+7 1/2 stars (out of 10) and you can take that to the Bank(ofMarquis)

"Extraction" is not just about guns blazing and bazookas firing. There is an emotion. Chris did wonderful job. During second half of the movie , your adrenaline rush converts into heaps of emotions. Feel the context to get the most out of this movie.

reviews.review_title: Really Bad Homework, generic action film
reviews.content:
1. Bullet proof vest is yet to be invented in that part of the world.
2. How would you feel if all the actors billed from USA use British English in a two hour long movie? Yes, that much annoyance was felt by the Bengali knowing audiences as the dialect or language used in this movie was purely from West Bengal, rather than Bangla (the state language of Bangladesh).
3. It was really unbelievable to see a colonel possessing that much power to assign a huge group of army personnel, choppers, police force and other things, which in reality takes the entire parliament to ensure, let alone the lock-down of the capital and deployment of military power.
4. The main antagonist struggled the whole time to pronounce the simple words in Bangla/ Bengali.
5. So Bangladeshi people always listen to hindi songs??
6. I understand that the director needed a new country to exploit, but why he had to do it by giving us a jaundice colored screen? Oh, because "it gives the feeling of a battlefield and a crime stricken city".
7. Zero character development, typical action sequences with zero logics. The antagonists never had a chance.
8. Even though the antagonists were depicted as trained military soldiers, they moved as if they had held the weapon for the very first time.

but the movie was illogical as whole, they are showing chris hemsworth as a superman, he can do anything in the movie.but, i really enjoyed watching it, you will never get bored
It is very dissapointing to see that Bangladesh has been totally Misrepresented in this most anticipating movie. Which is to me very poor to see from such a high level production house.

As a stripped back, overly simplistic action movie, this ticks all the right boxes & it's also worth acknowledging how "Extraction" features some truly impressive fight choreography, being equally as impressive in the way that these numerous brutal confrontations are visually captured - boasting some really spectacular set pieces - especially the already acclaimed one-shot sequence teased in Netflix's marketing campaign... But despite this flawless execution, it feels more like technical accomplishment than a film & there's very little originality or anything of real value beneath that over-saturated, superficial exterior.Instead, the project is built upon a noticeably generic premise, hindering the viewing experience with an over reliance on well-trodden, clichéd tropes.

reviews.review_title: They need a couple of Bangladeshi producers/ advisers not just indian
reviews.content: I will not talk about misrepresentation here a lot has been said already. Its a typical action thriller. Chris Hemsworth & Hooda was good. But just a couple of pointers. The whole movie is based in Dhaka but I didnt hear 1 bangla song in the background. And all those 90s hindi songs that no one listens to now. Our bangla songs are much more popular and way, way better. The only bangla song I heard was at the end when credits were rolling. And they took all kolkata indian actors none from Bangladesh. I'm happy that Hollywood took the initiative to shoot in Dhaka, when they could have selected any city in india. But all they need now is ask for some Bangladeshi producers or advisers to shoot not just in Old Dhaka but also get the new developments & New Dhaka's perspective.

I understand the emotion of the mercenary in the film, what I don't understand is why a movie consisting of a feud between drug lords has no drugs in any scenes, why Bangladeshi people can't speak Bangla well, and why the armed forces are working for a drug lord.The rating I have given is not for the action sequences, they were extremely well done. The plot however seemed like a variation of Man on Fire, and wasn't smart enough.

reviews.review_title: All about the action, and it delivers!
reviews.content: I usually don't give a lot of credit to movies that feel like a million others, because they usually feel pretty derivative. When one stands out among the rest though, I feel that a huge round of applause is in order. Extraction is one of Netflix's latest feature films to hit their service and it's probably my favourite film that they've released since last year's Oscar contenders. No, I'm not saying Extraction is award-worthy, but it's quite a ride. If you're looking for something new to watch, I think you'll be pleased with this one, even though some may find it too violent.This film follows a badass mercenary who's looking for his next big job in order to keep his mind off a troubled past. Being recruited to track down and extract a kidnapped teenager, who's father is in prison, this mission becomes his most difficult one yet. Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth) is the brain and the brawn of this story and if he doesn't work as a character, the entire film would fall apart. Now, even though there is some care put into the emotional moments, Extraction is all about the action. If you're not a fan of too much violence or too much action, then I suggest looking elsewhere.Directed by stuntman Sam Hargrave, who has done many of the stunts for the Marvel Cinematic Universe films, pulls no punches in dropping you right into the action. From long single takes with fantastic fight choreography to the brutal amount of deaths throughout the movie, Hargrave, even though this was his first major outing as a director, was clearly the man for the job. Written by Joe Russo, I felt even more enticed to watch it, and while there's nothing all that groundbreaking about the script itself, it has enough character development to serve the action overall. I feel that Joe Russo could write a few more films that are heavy on the action because it seemed to work here.If I were to explain everything that happens throughout this movie, you'd think I'm describing something else you've already seen, but I really appreciated the fact that the incredible action scenes made this movie stand out. On top of that, Chris Hemsworth and Rudhraksh Jaiswal, who plays the kidnapped Ovi Mahajan, have some nice moments together. There are a few humorous lines to break the tension and a couple heartfelt interactions that gave the film time to breathe. I personally really enjoyed watching this one.In the end, as I said, Extraction won't be winning any awards and it definitely doesn't hold back in the body count area, so if that's not your thing, it may not be for you. For myself, I like a good action movie with likeable characters and this movie delivered on that for me. Sure, things feel underdeveloped and the film unfolds as you would expect it to, but it's all about the action and it absolutely delivers. Purely on an entertainment scale, I didn't have a lot of issues with Extraction, because I truly don't believe it was trying to be anything new in terms of storytelling. As long as you're okay with violence, I recommend checking this one out on Netflix.
I wish we had a rating more than the 10. The movie is just amazing. Definitely one of the best this year
Fight scenes to rival Bourne and plenty of Sicario style gun fights. Great watch.

reviews.review_title: Well done third person shooter videogame adaptation (with lots of borrowed stuff)
reviews.content: Extraction is a lot to talk about.One should watch this film with an understanding that this is yet another film directed by a stunt coordinator, much like John Wick. So, there is not much to be expected in terms of story or characters.With this in mind, we encounter our first problem - Chris Hemsworth is very much miscast for the role. He looks ripped and all cool, he can do stunts, but he is too typecast as a good guy superhero to represent a generic washed up mercenary with no will to live. Also, and this is my personal humble opinion, he is not a good dramatic actor.This is where we find our third problem - the story is incredibly generic and unimaginative. You can easily spell out the dialogue before the characters do, just because you've heard it a million times.The film is a remarkably interesting combination of stunt ideas and cool scenes, mixed with inspirations and copypastas from other films, even the ones the director and the writer worked on together.What sucks is that all of these feel watered down, not even one of these borrows really works out in the end. The emotional connection base of a hired assassin and a kid who has no real family (for the assassin to become one for him) could not be done better than in Leon (1994) (or the Professional). The crime mogul intent on training a heir to replace him in time was also done before (but I can't recall now when and where), but in this film this plot goes absolutely nowhere, it just stops (while it could've been something interesting). The ending was also very reminiscent of the ending of Leon btw. The old friend subplot was super obvious, but it still felt like it was borrowed from 16 Blocks (2006). Some of the visuals of the film were inspired by John Wick (2014), Children of Men (2006) (the car chase), the shooting style of the action was reminiscent of 1917 (2019), the "drowning in the water" scenes were ripped straight out of Captain America: The Winter Soldier (2014) (interestingly enough, the director of Extraction was a stunt double for Chris Evans, even the music from these scenes was very similar because it was composed by the same composer.I can go on and on, but I think by now you get the point.Anyway, even well shot action scenes still need a script. They don't work without a good story, they just get tiresome and kinda boring, this was very well demonstrated by Michael Bay's 6 Underground (2019).There are lots of reviews of Bangladesh nationals who were offended by the portrayal of the country and the capital, but I'm not one of them (this is why filmmakers tend to use fictional locations).Besides the action scenes, I also loved that this film had that amateur quality to it, like lots of slow scenes that don't really go anywhere, but they just look smart.You also don't see Hellboy brawl with Thor very often, not even talking about Thor kicking and punching kids around.Interesting film in terms of how much they've put into it, still feels like a third person shooter video game with bosses and enemy respawns. Clearly not the worst of the stunt-directed kind.Easy watch if you're bored, but don't forget to disable your brain first.

REVIEW - EXTRACTIONNETFLIX ORIGINALFinally Chris Hemsworth (Thor) returns to what he does best.Over the past few years after Thor Ragnarock we've seen Chris Hemsworth take on more comedic roles in Ghostbusters and Men In Black which for me honestly just didn't work. There were funny moments in Thor Ragnarock and it seems that this opened and hopefully closed the door on comedy.Now Extraction is for me Chris at his best.In summary a 14 year old boy is kidnapped by one drug barron who is son of another, his son lives with an employee his fathers (I'll come back to this later).Eventually we find out that no one wants Obi not even his own father so why did his father employ Chris Hemsworth to Extract him?The fathers friend who Obi lived with was then sent to kill Obi and Chris Hemseorth, why? Surely if he didn't want his son just simply don't pay the ransome, problem solved.So as you can see the story is silly especially as half way through the guy Obi was living with and who was out to kill them both suddenly decides to help, cone on!BUT.........As I've said above Chris Hemsworth has finally returned to what he does best, ACTION all the way!The 11 minute continuous scene starting with the car chase and escaping the corrupt police is absolutely amazing! How the camera transitions from inside to outside the car and following the action, one word WOW!Atomic Blonde did this but this film blew Atomic Blonde out of the water in my personal opinion and the action continue throughout the film.So forget the story and simply enjoy this film for what it is, an action packed movie with simply amazing camera work which has to be seen to believed.Rating 9 out of 10

reviews.review_title: Best action movie this side of The Bourne series
reviews.content:
For people like me growing with Bruce Lee, Jackie Chan, Chuck Norris or even Van Damme or the first Rambo or DIrty Harry, seeing the Disney's Avengers series is like a joke or even worse a bad cartoon.
A few years back Paul Greengrass gave the Bourne series a very realistic style that even quite successful really never was repeated out of B movies that rarely get distributed in theatres (John Wick the exception).
Now Netflix as produced a really good one, that keeps and sometimes even perfect the Greengrass style with a lower budget but in very exotic scenarios with (apparently) one long takes (handheld cameras ) action scenes, almost in first person that rarely seeing (or never) in latest movies.
Forget the story; it is quite simple; as it was Die Hard or the Bourne, but the action and quick characters definition is so good that you even care about them in the middle of the bullets and infinite deads.
Suspend your disbelief (as you has to with the digitally enhanced Disney movies ) and prepare to enjoy a outstanding stuntworks, shootings and knife fights as the old good movies had.

reviews.review_title: Formulaic action which is entertaining but nothing special
reviews.content: Simple and clichéd plot and characters which are functional but nothing special. Good action scenes and use of its setting, but too much camera shaking in the chase scenes and outside of the action, it can be very slow as it tries to be emotional and thoughtful. There's some tension and surprises amongst the trail of carnage and bodies and it is entertaining with a suitably climactic finale.

Extraction movie was not a bad action movie. However, my country Bangladesh was vastly misrepresented in this movie. This type of movie can create false and negative prejudice about a country and should never be encouraged. There are no "Child militants" or "Drug lords" in our country, it may be an underdeveloped country but people in our country are overall peace loving. One thing I don't understand is that why did they drag 'Bangladesh' in like this?

One of the best & realistic actions. Edge of the seat. This was by far best gift by Netflix in lockdown."You Drown Not By Falling Into The River, But By Staying Submerged In It..!"
An emotional journey filled with world class action🔥

reviews.review_title: Familiar, cliché, and really well done
reviews.content: This movie has some issues, including a white savior complex and some serious blindspots. But it also has a compelling protagonist, amazing action sequences, and enough solid performances to put it ahead of most similar movies. Basically, I got more than I bargained for. It is not perfect, but it sure is entertaining.
It's like a fps game without a story. Drug lord commanding the Bangladeshi law enforcement agencies vs batman & Superman. Pathetic.

reviews.review_title: Excellent and well executed action sequences, but no plot at all
reviews.content: "Extraction: Tyler Rake" is the perfect movie that you put if you want to watch something fun with your family or friends. Action sequences are really impressive, transitions are amazing and seamless. During action scenes jump cuts are few and very well placed, this creates a nice flow. There are a lot of moments packed of tension and this is exactly how this kind of films should be made. The one take like scene at the beginning, required a lot of planning and care, but the result definitely pays off. Stunts artists made a wonderful job and VFX department realized amazing and very realistic effects.The story is basically non-existent, and the plot is extremely predictable. So, if you are looking for a profound screenplay, search elsewhere. I really wish that this production was a little bit more balanced. Characters are mono dimensional, not deepen at all. They are basically tropes, that I have watched many times. It is possible to create interesting and capturing narratives, while having great action. "Atomic Blonde" and "John Wick 2 and 3" are just a couple of examples. When I "review" a movie, I need to consider all the elements and having just technically solid and impressive scenes, does not suffice to create a captivating production. Beyond this, there is nothing more that I can really say. I gave six stars out of ten for the effort and I can understand what it took, in order to pull out certain things, but this honestly wouldn't be more than five stars.

I watch the movie as I love to enjoy action based movie. As this is a action based movie I enjoy a lot. Bus as an Bangladeshi I not that much enjoy the location, dialogue. It should be well researchers before shoot. Most of the movie lover from Bangladesh not that much enjoy as the plot based on Dhaka. But Dhaka is not like that show in the movie. But as story the movie is good.

If you want non-stop action - then this is probably for you. It was refreshing to hear Hemsworth not only keep his Australian accent, but embrace the fact his character was Australian. It gave the one-liners an Aussie edge which I loved (as a fellow Aussie) and definitely enhanced my overall enjoyment of the film.Hemsworth was well-suited to this role and it perhaps signaled an entire career direction taking place. The action scenes are the highlight. The storyline was really just a backdrop to what were some of the best action cinematography and fight scenes I've seen in a while. There was a grittiness and realism which perhaps set it apart from the likes of John Wick - which it will no doubt be compared to.The setting of the film itself was a somewhat refreshing change from the usual. It simply added to the intensity of what was happening on screen. I was craving some explosions and shootout entertainment - and this certainly satisfied that itch!An ambiguous ending is sure to divide some viewers. But ultimately, Extraction was fairly satisfying and did exactly what it said on the packet.

Some of these negative reviews should be banned from reviewing movies. Not every movie needs to be worthy of a Best Picture award. This movie was extremely entertaining from start to finish! The action scenes were John Wick"ish" so if that peaks your interest watch this movie!

reviews.review_title: "We just got attacked by the Goonies from hell. We made it about four blocks."
reviews.content: First off, I wasn't expecting anything going into this film. It came to my mind, so I watched it. And it was pretty entertaining. I was surprised by how quickly things went into gear in this film; it went straight into it.This film had notable aspects, and they also helped the film, as a whole, stand on its feet. But there were also other things; they weren't "bad," but I can see why other people would look at them negatively. And while I say "things," that's me being thorough, accounting for "everything" because there probably are other things that some people didn't like about this film. I only noticed one.There wasn't much of a plot. Plain and simple. It's pretty straightforward, easy to follow, and that, something with barely any substance, was turned into an entire film. Of course, most people probably expected that, and others weren't surprised. This film: action film, through and through. I didn't care, but I can understand why that would be a "bad thing" to some people.The biggest highlight of this film was by far the action sequences. They were well done: and if they weren't, this film would've flopped. It had nothing else going for it, although who knows how different it would've been if it wasn't an action film. But, as what it was, an action film, the action, being well done, saved it. They made up for any lackluster areas throughout the film. Those involved in the creation of this film understood the assignment. And they delivered. The core of this film was the action: nothing more, nothing less.Its second-biggest highlight, I'd say, was the camera work. It was creative. Usually, something like that never sticks out to me. There were instances where you'd realize it even if you couldn't care less about something like that, aka me. But it was well done and added a lot to the experience. Now, combine that with the choreography and direction of the action sequences: you're in the film.The score was also good. I'm pretty sure I read someone bringing up Inception. I was thinking of scores you'd hear in the Modern Warfare video games, and I suppose that kind of sound is pretty similar to scores by Hans Zimmer. So, that tracks. Yet it wasn't that identical-sounding, just reminiscent. Henry Jackman and Alex Belcher give it a distinctive twist.The acting was decent on all fronts. The actors who had elevated moments regarding that were Chris Hemsworth, Rudhraksh Jaiswal, and Randeep Hooda. The latter of which was the highlight for me. Not only that, his character was on par with Chris's character and brought most of the excitement to the film alongside each other.The cinematography was good in some areas with good shots. At the same time, I feel like it was lacking. More specifically, lacking "something." I feel like it looked too bleak and grainy sometimes, and it's 100% not because of India being the primary filming location. With good cinematography comes making something somewhat subpar looking into something good looking; making something already good looking into something even better looking. It seems like Newton Thomas Sigel had his work cut out for him. But he also came up short.Regarding positives and negatives, I guess this film is half-and-half. But the most important thing to note is that the positives are radiant. So having said that, I don't think the negatives were that impactful on the film and certainly not on its enjoyment. At least for me.This film is by no means one of the best films ever. But it gets the job done/it got the job done. It was thoroughly entertaining and enjoyable to watch, and I look forward to the second film. I hope it's even better, especially the action sequences.Here are my other thoughts:I thought the title card looked cool and slick. Green was an interesting choice of color to use. I haven't seen that before. But it made it look even better.Golshifteh Farahani has quite good-looking eyebrows. A slightly odd thing to say, I know. But it had to be said. Oh, and she is quite good-looking, too. I hope her character is more prominent in the second film since she wasn't that prominent in this one.I was surprised to see Adam Bessa. I'm sure most people have no idea who he is. I saw him in Season 3/the final season of Prime Video's Hanna. I'm guessing his role in this film had to do with being cast in the show.I've read that loads of people thought Tyler beating up the kids was hilarious, and I don't get it. I guess I can understand why, but I was indifferent towards that scene. Maybe knowing about it before watching the film made me expect it was more violent.Talk about being expressionless. Amir Asif pretty much was poker-faced throughout the whole film. I guess you could attribute that to his cold-hearted nature. At the same time, it was a bit comical. All hell is breaking loose, and everything is going wrong for him, and he's still poker-faced.Geez. Talk about lengthy end credits. Once the film was over, I saw that there was still a chunk of space left to watch, so I watched it, assuming there was maybe a post-credits scene. Nope. Well, I wasted time doing that.

From beginning to end
Action packed and excellent content
Loved the ending!!

I've seen this story 100 times, the white hero, going to third world country, kill bad guys, save the day, and seriously what's with the yellow color.I'm not from Bangladesh but people from there are saying it's not a true depiction of the country, so why not create a fiction place in story for the next time.I only watched the movie to end to be fair while writing this review.

I must admit, I am getting really tired of movies that are so poorly written, that all which remains is as much action, that the crew can possibly cram into a movie. Makes for very unsatisfying viewing. Kids might like it. But, adults? Give us a moment to breathe. After awhile, who cares anymore?Hargrave also plays Rake's sniper back-up on the rescue mission. The much-hyped scene that lasts over 10 minutes, goes from car chase to close combat and gunfights that wind in and out of flats, to people jumping from roof to roof, falling off a building, getting hit by a car, and ending in a big explosion. The entire scene was all-around crazy. The next-most-satisfying thing is seeing Rake slapping the hell out of a young, obnoxious gang of boys sent after him. Then, there's also the gorgeous Golshifteh Farahani, who blasts a helicopter down. Can we have a spin-off that focuses on her character? The Iranian actress plays Nik, who's Rake's controller, and also the only woman with a substantial role in the film. Extraction is very close to an all-male movie. With Farahani in it, it's like someone eventually realised that the film could use a badass female character, too.In the best moments, you can see Hemsworth and the stunt performers do their brutal hand-to-hand choreography in close quarters, but the camera is often so close to them that it's hard to get a clean look at the action. Impressive only on a technical level, the sequence drifts towards the uncanny valley of video game-dom, particularly in a lengthy car chase section involving a squad of police cars, aiming for gripping immediacy and missing the mark.The acting was good. Hemsworth was solid, Randeep Hooda was magnificently convincing, and the kid was good too. But, I was barely entertained by this film. Less would have been better, and more comprehensible.

reviews.review_title: Boring action but no story, a false description to a peace loving country like Bangladesh.
reviews.content:
Bangladesh, a small country located in South Asia, has a history of sacrificing themselves for the country. It's peace loving and heartful to the foreigners. The only question I want to ask to the producers that, 'Did they ever visited Dhaka'. I think they had better visit Dhaka and make the film. The 'Bangla' we listened in the film was not Bangla at all.
Guys, this is totally a disaster I think. Better to watch BLOODY INDIAN Bollywood films.
Vanity project for all involved, but it does produce some pretty cool action.

reviews.review_title: Action and fight scenes are real

The kill shots are also very real and those shots react and drop quickly and naturally rather than slowly sliding down against a wall with head shots.The movie also has some slow unnecessary sappy scenes as well.

reviews.review_title: If You Like Action Movies I Gues You'll Like It

Plot: at the beginning I thought that this will be a classic American movie where the main character is a super and invincible man. Then there were some absurd things like... well, no spoiler.
