What a direction, full action pack.... Chris Hemsworth and Randip Hodda both brillant....

reviews.review_title: It looks way better on the big screen but it's owned by Netflix so what are you gonna do
reviews.content: ACTIONThe basic set up has young East Indian teenager, Ovi Mahajan (Rudhraksh Jaiswal) abducted in an exchanged for money. It happens that the teenager that was abducted happens to be the only son of a known drug cartel in India, his name also happens to be Ovi Mahajan except that he is a"senior" while his son is a "junior" in which the father is serving time in prison. And that when the son was kidnapped, that he was kidnapped by a rival gangster who lives in Dhaka, Bangladesh by the name of Amir Astif (Priyanshu Painyuli). Because Saju Rav (Randeep Hooda), Ovi's right hand man has a limited time limit into bringing him safely back as he has insufficient funds, that he needed to resort to him employing mercs, head by Nik Khan (Golshifteh Farahani) to do the job. And that is when Chris Hemsworth comes in, he plays Tyler Rake relaxing in Australia as he is informed by Nik Kahn that 14 year old Ovi Mahagan JR is the "extraction"- hence the title. And of course, not everything is going accordingly, as it was soon revealed that the guy who employed them Saju Rav also happens to be ex-special forces himself, as Amir of Dhaka has a stranglehold over the entire city including the police force and much of the army with odds totally stacked against the star Tyler, making the saving situation much more difficult which is nothing more but to serve as a backdrop to the many staged action sequences shown throughout.As I had said above, although "Extraction" would have been much enjoyed in the big screen it's still owned by Netflix. I mean, there's still a fair amount of people who do not have a Netflix account, like the homeless and the middle class who prefer to save a buck, some do not even have internet service. Therefore, Netflix will never know how much more money they would have made had "Extraction" gotten a proper theatrical screening, as opposed to Netflix using wasted time cracking down users who share their Netflix accounts. That the reason was so that they are able to finance more series and more movies, than I just have to say that their is another route, and that is to give them a proper theatrical release since they're other ways to see Netflix produced movies or TV shows than to have an account.

This is an excellent action movie.****Most of the bad reviews are given by Bangladeshis . Please don't go by the average rating. *****Some action sequences are never before seen.Chris Hemsworth is just amazing!In the long term this movie deserves atleast 7.5/10 on imdb

I didn't expect much from this movie. The Netflix tag still doesn't quite instill confidence despite their recent successful hits, and the action genre is one rife with hit and miss entries. I've already read quite a bit of feedback on this movie, and I feel like there's one key point they're all missing; this is a mindless action movie. Judging it on the merits of being a deep, thought-provoking character study is unfair. However judging it on the merits of being a balls-to-the-wall action flick, there's actually a lot here to redeem itself and set it apart from other attempts.Okay, there isn't much plot to Extraction. The entire story is summarised in the movie's title. Hemsworth plays a mercenary; Tyler, who's sent to Bangladesh in order to extract a drug-lord's son from the possession of a rival drug-lord. The entire city goes on lockdown and Tyler has to fight his way through henchmen and a corrupt police force in order to get out. There's some nice twists here and there from changing allegiances, and a few points of foreshadowing and plot payoffs, but there's nothing that requires you to really wrap your brain around it, and honestly that's okay. This isn't Inception. Truth be told Extraction has a lot more plot (from the aforementioned allegiance switches and payoffs) than I expected, so I feel like calling it mindless is a little baseless.Another thing about Extraction that plays against the dull and plot-less complaints is the character work. Again this isn't a full-on character study, and the background development we do get is a little cliché, but it's way more than your average run-of-the-mill action flick usually gets to enjoy. Tyler is a broken man after the death of his son and the breakdown of his marriage. He spends his days getting drunk and doing death-defying feats for fun. He has no more love of life. He doesn't get into the job because he cares about the kid or anyone involved. He just wants his money. But being haunted by the death of his son ends up making him more sympathetic to the fate of this kid, and as the movie goes on, the money means less to him. He just wants to get this kid out safe and alive.But Tyler isn't the only one that enjoys a hefty amount of personality. The movie also makes a bit to explore other more fringe characters, the most notable of which is Saju, the kids keeper after his father was incarcerated. With assets frozen, he can't afford to pay the mercenaries what he owes, so he tries to finish the job himself, against them. We get a look into his family life and his motivations behind his actions, and sit with him in the downtimes between action sequences. He becomes as much the lead character as Tyler does, earning respect and sympathy from the audience. You end up really rooting for this guy even as him and Tyler sparr off. We also get a small glimpse into the world of the antagonist drug-lord, showing us how despicable he really is by casually killing kids without a care, and brainwashing those left over to work for him. Extraction is brutal to its kids, but it plays to Tyler's predisposition and creates a much tighter and meaningful narrative than many give it credit for.But Extraction isn't about its plot or its characters, even though I feel those aspects are being unfairly criticised. Extraction is an action movie, directed by an ex-stuntman, starring muscled action stars from across the globe. In fact on that last point I particularly liked the movie's dedication to casting people roughly from the same area their character is meant to be from (or I guess vice versa; rewriting characters to fit the actor's background). Tyler is Australian, David Harbour plays a grizzled American on foreign soil, Nik is played by Iranian actress Golshifteh Farahani, and while most the Bangladeshi characters are actually played by Indian actors, it's at least closer than most Hollywood casting. I particularly hope this opens up more Western opportunities for Randeep Hooda who played Saju, oozing charisma and cool without speaking a word, and effortlessly earning audience sympathies.But anyway, horrific tangent aside, Extraction is about its action sequences, and on that it certainly doesn't fail. This is another movie in the likes of John Wick and Atomic Blonde that prefers its action gritty and efficient. There's style here for sure, but it rarely breaks suspension of disbelief, and we see real consequences for all the hits these characters take. Tyler takes time bandaging his arm and putting it in a sling, Saju has to put his broken nose back into place, and David Harbour offers probably the most realistic reaction to being shot in the chest I've seen in a long time. There's no flying acrobatics, and no artistic flailing of limbs to make the choreography look pretty. It's brutal and efficient fighting, showing how exhausting it can all be. Ammo counts and reloading matters, getting punched in the face is different to being kicked in the gut, being run-over by a car hurts. And this is before mentioning the soon to be most-talked-about 12-minute long shot action scene that spans car chases, knife fights, gun fights, and apartment brawls, following multiple characters and different perspectives with seamless match-cuts to give the illusion of a neverending single shot.But the action isn't a complete winner, and there are reasons I'm apprehensive to label it as 'realistic'. Certain objects come out of nowhere for no reason just for excitement purposes, like high-speed cars heading down a dead-end. While there's no flying around, there are some cable stunts that are a little hard to swallow, like Tyler grabbing a kid by the leg and effortlessly throwing him into a car door. There's also a number of sniper moments that feel like they take too many liberties with how sniping works. Normally this would be pernickety even for me, but for a movie that wallows in it's accurate portrayal of gun fights, from injuries to the differentiation of sounds (pistols make more of a 'pah' sound, for instance), giving sniper superhuman abilities like seeing round corners and 100% accuracy just felt little lazy. In any other action movie I probably wouldn't have minded these slip-ups so much, but when the rest of it is all so tightly choreographed and mapped out, slipping up and breaking believability becomes so much more noticeable.In some regards, Extraction is just an average, run-of-the-mill action flick, and in others it's up there with some of the genre's modern greats. There are stakes, characters have emotional backbones even if they are a little cliché, there aren't any deeper themes, but the narrative is still tight and focussed, the action is more phenomenal than it is irksome, the cinematography is a little bland, the soundtrack can feel like a rip-off of better scores, but these kinds of motifs are iconic because they work so well. I find Extraction a hard one to judge because it feels greater than it has any right to be, while also hitting just shy of the mark. But generally I fall positive, so I give Extraction a respectable 7/10, and honestly I could see myself bumping it up with subsequent rewatches. There's a lot in this movie to like.
Awesome movie must watch. If you are a action movie lover then it's a real treat for you.

reviews.review_title: When You See Hate In Someones Eyes And You Have A Shot...
a very ordinary, cliche plotline made watchable by some extra-ordinary action sequences!
reviews.content: #MovieReview #Extraction #ChrisHemsworth #RandeepHooda #Netflix #SpoilerFreeWith former MCU stunt co-coordinator Sam Hargrave at the helm, it is no surprise that Extraction has some jaw-dropping, adrenaline-pumping action sequences that keep you on the edge of your seat. It is the screenplay that lets the film down however, with the audience at no point drawn to emotionally connect with Chris Hemsworth's lead character, mercenary Tyler Rake or the kid being rescued, Ovi Mahajan (played by a medicore Rudraksh Jaiswal)David Harbour and Pankaj Tripathi are completely wasted in their roles while Randeep Hooda shines as ex-Special Forces soldier Saju, squeezing in enough acting chops into his minimal screen time to outshine even Hemsworth. In summary-Extraction is a very ordinary, cliche plotline made watchable by some extra-ordinary action sequences!I would highly recommend the YouTube video (Link in comments) where the lead actor and the director explain their more intricate action sequences.

reviews.review_title: Lots of action, that's all I got
reviews.content: OK, there will be spoilers. FIRST, why hire awesome actors and kill them in the first battle? SECONDLY, never understood why the uncle was sent to kill everyone but changed his mind and decided to help? LAST, this isn't an American movie. You can tell because other countries make movies that are pessimistic and everyone dies and nobody finds love. I don't know why this is, because they are used to losing wars, because they are not the USA, because romance is dead there? Either that or the writer waned to be "artsy." Either way, ending sucks. Good action though. Reminds me of the old Sly Stallone and Arnold flicks.
Nice action movies all actors work marvellous don't need to play pubg after watching this

reviews.review_title: Weak story line but super action
reviews.content: Watch this for its action sequences. Action shots were supposed to be good as it was being directed by Sam Hargrave but the plot is the real weak point in the movie. There was absolutely no plot and no such storyline but still it was an enjoyable ride.

I loved this movie.
The shots, the action, the location, just everything.
Chris Hemsworth tho... What a machine.
He steals the show in this from, the epic action scenes to. Among the audience feel his pain throughout.
It's took so much inspiration from other movies yeah. In my opinion it's took a few key /best bits from some epic movies (this ain't a bad thing people)
This ain't a good movie for lockdown or one that will do just because.
It's a good movie from start to finish you are never waiting on something happening.
Get it watched

reviews.review_title: "Extraction" is a big, explosive action blockbuster
reviews.content: "Extraction" is all about the gritty action and violence while Hemsworth holds again his sort of superhuman entity, near-invincible hero that populated the action films of 1980s (Rambo). If you need a quick action fix while quarantining "Extraction" will do the job nicely, but outside of the polished action scenes, there isn't anything offered here that hasn't been done a hundred times before and better (John Wick). Although predictable in places and featuring set-pieces that stretch the realms of believability, "Extraction" is a well made action movie which ends with a strangely ambiguous shot. Overall, "Extraction" delivers high octane action sequences but doesn't have anything else except that.Rating: 6+/7- (above average action movie)

reviews.review_title: One of the best action movies, empty and dull plot
reviews.content: Chris Hemsworth's performance was marvelous. He acted really well and at the end even inserted emotion into our hearts, but the movie and the storyline was just taking place too fast. Could've made movie at least 30 minutes longer. Some parts have no explanation whatsoever. Also, calling it Dhaka, Bangladesh but filming it in Kolkata? Just.. Why?

reviews.review_title: I would like a series of at least 10 prequels, please!
reviews.content:
The fighting in this was incredible! A crew of ex-special forces officers from all over the world are hired as mercenaries to rescue a kidnapped child.
Straight-forward plot with lots of room for adventure and violence, and boy was there ever lots of adventure and violence!
If you like fight movies, watch this. It doesn't waste a second on anything boring or irrelevant. I'll definitely see it again, and I wasn't all the sequels that set up this crew and see them take contracts all over the world.
This is a great action packed movie I have seen in the last 2 years, stunts are top class, great story and actors, Chris has given a great performance..loved it..

Looks like shooting was done in India and Thailand,the music was playing from each apartment was in Hindi ( not Bangla) ,the actors were all from India.So why the heck Bangladesh name was used to humiliate the country unnecessarily.

reviews.review_title: It's been done before but rarely as good as this
reviews.content:
With a title that should be the name of a crappy Steven Seagal movie that you'd find at the bottom of a DVD bargain bin, this movie was surprisingly rather good.
Of course the plot is a recycled one but hey! Recycling is good right?Chris Hemsworth plays a mercenary who is hired to rescue the kidnapped son of an imprisoned crime lord.
It's a simple premise. One that's been reincarnated many times before but rarely as entertaining as this.
The Russo brothers of 'Avengers' fame produce with first time director Sam Hargrave at the helm.
I say first time. Hargrave has directed several short films but this is his first feature film.
A renowned stuntman and stunt coordinator. Hargraves has crafted a fine action movie with 'Extraction'. His expertise shine through with some of the best hand to hand combat scenes this side of 'John Wick'.
There's a beautifully shot car chase in which the camera stays in the car so we the audience feel like a passenger. There really is some marvellous direction of action here.
The film maybe basic but the fascinating camera work is certainly a cut above.
After this I can see Hargrave's being in big demand.
He knows how to get the best out of his actors too.
Hemsworth is in full badass mode and sells every single punch.
Apart from his excellent performances as Thor, he's never been better.
Hemsworth has the talent, charisma and physic to follow in the footsteps of Sly and Arnie.
There's not too many genuine action stars anymore. Chris Hemsworth is totally believable onscreen and it's clear like Keanu Reeves he's doing most of the arse kicking himself and not relying on a trained martial artist or stuntman.Presented in Dolby Vision on Netflix, 'Extraction' is a visual treat.
It boasts a 4K crisp image.
There's absolutely no film grain which allows for a digitally crisp picture.
Detail is very strong with sweat and grime visible in every pore. Close ups reveal every hair strand and blood soaked clothing as fine texture.
The movie has a amber coloured filter making the whole look of the movie feel hot, sweaty and gritty.If the visuals are good then we should have a great sound mix to accompany it right?
Well rest assured that the Dolby Atmos mix that is available for those rocking a dedicated home theatre system is one of the best Netflix has to offer.
There's plenty going on up top with helicopters and bullets wizzing overhead.
In ceiling or height speakers will have to work hard.
Surround sound effects are constant. Ambience or action, there's always something finding its way around the soundstage.
LFE is rich and punchy.
Gunshots have a realistic thud whilst mid range sound is crisp as depleted shells bounce off the floor.
My only gripe with the sound mix is that the centre channel, particularly dialogue could become muddled from time to time causing me to raise my centre speaker by a few dB.
All in all this movie offers a fine surround sound experience.
The action scenes are demo worthy.
The film itself was a joyous surprise and one that those with a Netflix subscription should definitely check out.

reviews.review_title: Fight scenes are better. Chris is good.
reviews.content: You will enjoy the intense fight scenes, they are well directed. The movie about the Tylers regrets, drowning in pain and going on with his life vs the drug lords kidnapping followed by rescuing and finally getting attached to Ovi and everything in between. The Bangladeshi drug lord is shown weak. Tyler, Ovi and Farhad are good. Rest of the casting is bad. End is fhe opening for part 2, I guess.
Right now mostly on Banglafeshi people don't follow any country like India!!

reviews.review_title: It is entertainment, watching people die
reviews.content:
A dance movie, the spectacle, the coordination
Watch it in the evening with a beer or two
The plot? Don't worry about it!
Much joy

reviews.review_title: the smell of gunpowder in the air
reviews.content: This is an action film with a rather interesting story that is ultimately undefined and spoils the whole impresion, story takes place quite quickly (too much is crammed in in a short time). Unfortunately acting isn't exactly something (given the caliber of the actors), it's not very bad but it should definitely be a lot better. There are pointless scenes in there which definitely spoils the impression. The fight scenes are done well I have to admit. Visually and sound are done neatly, the ambience where it was filmed was cool location. While this movie has its good sides it just doesn't have that woow action effect, I regret the case.

reviews.review_title: A full fledged action movie which will keep you riveted
reviews.content:
Seriously reviewers, were you looking for a plot in this hardcore, unadulterated action flick ? I wasn't and hence not disappointed. Most action films are based on the extraction of kidnapped family member or a precious item or heists of different types. Lovers of action films are going to love this film. The 10 year old son of an Indian drug lord ( Pankaj Tripathi) is kidnapped by a drug lord of Bangladesh, and taken there. Pankaj tells the boy's caretaker Randeep Huda to get the boy back or else.... On the other hand, a mercenary Chris Hemsworth is launched for a rescue mission keeping in mind the ransom money. The mission is launched and like all projects things don't go as per plan.
The film is full of car chases, car crashes, shootings, explosions, fistfights, sniping with dozens of policemen/ goons getting injured or falling dead. Our heroes/ villains have barely the time to reload. All credit to the director and his cinematographer for creating continuous, pulsating, edge of the seat action majorly with a hand held contantly fluid camera. The viewer has no option, and he/she is sucked into the action through the vibrant cinematography supplemented with rocking music. A word for the crisp editing which makes the film racy.There are some splendid aerial shots to heighten the impact. Never a dull moment.
Chris is at home doing all the action. He gets a chance to emote too as his character has a soft side. Randeep Huda does well. The actor playing the boy's role impresses.
You wouldn't be disappointed, the action sequences are too real !!

It's a pretty simple story. A special forces mercenary takes on a contract to rescue the son of a drug lord who was abducted by a rival drug lord and kills an entire city's police force in the process. There is some cool gun action and some intense fight scenes but ultimately the whole thing is just another typical cliché modern Hollywood action movie. Except perhaps with slightly less 'badass empowered female' action, which was refreshing. There is a lot of violence, but it still felt watered down. It could have been way darker and edgier, which would have been more realistic too, but the main character was held back by the script. Being too nice and always honorable to even the most vile creatures and getting nothing in return. But maybe that is a metaphor for the Vikings of today, who knows.

My heart hurts after watching this, but it was SO good! Very intense, great storyline and symbolism/themes. The cinematography upped the amazingness to a whole different level. Wow. No spoilers, but I have questions after watching this.

reviews.review_title: Great action movie. Didn't expect it to be this good.
reviews.content: Action movie that somehow felt fresh, even with the plot being standard. Other movies should take note and replicate how the action was done in this movie. The camera wasn't all over the place like a lot of these types of movies try to do, which made me able to take it all in. It was also realistic with a nice minimal touch of over the topness. The plot was simple but solid, and rarely took me out of the movie. The acting was good as well, and the characters were cast correctly. Hemsworth plays this role well. It wasn't perfect, as there were a couple times where you are asked to sort of "just go with it", but overall really good. Very pleasantly surprised.

reviews.review_title: No one cares about the city
reviews.content: The movie itself was amazing, the fact that some angry indians online are mad about their horrible city not being portrayed right is just stupid

Mitch Albom once said, "It might seem strange to start a story with an ending. But all endings are also beginnings. We just don't know it at the time."This movie did that. Starting with the ending in mind was interesting. However, the storytelling and action pulled me in and caused me to forget about the ending in the beginning.Chris Helmsworth crushed this one. Action-packed. Heavy in emotion.

Extraction is one of those really stereotypical action movies where you know what's going to happen, but it's super entertaining. Extraction does exactly what's it's supposed to do, and it does it perfectly. The action is so good that it actually holds the movie up when everything else holds it down. If the plot and characters where more compelling, then Extraction could've been one of the best action movies since John Wick.The plot follows a mentally scarred ex soldier merc who rescues the protagonist. Since this plot has been done too many times to count, it becomes nearly impossible to be just slightly unique. Extraction does one thing different, and that's the setting. It's unheard of that an action movie takes place in Bangladesh or anywhere near Bangladesh, but Extraction took the opportunity. Bangladesh is a hidden gem for settings because the possibilities are endless, and you can have some beautiful cinematography.When it comes to the action it's great until the last act for me because of how repetitive it becomes. By the time you reach the last act, you pretty much become desensitised to the action. If they slowed it down and had more dialogue, it would have been a breath of fresh air, and possibly be more emotional. Other than the repetitiveness, the action was really good. The character development and execution was good, although the cliche was to the max.This was Sam Hargrave's first big time directional debut, and it's a promising outing. Everything was shot well and the choreography was super impressive, and those few fight scenes where the most entertaining scenes in the movie. The editing was done masterfully too, as many action movies do a terrible job with showing all the action, but in Extraction, you witness everything.Overall, Extraction is a movie that is a definite watch if you're bored. Although Extraction does have issues, it doesn't really matter because this movie has one goal and that's to entertain you.
Good fight scenes, thats just the only good thing about this move. A very bland plot just like EndGame. Overall, don't waste your time on this one.

Despite this being Sam Hargraves directorial debut, it goes without saying it was done extremely well, along side Joe Russo's ingenious writing abilities. I was extremely impressed with the action sequences, more so with the extensive "Single take" sequences. I found myself thinking about how they came up with the ideas including the impressive camera work and how it is done. What I enjoy most is scenes/shots that can be interpreted differently, in this case, the end scene.
Enjoyed the movie. It's action packed with killer stunts n best casting.
No background studies at all. Hollywood got tired of misrepresenting African countries, so this time they come up with a country they heard for the first time.
Great action movie, not a groundbreaking plot by any means but very well executed and left an impact 👌

reviews.review_title: Didn't make it to the end
reviews.content: A movie where Netflix wondered how many people Chris Hemsworth could kill in two hours. The plot is nonexistent and the non stop action gets pretty boring after the first hour.

It's a movie, no, it's an action movie, and some of the stunts are definitely on par, if not better, than some produced in Hollywood. Main actors performed well. I was hoping that boy making that last shot could have got some comeuppance though. Overall, definitely worth watching.
Great one shot scenes, raw action and great phenomenal hand to hand combat. Worth a watch for sure!

reviews.review_title: As lame as it could be!
reviews.content: If you don't have slightest idea about a country, you shouldn't base a movie on that. All the background smaller details mistaken in the environment, accent etc. I can excuse; but you did grave mistake by depicting Bangladesh law enforcement this rogue, specially bringing in Army in the picture. Bangladesh Army is well respected all over the world as one of the largest in UN peace keeping mission. There could be individual rogue law enforcement agent working for criminals, as shown in many movies. But in this senseless movie, it was depicted the whole law enforcement system is working for a drug lord. Seriously mate?

reviews.review_title: Soooooo no real story at all....zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz
reviews.content: So 43 minutes in and so far we have about that many lines of dialogue making for zero actual story. I will say that the fight scene that I paused to type my thoughts so far is probably the best knife fight I can remember ever seeing in a movie so kudos for that. To bad they ended the way they did totally ruined that fight scene. Next oddity, why does this kid keep trusting Hemsworth? So we have in this story a typical troubled hero with something in his past that haunts him and drives him to make the choice that ultimately kills him but also makes him a hero. We have the innocent caught in a world he does not belong in and completely out of his element. We have the woman who loves the hero from afar and has never had the courage to act on her love. We have the trusted henchman that double crosses his boss only to be destroyed in the end. Finally we have the evil tyrants on both sides spreading hate and death for selfish reasons and greed in this case as often is the case two warring drug lords. 60 minutes, I am getting a bit bored of the same old same old. Oh my, the old friend, I just paused again, I am gonna guess that the old friend betrays him and tries to make an excuse about how he has to survive or they came to him and threatened his family or something like that. Watch it to see if I am right. 1:21 unforeseen twist, not completely unpredictable but I did not see it. Final thoughts; Randeep Hooda aka Saju is a fantastic action actor and I really enjoyed watching him in this movie and hope to find some others he is in that I can watch. Hemsworth does an admirable job of playing an operator or special forces or whatever you choose to call his past roll. We knew how the movie would end, however, that does not mean I or we should be happy about this, it was a bullstuff ending and frankly lost a star from me over the ending itself. (Yes I know this was based on someone else's work, a graphic novel, so what it is still bullstuff.)

Good action, i loved the story plot they didn't just put Chris Hemsworth in it. They put an effort on the story. They missed a couple of little detail like that left arm i think wasn't really necessary to put a bandage on it because he use it anyway.but overall you can feel the amount of work in this movie story

I'll start my review by saying that I love Chris Hemsworth since I am a huge Marvel fan. Also English is not my first language so I'd like to apologize about any of the possible mistakez, whoops, there's one! Joking.The fast-paced action scenes, the trembling camera work, alongside the exciting score, all excelled by giving me anxiety, extreme sensations and a huge portion of adrenalin.
Hence bravo to the director by delivering us maybe the best Action performance I've seen in a while! But the other problems just drag the movie down, unfortunately, and here they are:1. The story is just so poorly and full of cliché that since the beggining I had this sensation of deja-vu. An ex-soldier, Tyler, who is now a mercenary, full of psychological burden, accepts any mission he receives, even though his life might be in danger. This one is an extraction of a Bengali kidnapped boy, Ovi, whose father is an imprisoned drug lord. Think you've seen this one already, don't you? And not to forget Tyler Rake, who literally kills a bad guy with a rake(and who in the name of God keeps a rake in his 7th floor apartment, oh, oh, I think I know this one!). Not to mention the other 150 bad guys he just smashes, and not one of them is smart enough to think of a smart plan to take him down. Nooo, sir! They were like: "I think I really wanna get shot today, yeah.. Maybe even die, we'll see".2. I'm pretty sure that there are also beautiful parts in the capital of Bangladesh, Dhaka, except from the penurious, miserable areas we are constantly shown. Where are my Bengali people, we stand by you guys!
But of course, we already got used to this poorly vision American producers have about Asian/African/ or even some European states. See also the bright side of life, dear Americans, as the Pythons would say!3. The Poor Character Development, a MAJOR PROBLEM FOR ME.
Was I supposed to care about Saju(the South-Asian-Pablo-Escobar's right hand), who died to protect Ovi, and in the same time his family? Because I didnt't. At all! I simply didn't care when he died.
That Indian girl whose ancestors I'm 100% sure are the Amazons from mythological Greece. Also, didn't see her use in the story, just because she's so badass that she blows up a helicopter with an RPG, or because she is such an effective sniper, but not before Saju and our hero, Tyler, gets shot, I'm supposed to give her a big round of applause? Nope, I don't buy it, sorry!
And our dear boy, Tyler. Gosh I love Chris Hemsworth. I keep waiting for the movie in which he will be able to show the world his acting skills. Surely this is not the one, but actually he did pretty well. But I didn't care about his missing wife, didn't care about his dead child, and obviously didn't care about the moment - which is supposed to give us some acknowledge about who they are as persons, it fails - he and Ovi have in Tyler's friend's house, Gaspar(i guess??), who, as a matter of fact, is ready to betray his dear friend(who saved his life in the past) for a bunch of dollars. And, you guessed, our professional mercenary, who not long ago in the movie, said that he only want his money, now is ready to save Ovi for nothing!(seen this one already, stop the cliches!!!!) they fight and at the last Ovi shoots him. Later on, that little boy has no remorse for shoting and killing a man.
For me, the death of Tyler only made me sigh by the love I care for Chris, and the melodramatic score(personal sensibility), but that's it. Not even the little kind of totem of underwater meditation Joe Russo gave us, that our hero is doing when we first met him, and wants to do it before he dies. Not only the last scene where Ovi is doing the same thing in a pool, and after he returns to the surface, we see in the backround a foggy appearence of Tyler, which gives us a little hope. Rub your eyes kid, you're deluding yourself.To finish this, overall this is a good action piece, really, even though it is sometimes a little improbable, but what isn't in this World. Sam Hargrave handled the alert rythm very healthy. Joe Russo, though, maybe it is better for him, and especially for us, to keep directing superheroes and leave the writing behind, for now.

It's a movie we've seen a thousand times.. Sure the action scenes are great but that's to be expected these days with film making tech and a bug budget.. The cast aren't great and the plot is predictable. The ending tried to be different but it just played out quiet silly. I'm sure it'll spawn a few sequels as there isn't much work needed to make these types of films. I'm sure alot of action fans will enjoy it and it's simplicity but for me, it lacked any standout performances or anything to think about or remember.. Its a one time movie, definitely not something I'd ever see myself watching again. Hats off to the stunt men tho, they carried the film and made the dull main cast look good.

This film looks very similar to John Rambo series. Firstly, the plot is very simple like in all fis about saving lifes. Secondly, the cast is good but Cris Hamsworth played well, I believe him. His character is a man who struggles with his own past and fears. Thirdly, the action itself is good, action scenes take a long tome, fighting looks very realistic. Don't miss the final scene, it has some surprise.
So, it's good actoin film for people who likes film with fighting and action.

Very well done and quick action movie with some superb shots and fight scenes. Of course the plot is non existent, however who is watching such movies because of a plot? Additionally some weird message is delivered here - it is basically ok to kill dozens of actually innocent police officers who are just doing their job to save a kid of a drug lord?.

reviews.review_title: This is kinda sad to see Dhaka
reviews.content: In the movie represent the Dhaka is very dirtiness.Dhaka isn't like this as the movie represented .Although this is a movie we should have take it.
10/10 certainly not 5/10, this movie is superb!!! Chris Hemsworth brings the action from start to finish. a must see

Netflix brings another action movie to streaming. Unfortunately, all the movie brought to the table was action scenes. Stunt coordination, close quarter combat scenes and the cinematography for the action scenes were all solid. Even the acting was fairly good. However a lack of adequate backstory for the main character leaves the overall feel of the movie as "meh." If you are looking just to watch a series of action scenes strung together then you will truly like this movie.

There's nothing much in the story, there's rarely any logic in action movies. BUT, this movie knows what it is and does it really well. If you're looking for something full of out-and-out action, do watch this. Amazing camerawork and stunts. You'll have to make sure you don't bring logic in when it comes to bullets flying all over the place in this movie, IYKWIM.
Even pubg has better plotting! Total rubbish! ... Bangladesh law enforcement is portrayed not only in a false way but also in a very wrong way!

Will I remember this and want to watch it over and over again? No. But for 2 hours this kept us very engaged and on the edge of our seat. Great acting, actions, location, and ending. It's the simple things that if done well make for a great experience. This move was just that.

reviews.review_title: The movie wasn't shot in Dhaka, Bangladesh
reviews.content:
If the movie is not shot in Dhaka, Bangladesh so how is it possible!!!
BANGLADESH is not such a country the way extraction movie presented.
The language used in the movie isn't Bengali language, actually it's a mix of Hindi and Kolkata language.Director has not even a minimum Idea about Bangladesh army, navy, RAB, swat, ssf, etc. Without having a minimum Idea of the particular shooting place should not mention the name of the place.Director could include at least one or more actior or actress in this movie.So, I am very much frustrated seeing the movie.
It's an explicitly violent movie and the special effects are really convincing. It is a good movie with pretty substantial plot.
I cry cry and cry , what a casting. Many action many drama i felt unhappy sometimes, sometimes i was in action

Rated it 5 only for its action and well direction..
Being a Bangladeshi only problem I have is the bengali dialect the cast uses is not actually Bangla language,its a different dialect and it sounds funny..
Hope next time they would put their efforts refining these small but important section!
Kudos to 'Extraction'
2 fight scenes and randeeps performance was the only good part about this movie or else avoid it
Loved the movie.Saw some crying over misrepresentation of the city.It is afterall,a fictional movie right ?

reviews.review_title: Same pattern but not boring. A good action!
reviews.content: Joe Russo and Chris Hemsworth gave us a good amount of action in the Extraction combined with good directing and fighting scenes. It didn't offer anything new to the action world but it succeed to offer pure entertainment and adrenaline! Chris Hemswroth really maintained good his physic and was able to withstand many stunts!

reviews.review_title: Chris and Hooda Nailed it with looks and action !!!
reviews.content: Once again Netflix did a brilliant job. The movie is highly entertaining and action-packed. Loved the action sequences and how detailed the scenes were. Chris acting was as usual spot on along with the way he looked. The villain for me was not up to the expectations I think the character should have been bolder to match Chris and Hooda. Hooda played an exceptionally outstanding role, always been a fan of his acting. The part where Chris and Hooda join the party together was my favourite part of the movie. Overall it was good entertainment to cure quarantine blues.

I love my films and even though I'm not a huge Hemsworth fan, I thought I'd give this a bash. I gave it over an hour and found I'd lost interest countless times and wasn't particularly enjoying it. Not quite sure about some of the high ratings. Maybe some people just love this type of film and it doesn't matter what happens. It's dull, moody, boring and unoriginal. Watch something else would be my advice.

reviews.review_title: Its a mispresentation of a country like Bangladesh
reviews.content: If you are looking for action movie with good content then this is not the right movie for you . there are thousand of lacking with the story and country like Bangladesh with good law and order but this movie shows opposite so i would say writer had no idea about this country

reviews.review_title: A new standard for fight choreography
reviews.content: The amazing tracking shot in the middle of the movie is worth the watch alone, right on par with that unforgettable "where's my elephant" scene in Tony Jaa's "The Protector."The moves in these fights will you have jumping back to watch in slow motion. Amazing.Some people are whining about "the plot." Go watch "Citizen Kane" and shut up.Don't remember the last time I enjoyed an action flick this much.

It was a good movie well shot. Very good action scenes. But I was expecting some more of pankaj tripathi. There is only one scene of pankaj tripathi I think it's less than 1 min. Same as shown in the trailer. Some more of him could have been better.
But although a good action packed movie. Chris Hemsworth as always fabulous. Randeep huda has also done very good work.

reviews.review_title: Good action, Chris rocks but factual mistakes
reviews.content: Great action movie especially a quality Netflix original for change that is! The movie is all set in Dhaka, Bangladesh with a kidnapped Indian kid from Mumbai India being rescued by Chris Hemsworth's character. Would just like to correct that Mumbai has no known Drug Mafias living in the city and driving in Benz Bmw etc. It's a business city and There are loads of not only Industrialists but plethora of upper middle class folks as well driving in those cars and and their kids going to awesome schools. Hollywood needs to do some homework on that and not be eternally stuck in the Slumdog Millionaire time warp which in any case was lopsided and a big flop in INDIA. Am a Chris fan and love this one for his amazing role nevertheless. Cheers!

This is called a "movie " , an action movie . I live in New York City and there are so many movies that give NYC a bad rep , Who cares , it's entertaining . Even New Yorkers have an accent. Anyway watch this movie to be entertained its just fluff and nothing else .

One of the stupidest movies i have ever watched.
2h of plain shooting....
don't waist your time and nerve cells...

The story is pretty much ordinary and predictable.
Chris Hemsworth did a great job in the action sequences.

Extraction is Sam Hargrave's first real instructor credit. He has been second unit on several major productions, and is big in the stunt world, where he has been a stunt double for Chris Evans's Captain America, and has subsequently become a stunt choreographer for Marvel and the MCU. The Russo brothers have written the story, and Joe Russo has lived screenplay. The film is based on the cartoon "Ciudad", written by Andy Parks.The film is known for its 11 minute long one-take, witch is made up of 36 different stitched sequences. Some of those sequences took 25 takes in order to line up correctly.It's an action-packed movie, but it's a bit of a shame that the first action scene is almost the best. This action scene is made with rubber weapons, as it was illegal to transport weapons that could shoot with light gunpowder into the country where the film was filmed. You can't see that in the finished film, so cardou for that.There is not much character development in the film. It's 100% show, with no significant history.The ending sequence on the bridge also causes the film problems, in terms of the sniper's ability to shoot and lack of the same.Chris Hemsworth is no doubt cut for action movies, but he is also good at comedy. They do not make use of it at all in this film.

reviews.review_title: High Intensity, Action Packed, & Tactically executed

There have been a lot of comments about "Racism" and the portrayal of Bangladesh etc... I just want to remind you that this is a cinematic work of fiction! If you're going to rate movies on how realistic the cities look and become overly critical at how accurate the culture is etc, then I really think you need to reconsider even watching films like this in the first place... I say great work on delivering an enjoyable Action Packed Film with talented actors, realistic looking fight scenes, & well executed stunts that keep you on the edge of your seat the whole way thru.

reviews.review_title: This film is very good, but why all the fuss about 1 kid?
reviews.content: The action sequences in this film are some of the best I have seen -- congratulations to everyone who put this all together -- great job.The story in this film, however, leaves me cold. OK, the Kid's father is in prison, got that. But there is this Other Guy, the one with all the gold chains, who apparently spares no expense in human lives to stop Rake (Hemsworth) from rescuing The Kid. The motivation almost seems like it's Gold Chains Guy's personal vendetta or revenge against some (?) opposing forces, and The Kid is merely a pawn in this story. But since that dialog is all in Indian, English-speaking audiences may not know any more.Although it's just a movie, it seems irrational for such an extreme expenditure of human life for 1 Kid -- although The Kid's life is valuable too -- I'm not disputing that. For these reasons. I give the film 7-stars.

reviews.review_title: Very tightly shot action film, what more do we want
reviews.content: This is a tightly run, minimally scripted action film, with a core plot point of a mercenary who develops an attachment to the principal target. Sure, we have seen this before.The amount of violence is very high, and the kill ratios are reminiscent more of a first person shooter than a real combat situation (the opponents always wait to fire, and patiently take head shots), but that is not in itself different from any other Western action flick. Those who remember Arnie mow down dozens in Commando without changing his clip will hardly find cause to complain.Bangladeshi viewers who find this movie's depiction of Bangla armed forces as corruptible have a cause to feel aggrieved. But seriously, after decades of Western cops shown as bent in cinema, it is fine if the reality of other countries makes its way into fiction? And principal photography was done in Western India, a vastly different visual space. It is not meant to be a realistic depiction of Dhaka. The traffic snarls and nearly impossible road situations are spot-on for Dhaka, as well as the people who stand and gawp at the action (speaking as a South Asian)..Chris Hemsworth keeps the emoting light and is effective in the role he essays here. Not much more was asked of him. He is believable as a man with a deathwish who wants to go out doing one last right thing. Strong international debut for Indian action star Randeep Hooda. I think he can expect more in the future. Not sure what the people asking for a plot really think they deserve, but the amount that there was - was sufficient for me.

A mob in India hiresTyler, a special op of some kind who seems distraught and in desperate need of money. He accepts the mission and goes with a team of his to rescue the child and claim their prize. Little did he know that after he retrieve the child his team were to be played by the mob and not give any money. His team get killed and he is left alone with the kid. He goes through many armed fights against the police and different mobs. The situation gets complicated and he fins refuge in his old friend of his that owes him his life bu alas,this friend too turns out to have struck a deal with the mob to hand the kid for the life of Tyler. Tyler refused to shoot the kid and he gets in a dispute with his friend who gets shot in the process by the kid. Tyler finally decides to get the kid back home and makes a deal with the ex special force officer who works for the father of the kid so that Tyler can get to the other side of the bridge and aboard a shopper that will meet him there. But Tyler gets shot with his last image in his head is his of his wife and his kids. Tyler gets on the shopper and apparently leads a new life elsewhere away from the mob life. Also,the mob's head gets shot in the head.
Nice action film with very good fight scenes.
This is the most thrilling movie I have seen in a long time.

reviews.review_title: One Star Extra For Authenticity & Some Bad Ass Action
reviews.content:
Thank God we live in an era where authenticity is now being valued and that is one the pleasing thing about Extraction. If its about Indian Drug Mafia's Lord you'll see an actual India with an Indian guy as Drug Lord communicating in Hindi, similarly when film goes to Bangladesh, you'll see real Bangladesh with Bangladeshi guy being Drug Lord there talking In Bengali. The film is the directorial debut of Sam Hargrave a Stuntman and Stunt coordinator known for choregraphing stunts in several Marvel Movies including Captain America: Civil War, Endgame, Thor: Ragnarok etc. which explains the fact that film is very mediocre in its storytelling and plot unfolding. In addition to that the film also never connects you emotionally during its emotional parts. Despite of that the film is a visual gem and gives you some visual experience as cinematography and Long action sequences are the strongest part of the movie which somehow despite of the flaws pulls this movie off to engage its audience. Talking about performances, Chris shines in all the action scenes as he should've and his presence is delightful to watch especially in cat and mouse sequences.However on the other hand Randeep Hooda looked little off colored may be due to the longer tiring action scenes for which he is not use to of, despite of the fact that he has fair amount of screen presence and is one of the leads which I definitely not expected. Tripathi as an Indian Drug Lord having just cameo appearance but he nailed it as he always does.
So if you're looking for some action then this movie is for you as you cannot skip this visual gem when it comes to action

The characters feel almost hollow for the most part.The only character who had some back story was Randeep Hooda (Saju) he is the only one whose actions feel appropriate in the given situation. You don't get why Chris Hemsworth's character is trying so hard to save this kid there was no reason for him to try so hard. The story kind of feels forced at times.All in all, the movie is fine you might have a good time watching it but due to poor writing and hollow characters, the movie just feels flat.

Extraction is not a video game adaptation - but it could have been. Nor is Extraction a spin-off from the highly-successful John Wick franchise, although if it is was, you wouldn't have thought twice. If anything, thinking twice is not why one would watch the Netflix original movie.Resplendent with turn-yer-brain-off action and in-yer-face fisticuffs, Extraction is the perfect prescription for fun escapism this quarantined world needs.Based on the graphic novel Ciudad by comicbook veteran Ande Parks (Capote in Kansas, Green Arrow) and Joe Russo (a screenwriter/director... somewhat of a newcomer in the field. Has a few little-seen, indie flicks on his resume...), Extraction is the straight-forward tale of a hardened-yet-weary merc hired to rescue a kidnapped boy. That boy, refreshingly played by Rudhraksh Jaiswal, whose wide, innocent eyes are more-than-reminiscent of Finn Wolfhard's Stranger Things teen exuberance, is the son of a ruthless Mumbai mobster. An equally-ruthless mobster, this one from Dhaka, Bangladesh, has the son kidnapped in order to finalize their gang war. Enter Chris Hemsworth and team whose muscles, grunts, and squinting eyes would make any paramilitary army quake in fear from their oncoming storm. In a fun little twist, once Hemsworth's team gains the child, they are brutally betrayed by the son's guardian, Saju, a former black ops solider, portrayed by action-star-in-the-making Randeep Hooda.Directed by Sam Hargrave, who worked as a stunt coordinator and second unit director on a number of Marvel movies, he follows in the footsteps of Chad Stahelski (John Wick) and David Leitch (Atomic Blonde). Showing more than hyper-stylized fight scenes, of which there are plenty, Hargrave beautifully choreographs an 11-minute, single-shot scene that even Sam Mendes (1917, Spectre) would find impressive.Hemsworth brings brunt physicality to the role as well as the requisite levels conflict. The twinkling Thunder God's eye has been replaced with a study of seriousness, which was a welcome turn following the depressing aloofness shown in his Endgame character. Most of all, Hemsworth is convincingly believable in a rather unbelievable role in a most ridiculous movie.Extraction has all the tropes of an 80s action movie. Of course, if Ovi was a blond woman there would have been the obligatory romance scene. Instead, there is the all-too short bromance between Hemsworth and David Harbour, whose affable charisma deserved longer screen time. Extraction is R-rated theater in single-minded pursuit of a single-minded goal: thoughtless entertainment. With that, Netflix has extracted a win.

reviews.review_title: Great action sequences and visuals but lacking in plot and character development
reviews.content: I thought the fight scenes and choreography were amazing, as were the visuals. Chris Hemsworth did a great job as did everyone else. However, I thought the film lacked in the plot. I didn't really see the motive in the kidnapping when the drug lord is already immensely wealthy, and I thought Hemsworth's character could have used some better character development. It would have been nice to see Rake's motive for the extraction to change from money to love as the film progressed as well as the relationship between Tyler and Ovi. As a result, Tyler's sacrifice at the end of the movie would have packed a much bigger punch than it did. Overall, solid movie that gave me what I expected - lots of action.

reviews.review_title: Great stunts for a movie that could have been fun if it hadn't taken itself too seriously
reviews.content:
The absurd, raw, violent and bloody stunts work pretty well and some of them are impressive so that would have been enough to make it a fun flick for a Saturday night and probably it's what the movie should have gone for: entertaining, technically week done and unpretentious action and nothing more.
Instead it makes a mistake, it takes itself too seriously with dramatic segments that should add some emotion apart from the entertainment but on the contrary they only break the rhythm and feel unconvincing and inevitably forced.
For other movies it could have worked but in this one, with its two-line script, there wasn't any space for that.

I must imagine things myself I think. What is the organization he is working for? Why is the movie focused on having a relationship with your child, while so many fathers are being killed? But ok I think this is a Stallone movie so why you need a story anyway?So the camerashots are nice, you are getting into the action and you are sucked in. Also the action looks realistic enough and it feels like there is mostly no pause for some dramatic movements. But I must say the main characters are punshing bags who can also take bullets.I feel no connection with the main character, on the bridge I was thinking: and now they will shoot him... And yes there he goes! I did not care at all. The only thing we know is that he had a wife and his child died. And he drinks a lot of course. But I must say the acting is good, also from the other actors, but the main villain looks like a joke. Also the things he does is getting boring. Ok so he kills children, has weird demands and he is ordering around people. Why he wants to have the kid... Only humiliation right?And the action is getting boring quickly. It looks fantastic but after a while you are getting used to the falling of the bodies, the explosions, the 'they block everything but still we get out'.So it feels like a hommage of the 80/90s action movies. The kid at the end will get his revenge like he wanted... So I must give it a 5. I have seen way better, but also worse. This movie does one thing very good: action, but it does the same trick over and over again. You still have the action left, which is good. But it fails on the story and the urgency of this movie.

reviews.review_title: Thats how you direct an ACTION FILM!

reviews.review_title: The real hero of the movie is Sam Hargrave
reviews.content: For a director's first massive feature film, this movie has been executed with a finesse of someone far more mature in the movie industry. The action scenes are top notch, although you cant expect anything less from the man who seems to have worn every cap the movie industry can offer: stunts, director, cinematography, sound. The result is this baby, Extraction, starring Chris Hemsworth and Randeep Hooda from Bollywood. The detail to the action scenes, be it gun fights, car chases, hand to hand combat are a pleasure to watch. The plot itself is old and predictable but the movie is still worth seeing.Pure good action film, executed particularly well but predictable.

Many writers have tried to recognise the ground for this movie, those two above in the title are where you can find the base for it.
It would not surprise me if they said the goal was to bring those two together (inventive camerawork with bar setting action), ad on that the long shots which has become more popular due to flimsy material (cut up scenes) many have used during the last 2-3 decades and you're there (exceptons in recent years include Russian Ark 2002 and Woody Harrelson's Lost in London 2017 that was groundbreaking in of itself).Regarding the movie they try to ad a little depth to a partially cliché subject by making the boy close to an oposite to his crimelord father and play out the bond that brings up in Hemsworth's character (who is  merchenary basically).
They do not exactly hit the notes here and that means the plotline that was strengthened by these elements don't end up being so more than a little tad.
Having characters without morale, which is is line with reality afaik for blackops personell (may it be formerly known blackwater oeprators, CIA hitmen or other guns for hire that kill both criminals and innocent alike), is also a good notion.Overall what is the focal point is the thriller momentum mixed with the action, action which is close to that in The Raid 1/2 and very few movies since (less than a handful asian movies). If you like action movies - this is a MUST see, if you like hemsworth he makes a solid but not aced performance when it comes to emotional depth but nails many of the actionsequences. Those where he misses and the martial arts koordination doesn't end up working are not in focus as the camerawork is good and the stuntmen are also mostly good which means it never really comes into focus either but lands in the periphery.The end become a little anticlimactic as it's more towards the cliché direction (one being tying up loose ends).Regarding any other notes the cinematography that has been mentioned stands out for another reason, several notes has been lent from the Bourne series, at one point you're just waiting for the theme track to roll. Which detracts a little but also possibly open for a sequel (?). Which it should get, but I wouldn't put that one in connection with this movie but rather as a fully new plotline for the same characters.

reviews.review_title: Decent Actioner, But Not Very Original
reviews.content: First off, this is a good movie to kill two hours. Who doesn't love Chris Hemsworth? He's one of those guys men want to be and women want to be with. He has great screen presence and he just seems like a likeable guy,The movie has a ton of action and the fight scenes are at a John Wick-ish level for production, choreography and execution. The opening sequence where Hemsworth's character rescues the young boy and kills like a dozen men is filmed at close quarters, is very fast paced and is hilariously violent. The camera jumps around the scene so you get different angles.Hemsworth plays Tyler Rake, a depressed, burnt out former special forces soldier turned mercenary. He is hired to "extract" the 14-year old son (a very good Rudhraksh Jaiswal) of a imprisoned drug dealer from a rival drug dealer's clutches. The movie is set in India and the scenery is bleak, dirty and does not do India's reputation any favors. Once he rescues the boy, his team is ambushed and Tyler is left alone with the boy trying to navigate his way through the city to an extraction point. The father's right hand man, Saju, (an also very good Randeep Hooda) is likewise a former special forces soldier and he is tracking Tyler and the boy as well, holding his own personal motivations.David Harbor as an old friend with a safe house and Golshifteh Farahani as Tyler's handler Nik Khan are good in small roles. And that is the problem. The movie had some real potential to develop characters we care about, but it sacrifices 3D characters for action and violence. Tyler and Saju are two sides of the same coin, but that isn't explored very well other than a few quick scenes of their families. Nik is a bad ass supporting character, but her role is just yelling Tyler's name into a radio most of the time, until the end climax and epilogue. There is no sense of history between them...or between any of the characters. This movie had some pretty decent talent involved and it just felt wasted to make room for more action. When characters died, I didn't care because I had no emotional investment in these people.As I said the action scenes are superb. The scene of Tyler and Ovi racing through a rundown apartment complex chased by a slew of soldiers, police and gangsters is filmed in several very long takes and the camera is so close to the action you almost feel the punches. The fight that culminates this scene between Tyler and Saju is as good as anything in John Wick. Its a highlight of the film.A good movie that could have been great had it spent some more time on its characters. Still, I enjoyed it and look forward to Hemsworth's next project.

reviews.review_title: Watch it don't be a critic

It keeps you engaged I don't care what people say movies are made to entertain you.

Even action films need a plot and believable characters. What passes for plot in Extraction is so ludicrously threadbare and lacking in sense that you might as well not have one at all. The central characters are little bundles of cliché tied together with strings of cheesy dialogue. The action itself is, as usual, just mindless violence. The overall experience is like watching someone else play a tedious computer game whose sole object is to shoot anything that moves. The one tiny positive note is a bit of deft camerawork in one scene. And that's it. Really.

reviews.review_title: Netflix's Best Action Film To Date
reviews.content: With Netflix series, it's always good to just jump in but with their movies; it's very hit and miss with things leaning more to the latter.This is a very decent action film and probably the sleeper hit of the early summer season. With very little movies being released this summer due to the pandemic; this is a good mindless, fun, shut-your-brain-down kind of flick. The action is believable compared to some over the top Hollywood movies, probably has a lot to do with the overall budget.I'd say my biggest gripe is that the scenes that were finally calm, you could barely hear the conversation between Hemsworth and the kid. I almost wished the subtitles remained the whole time even though I hate seeing words across the bottom (yes, I know it's Netflix and I could have just turned the subs on permanently).One thing is for sure is that we need more Hemsworth led action movies without Marvel being in the title.

reviews.review_title: Retty good turn brain-off action flick
reviews.content: Beautifully shot movie. Loved the color palette lots of orange yellow and green.Pretty well acted. Acting is somehow i don't know how to say it but cartoony like you know villains are villains cause they wearing Tony Montana outfits lol. Hero is the pretty boy damaged lone wolf manly white dude.I heard Russo wanted to make an hommage to old manly action movies who are a dying breed right now and he did a very good job.The fight scenes are brutal they don't hold back at all mad me think of Sicario a bit. You feel every gun shot has an impact and every knife wound actually does something to the person.The plot is simple. Get the kid extract him to safety from the bad guys nothing else to fluff the scenario with useless stuff.Really good old school action movie really. Straight to the point action flick.Usually these kind of movies are made cheap straight to DVD with bad actors and low budget and they hire a too old Bruce Willis to sell tickets and just end up bad but not this one they really wanted to do something good. And it works.8/10

I enjoyed every second of this movie even though there are a bunch of movies with similar storyline. The cast expressed the best emotions there's to express. If you care so much about storylines, this movie might not be for you. you'd enjoy every bit of it if you love action movies.

reviews.review_title: Incredible Stunt Work Steals the Show
reviews.content: The backstory of our hero may feel shallow and familiar, but all of that is swiftly forgotten once you're wrapped up in the action scenes. Sam Hargrave deserves a lot of credit on this - you can see and feel his directing/stuntman blended touch throughout. Hemsworth & Hooda both do a good job with the fight choreography and yet Farahani is who I want to see more of in the sequel.Extraction makes no attempt to fool you into thinking this movie is more than what it originally seems. Go in expecting an action movie, come out very surprised and happy about how good of an action movie it really was. Top marks for stunts and camerawork. Excited for the sequel.Verdict: Watch it.

reviews.review_title: They wasted 99% of the movie budget on thor
reviews.content: Tv movie, unwatchable if you have high movie standards.

reviews.review_title: Expect an action movie and no more
reviews.content: Yes, this is an almost nonstop action movie about an broke ex soldier hired to rescue the kidnapped son of a jailed drug lord in Bangladesh. The seemingly straightforward rescue goes south when those who hired our protagonist (Chris Hemsworth) refuse to pay the fee they have agreed on, instead trying to bypass Hemsworth and rescue the kid themselves. Add to the mix the rival crime lord in Dhaka, whose people originally kidnapped the boy but have lost him to Hemsworth and now will use all of their resources, including most of the bought and paid for police and military personnel on the payroll, to recover or kill the boy.This movie has great action sequences and cinematography going for it, but it needed a better sound editor, as many of the regional Indian dialects sound like mumbling to the western ear. Also many of the vehicles and scenes looked more like India than Bangladesh. Even Thailand was listed on the ending credits as one filming location, but it is difficult to pick out any scenes that looked like Thailand.

A gangstar with 5 child Bro!!This gangstar has a government Army too.Ridiculous.
Gangstar from bangladesh bt can't talk in Bangla properly.No one even.Worst movie ever .Waste of time totally.

Just see this movie , you will enjoy it so much and you will not think that you wasted your time
I loved the fight scenes which went too hard
The story is not a very good but interesting
Chris is Great

reviews.review_title: 2 hours of great action sequences & a very good story (minor spoilers)
reviews.content: A really good film to watch on a lazy Sunday. If you know the basic plot & choose to watch, you should love it. A really well written story with lots of sub plots. The action sequences are top notch, fighting some of the best I've seen since John Wick 3. Hemsworth delivers a wonderful ranged performance with great action, anger but dealing with grief & some soft moments. A great watch worth 2 hours of your time. Just didn't think they needed to 'start' at the end & then go back 2 days - which actually seemed more like 3-4 days watching it but only a small problem in an otherwise fun film.
It's a good action movie. finally. the setting is really important, few movies have been filmed in such countries. there are a few cliches but we're able to get over it. worth it.

reviews.review_title: A solid action movie that doesn't try to be anything else
reviews.content: When I saw that film critic Chris Knight of the National Post hates this I was pretty sure I would like it. Like many critics he's a pompous louse regarding any film that is not touchy feely or "artistic".Extraction is none of those things. It's vicious and non stop. Character development takes a long time given the structure of the teleplay. The character played by David Harbour is mostly unnecessary except to facilitate a leap in the character of the kidnapped boy. The edits are fast and the cinematography in some of the car chases is quite neat.

I really enjoyed this movie, it had all the ingredients of what I find to be an awesome movie, it did not disappoint. I thought that Hemsworth was brilliant in the lead role, and really made that badass action hero role his. I think the story and plot was pretty basic, but it makes up for it with action and I found it emotional at times even though it was faint, I found Tyler was struggling in life and actually took the job for him to be reunited with his deceased son. Tyler does in the end connect with the boy he is protecting, and does everything in his path to get him home. I really enjoyed this movie, and by the looks of it at the end it looks like signs of maybe a sequel, which I'm all down for.

This movie wasn't heavy on storyline, emotion, or character development, it's a pure hardcore action flick with tiny bits of the aforementioned added to round it out ever so slightly. For people who like movies like John Wick or The Raid: Redemption, this movie will probably be right down your alley.I'm not sure what is with all these negative reviews with respect to accent when 95% of the people who watch it won't give a damn. With the way some of these reviews read it makes me think every employee at the Bhangladesh tourism board was told to right an angry review.

It's an action movie with a weak story behind it. I was hoping for something better in the plot because Joe Russo was one of the writers but it turns out to be a simple action movie so the best thing you can do here is to enjoy the hard work creating the fighting scenes which had some interesting moves but with the traditional fast camera cuts.

reviews.review_title: The little brother of John Wick :)
reviews.content: I'm giving it a 6 cause the plot is nothing new, action is OK, inspired by John Wick, but it's nowhere the level of Kianu and his performance. Otherwise the movie is great for a lazy afternoon :) And kudos to the camera man.

This is a solid action film, with excellent choreography, that makes all the fight scenes seem vivid and realistic. The characters aren't superhumans and it's appreciated that they seem to get hurt like real people would. The plot may not be original, but it's done well for what it is and tugs on the right heart strings at the right times
Needed to be realistic. Bad representation of dhaka.
A decent action flick with good pacing and some interesting subplots. The close-up over the shoulder camera style adds to the suspense and grants a feeling of presence.

reviews.review_title: Really spectacular action sequences turn into 80's meh
reviews.content: Look, the plot is the plot. Man on Fire and a dozen other movie plots, it is what it is. The inital action scenes are great, with some great free form camera work. I really enjoyed them. Hemsworth is good in what had to be a very physical role. Now we come to the necessary midpoint of the movie, some you see it coming moments etc. and necessary character bio...but when the action starts back up it turns into what a Ramboesque action scene from the 80's standard fare, slo mo the whole bit. Its like they changed crews in the middle of filming. I'm assuming these Netflix fliks don't go through test audiences and so forth, but I find that the second half of most of their movies disappoint.

Movies is AWESOME.... Packed with Action...... I see Bangladeshi people are getting offended by the movie.....Chill guys it's just a movie...Not reality....They are taking this thing personally.
.
Chris and Hooda acting is just lit🔥

Even in the lawlessness of Bangladesh's capital city it wouldn't go unnoticed if someone came into town and shot at least a 1000 people. Chris Hemsworth's gun seems to hold a million bullets and none of the elite Bangladeshi cops and army appear to be able to shoot in a straight line. Underneath the crass stupidity is a good idea but it's so ridiculous that in the end it's just boring and derivative

Every once in a while an action movie come to life to give us a bit of a thrill, and this movie delivers that the compact scenes are done in such a great way, the plot is ordinary yet the way the actors play their roles are marvelous.
Chris Hemsworth as Tyler Rake, Randeep Hooda as Saju Rav did their best.
Finally, we should definitely see more of this young ravishing and most stunning woman Golshifteh Farahani (God she is beautiful).

Action is what this film heavily relies on which it gets it right! Excellent one take chase sequences and some stunning stunts here and there and boom! According to some Indian Hollywood blind fans, your 10 star film is ready but no I am not a fool I prefer a strong story as well. No twist nothing. Simple straightforward film.Another day where i can say "All action no substance".
I don't like in action movie when the hero kills an army of people alone, I prefer to make it more realistic, but anyway the film is cool and watchable.
Chris nailed it all the action sequences . Thank you Netflix and Russo brothers for extraction.

The storyline is successful and understandable. Some scenes are reminiscent of John Wick, but that's not a bad thing. Lots of action with less annoying and unnecessary sequences. All in all it's worth watching it. Acting and also the stunts are performed great and the movie is a successful entertainment.

The crap never stop pouring out of Hollywood.
Bad story
Bad acting
Bad directing
Bad realism
Bad ending
Bad everything
Bad waste of money
Bad waste of everyones time

reviews.review_title: A Bourne movie without a plot.
reviews.content: The combat choreography was pretty good for this film; kind of like military John Wick gunplay meets Bourne hand-to-hand combat. The camera work during the action scenes was pretty fresh, if a little overdone to the point that you were too aware of what the camera was doing. What little acting is required is passable at best. The.... let's called it a "plot"... is more of a mechanic to get Hemsworth to cross a large chunk of an Indian city on foot while straight killing any cops that might get in his way, but being nice enough to give any young kids a pass. So in this film the bad guys are people that kill one kid on screen, while the good guys are people that slaughter around 30-50 (could be higher) cops who may or may not have been "dirty". Take that, and the fact that the film could have been over in 30 minutes had Hemsworth's character not decided that growing a conscience involved taking the kid away from the person who was previously his handler. It kind of made the whole film feel like "we could have used a native military character as the hero, but instead we wanted Thor to come in and save the day."If you're looking for nothing more than a film full of action, with very little down-time and even less plot, then this film is great. If you're looking for the next Bourne-like film, then sadly you'll have to keep waiting a little longer.

Chris Hemsworth nailed the action, below par plot but huge action sequences. Loved the movie its an entertainer and people of bangladesh appreciate the effort and chill out this is just a fictional movie don't degrade the movie for showing the city bad.

Very good action movie from Netflix. Theres never really any quiet moments and although the story is quite simplistic the movie doesnt hesitate in getting straight in with the action.
If you're looking for 2 hours of gunfire and explosions mixed with some pretty good acting look no further...

reviews.review_title: Definitely Watch if you are the action thriller freak!
reviews.content: Totally loved the movie. Perfect blend of action and drama. Though this kinda story is too much common now!But action, perfect 10.Hatts off too all the actors and actresses!

reviews.review_title: Thanx for such a thriller in this lockdown time
reviews.content: Its amazing to see the movie being made like this with such a theme which is simple yet thrilling. I like how Randeep hooda has done his role along with the thor(Chris Hemsworth) .. A very well directed and managed movie.... Must watch.... Enjoy the thriller.

A beautiful looking movie, with great effects and cinematography. But it lacks everything else. The main character is hardly likeable, and the story is very linear. It had a lot of action, but the breathing rooms were awkwardly placed. The dialogue is very plain - except part of it being non-English. Decent acting, but any efforts for emotion were discarded as the characters themselves were plain. The cinematography was great, with long and well thought-through shots, but it had its fair share of constant cutting and shaking camera too.
