Full action packed entertainer. Worth a watch on netflix.

"Extraction" is an action movie along similar lines of many other rival movies. It's worth the watch because there's little deep plot. Actors, new ones and seasoned one, honed their talents and provided a good showing. Enjoy!

Giving it a 10 to up the overall rating because of all the butthurt Bangladeshis giving negative reviews! Guess what most people that'll watch this don't give a flying frak that it's not a correct representation of Dhaka or that the accents aren't correct! I'll repeat most people don't give a frak/ won't even notice that sheet!
Amazing stunt work and great shots roll this movie to the end without noticing. Still some lack of detail explanation makes some plot holes throughout the movie.
Good CQB demo. But lacks reality. Army can hardly be controlled by a drug dealer.

Troubled main character with something to do about his wife and kid (eye roll) goes and protects some other kid. Typical story, typical characters, over the top, etc. Fight scenes are good and that's about it. But that's what I expected so I enjoyed it . Only see this movie for the violence the story is retarded and characters are retarded.

reviews.review_title: What an awesome way to start the weekend
reviews.content: If you love an all action movie, then strap in and get ready for this ride. The storyline is awesome, the acting is spectacular and a gory movie I'd say.

What more can you say? The production values are impressive, the action is directed stellar for most of the time and Chris Hemsworth is a great action hero.The plot itself isn't amazing, but it serves enough reason for all the shooting, kicking and screaming. I'm surprised some people are annoyed by this, as this didn't seem to be a problem with Max Max Fury Road or John Wick - Great movies in their own right. Instead it focuses on what it also does best: The juicy action! Hemsworth is hands-on, he sure took quite some beating while making. His character is written well enough to feel believeable and his acting is on par. Same goes for Randeep Hooda, who is quite explosive as the antagonist.Most of the creativity and talent by the crew was spent in the first half and it shows. The camera work and the direction is simply amazing, the car chase scene left me puzzeling what was going on (in a good way). Sadly the creativity drops off quite going towards the ending, which is a little disappointing. It all becomes a little too predictable and cheesy.Nevertheless a highly recommendable no-bullshit action flick.

reviews.review_title: Good for an action fix, but not much substance
reviews.content: Not much more to the movie besides the action. The acting acting was ok, but I didn't feel much for the characters. The movie seemed hollow besides the action scenes, with nothing much in between.
This movie is insane.. a lot of fighting scenes... I enjoyed this movie but the saddest part is in last.

Extraction is one of the better action movies of 2020. Extraction is a realistic style thrilling ride set in India, the core of the movie is its back to back violent action sequences followed by strong performances from Chris Heimsworth and Randeep Hooda. The movie also succeeds in portraying the suffering and helplessness of people in a drug lord controlled country.The movie is really entertaining at times and at times it feels like the action feds you up. This is one of the unique movies were action is its pro and too much action is its con. The setting and tone chosen for the film delivers a Bengali touch to the movie which might degrade the hollywood feel of the movie.In the end, the only thing to praise in the movie is its well executed action sequences making the flick a strictly average one.Rating:61%
This is the best movie I have ever seen in my life. Bangladesh has not been underestimated here.Truly a movie to remember for a lifetime.

High body count, standard plot. Typical action movie. Cookie cutter all the way.
Expected more from the talent attached to this movie.
It's basically John Wick light... in India, with less compelling characters

Unbelievable headshots and perfect encounters. But its a good action movie. Both Chris and Randeep were great in the action scenes and acted really very well. The Don guy is not scary at all but the massacre shown in the movie is pretty huge. Loved It because of its action.

When i prepare to watch this movie i do not have a big expectation because i thought this will be just another action movie, personally i'm not easily impressed by action movie because so many action movie not having a good plot and for many reason they so predictable. Don't get me wrong i grew up with action movie, my father is a hardcore action movie, Stallone, Van damme, Arnold Schwarzenegger, and Jackie chan is my childhood memories, because of that i put my standard to watch Extraction very low. The only reason i watch this movie just because Chris Hemsworth is my favourite Avenger.Suprisingly this movie have a good cinematography, the director of photography have a good job shoot the scene for hollywood quality thumbs up. The second good things in this film is the choreography of hand to hand combat, it's very good they do it perfectly, i love every hand to hand combat in this movie.Yup that's the good thingThe very first thing i catch bad in this movie is the CGI, okay it's not so bad but it's caught the attention of me, maybe because this movie have a very good cinematography that makes the little bad CGI caught the eye. Second bad thing is the plot is too simple, so many forgotten character and so many oversimplifying story plot. I won't SPOIL the story, i just make a simple note of example like:1.Why the kid care so much to the main character? (it's like just a one day movie set and why he trust the main character more than his father right hand?)2.What's the important subplot of gangster kid Dhaka?3.David Harbour character background is contradicting with his act motives4.The ending is just duh5.Is this father and son movie? (you'll see many father and son scene in many character plot)Yeah i would say they have a lazy writing here, but in the end credit i see that this movie is based on Graphic Novel called Ciudad. so i dont know if this movie stay loyal to the Graphic Novel source or not, if it's not then probably it's lazy writing.The conclusion is Extraction it's a movie that have a good cinematography and one of a kind hand to hand fight scene, but this movie is not a martial art movie like The Raid so probably you'll find more shooting than fist, you'll also find noticeable CGI, cheesy ending, unanswered background story, and many why plot.What concern my mind is why the choose grown up actor for Ovi The Extraction kid character? They have a gangster kid group in the Dhaka who is more younger than Ovi the Extraction Kid !maybe if they change the kid character to more younger actor maybe it'll make me more sympathy to the film, yes like Logan movie.

The impressive rescue skillfully use of Netflix give creative space, in a highly entertaining Hollywood action movie at the same time, in which can moderate the parcel director want to presents the connotation of the story, and in the scene and the story to make a bold yet but try to the fire, successfully mastered the balance of various aspects quite commendable. I loved the way the rescue portrayed Taylor, letting the audience see that beneath his tough exterior there was a fragile, sinful soul. For years has been to mentality to perform the task to death, until meet with the rescue of the hostage action, urgent rescue process and have dialogue with each other and their depth of moment, neither team attack and not received the payment and cancel the task, inner doubt leave Mr D leave, or face years of friend's betrayal, again in the middle of dilemma of whether to continue to protect the d struggle, not only let the audience deeply like Taylor on the role, also make the impressive rescue the whole movie, more opportunities can cause us to think.
Love it, don't watch it on a small TV or your phone. Watch it on a big TV screen and nice sound system with plenty of bass, you will enjoy the movie 👍

The Netflix film is a wonderful action film with a touch of emotion. Chris Hemsworth and Randeep Hooda did it perfectly. The ending was really emotional. Every action moves are on point. But somehow we miss the beauty of Bengal in this film.

reviews.review_title: As An Indian Film, Bad. As An American Film, Horrible.
reviews.content:
In the beginning, we see a dirty "yellow" country full of polluted air and that's how a poor country looks like. They did their best to make it as dirty as they could. Overpopulated areas, too much traffic, child gangsters, guns, bad cops etc.Can you tell what this was all about? You can't, 'cause there's no story. You don't know what's happening. Just shootings and killings and that's it. The police, The Army, even the special force are working with their full strength for a "drug lord" as if he was the prime minister of the country and the mercenaries are trying to take away his own kid.
(I don't understand why they had to extract a national treasure from a "terrorist country" when they could just pay the kidnappers.)Lastly, do you remember the kid who shot Tyler at the end? Ok, do you remember WHY he did it? Why exactly he was so furious with Tyler? No, you don't remember. Because there was no damn reason. Because it's a bad film.

The Dhaka in the film is surely from another multiverse. This may in future be tied up with Doctor Strange Multiverse Of Madness or something😑. And btw if they call it cinema Mustafa Scorsese swears by Allah that he will shoot himself.

reviews.review_title: Just fighting isn't defined as movie
reviews.content:
Indian (West Bengal) and Bangladeshi (Dhaka) accent, infrastructures, geography, vehicles, dress are totally different. So, it's very odd seeing an Indian region titled Bangladesh. A Bangladeshi drug lord is talking in Indian accent !!! The girls inside his house wearing dresses in Indian way !!!
Plus the badges, vehicles of 'RAB Elite', 'DMP' isn't like this.

reviews.review_title: Don't fall for the stupid reviews of the natives
reviews.content:
This movie is great, but I've seen so many butthurt reviews of people from Dhaka, that claim that that's not what their city looks like, there's actually no criminals there, there's no violence, etc. etc. Guess what, IT'S A GODDAMN MOVIE, JUST WATCH IT AND SHUT UP. NOBODY CARES ABOUT THAT STUFF.
India played a big role on the production of the movie, that's why they're butthurt.
The film is brilliant, Chris Hemsworth and the rest of the cast were awesome. I'd recommend watching it.

It's Extraction and that's just how I like it. Chris simply nailed it, and not to forget the young Indian actor Rudhraksh Jaiswal and the more experienced actor Randeep Hooda who both did not fail to deliver. The end was really emotional and brought me down in tears. The plot overall could have some improvements, but it does not take away much from the film. The primary villain needed some more motivating factors, but the film will make you hate him enough to root for anyone who stands against him. I loved the scary & dangerous atmosphere & the frantic explosive action that bursts out of nowhere & makes everything feel on edge & intense. An exciting survival Thriller that feels real & intense as hell. A wild thrilling ride with great performances & gory blood soaked action.
Very gripping, good action sequences, great acting my Hemsworth and other Bollywood actors. Overall a very good movie. Do watch !

First of all, just because a film is not accurate in the depiction of some city, it doesn't deserve a 1 star rating, so don't listen to all the butthurt Bangladeshi reviewers.So this is the directorial debut of Sam Hargrave, taking the quick route from stunt performer to coordinator to second unit director and finally director. We already know that Hargrave is very competent when it comes to action, escpecially close combat and hand-to-hand fights, and it shows. Chris Hemsworth is physically brilliant, thanks to his director, and gives us a glimpse at how John Wick might have moved 15 years ago. The camerawork is quite impressive, the look of the film is a bit generic, but still beautiful to behold.Unfortunately, that's where it ends. The characters are shallow, the story almost non-existant and the acting... well, how good can it be? Hemsworth and his fellow co-actors actually try to make the most of the weak material given to them, but that material is very low-mileage indeed. Astonishingly generic backstory for a potentially great protagonist, no background for the antagonist, no interesting side characters. Given that, any emotional impact is sorely missed, even if the film repeatedly tries to make you feel something with cheesy flashbacks, meaningless sad music and other cheap tricks.This is a film with a starved skeleton of a plot, uninteresting characters and no reveals or plot twists at all. No surprises, no emotions, no impact. And even with the action being absolutely top-notch, it doesn't spark any real interest, at least not from my side. I even found myself a bit bored after the umpteenth time of Hemsworth doing cool moves, which leads to the inevitable conclusion that even the action falls short of fulfilling its objective: to thrill and make you root for the hero. Still, my verdict would have been a 3/10 if it wasn't for the excellent action.And so a question pops up: should every stunt coordinator and second unit director get to become a director? If he can also tell a story and has a vision, sure! Unfortunately, Sam Hargrave doesn't seem to fit that description and might be better off sticking to his guns.

Another stunt director spreading his wings into full fledged movie direction courtesy Netflix.
This one's a brutal grind thru two hours of bone crunching action. There's enough in here for satin junkies and Chris Hemsworth in his outing beyond the Marvel universe delivers. And gets down to it without too much of a build up.
A Indian drug lords son is kidnapped and whisked away to Bangladesh. What follows is a double cross and some macho action that will leave fans is the genre satiated.
Given what follows I can kind is understand why they would set the story in Bangladesh.
Our macho men go around dropping elite forces like nine pins taking out an entire division.
The action is good and well directed. Randeep Hoods acquits himself well... Going toe to toe with Chris and holding up his end of the deal.
All in all a decent watch. Is

This was a pleasant surprise. Lots and LOTS of action but the story itself was weak. Not really much of a story at all, to be honest. Honestly, there isn't much to write home about with this movie outside the fact that it's basically 'Call of Duty' meets 'John Wick.' It's a fun way to spend a night and probably has some re-watch value if you're bored enough.***Side Note Rant***Yeah, I get how some Bengali would feel some type of way of how Dhaka is portrayed in the film. One thing I don't appreciate is how those same people will quickly associate the violence and action portrayed in the film to African countries (which have also been one-sided and poorly represented in the world media for decades). You kind of lose the point of your argument when you use other counties' hyper stigmatized issues as a shield to defend your own representation. I'm with you on the misrepresentation, but please, STFU on using African countries as your go-to scapegoate.

reviews.review_title: Superb action and amazing camera work, loved watching Hooda and Hemsworth together on the screen!
reviews.content: One of the best action packed movie lately. And man oh man, what great camera work!! Hemsworth and Hooda stole the show, you can see their sweat and hard work paid the price. Randeep Hooda, thank you for taking this role and giving us some out of this world action sequences with Hemsworth!

I felt like this film did its job very well. It's entertaining and the action sequences are for the most part great. Had some issues with the CGI on that laughably unrealistic jump at the beginning + some not so good explosions and missile animations AND a one-time green screen goof. Other than that it was very visually pleasing. The plot on the other end had some issues like a lot of "pure action" movies. Overall it was predictable and used a bit too much "plot-armor" for my liking. BUT... I didn't go into this film expecting an amazing plot so I wasn't disappointed or felt like it took away from the overall experience. A solid 9 for its genre. Badass. Exciting. Violent.

I was expecting more of a "Taken" style movie, but this is nothing quite like it. It's more of a gun fight action movie but well made and even some gun-less fights, also well choreographed. The whole thing feels very real and suspenseful. Action wise this movie is packed. Story wise, I wouldn't say exactly original but it's not your Hollywood cliché either. It's not a happy movie, you might want something more upbeat after it. I found a a little disappointing but still glad I watched, especially since it stars Chris Hemsworth, he's not even fat anymore :) one thing it seriously lacks is more women, but it's understandable why.

The flim was energetic.
The camera tricks and stunts are outstanding and realistic one.
For those who are blabbering about how they portrait the bangadesh.
I wanna ask some thing..when some movies portraits bad stuffs about middle eastern and African countries. Where you all been then..
STFU and enjoy the movie.

Such an awfull, idiotic plot based, disrespectfull stupid movie!! No homeworks! India and Bangladesh is not same! They have differences! Dhaka is not Kolkata! And Bangladesh Army is not a terrorist organization like US Army!!!Mongol Shovajatra does not happens in evening! Its not that poor either! The language is not that rubbish to listen! And those songs!!Um annoyed by your cheap c graded potraying, and your rubish politics!! You show Bangladesh so negetively because you need to get the indian market on NETFLIX!! Right??You should not humilliate any nations pride!! You better say sorry for this stupid film!!

reviews.review_title: It's good. A bit much at times, but overall respectable action flic.
reviews.content: So, you know that moment when you're watching a movie and you suddenly ask yourself if maybe your "hero" is actually the bad guy in this scenario?And don't get me wrong, corruption and criminal empires and all that are bad. But hell, a lot of the people getting slaughtered like flies are as far as I can tell regular police officers... Them being from another country doesn't really change this fact... Doesn't justify the amount of death, destruction, collateral damage...Also, a "tad" unrealistic. Sort of a Rambo/Wick level of fake overpowering where too much is like not enough rather.Can't say I really liked Thor much (7/10?), and while I don't really care for this movie, Hemsworth does pretty good. It's funny though, his character seems to have the same kinda vibe as the failed MIB movie there...Almost makes ya wonder lol if he is cast for his looks or his talents...

Straight from the 90s playbook of action films, Chris Hemsworth plays the ridiculously named Tyler Rake, a seasoned mercenary sent to rescue a drug lords son from another drug lord. Could have been set in any slum in any third world country in the world, originally set in Paraguayan city of Ciudad del Este in the graphic novel series.Middle of the road action romp. Worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: It's a B action movie, so calm down.
reviews.content: The movie review, it's linear, derivative and lazy.If you want to see a car chase, it's in this movie.If you want to see a knife fight, it's in this movie.If you want to see gun fights, pew, pew, it's in this movie.On the other hand if you're looking for a strong story that has some basis in reality then you might get upset, much like the reviews by people from Bangladesh it seems. We get it your upset how your country is being portrayed. You do know it's not a documentary, right? Get over yourselves, it's just a B movie to be consumed and forgotten.

Hey, "Extraction" may not win any awards but it's a total alpha male movie. It is what it is. Violence, violence and more violence. Lots of blood too. Not for the faint hearted. Good old fashion action packed flick. The plot may be basic but if you like tons of military ops type fighting you will love this. The audio seemed too low for some of the quieter scenes. You have to strain your ears to make out some of the dialogue. I played it though big tower stereo speakers too. Really my own complaint. It's no mystery what to expect if you read up on the movie and watch the trailer. SPOILER: Watch close at the very end. Great fight guys and gal!
It is good action entertainer. Though the plot is simple the movie makes up what it lacks in plot with nice action sequences. The movie has good long shots and stands aside from other action movies.

It's basically an action movie so the whole plot supports the action, it's a mercenary who gets tangled up in Bangladesh. It's cool that it does the location aspect well. My issues are when you have a seasoned mercenary I feel like he commits a lot of mistakes and gets into some situations that could have been avoided. There were a lot of tactical errors. First he goes in Rambo style, which is cool but if you're planning a mission up against 20 hostile, you need a squad. There is an ambiguous support character who seems battle hardened but his methods don't really add up. When you are senior military, you make sure you can win and you have the upper hand. But we see a lot of panic and escape here, not a cool controlled authority. It's a good movie but I think they should have ran it by a military consultant to make it more authentic.

reviews.review_title: They made the movie they wanted.
reviews.content: To be honest, I was able to watch this movie for free and enjoyed it to some extent, but I would not recommend it to anyone wishing to see a 'meaningful' film. It is not that. It is a typical 'action' movie with some good moments, especially some of the tracking shots and even some well done tender moments. It is not realistic, nor is it meant to be. It holds no deep or thoughtful presence, but it does display to some extent the living conditions of the poor in the Indian subcontinent.The creators made the movie that they wanted, and, for that reason, I award them with a ten star rating.

The backstory isn't convincing enough, the supporting characters have no scope, they just fall like Dominos with no value other than just being part of itYou wouldn't regret watching it, nothing to say it's a must watch either.(The comparison of this with Taken, Man on Fire, John Wick are pure exaggeration, don't fall for it)

reviews.review_title: A Little Bit Disappointing But Still Good Movie
reviews.content: I had been waiting for this day since long. With cinemas locked down due to the global pandemic, I had stopped waiting to watch any new movies. What caught my attention was the trailer of Extraction, that finally gave me hope to wait for a big action blockbuster. And having watched it on Netflix just minutes ago, I can assure you that it's the best action movie of the year till now. The film lived up to the hype and left me satisfied as the credits rolled.Extraction's USP is the action it offers: beautifully shot, neatly choreographed and well-edited too. Those fed up of quick cuts in recent action movies would be pleasantly surprised to find long takes in this film (in this case, a prolonged single-shot action sequence!) instead of fast cutting. The color tone is rich and suits the film's own tone. There are a couple of dramatic breaks between the action that make the viewers root for the characters.Chris Hemsworth delivers an impressive performance that gels with his character, while Rudraksh Jaiswal also presents us with a neat act. It's finally very satisfying to see Randeep Hooda doing a character like this. Make no mistake, he's done a couple of action films before but never did he play a tough character like this: one that allows him to both throw a punch and emote whenever needed.Extraction is also surprisingly realistic in terms of how it doesn't want to turn heroes into indestructible characters. When they get hit, they bleed. When they are injured, they feel pain. And given how all of this is done masterfully during its video-game style action, Extraction fulfills the action genre to its fullest. Again, since there's no way one's gonna step out and pay to buy tickets and popcorn to a movie at this moment, it's better to stay home, grab some snacks and prepare yourself for a thrill-a-minute, no-nonsense action ride called Extraction. Action aficionados are definitely in for a massive treat
Below average and poor story. Avoid. Only watched for Chris Hemsworth

reviews.review_title: Top-Notch Action Overshadowed By Weak Plot And Artificial Drama
reviews.content: Extraction grants you all the thrill, action, directing, choreography, and visuality that an action movie can offer. It's two hours of non-stop bloodshed and violence. It would be an excellent example of its genre if it was not trivialized with far-fetched drama.---- Spoiler---Tyler is a character who has already completed his development. He has his issues, yes but he's ruthless, he's professional, he's determined. He knows what to do and he is part of a larger operation run by other professionals. Instead of adding this pointless emotional motivation, they could easily install operational complications and still keep him motivated to finish the job and save the boy. Do you ever realize how stupid it looks to get emotional for the long-dead son in the middle of an extraction mission in which you killed dozens of hostiles? He is not that kind of character, it is not that kind of movie. The same goes for Saju too.--- Spoiler ---

reviews.review_title: WOW ! Forget about the triggered Bangladeshi crybabies, this movie kicks ass !
reviews.content: This movie doesn't claim to be an Oscar nominee so kindly do not view the movie with those channeled expectations. The action sequences are up there with the very best, the plot based on Ciudad has some palpable tense moments and Chris Hemsworth has done justice to the mercenary with a baggage role.Don't get influenced by the Bangladeshi people who have a problem with the accents or the shabby state shown of Dhaka. Trust me, I've been there, it's much worse. Also the accent is definitely not West Bengal, it's Bangladeshi for sure. It's just easy to raise questions on authenticity when you feel disappointed about the portrayal of your country, but kindly do not let it come in the way while enjoying a movie.The film juggles with the concept of internal conflicts, mercy killing, guilt nd walking the right path even if the odds are stacked against you, and does a good job of it. A great action flick, do give it a watch !

Being the directorial debut of stuntman/choreographer Sam Hargrave, 'Extraction' delivers on all its premises. For a film I was in moderate anticipation of, I must admit, I was heavily entertained.1. Written by Joe Russo, the plot involves mercenary Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth) who is tasked with recusing Ovi (Rudhraksh Jaiswal), the teenage son of an imprisoned Indian drug lord from a rival kingpin in Dhaka, Bangladesh. Whenever I watch action/thriller genres of film, I prefer simple plots and this does just that. The story never feels heavy-handed nor do the minor subplots ever disrupt the flow of the film itself. Each of the lead characters are given just enough backstory to where you feel for them by the time the suspenseful climax comes around.2. The film is ultimately Chris Hemworth's to carry and he doesn't disappoint. You completely buy him as an action star and this film is undoubtedly the most physically intense and realistic action I have seen him do. Unlike Sylvester Stallone or Dwayne Johnson who are rather generic action stars, Hemsworth proves himself as also being a very formidable dramatic actor as well just by the sheer emotion he puts into his deeper characters including this one. All credit to Sam Hargrave as I was completely floored by his direction of each fight scene and the manner in which they were staged.3. Unfortunately, as much as I want to praise this film, there are problems that need to be addressed. For some reason, the krytoninte of many action films are the generic villains and this one is no different. Priyanshu Painyuli plays the rival kingpin Amir who is responsible for the kidnapping, but he never has a formidable presence or seems like a legit threat in the overall story to where the film feels like there is no real antagonist. The same goes for Golshifteh Farahani (Nik) as her character is never fully developed either. The real dynamic is ultimately between Hemsworth and Jaiswal.4. Unlike the 'Fast & Furious' franchise, the action never becomes unbelievably unrealistic or buffoonish to where it lost me. In fact, despite there not being anything new action-wise, the realism and the way the cinematographer captures it all is what has you most compelled. Its been a long time since I've felt such intensity and fear for certain characters during a climax especially within an action film. I should warn that there is a certain level of gore that may make some viewers squeamish as this type of action doesn't shy away from the graphic nature in which people are killed.Had this film been released in theaters, I would have gladly paid to seen it on the big screen. I understand these types of releases are usually decisive among critics, but if you love R-Rated action, this is by far one of the more better ones in recent years. Much congratulations to Sam Hargrave because I honestly can't wait for his next directorial feature.

reviews.review_title: Extraction deserves to be in top rated 250
reviews.content: Its title is so fictional and the end was so surprising

Extraction's excellently staged, inventive action is ultimately overtaken by a rousing story, in spite of the hundreds of close-quarters gunblasts and the absurd body count. Powerful performances and tight scripting take tired clichés and make them feel like tried-and-true storytelling techniques. (Most of the time.) This could have been just a fun, disposable genre pasttime, but it's significantly better than that.Chris Hemsworth reveals himself to be a gifted craftsman through an understated, gripping performance. It's refreshingly un-self-conscious, and delivered humbly, without flash or fanfare. It's the mark of a smart director that he was given the space to do that. In those quiet moments, with his fierce, but anguished, weary eyes, he really made me believe his spiritual desolation. On reflection, it reminds me of Denzel Washington, who also elevates more than one action movie with hard-wrung pathos. I hope Hemsworth is allowed to continue on this track and do meatier work than he's been saddled with up to now.His isn't the only impressive performance. David Harbour is delightful in a thankless, but crucial bit part. What a presence that guy has. Rudhraksh Jaiswal shows up big time in that last act. Most kid actors aren't nearly that good. If there's any justice, he has a good career ahead of him, as does the startlingly adept first-time feature director Sam Hargrave. He doesn't quite sidestep all of the pitfalls of a movie like this (lots of side characters we don't have time to care about, some on-the-nose flashback material, etc.), but the way he choreographs motion, viscera, and heart is impressive.

Hard, gritty, well fleshed out characters and tight, tense action scenes make this an excellent, fast paced watch.The overall hue of the movie is army green, dusty desert, makes one think of Vietnam. His most famous role, Thor, is heroic, funny, jokey. Tyler is dark, brooding, fearless and Hemsworth brings that very well.Great fast paced non stop action; well worth watching!

reviews.review_title: Honest review of Extraction: Russo Brothers do everything right except the Bangla
reviews.content: The Bangla language and Bangladeshi people, more accurately Dhaka's residents, were not accurately portrayed in Extraction. Yet it marks the beginning of an era where the stories of the capital of this small nation are being told by the Hollywood infrastructure to the whole world for the very first time on this scale. Events like these are important for Bangladesh and its filmmakers to create the urge in them to craft such stories on a massive scale for the global audience; stories which will be the accurate representations of the rich history, heritage and diversity of Dhaka.Except for the smartly handled production design choices, action packed fight sequences, and Hemsworth's Asgardian god like charms nothing else really works in the movie. The screenplay is poorly written and lacks emotion. Though this is a spoiler free review yet there is really nothing more to the story line. The film feels like a two hour long fight sequence with some bandage breaks like a PUBG match on your phone.We see a Bangladeshi drug lord kidnap an Indian crime lord's son and Tyler is unleashed to extract him from Dhaka. But why the big names of the subcontinental criminal underworld came to this rivalry, why these desperate measures are unclear.Another problematic thing is the portrayal of Bangladesh's law enforcement agencies. Every agency including the police, a fictional force named "Elite" which looked like Bangladesh's Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), and even the Bangladeshi military were portrayed to the worldwide audience that they were controlled and bribed by Dhaka based international drug cartels which is fictional but still problematic.It paints a picture to the world that Dhaka is like Medellin in Colombia during the Pablo Escobar era which is far from true.The screenplay could have supported some residents or law enforcement officers who were not criminals or involved in drug rings to balance this but every scene of Dhaka felt very wrongly portrayed.Then comes the main issue of the whole film, the Indian actors who played Bangladeshi roles. Not a single one of them was talking Bangla in a "Dhakaite" accent or even a Bangladeshi one. Some Indian actors were completely butchering the language and most Dhaka based characters in the film sounded like they had a West Bengal based accent and pronunciation. Bangladeshi netizens were quick to respond to this error and complained that the producers of the film did not give attention to the language at all and how no one in Dhaka speaks like the way these characters in this film do.The creators of the project should have kept in mind that Bangla language is the quintessential element of Bengali identity and they are the only nation who had given their lives for their mother tongue. So a faulty dialect of this language will become a sensitive issue for the Netflix users of this country.Another huge issue was the acting of the kidnapped kid Ovi, played by Indian actor Rudraksh Jaiswal. As one of the lead characters of the film and having a huge screen time his acting weakness bores the viewers. Most of his dialogue deliveries are typical Bollywood melodrama and in some scenes beside Hemsworth he seems redundant and ridiculous.

I just finished watching it last night and I don't know where all the hate comes from. Is it about representing Dhaka? How many of you ever left your Dhanmondi Banani and went to Puran Dhaka and shadar ghaat? The movie clearly says it's based on the gangs of puran Dhaka and I see them much nicely portraying that. Guess what? Puran Dhaka's slums are worst than the scenes of movie and gangs are scarier than what was shown. They showed our rivers brown where it's black lmao. Go have a look tomorrow. Atleast they showed cop cars and strong police defence which doesn't exist in Dhaka haha.Coming down to the sepia (yellow) effect, try going out to USA or NZ and then back to Dhaka and the yellow effect will make some sense to you. Dhaka is covered in haze throughout summer where the sun rays get blended to haze. We don't notice it as we live in Dhaka. The movie has exaggerated it, I agree. But that's what Hollywood does with Kenya, South Africa and any warm country.Coming to the movie, y'all mad as it was not loaded with multiple complex segments to drive your head crazy. The action was amazing, visuals were realistic and it was way emotional near the end.All up, a nice movie. Lets not ask them to portray our city as something it isn't lmao. reviews.review_title: A straight-shooting, no-nonsense ride that goes for the jugular when it comes to action, just don't expect to find much meat on its bones.
reviews.content: A mercenary, Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth), with a troubled past accepts a contract to extract a mob bosses' son from the clutches of a rival mobster. With the odds stacked against him, Tyler finds his physical and mental resolve put to the test as the stakes become increasingly personal.A throwback to 80's style one-man-killing-machine action flicks that gave Sylvester Stallone and Arnold Schwarzenegger their respective careers, Extraction's title also doubles as a pretty accurate synopsis of the film.Fronted by Hemsworth in another solid action leading man role, Extraction is a straight-shooting, no-nonsense ride that goes for the jugular when it comes to action. As Tyler travels through Dhaka, Bangladesh with the kidnapped kid in tow, he finds himself chased by crime lords, corrupt police officers and even child soldiers. The action is relentless and the film transitions from car chases to rooftop scuffles and street standoffs all within minutes of each other, making Extraction feel like it could have worked well as a single-take film had the filmmakers decided to take it up a notch.Naturally, comparisons to John Wick are inevitable, not least for being another feature debut for a stunt coordinator turned director. However, Extraction's endless onslaught of bloodshed ends up having the opposite effect of John Wick. Long before the film's protracted finale, the relentless shooting and killing becomes numbing rather than exhilarating, largely due to the exploitative nature of the story.Unlike the hyper-realism of John Wick, Extraction grounds itself in the gritty geo-political climate of a third world country (Thailand doubling for Bangladesh) and the grimy subtext of police corruption and organised crime is exploited for mind-numbing action carnage. It works on a basic thrill-level but leaves the film mired in questionable politics and a general air of callousness.That's why the Michael Bay school of switch off your brain to enjoy applies whole heartedly here. Extraction does not short-change viewers looking for a solid action flick to sink their teeth into, just don't expect to find much meat on its bones.

A very good action movie - I am a fan of action movies and this one kept me on the edge. If you enjoyed movies such as John wick, the equalizer, Taken, man on fire, The Man from Nowhere etc, then your in for a treat.

reviews.review_title: Quality cast, production and non-stop action
reviews.content:
When John Wick snuck under the radar before blowing up on streaming services, it changed cinema in the way that Hardcore Harry showed the possibilities of POV. Keanu Reeves' character bobbed and wove through seamless action scenes littered with bodies and close quarter pistol techniques that were both brutal and poetic. Extraction brings the efficiency and intensity of battling for survival to the underworld of India in the hands of Chris Hemsworth's haunted mercenary- Tyler Rake.The character introductions are well handled, with Tyler's depression clearly signalling a painful past. Flashbacks are used to hint at the nature of this past, without fully becoming clear until the final act. Tyler is recruited to a mission that he says no other mercenary would touch, and this again signifies Tyler's broken state accepting a mission that is bound to go wrong. There is more characterization done on Tyler's counterpart, the man hired to protect the victim from the start, with a clearly defined motivation and predicament around the boy - Ovi, who is excellently played by Rudhraksh Jaiswal.
What follows is an intense series of action scenes with few breaks for exposition before wrapping up in the final act.Where the story succeeds most is in the dynamic visuals and the scant dialogue is effective in furthering the plot while racking up a massive body count. Scenes move smoothly from running through the jungle, to a furious car chase, before the camera travels out a window into a building chase sprawling multiple rooms and floors before crashing from a balcony into the streets again. This gives little time for characters to emote beyond grunts of exertion and desperation. This leads to some of the films shortfalls, moral ambiguity and lack of vested interest.
Far too little time is spent getting to know characters that their loss is hardly felt, while others undergo significant screen time that ends in tragic survival. This undermines the primary antagonist when subordinates demonstrate agency over their actions without consequences and often in ways that don't affect the narrative arc. A show down takes place, for example, between a background character that has had only a few short lines, while significant time is spent flushing out the unexplained thirst for violence in a young person who ultimately fails to contribute much to the plot at all. This leads to a moral ambiguity that is emphasized by a conversation between Tyler and an old friend - There are no good guys.Tyler demonstrates many admirable traits in the film, willing to stick with things to the bitter end, driven by something deep within him. He fights for what he thinks is right and does it well. He is however working for a drug lord to rescue his son from another drug lord. No matter where you point, there is no moral high ground, and there is legitimate concerns raised over the permanence of their actions, causing many questions to be left with simplistic or incomplete answers.The end result is a genuinely impressive action film, which benefits from a simple viewing. There are some deeper themes hinted at, not very well flushed out, but for sheer adrenaline and stylistic violence, it is a well done film. Chris Hemsworth and the other leads deliver on pretty well all fronts, and the production is very well done.
Honestly what a film!!! So much action and gore and true acting! Wow! Intense and had me captivated the whole time!!!!

1. The movie represented that Dhaka is a city of drugs and crimes. It showed that DMP, Bangladesh Army, and even Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) are working for the Drug Lord of Dhaka. Using all these three Defence Forces working for the Drug Lord was an insanely bad idea. They could have used one instead of all three. It felt like Dhaka is a dark city where killing people is a normal thing on the street during daylight. Just like Mexico.2. In the movie, the director used kids to shoot gun fires. Using kids and representing them as the source of crime demeaned our reputation. I never expected that Dhaka will be presented so badly in our first collaboration with a Hollywood movie using kids. Are we so down to earth that we have to use kids for that? Okay, the director wanted to make it more realistic but I felt that he wanted to bring the ISIS vibe where we saw pictures of kids with guns.3. Why the Hell the Drug Lord of Dhaka cannot speak proper Bangla? They could have used our artists for that. I guess The Drug Lord of Dhaka was from India. It was depressing.

Huh?I'm a devout Christian and movies are made all of the time misrepresenting Christianity and painting a false picture of it. If anybody would have a right to angry, it would be people like me. But gees...it's a movie. It's 'ficticious'....meaning, it's NOT real. Get your little pacifier-sucking feelings off your shoulders and review the movie for what it is...a fictitious, action movie.And for what it is? It is great. Action scenes are better than the 'John Wick' movies. It's violent, be warned. But Hemsworth does a great job and the other actors nail it as well. Two thumbs up...and ignore all the whining...you can thank me later.

Another thing I didn't particular like is the amount of killings, just one after the other after the other, it's like the bad guys were spawning out of nowhere. It kind of got repetitive after a while, I blame it on the legacy of John Wick... Buy all in all, it was worth watching, just don't get your expectations too high.

reviews.content: I guess I was hoping for something better with the folks involved, but there was way too many over-the-top bloodbath shootouts and the story really held too strong to a white savior undertone.

The story is a bit common but it's ok. The film has a great and realistic videography, great effects and fighting choreography also good music. If you have the mood for a good action film than this is a good choice. Well played for Chris Hemsworth.

And Bangladesh has been badly presented!

reviews.content: Expected twists, a dumb plot, mindless violence makes this a dull watch. Definitely avoidable. Seems to be a hurried movie.

If you were interested in adding a foreign language to the movie, say Portuguese. Flights are cheaper to Brazil right ?Point 2: So Bangladesh military works along with the Mafia and they can arrange just 1 helicopter that too was useless against 2 men. reviews.review_title: WOW. Makes you think about whether or not you want to die for something you believe in.
reviews.content: Amazing movie. Makes you realize how precious life is. He was willing to die for something that wasn't even his.

I liked long action sequences shot in one go.. many 3 to 5 min chase scenes were choreographed in one shot.. i had so much expectations from sam hargrave's as he was associated as fight and stunt choreographer in recent marvel movies.. which he stood as per promise displayed in trailer..Thumbs up for Chris and Randeep for phenomenon acting.

I wanted to love this movie. Indeed, some of the cinematography is well-done. Some of the acting is OK, too. The killer for me is the story.
Typically, I can suspend logic when watching a movie. I am on the side of the movie makers, and WANT to believe what they are asking me to believe. I am a friend to movies. I'm rooting for them.
Optimism aside, this Netflix original is one of the poorest written stories offered by the streaming site to-date. It's endlessly loaded firearms, and the hero's penchant for the double-tap coup de grâce fighting style becomes lazy after a while. I have heard review that liken it to a John Wick-style, ultra-violent, revenge fantasy. The difference between the movies' approach to killing, however, could not be more different. John Wick lives in a dream-like word of paid assassins, where Extraction exists in a gritty, morally bankrupt reality. The story has very little, humor or heart. At last count, Chris Hemsworth's character kills 183 people. John Wick's body count is notoriously high as well, however, Wick's killing has context. He is getting his revenge. Extraction holds no such justification. In order to save one boy, there are hundreds of deaths. Where John Wick kills bad guys. Extraction, in stark contrast, kills police officers and military troops. Almost 200 kills for the life of one drug trafficker's son. I just don't buy it!

Why are people complaining there is no plot? Action at its best with no annoying emotional side show. Loving the whole setting as well. Watched the movie three times in a week and have played back some of the action scenes repeatedly, secretly wishing I was the one in need of rescue by this guy!

The film has superb action, similar although not quite as excessive as John Wick. The plot is good enough and the picture is excellent. Chris Hemsworth does a good job portraying the vulnerable but brutal action hero. The only thing that at times broke the immersion a tiny bit for me is when the movie didn't know if it wanted to be realistic or not. The (by the way stunning) female lead looked far too glamourous in combat and Chris was too superhuman at times when you consider the (relatively) realistic setting. So maybe the sequel needs to be more realistic or more over the top. But overall I found it very entertaining, especially for a Netflix-original.

2 things i want to tell about this movie.1. you can buy the moon but you can not buy a military person of Bangladesh. it was inappropriate and absolute trash way to represent Bangladesh military persons.2. few drone shots are taken from Bangladesh rest of the shoot was out of that country. i guess its kolkata from India. and also the actors talking in Bangla are not from Bangladesh , their accent belongs to kolkat people from india.

reviews.review_title: AMAZING ACTION, GOOD ACTING, VAGUE AND DULL STORYLINE.

Positive Points

3. Great castNegative Points

2. So many points in the movie are unjustified.

reviews.review_title: One of the best action flicks in recent years
reviews.content: If possible, leave your brain at the door (it's not a bad thing!) and allow yourself to enjoy a movie that has the following qualities:ACTION: Brilliant fight sequences and solid gun fighting.CHARACTERS / PERFORMANCES: Hemsworth is a very likeable hero. Does a great job playing a troubled soul. Randeep Hooda (long-haired dude) plays an excellent opponent. First time I've seen him in a film, and he's evidently a brilliant action actor. The kid is so-so.PLOT: A very simple, easy-to-follow, enjoyable plot. It's not innovative in any way, but it doesn't always have to be. It knows what it is -- an action film about saving a kidnapped kid -- and executes itself very well. And it's lead by a hero who has an arc you can dig in to.So yeah, really surprised by this. And would definitely recommend if you're a sucker for high-octane, medium-violent films.

Personally I admire all the actors in it..being a Bangladeshi Australian i had a very high hope for it.. but the film set in Bangladesh, does nothing even remotely close to Bangladesh... the Bengali dialogues are awful with very unnatural accent.. the sets does not resemble Dhaka in many way... very disappointing movie from my favourite Chris... Insulting actually

reviews.review_title: Some nice Cinematography in a bland copy paste thriller
reviews.content:
The one redeeming quality this movie has was the cinematography. Some of the scenes are very well constructed including the epic 11 minute 'one shot' part following the characters around in the chase. Having said that, I wasn't a fan of the widescreen which felt very claustrophobic or the constant orange filter because I obviously need reminding that Bangladesh is a hot place.
I thought the characterisation was barely noticeable. You don't learn much about them and when they're being sad or determined, the viewer hasn't been put in a position to empathize with them.
Chris Hemsworth was a decent enough actor for a 'merc' but the part needed a lot more fleshing out in the script to make his character have more prestige. In other words, he needed a (better) backstory, a clearer motive and a personality!The narrative felt like it was pasting tropes from other movies it had copied from. You get very typical chases, car stunts, twists and 'military movie conventions' sloppily thrown in if you ask me.I see on the grapevine that a sequel is possible...oh dear...

reviews.review_title: One for the running around shooting at things fans
reviews.content: It's standard fare - mercenary with past goes rescues kids and along ways confronts betrayal and personal demons.There are action scenes, long shots and plenty of blood, gore and close-up fighting. Guns run out of ammunition, people lose more blood than is healthy and knives fly around.Somehow all of this chaos sort of comes together. It doesn't try to be more than it is, and is all the better for it. Hemsworth does a decent job with what he's given and the supporting cast props him up well.If you're looking for high drama and twist-and-turn thriller, this won't be for you. If you just want to be entertained with a solid action film it'll do the trick.

reviews.review_title: An other bland Netflix movie. Filled with cliches, but great fight scenes.
reviews.content: An other bad movie by Netflix. Damn the amount of cash Netflix generates thanks to us stupid subscribers and they mess it up anyway as always!The fight scenes are great, especially one of the long ones. The director is a stuntman and it shows. He knew how to push the actors to the max for those fight scenes! Unfortunately, the story felt like a rip off from Denzel Washingtons "Man on fire" in many aspects. In total it is a super un-original and bland story.Filled with cliches, for example pretty woman having almost no role other then looking pretty. The violence was senseless. all act of violence are senseless of course but in this case much more so. I can't say much without spoilers but the story had zero depth. The director clearly just wanted to make his debute as action director and work with Hemsworth and had zero care for the story to be good.I wanna give the fight scenes an 8. But the storyline is worth a 1 star.

Ending scene on a bridge ruined the movie. It was if the director suffered from memory loss and forgot that everyone on Hemsworth team had radio communication and that he could have been informed several times that there was a sniper. Worthless.
Really a amezing combo movie of bollywood and hollywood from Netflix .

reviews.review_title: Glorious over the top action; thin story.
reviews.content: In this story, mercenary Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth) is hired to rescue the kidnapped son Ovi Mahajan Jr. (Rudhraksh Jaiswal) of an imprisoned crime lord, Ovi Mahajan Sr. (Pankaj Tripahti). Rake is able to do so, with a lot of bloodshed but then he is double-crossed by Saju Rav (Randeep Hooda), an operative working for Mahajan. There's no money to pay Rake and his team, so the idea was to take Ovi Jr. Away from Rake and take him home. But, then, the gangster that kidnapped Ovi, Amir Asif (Priyanshu Painyuli) sends his army of soldiers and criminals, including some youths, to recover the boy. Saju and Rake have to work together to save Ovi.The action in this movie is non-stop and well orchestrated. There's lots of gun play, hand to hand combat, armed and unarmed, and vehicular destruction. It's all very well done. But, there maybe too much of it. Because of that, it starts to become less interesting. Although I loved the intense adrenaline of it at first, it lost credibility for me when Sanjay survived being hit hard by a big bus. It just wasn't believable after that.Hemsworth does a solid job of leading the movie. He is impressive in his stunts and his acting. There was largely some pretty good acting all around. While the action was extraordinarily well shot, I thought the story was a little cliche. Nothing new here but still, a good action movie. Hemsworth and Hooda are both great action stars and I hope to see them in better scripted movies.
Worst movie ever,,Disappointin...They Disgraced our country

reviews.review_title: Not much better then a Youtube compilation video.
reviews.content: Overall this was not very good. it took me over 4 hours to watch this since the plot was so poor. There are so many things wrong with this movie, I understand there is a need for suspension of belief. 1st the father who fails to protect his son. 2nd the boat crew that is so poorly trained they get killed, 3rd the sniper gets killed, then the lead character goes to someone who OF COURSE betrays him, I was a little surprised that the kid killed him so 1 star for that, the amount of police and soldiers that are killed and no one in the local government could be bothered to ask what is going on. The people just lining up with no protests, Then the lead getting killed by the other kid on the bridge, because his team lead decides to break training? But wait he might not have died but his team leaves him behind, So many holes, The good thing is this was not released to the theaters, So I didn't waste any money on it.

reviews.review_title: Good fight scenes but ridiculous attempt to put a moral twist on it
reviews.content:
The movie was great until about half way through.
The idea that a mercenary paid to rescue a drug lords son, gets shafted but ends up rescuing the seemingly nice kid any way after flashbacks to his owns sons premature death is trite but OK, we can love with that.
The idea that the drug lords second in command is also making the ultimate sacrifice helping the rescue because otherwise his own family will be killed is also trite but OK.Whats not OK - is that while this moral premise is being played out, of a rescue of an innocent, there seems to be several hundred innocent police offices ruthlessly slaughtered along the way, with a sort of deliberate unemotional distancing.
All the police, almost universally have their faces covered - almost as though the director is trying to turn them into simple targets that you're not supposed to think about.
So while we watch literally hundreds of police - who are presumably just following instructions to track down a mercenary, have their throats cut open, blown up, crushed by cars and riddled with bullets - the movie at the same time is trying to create a situation, where you feel this is OK because the mercenary isnt doing this any longer for money, but is doing it to protect the drug lords son from a bad man.
We know this is a bad man, because we see his henchmen throwing children off a roof - but were you to tally up the death toll in this movie, it would seem the baddies kill about 4 innocent people, and the goodies several hundred.
The movie even sinks lower into its moralising by finishing off with an assassination of the baddie leader at the end as though that keep the boy safe and then stupidly does a shadowy figure behind him as though 'but is he really safe'.For a brief second, the movie looked like it was going to flirt with realism, and then it descended into a pure body count and that thing that happens in a movie where despite being injured hundreds of times, the hero gets up and still kicks ass.But oh well, first 30.minutes were watchable.

reviews.review_title: This is pure ART. An unbiased and honest review.
reviews.content:
If you think action/combat choreography isn't a form of art then I'm sorry to say that you have a very skewed view of what art is.
Before I begin my review, on behalf of the more literate Bangladeshi's, I apologize for the bad reviews, please ignore the natives, they haven't even watched the movie, they're willfully putting in bad reviews just because they feel the Bangladeshi army was shown in poor light and that the environment doesn't look anything like Dhaka. But the fact is that, the army is indeed incompetent and highly corrupt. The plot doesn't take place within the city but on the outskirts, this literally proves the fact that they haven't watched the movie. The people putting in bad reviews should be ashamed of themselves, it's so easy to put in bad reviews. If you'll go through the reviews you'll easily know that most of them are just hate reviews without any legit reason. I made an account just to come in support for the people who have made this project a reality.The movie is a Gem, one of the best action films of the decade. I cannot believe this was out for Netflix, it truly deserves a big if not a huge screen. The first half of the movie is non-stop, literally breathless action. The hand to hand combat scenes were on par with the RAID films! I never thought I'd say this, atleast not so soon. They've pushed the limits as much as they could. The car chases in the outskirts of the city were shot extremely seamlessly and choreographed with unbelievable precision. The vfx and sound design is astoundingly neat and crisp, again wasn't really expecting it to be so damn good. The muzzle flares and gun shot effects were on point and as realistic as they could get. The editing is so clean you'll never know the transitions between the takes.
Sam Hargrave, the director, is truly a master of his craft. He knew exactly what he was doing. There's a long extended action scene or a (Oner) which I don't want to spoil for anyone, it's probably the best one-take action sequences I've witnessed in a long time. You think John Wick and Atomic Blonde had cool slick action, wait till you watch this movie. There's some meaty stuff in here for Action nerds and the kind of gun-fu I haven't seen before. You will never be able to anticipate the moves. The stunt choreography was so meticulously and precisely designed, I cannot fathom the level of expertise it would have taken for them to have practised the whole sequence, to remember every move and have executed them in such a precise manner, is so f**king impressive. This is some premium stuff right here. Chris has done all the stunts and combat scenes by himself which is highly commendable. There's a lot of hard work that's gone behind this project and it is clearly visible. Indian actor Randeep Hooda has also done a commendable job especially during the action sequences and that one ridiculously stunning knife fight.
Loved Hemsworth's emotional performance as well, he's a big mean beast with a soft heart and it shows. With this movie Chris Hemsworth can well and truly join the big leagues of pure action movie stars. Not that he wasn't one before, but the stuff he's done in this film is particularly spectacular. I cannot wait for a sequel or even another project from Hargrave. He had my curiosity, but now he's definitely got my attention. There should be more support in favour of projects such as these. I think this is by far the best Action original from Netflix. Do yourself a favour by not missing it. What else are you doing in the lockdown anyway? Totally worth a re-watch.

Anyhow, the drug and mafia interplay and the country's top military and police brass in cohorts, tries to give a police state with a nexus much similar to African countries. The story backdrop of kidnapping and rescuing is okay, but there is no build up.
The dhaka ganglord is totally unbelievable. He is not menacing at all.
The child actors are better and natural. Specially the slum dwelling would be one and the kidnapped kid.
Liked the Randeep huda versus Chris fighting, but the final crossing over in the bridge with huge lots of random killing and blasts are just mindless, because of lack of empathy and focus.
I hope better movies will come out with more audience involvement and focussed screeplay instead of random blasts like video games.

reviews.review_title: Negative Review Dhaka Bangladesh in Extraction
reviews.content: With the exception of the insightfully taken care of creation plan decisions, activity stuffed battle successions, and Hemsworth's Asgardian god like charms nothing else truly works in the film. The screenplay is inadequately composed and needs feeling. In spite of the fact that this is a spoiler free audit yet there is actually nothing more to the story line. The film feels like a two hour long battle grouping with some gauze breaks like a PUBG coordinate on your telephone.We see a Bangladeshi medication master grab an Indian wrongdoing ruler's child and Tyler is released to extricate him from Dhaka. Yet, why the enormous names of the subcontinental criminal black market resulted in these present circumstances competition, why these edgy measures are indistinct.Another tricky thing is the depiction of Bangladesh's law authorization organizations. Each office including the police, an anecdotal power named "Tip top" which resembled Bangladesh's Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), and even the Bangladeshi military were depicted to the overall crowd that they were controlled and paid off by Dhaka based universal medication cartels which is anecdotal yet at the same time dangerous.It paints an image to the world that Dhaka resembles Medellin in Colombia during the Pablo Escobar period which is a long way from valid.The screenplay could have upheld a few occupants or law requirement officials who were not hoodlums or associated with medicate rings to adjust this yet every scene of Dhaka felt wrongly depicted.At that point comes the primary issue of the entire film, the Indian entertainers who assumed Bangladeshi jobs. Not a solitary one of them was talking Bangla in a "Dhakaite" highlight or even a Bangladeshi one. Some Indian on-screen characters were totally butchering the language and most Dhaka based characters in the film seemed like they had a West Bengal based complement and articulation. Bangladeshi netizens rushed to react to this blunder and grumbled that the makers of the film didn't focus on the language at all and how nobody in Dhaka talks like the manner in which these characters in this film do.The makers of the task ought to have remembered that Bangla language is the quintessential component of Bengali character and they are the main country who had given their lives for their native language. So a broken tongue of this language will turn into a delicate issue for the Netflix clients of this nation.Another colossal issue was the acting of the abducted kid Ovi, played by Indian on-screen character Rudraksh Jaiswal. As one of the lead characters of the film and having a gigantic screen time his acting shortcoming exhausts the watchers. A large portion of his exchange conveyances are common Bollywood acting and in certain scenes close to Hemsworth he appears to be repetitive and crazy.

So the movie starts and we see Tyler Rake (played by Chris Hemsworth) decked out in tactical vest, looking very badly injured, on a bridge. As he slumps behind a vehicle with shots being fired around him, his mind goes back, we see a blurred vision, of what looks like a little child on a beach. The story then cuts from that scene and goes back to explain, how and why Tyler is in this condition.
We see a teenage Indian boy, Ovi Mahajan (played by Rudhraksh Jaiswal) with his friends. He looks like your average teenager, hanging out with his friends. You can see that he is of a wealthy family. He sneaks out of his home to meet his friends at a club,While out one boy he is with gets shot and a hood is placed over Ovi's head.
We then find out that this is a kidnapping. Ovi's father a Mumbai crime lord, serving time in prison, but he main rival Amir Asif (played by Priyanshu Painyuli) has orchestrated it all and will use Ovi as a pawn to get what he wants. Amir runs the underworld of weapons, drugs and trafficking in Bangladesh. So where does Tyler Rake feature? The next scenes show Tyler being commandeered and offered the mission of the "extraction" of Ovi. You see Tyler is a black market mercenary. The mission is offered to him by Nik Khan (played by Golshifteh Farahani), who is also a mercenary. She describes the mission to Tyler as, the most deadly "extraction" of his career. Does he get to Ovi?

He has come to be known as a very good actor and in Netflix high budget movie, i wasn't as blown away as i think I should have been, especially as its screen-writer was veteran Marvel Comic guru, Joe Russo.
Still worth a watch for you car chasing, gun wielding action fans.

reviews.review_title: It's all out fight from the word go
reviews.content:
Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth) is recruited by fellow mercenary Nik Khan(Golshifteh Farahani) to rescue Ovi (Rudhraksh Jaiswal)from Dhaka, Bangladesh. Rake and Khan's team prepare to extract Ovi, with his father's men set to pay them once Ovi is recovered. Is Tyler successful? What all enemies he has to fight to bring back Ovi and do both make it back successfully is what the story covers.
There are some impressive stunt work and fantastically steroidal action sequences by both Chris Hemsworth ,Randeep Hooda(Saju) and even Golshifteh Farahani towards the end. Golshifteh as Nik looks beautiful. Randeep and Chris have some great moments of guns blazing and combat knives stabbing.with each other and against Asif's man. As action takes the centrestage the story goes for a toss as case is with most of the action series. Many would call is mindless. The movie does get tedious after an hour but quickly finds its feet once Ovi(14 yr old) kills the Gasper(David Harbour ). Yes, 14 yr old has moments as well. And, bond between the Ovi and his saviour Tyler do carry emotion so Tyler going all out for Ovi does make sense.
Though I would have loved to see backstory of Ovi Mahajan Sr(Pankaj Tripathi) and Amir Asif(Priyanshu Painyuli) for me to be fully invested into the series. Such detailing was absent and many a times you could wonder if all the bloodbath is all worth it.
All in all, for action movie fans, it is a must watch.

reviews.review_title: Chris Hemsworth + Russo Brothers = Solid Crime/Covert Action Film!!
reviews.content: Russo Brothers in this day and age can't seem to do no wrong with their style of action that comes off the heels of several blockbuster Marvel franchises in the likes of Captain America, and Avengers. And what a way to woo one of the biggest names of those franchises to a project that pits a covert mercenary against a kingpin in a battle for the life a child in the dirty filthy streets of India. What else can you expect? Well... A lot, and I say it does that for most of the film.Chris Hemsworth plays Tyler Rake, a mercenary hired to extract a kid named "Ovi", played by Rudhraksh Jaiswal, to the border before his father sends trained killers to hunt him down and anyone who helps him. The twist of one of these hunters sent after him, Saju, played by Randeep Hooda is a sympathetic father forced into action for the sake of his family's safety, creating tension between Hemsworth and Hooda's characters that leads to one of the greatest action scenes I've ever seen filmed on camera. In a one take 15+ minute scene where Rake and the kid go through car chase, foot chase, gun fight, and ends with hand-to-hand fighting is jaw dropping and very fitting of the Russo's style. The grit and grind are deep in this one, and it never leaves from the start to the end. Nik Khan played by Golshifteh Farahani is introduced as the director of the operation and she plays the bad ass chick that you don't normally see from these kinds of women in those regions. Golshifteh was also very genuine in her performance that was very similar to her role in Body of Lies with co-star Leo Dicaprio, and she commands her presence in a way that was never forced or overbearing but stern and caring for both Hemsworth and Rudhraksh's characters. Chris plays his part to the "T" and when he gets prepared for the role, he puts effort where it matters that could possibly range in weapons, physique, and martial arts training and I appreciate it more than anything when an actor takes a role like this seriously especially one that requires physical action to point of believability and he delivers with passing colors. But that's not all of his performance that can be said he delivered. His performance as Tyler Rake, a man living on the edge and almost suicidal can go really wrong if Hemsworth doesn't buy the vulnerability of his character, and putting aside the hero of Thor, and replacing it with a darker more greyish hero could of went completely wrong for him, but he plays it well from his opening scene to his end. And I grew a deeper appreciation for Hemsworth as a solid actor because of it. The surprise of the film for me was Randeep Hooda. His character along with performance was interesting to watch, and I'm curious now to see if he was or will be in any more action style films of this genre. Only time will tell I suppose.I enjoyed the film. It had Russo style action, interesting themes and archetypes. And mostly it had some solid performances from its cast that got me excited for the sequel. It's worth checking out, even if you don't like violence.8/10.

reviews.review_title: A lot of police officer's kids lost their dad that day
reviews.content: This movie is great at what it is - a brutal violent action movie. Brilliant, John Wick style choreography, and some ingenious shooting techniques you haven't seen before. The plot is as thin as a razor, and it draws blood wherever it can.What really bugs me however is the poor choice of "villains". Hemsworth and Hooda mow their way through literally scores of regular police officers. Sure, the Dhaka police is shown as corrupt, taking orders from a mafiosi, but they are not *all* corrupt, right? At least some of them are just there to do their job, protecting the civil order of Dhaka, trying to take down two psychopathic killers and their paramilitary friends. Even in a not-so-black-and-white world, they are clearly not the bad guys. And yet, the movie expects me to feel pity for those two psychopaths instead? That bugged the hell out of me and really took me out of the movie. Especially towards the end. Tyler Rake is *no* hero.Seriously. Next time, if you're going for a mindless, bloody action flic with a body count in the hundreds, you got to make a better choice of who is gunned down by your heroes. Make them criminals, aliens, orcs, nazis, or some other comically evil army of soldiers who attack sovereign neighboring countries and murder innocent civilians. Is that too much to ask?Maybe then your movie will get the better rating it otherwise would have deserved.

reviews.review_title: A Massive Treat for an Action Lovers
reviews.content:
Extraction is Tightly Packed from
the very beginning and keeps you hooked to the screen with its Well-choreographed (High-Octane) Action Sequences, a Heart-Thudding Background Score and Brilliant Camera Work.
The story of film looks strictly Decent
Chris Hemsworth has been hired on a mission to Extract a boy, the kidnapped son of an Indian Drug lord, held in captive by a gangster from Bangladesh. Subsequently, as things fly off the handle, and with an armed professional behind his back, the remainder of the movie explores how Chris Hemsworth manages to protect this boy's life while hanging on a suicide mission that manages to get deadlier every single second.
Screenplay by Joe Russo is Strictly okey as the Depth & Exciting twists in the story is missing but Director Sam Hargrave has executed Brilliantly and Delivered the full dose of Entertainment
BG Music by Henry Jackman and Alex Belcher is impactful.
Newton Thomson Nigel's camera work amazes you by capturing the streets of Bangladesh stunningly, and the stunt scenes, especially the continuous shots during the fight sequences are highly enjoyable.
Director Sam Hargrave has really gone out of the way to capture some shots we haven't seen on this scale in a long time.
Chris Hemsworth,who stood out throughout the film and Delivered outstanding Performance.Randeep Hooda too succeeds to steal the show with his spectacular performance. Rudhraksh as Ovi does justice to his role. Pankaj Tripathi and Priyanshu Painyuli get little to do.

No offence intended, but we are living in a time where the President of the United States suggests injecting disinfectant or having UV radiation against a virus. reviews.review_title: Great Action with Inspiration from John Wick
reviews.content: Extraction comes from director Sam Hargrave, a former stunt coordinator turned director. Knowing this fact, I was expecting some John Wick level action sequences and Extraction did not disappoint in that regard. The action was fresh, intense and beautifully choreographed. The 11+ minute tracking scene is exciting, even for those who aren't film nerds. Hargrave clearly had a vision for how he wanted this film to look and handled some huge action set pieces with extreme precision. This film definitely borrowed heavily from the John Wick series, and to a lesser extent The Raid. It wasn't quite as good as either, but with the right expectations this is a highly enjoyable, fast paced film. Sure, the plot is fairly thin with a handful of thinly developed side characters, but that's ok since everything else was done pretty dang well. Could this be a franchise for Chris Hemsworth? I wouldn't mind seeing another film in this world.
