reviews.review_title: It's captivating in bits and pieces
reviews.content: To me the movie seemed solid and with flavor. Certainly not the best in the genre but then it sure is one time watch.In these elongated single shot sequence movies or in action movies in general, the story always goes for toss, I still don't understand the point of fast and furious but they are enjoyable. Exceptions would be Bourne series which has a lot more gripping tale to tell although action is the main focus. This movie story assessment falls in between. The plot is not the high point.The high point are the action sequences. There is a floating sense of bourne series, a touch of 'the raid' specially the fights within buildings. some of the gun shooting are slick.Chris Hemsworth in my opinion overshadows others mostly by his strong physical appearance, Other mention would be Randeep Hooda, he had his presence marked, all others did what they are supposed to do, no stellar performances.Now few words about misrepresentation of Dhaka, I feel movie as a form in itself is a misrepresentation, If you want a true representation look for a Documentary. Slumdog millionaire won Oscar though people were pissed off because it misrepresented Mumbai (Bombay). Here is the thing, When you are making a commercial movie, You look for bare minimum and you stroke the preconceived notions of people. They highlight the things which fascinates people, I personally didn't like the overuse of chromatic lighting to make street looks dirtier. But then I feel you are not doing yourself a favor by being offended.All in all it's a one time watch with good action sequences and it's always pleasing to watch Chris Hemsworth who also produced the movie.

reviews.review_title: Didn't like the movie concept, story in depth, plot
reviews.content: The movie didn't fulfill its expectations. Not only bacause it portrayed Dhaka in a wrong way, there was no story in depth, nothing thrilling, all we get to see some marvelous action stunt scenes in all over the slums in Dhaka which doesn't make any sense. No humors, nothing special and estreme yellow effects killed the least of emotions. And wherever they tried to show in Dhaka couldn't connect its audience bacause Dhaka is not like that at all. Dhaka is a megacity, its not a beautiful city but It's not a slum at all. They didn't shoot the movie in Dhaka so nothing match its actual environment. Their accents didn't match and Indian music in every home and child with shotguns also very unfamiliar in Dhaka. So what is the point of using a name of a different city from a different country when you are not able to connect even not the language. The only thing I love in the full movie is Chris Hemsworth and Randeep Huda's acting. They did their parts very well.

This movie is directed by the Sam Hargrave, the stunt coordinator of the recent Avengers movies and screenplay by The Russo Brothers,the directors of the recent Avengers movies.
Tyler Rake(Hemsworth),a mercenary,is hired to rescue the boy of an Indian Gang leader who got kidnapped by another deadly crime lord. Thats was the entire plot though. The story becomes secondary while making the action primary and,they did achieve what they intended. For starters, Chris Hemsworth was good in this, he did have a really good charisma in this and he was the only one to get a bit of additional character detailing. Ovi Mahajan(Jaiswal), the plot device, had less characterisation but, was likable and had more emotional attachment towards the end. Nik Khan(Farahani) and Saju(Hooda) were also good although they were one dimensional. David Harbour had a small cameo which was actually good. The villain was bland.
Speaking about the other aspects,the movie did have pretty good action sequences. The long fight sequence in the first half of the movie is my favorite. They utilized the 'R' rating properly. The violence was extreme at certain times, unlike in Deadpool which seemed comical,this was more realistic and brutal. The movie was made by a stuntman and he did ensure really good action sequences. There were really good camera movements in this and choreography was good. The music was apt for this. The biggest con of this movie which I felt was that this whole movie felt like a video game. First we had a bit of character interactions,then fights, slowing down to interactions and continuing. This was still a watchable movie, guilty pleasure to be precise.
I recommend this movie to every action lovers, Hemsworth fans and to everyone who needs some adrenaline during quarantine.Rating: 7/10

reviews.review_title: Overall a great movie leaving you satisfied and hungry for more.
reviews.content: Although the story may be insufficient for some viewers I believe the straight to the point amazing action more than makes up for it. This is not to say action is the only thing it provides, the story isn't non existent, it's just hidden. They don't go off on dialoge giving backstory, they convey it through the actions of characters and emotion. The context of the storyline is admittedly abit lacking but i think and hope they will cover this in a later release. A second movie is already in production. The story is a tool to create a satisfactory experience paired with the action. With this insight i believe the existing story is more than sufficient while also makeing one long for more.This movie is not ment to be a representation of the modern world, it's a fictional world that exists to convey the film. So judging the quality of the movie upon what music they listen to in one building in Bangladesh is irrelevant. Misrepresenting details about Bangladesh is not important when you have the entire Bengali police force helping the biggest druglord in their country kill an Australian man trying to save a teenager. Talk about realistic. Just beacuse a movie isn't classed as sci-fi dosn't mean you should expect a documentary. The "based on real life" trope is played out, we need more creative film expression like this.90% of the people condemning this movie are either Bengali who were expecting seeing their uncle herding animals or people who didn't follow the story. If i wanted entertaining drama I'd have read a book instead or watched reality TV. Personally there's enough drama in my real life already, so much so that i might want to watch a satisfying action movie as an outlet and distraction from todays world events. Oh wait i already did that when i watched this movie.If the sequal gives that contextual sadisfaction this would be a strong 10, For now it's a great set up for that, sitting at a 9.5.

reviews.review_title: Gritty action packed movie and an overall great directorial debut
reviews.content: 7.5/10The film builds up on a somewhat John wick movie structure not in terms of tone or story but on an action based plot of getting from point a to b without too much established storytelling. Knowing that, the action is spectacular throughout and the movie is surprisingly emotional. The cinematography throughout the action sequences is executed beautifully with long takes that dont leave out anything out of the picture.
Love the storyline. Worth watching during the lockdown period. People should Stop complaining about background music or dusty roads. Accept the fact.
Bollywood style movie. With a lot of bollywood actors in Dhakka, dirtiest city in Asia

I had no expectation at all, maybe that's why I was positively surprised. It is really very action-packed. Chris does everything, he gets shot, beaten up, even hit by a car, he bleeds and gets injuries but he just keeps going. No one can stop him. The same must be true about the camera man, who must have danced around the fist fights and run after the characters - this is how it looks at least. It seemed very realistic, I can't remember seeing anything like this before. It was like being in the same room with the actors and really standing next to them when they were fighting each other.
The last couple of scenes were not necessary in my opinion, but it didn't harm the film and maybe, will there be a sequel?

The Good:
The action was pretty slick. There were some camera tricks I'd never seen before, and the fight sequences were pretty intense.The Bad:
Very little character development, therefore, not much to care about. What little character development that exists seems like it's ripped straight out of 2000's Gladiator. All in all, it's fairly predictable yet entertaining.It's watchable. 4/10 It's a Netflix movie, so what do you expect?

The long takes make the action look real and continuous. Other movies have cuts between bad stunts to hide mistakes.The story is exciting and emotional but doesn't add up to something totally smart. Although it tries really hard to do something with father son relationships. It's not bad just not great.The ending sucks.

reviews.review_title: Just like MCU movies, it's not a cinema, it's just an extended fight scene
reviews.content: This movie lacked the single most important ingredient of a cinema, a plot. This is probably the 2000th movie about the same story in the past 3 decades.Doesn't matter what Bangladeshi or Indian people think about it, it's just a poor action film. No one will remember it in a month or so. Just just cool down. It's a mainstream summer flick from a third class director.I'm not angry with Indians, they're just as badly portrayed in Hollywood movies. To all the white people of the western countries, Asia, specially South Asia is filled with people who live in mud huts and has no socio-economic background. We're savages for them, we're cave people for them.Hopefully they're realize what mistake they have done after this one :-)

Full of actions, acting was pretty good. Definitely enjoyable.But there are few issues. Firstly, they messed up the city environment. They shoot it in India and represented ''Dhaka'' more like African cities! On contrary Dhaka is quite developed metropolitan. I appreciate their effort to give the Indian town a Bangladeshi look (they used Bangla poster/signboards everywhere), but Capital Dhaka has not much similarities to the ghetto they showed in the movie.I appreciate the use of local language- but the pronunciations were in some cases- horrible. They could use good voice coach/take opinion of some native Bengali.Overall, I had fun and highly recommend the movie.

reviews.review_title: Finally a Great Action Movie. Not a Single Dull Moment.
reviews.content: This movie is everything you would expect going into it and much more. Very impressed by Chris Hemsworth's action sequences. It's Jason Borne meets John Wick, Call of Duty style. Would love to see CH in the next Mission Impossible movie.The 12min-long single camera shot was sick. All the supporting roles were great. The most entertaining movie Netflix has put out so far during this PC & girl-power pandemic. Maybe they're beginning to choose entertainment over wokeness. One can only hope.

reviews.review_title: I gave it a 6 for Hemsworth,s acting

And his ability to cope with the action sequences, plus the film setting...although I admit, they gave the action and fight sequences choreography good shot, throwing children off the roof did not need to be included.
As an ex Bangladeshi, of course, I was chuffed to see it included in the story, here's hoping for more of my birth country.
The thing is, you put a gun in a Bangladeshi man's hand, and he thinks he is God...well portrayed in the movie.

The movie glorifies the mass murdering of regular police and military units in a way that can only be considered terrorism. It is entirely unclear how showing the movie in Europe is even legal and I believe the legal stats of the movie needs to be reviewed.

Acting, action is very good, super cinematography and sound effects.They could have done some research and used actual bangladeshi accent of Bengali. Thats been issue for ver long whenever they represent Indian subcontinent people accent is middle eastern.Anyway, a good watch for active on movie lovers.

The action sequences were enjoyable although it was nice for every soldier to allow the protagonist to deal with them one at a time. The acting was poor and the dialogue was poorly written. I hate the ending; this movie certainly does not need or deserve a sequel.

reviews.review_title: A budget Brad Pitt plays a budget John Wick
reviews.content: I mean, it works on a very basic level, like a cheap vodka will get you drunk, but it won't be a pleasant trip. There is too much shaky cam (John Wick had zero), the scenes are not very believable (I mean the only action heroes that can basically ignore infinite numbers of enemy soldiers are Stallone and Schwarzenneger, right?). But I agree, the boy was a decent actor, despite that inconvincing psychoanalysis scene in the middle, and the sidechick was beautiful enough, like Player 2 who inserts coin just before the end of the level, and cherrypicks all the bosses due to still having full ammo and health. There is a nasty white supremacy undertone to the film, because if the main hero killed this many American policemen and soldiers, I doubt he would be able to remain the "good guy", but since it's India or Pakistan, or some Asian country, I mean they are all corrupt anyway, right? As I said, it's a dumb action movie. It works, but only barely.

A beautiful action and emotional thriller.
I would love to see a second part of this
Left a bad taste in the mouth even in this boring time.

This movie does what it says on the tin. It's a fast paced action movie. The action is well executed and the acting is good for this genre.I have read in one review this is "John Wick in Bangladesh"...... and think that sums it up well.I have see some of the really negative reviews and must disagree. This is a straight up action movie. It is not a nuanced analysis of the geo politics of the Indian sub continent or a tourism video for Bangladesh. The location is irrelevant it could be anywhere and the next one will be. The dialects may not be spot on and the uniforms may be wrong ....... but so what ?If you want to learn about the Indian subcontinent subscribe to national geographic.I think a score of 7/10 if fair (my nephew who is a film addict scored 6.6-6.7 out of 10)I would recommend this film.

I expected this movie to entertain me with some good action scenes, but I didn't expect the story to be also enjoyable this much. Some violence was too much for my taste so I had to skip it, especially related to violence towards kids. Action is new and the director used the small spaces really well. Car chase was also good. The only thing that I felt enforced into the story, is the death of his son. They had to give a good reason for why he is fighting so hard and risking his life so they came up with the story of the father who lost his kid and now he does that cause he doesn't care if he catches a bullet. If you want a few hours with popcorn and good movie, this is a good choice.
This is a good (not great) shoot em up with Chris Hemsworth. Enjoyable in parts, it is let down by a poorly executed storyline, mixed dialogue and an average ending. Bourne it is not...

reviews.review_title: Like guns & blood? This has it!
reviews.content: Good movie. You get to a point where you have to remind yourself why he's doing this. A lot of gun fire and blood. Chris is always good in his roles.

reviews.review_title: Story line very bad, Very good action
reviews.content: Only thing I watched this movie because of Chris Hemsworth. He is my favorite actor. This movie has very good Action scenes but very poor plot. And also this Accent isn't bangla from Bangladesh. Accent is Kolkata bangla, india. And Show us worng ways Bangladesh culture.

It seems to me that Netflix has made just another mediocre film.
Now, that's not to state that Extraction is a bad film. It's pretty enjoyable, the actors are quite good, and it has well-executed action. Unfortunately, the film's flaws drag it down, resulting in its forgetfulness and averageness.
Now, the film nails the emotional bits. These characters are likable just from the start of the film, thanks to the writers establishing our connection with them using a few effective scenes, and doubled with great performances from the actors, an array of great protagonists are created.
Unfortunately, the script fails in terms of originality, as the story follows familiar beats as other films, therefore diminishing the element of surprise. The film's side characters are often underdeveloped and underused, for example, Jake Tyler's boss. She gets more crucial to the story as it goes on, but it feels like the writers aren't interested in fleshing her out, as we get glimpses of her past, her relationship with the main protagonist, and more so, but these traits are ignored, leaving a caricature of a character.
Also, the action gets stale quite soon as it doesn't change throughout the whole film.
Finally, this film could be so much better, if it could focus more on either the characters or the action, instead of attempting to do both.

reviews.review_title: Wrong representation of Dhaka, Bangla and Bangladesh
reviews.content: Had a great expectation but I am frustrated. The plot was centered Dhaka, capital city of Bangladesh but the film shot in India. The buildings and infrastructures are shown like entire dhaka is a slum. Dhaka has much more to offer than what is shown in the movie. The worst part is the language. Being native speaker it was awful to hear that most of the spelling and accent is false because non Bangla speakers were acting when its supposed be Bangla speakers. Netflix could have done far better.

This movie deserved ratings mostly for the camera work. The actions scenes in this movie was beyond epic, the chases, driving and crashing has almost looked like something out of a video game.I was left in awe with the exceptional camera work, it was flawless and organic. I have never seen anything like this kind of non stop, long sequenced videography! There were hardly any transitions in the camera shots and frames during the action scenes.The representation of Bangladesh was not entirely accurate, but I guess this is a fiction movie, not a documentary. It would have been good if the film composed and highlighted a little bit of local lifestyle in the markets etc.

First of all, I don't think people would have watch the movie if wasn't lead by Chris Hemsworth.
And, secondly great timing, to launch it just after the end game environment cooled down making people see towards there favourite hero again in no interval.
Still good concept and story too.
A bit confused or not assent with the last quote to "You drown...Submerged in it".

Just awesome. Simple extraction story, outstanding cinematography. Trust me it's worth watching it.

reviews.review_title: When John Wick meets The Raid!
reviews.content: Just spot this film being advertised on Netflix and by watching some of the trailers, I thought I'd give the film a chance to watch since it looked promising.It was well paced and everybody did their part just right, Chris Hemsworth, Randeep Hoda and the boy (forgot his name) were the highlights of the film, the fight scenes were all taken in one shot making it easier to watch (if your into Gareth Evans-style action, this is def the movie to watch).The only downside was one or two plot holes and some of the dialogue in the middle act, otherwise a very enjoyable film, probably the best film of 2020, hope a sequel comes soon.

In this quarantine time Netflix just gave the most adranaline pumping gift to his audience as this movie just knocked it out of the park in terms of sheer scale of action. I always thought John wick is the most polished action cinema Hollywood ever created but the russos took the challenge and with stunt coordinator turned director Sam hargrave delivered another flawless action film where every broken bones can be heard and feel, the unbroken 12 minute tracking is the highlight of the film reminded me of raid 2 but this scene has its own ruggedness and grit. So coming to the story it is nothing new there is zero sense of character development In this film, the character dynamics between the two main leads are undercooked and the misunderstanding of both the hero and the anti hero Randeep Hooda fantastic performance, are somewhat litle half backed. The predictable plot beats will remind you of Leon the professional and many other films but the dissaopointing script makes up for the terrific acting the cast offers. Randeep Hooda nails his ability to create a believable mercenary from India his acting style is no doubt extraordinary but the way he performed the action scenes feels like he is the action movie star of the world extremely authentic and his character beat is very emotional proud that an Indian actor deserved his talent in the wider Hollywood spectrum. And the lead character Chrish Hemsworth is again brilliant this guy with a hulking physique can emote so brilliantly is a testament to his talents he really is mastering his emotionally charged scenes right from the Endgame. The supporting cast ably did justice to the film and one more thing the wild card of the movie golshifteh farahani stole the show at the climax and the third act she really saved the guys bravo subtle performance from her very intense her role was small but she really made an impression in this film. Higly recommended
Great action,,,, everyone done good job. Especially Chris Hemsworth.

reviews.review_title: Hemsworth shines through a quite mediocre and outdone script
reviews.content:
The movie's action scenes are excellent and their direction is perfectly suited for our beloved "Thor" Chris Hemsworth, who seems like a natural fit for the genre.
On the downside, the film fails to offer anything new, based on a script that has been done multiple times in the past. The villain is never developed and the film's person in distress seems more like an object than a developed character.
As a resume, this film is fun to watch, but surely could be developed further.

reviews.review_title: Waste of Money and Time as an action Film
reviews.content:
Personal Rating 1.5/10In parallel to their creative liberty, I also take my consumer liberty to share severe disappointment on the substandard delivery from below persons in charge.Sam Hargrave - Director
Casting - Sarah Halley Finn, Tess Joseph, Soham Mad and Ayan Mad
Production Supervisor Bangladesh - Tariq Anam Khan
Production Manager Bangladesh - Lylie Almeida
Key Location Manager - Mary Barltrop & Luke Torrevillas
Location Manager Bangladesh - Ariq Anam Khan
Dialect Coach - Rafael Ahsan
Tutor - Prarav Ajmera
Bengali Interpreter - Mahua Banerjee
Production designer - Phill Ivey
Costume Designer, Bojana Nikitovic
Music- Manish Raval, Tom Wolfe, Henry Jackman & Alex Belcher
Unit Production Manager - Patrick Newall
Set Designer - Nicholas Dare
Art Directors - Charlie Revai and Harrison YurkiwCreative excellence or even minimal quality was surely not the focal point of this production. It was all about developing a profitable product for a broader consumer market. Casting two established Bollywood actors (at lower wage), paying for hindi music bits, faking Kolkata locations and ambience as Dhaka and casting Thor himself was to bag in the greater usual netflix crowd from India. Putting the name Dhaka and just showing freelance drone-shots of the city and shamelessly fooling around with inappropriate accent, language, culture and ambience along with lack of any Bangladeshi actor still brings in Bangladeshi viewers. Engaging a reputed line producer from Bangladesh and well portraying the country was not a big deal but I guess Netflix cautiously ignored it.Hence, Netflix will certainly recover the investment with full profit. But for the creative hats looking into the mirror, it's hard not to regret for such pricy and smelly trash.
No complaints here. If you like action it doesn't get any better. A great movie that is well done and deserves more than one watch.

It's been interesting observing some of the follow on work from the MCU's second and third wave cast members. In this case, MIB Intl, not is best work ever. However, this one, pretty darned good, IMO. Oh, in both, there were moments that felt a bit type cast, to be sure. And you do have to remember the executive crew on this one; written in part by Joe Russo, think Russo brothers, Avengers, etc. But it did not overwhelm the overarching story line. They kinda setup for a sequel, but how in the hell Rake survived all that, who knows... He would have to have lightning coursing through his veins, or Cheez Whiz. All in all, worth the watch. Oh, and if you catch it apart from Flix, subs are ESSENTIAL.

Its not Dhaka or Bangladesh at all.You are giving wrong message to the world though this.Which cannot be tolerated. Wasted my hours.You better have done this film in country lika Afghanistan,Syria,Somalia.Very very unrealistic actions also were there.

Back to the 90's we go in this highly forgettable action flick that obeys every cliche and adds exactly nothing to the genre. Brooding tough guy? Check. With a layer of scars and calluses from countless unnamed wars? Check. That are hiding a the soft centre of a genuinely good man? Also check. Right, let's have a quick flashback to hint at his tragic backstory and explain why he's so broken and self destructive. Done. And give him one last mission - a rescue, someone vulnerable that reminds him of his tragic loss. The list of action tropes goes on and on - right down to the pretty lady, the hint of new beginnings, of a relationship that can happen once the hero's dealt with his demons. *slaps forehead and sighs* There's just no reason for this thing to exist - other than to prove Hemsworth can do more than Thor. Which he probably can, but this does little for his case. The plot is purille; Rescue drug dealer's kid, oh no, we've been double-crossed (imagine that) but we'll carry on despite the fact he's nothing to us because it's the right thing to do. Even if that means killing hundreds of police with families who are just doing their jobs, a whole lot of innocent bystanders, truck loads of bad guys and a few highly trained professional mercenaries. This makes not a lick of sense considering at one point the mercenaries actually say they couldn't keep the kid safe even if they could pull off the rescue. This is glossed over at the end. The characters are flat and predictable. We know the bad guys are bad because, like Bond villains, they just stand around throwing kids off buildings and doing evil stuff. A lot has been said about the action but really, it's just OK. It's mostly down to shaky camera work making everything seem faster and more frenetic. The location is the film's one interesting point. And also the source of some of the problems with the action. There's a few chase scenes that anyone who's tried to drive in India would know are impossible. Pedestrians etc jump out of the way like in a bad computer game. And in one scene a speeding vehicle comes out of absolutely nowhere to hit poor Chris. Despite the fact we've just see that all the narrow streets are blocked. Inconvenient. But don't worry, we'll just take this truck that's conveniently appeared - from the same narrow alleyways that we've just seen to be jam-packed with people and overturned stalls and carts and whatnot. And drive off at speed. The simplistic plot goes from dumb to dumber as we head towards the inevitable showdown on the bridge we caught a glimpse of at the beginning. It's the typical 'we have to get from A to B' scenario via the hardest way possible ignoring any possible alternatives. "The police have all the bridges blocked? And for some obscure reason you can't get a chopper to us until we get to the other side?! Umm, what about a boat?" "Shhhh. You're spoiling it." This is anachronistic, dated, dumb action that simply shouldn't be. After watching 6 Underground which felt fresh and interesting (for a popcorn action movie), you have to wonder why Netflix greenlit such a backward leap for the genre.
The constant camera angles and the badass performances really make the movie good. The plot on the other hand was not good.

For the first time in my life I have made it a mission to rate and leave a review. This movie was executed in such a way that you literally feel as if you're in the heart pounding thrill of it all. It's definitely the BEST action movie I have ever seen! You have got to watch it! I literally want to buy this movie and add it to my collection!

reviews.review_title: Over the top action seldomly carries an entire movie by itself.
reviews.content: Extraction is technically well made, and features action that is shot at exciting angles and is paced just right to keep it grounded enough to pass off as realistic, it manages to pull that off over movies like "John Wick 3" where the absurdity and frequency of the action becomes numbing.Where Extraction gets tiring for me was the entire premise of the story being delivered in such small and IMHO insignificant chunks that any opportunity to flesh out the main protagonist played by Hemsworth is ultimately squandered. The movie feels like a video game where the viewer is taken through one action-packed scene to the next all while the human element of the characters is left woefully unexplored.The art of action movie making seems to have shifted more to elaborate stunt and special effect extravaganza, while ignoring the more intimate and quite moments needed for the characters to become likeable enough for you to care for them. Comparing modern action movies to the offerings from the 70-90's era, it becomes all too evident to me that this genre has seen a noticeable decline in quality over the years and extraction is a painful reminder of this.

From my point-of-view In Extraction Action, Cinematography,BGM were outstanding & the casting was good & also with direction....
But the storyline, dialogue were very common that was the only problem in this movie I think so ... otherwise as an action movie it's was mind-blowing man!!!!!!!!
I'm going with 8 star out of 10

About half of the movie is great. Creative, bloody action. Great camera work. Setting in Dhaka is something new and well scary. Unfortunately ending feels average at best. Just standard shootout, few forced dramatic scenes. One death that was just stupid and sequel bait that made no sense. Don't know what went wrong maybe it was rushed because of the Covid?!

They already said it's an action movie , I don't know why people expect other things from this movie how it can be a romantic movie at the same time. If you love action movies go for it without any hesitation. Randeep hooda did a fantastic job and so did Chris Hemsworth.

Straight up let me say that the 4 rating is solely for the cinematography, camerawork and sound effects which is outstanding without a doubt. The movie receives a 0 from me in other areas. If you watch enough movies the plot becomes so obvious within 15 minutes into the movie. There's nothing new to the storyline, the same 'military man- haunted past-lost family' stuff recycled in Hollywood over and over again. It'll certainly be entertaining for casual audience especially the younger generation. But there's nothing in the movie apart from the visuals. I'd even say the plot is worse than expected. Motivation for the kidnapping doesn't make any kind of sense at all. Money? Come on, seriously?
And then there's the plot armor, main character vs main character drama etc

reviews.review_title: Formulaic and somewhat predictable but still entertaining
reviews.content: The plot is quit familiar: Mr. Special-skills-ex-military-tragic-backstory is hired to save powerful person's loved one from rival powerful person who has kidnapped said loved one. Connection to powerful person's loved one becomes personal as both parties survive together. Also, important person's loved one comes to somehow remind Mr. Special-skills of the loved ones he's lost and he decides this mission is worth risking his life.I wasn't bored by any means and there are a few twists thrown in here and there that will probably keep you watching till the end.The ending was perfectly satisfactory in my opinion until the directors/writers or whoever is in charge of such decisions just couldn't bare to have Mr. Special-skills be actually, truly, unambiguously dead. He gets shot and falls in the river so you really do feel the weight of his sacrifice but of course there's no body and we see a familiar silhouette in the background of the final scene so the 'sacrifice' turns out to be no sacrifice at all. Can't traumatize the audience with the death of a Hemsworth and kill off any possibility of a sequel, can we?The assassination of the rival drug lord is both satisfying and frustrating. Satisfying in that we finally see this cruel man get what he deserves and frustrating in that it might, in my opinion, have been more interesting to have him survive and get away with it, making it so the conversations about how Ovi will never truly know peace actually mean something since his father's rival is still alive somewhere waiting in the shadows.It's fine. It's an ok movie. It has enough action to be enjoyable and the characters are somewhat interesting. Bonus points for not shoving fifteen minute flashbacks of Tyler's past in our faces.

The movie won't bore you in any sense, (aslong as you don't get bored of really good action scenes) you can really tell that the stunt team and Chris Hemsworth put 100% of their effort into this movie..Recommend a good watch for a well built action movie.

reviews.review_title: Can be easily extracted from your binge-watch 😊
reviews.content: Extraction, watched last weekend, I would like to share my review comments with you guys.Verdict: Can be easily extracted from your binge-watch 😊I would rate this 6 on a scale of 10. In one-liner "it's good for action lover and worth watching but can be spared". It remains a one-man show from beginning to end. What I noticed a tactical plan of rescue is missed, insignificant sequences which are not must.Plot Overview:The movie revolves around the kidnapping of boy(Ovi), an Indian drug lord's son and how he is extracted from Bangladesh by Tyler (Chris Hemsworth). Most of the scenes are filmed into crowded streets of Dhaka and comes out natural throughout the movie.Action:The action sequence is good and shot beautifully, don't know the technology but it feels you are in a game. Chase scenes are eye-catching, especially the tussle between Chris and Randip Hooda is a treat to watch. Both Chris and Randip did justice to their roles and executed actions perfectly and it seems real. However, some scenes from the army look incompetent, how come a country which is kept under complete lockdown not able to hunt a single person. Personally, I can't believe.Performance:Main screen time is taken by Chris and Randip, both did justice and acted in the character. Rudraksh portrayed the son's role elegantly. The Indian drug lord played by Pankaj Tripati but he hardly got 2 minutes on screen and Priyanshu Painyuli, Bangladesh's drug lord make a significant impact but he also doesn't have anything to do.

Sorry but this is over hyped.The film fails to get you to emotionally emphasise or relate to any of the characters.It ends up being a chase and run fest and ultimately boring which saw me fail to watch until the end it was that bad.

For a director debut, it was very good! The action sequences are honestly incredible, the plot is weak and if the Russo brothers didn't have their names attached, it wouldn't of been such a high budget. Character development is poor as I didn't feel too attached to any of them but that's fine, the film knows it's a gritty action packed film and keeps to that, the character development as I said is poor but is there to help you try and rout for them to survive. Most Netflix films are trash and I turn them off after the first 20 minutes but I really didn't want to turn this one off. You can easily tell that the director was a former stuntman as the action sequences are so good, for me, they are up there with some of the John Wick fights, Chris Hemsworth does well with the role and it's good to see him play a role with a lot more grit and an almost darker side than I've seen in a while especially compared to the MCU.If the action sequences weren't as good then this would get a 5, they make that much of a difference!

reviews.review_title: Surprisingly good film with great action sequences
reviews.content: When I first saw this Netflix type action film I was filled with doubt, having watched Triple Frontier recently and seeing Chris Hemsworth as the main protagonist. But I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. Action scenes are fast paced, realistic, exciting and have that Bourne feeling to them. The setting is not your usual location either being in Asia (India) for this type of film either, which is usually South America. Chris Hemsworth proves he can be more than just Thor (who he plays brilliantly I add). The ending was unconventional too, it's happy but not the predictable type of ending you see in most action films, it has heart and makes you feel a connection to the characters and why they are doing some of the things they are. Overall a good action film made by Netflix.

reviews.review_title: One of those action movies you watch to pass time and then forget about it
reviews.content: Just because it's a bloody action movie, doesn't mean that you gotta get every single fact wrong.People in Bangladesh don't talk in that accent, they don't listen to hindi music in their homes in the middle of the day. Hooligans in Dhaka don't use AK-47s. Heads of the mafia don't let wasted kids in their dining rooms.Most importantly, a big foreign guy like Hemmy doesn't just go around talking suspiciously on the phone in broad daylight in the middle of a busy street in Dhaka without attracting huge crowd. Maybe possible in India, but not in Bangladesh.And then 60-something year old leader of a law & enforcement starts sniping and accurately killing people by headshots from quite a distance? Give me a break! That's superhero stuff. Wait..Action was good, but nothing spectacular or ground-breaking by today's standard.

After reading many of the "reviews" here, I have to wonder if they actually watched the movie at all. You saw the previews and knew what you were getting, so the logic of people complaining that this wasn't "Citizen Kane" is lost on me. For those who don't know, this was a film adaptation of a "graphic novel" (comic book, for those over 30) and that genre is not well-known for its engaging storytelling.Let me say up front -- the cinematography, fight choreography and seamless special effects (camera behind the car, pulling up alongside, outside the car, panning back and forth, then suddenly *inside* the car, exiting the other side in a long, unbroken chase scene... take a bow FX guys!) combine with a story that's unexpectedly complex for its simplistic origins.All the actors turned in amazing performances, even though all but the two leads didn't have a great deal to work with. Randeep Hooda was particularly memorable as his character wasn't the cookie-cutter character as his motivations are revealed.In short, if you have a couple hours to spare and need a bit of high-octane escapism that doesn't require you to turn your brain off, you may enjoy this. I certainly did!

Being a well-known/successful brand is often a double-edged sword - it commands a premium price in the market but it is also subjected to a higher expectation from the public. Same notion is valid even in the field of entertainment. If a movie is released by a well-known studio or an actor, there is a standard that it is expected to meet. Thus, when Chris Hemsworth partnered with Netflix to release Extraction on April 24th, there was a certain expectation from this film & I think it's fair to say that it fell short.Extraction is an action-drama set in Bangladesh in which Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth), who plays the role of a courageous mercenary, is hired for a perilous extraction in which he has to rescue the kidnapped son of Ovi Mahajan Sr (Pankaj Tripathi), an international criminal. Things start to take a wrong turn for Rake when there is a glitch in the plan and he is left stranded with Ovi Mahajan (Rudhraksh Jaiswal) after rescuing him from the kidnappers. What follows is a 60-minute non-stop action drama following Rake's journey to rescue Mahajan with the help of Saju (Randeep Hooda).Be it Billy Lee in 'Bad Times at the El Royale' or Captain Mitch Nelson in '12 Strong', Chris Hemsworth is one of the few actors who has been able to continuously deliver notable performances outside of Marvel Studios. His performance in Extraction is one of such notable instances. Hemsworth is also supported well by Jaiswal who, despite being only 3 films old, looks completely in his element while sharing the screen with the mighty Thor. Hooda also delivers a convincing performance as an alibi of Tripathi and risks his life for the safety of Mahajan. For all Stranger Things fans, you also see a nice little cameo by David Harbour as Gaspar.Extraction is the testimony of Hemsworth's effort to keep growing as a filmmaker as this feature marks his debut as a producer in films. Speaking of debut, Extraction is also the directorial debut of Sam Hargrave, who is known for his stunts in Avengers: Endgame, Avengers: Infinity War, Deadpool 2, and many other action movies. One could see Hargave's signature all over this movie with dangerously yet immaculately performed stunts - especially in one action sequence that goes on for 11 minutes in which Rake is trying to save Mahajan from the cops and Saju. Hargrave mentioned in his interview that it took him 5 months to create that scene and 10 days to shoot it. Hargrave also clarified that although it looks like a one-long scene from a naked eye, it is actually a compilation of many scenes digitally plastered together.Although the acting, cinematography, production design and stunts are good in this movie, the script doesn't do justice. There are several sub-plots in the movie that are left undiscovered and even the ending demands a little more clarification. Because of its starcast and the current 'stay-at-home' order, this movie will garner more eyeballs than it would have otherwise. But if you are busy pursuing a hobby or have limited disposable time for watching content, you can give this movie a pass.

reviews.review_title: Chris Hemsworth becomes a John Wick influenced killer.
reviews.content: Extraction sounds like a cheaply made film that you would find on Redbox. But since Chris Hemsworth is in the movie, it's a win-win. the film has a cliched plot that we've seen a ton of times. Interestingly, it takes it and does something different with it. The cinematography is average and the hand to hand combat is absolutely the best I've seen. One really outstanding scene from this film is the long 11-minute long take in one of the action sequences. Of course, it's actually simulated but they probably put it there for a reason. Another worthy aspect of Extraction is the acting performance by Chris Hemsworth. He is really great in the film and works. The complaints I have are the plot and feel of the film. It has that filter of a Mexican movie. Now there are some complaints about the violence being over the top. I didn't mind it since I have seen films that are more violent than this one. Overall, Extraction is an enjoyable action film that you can watch during the quarantine. It will just be another of those films that we forget throughout the week.

It never gave the pain which character of Chris Hemsworth was going through. If I was given a chance i could have reduced actions by 5-10% and added additional emotional touch better.2 min explaining rivalry could have added flow to movie. It looked very very low budget movie and conditioning lockdown i hope it had earned required OTT through Netflix.I am not sure of shooting permissions in India but if it was casted in India , I am sure it could had come well.

reviews.review_title: A movie theater movie from home!
reviews.content: If you miss going to see blockbuster movies because of our weeks of isolation, Might I recommend Extraction? The Russo bros. are on their game once again, with Thor himself playing a mercenary in a non stop action packed bloody good time! I would have happily paid money at the googleplex to see this one, but Netflix has gifted us a top tier shoot 'em up! Letterbox format, a continuous shot that lasts about 12 minutes, and Hemsworth proving his action hero status, this movie ticks all the right boxes. It is rated R, and I would normally say NSFW, but who are we kidding. You are working from home, and have been wearing that bathrobe for 8 days now. Get a box of cereal, and pop this on Netflix. You will be happy for the 2 hr. escape. Stay safe, my friends!

reviews.review_title: Cliche ridden John Wick Raid rip off
reviews.content: The problem with giving your stunt action guy a directing gig is that of course the action sequences will be great. There will be loads of Steadicam one take shots and loads of camera floating between cars in a seamless fashion shots so yes so far so spectacular. Where this whole movie falls over is plot, story, character development, chemistry between the cast, dialogue you know, everything else.This film borrows a lot from The Raid and John Wick for its action sequences and they are really satisfying and unpredictable but I do wish the story and dialogue had someone to give it a spot shine. I didn't feel invested in the characters even Chris H, who normally makes everyone he plays likeable, looks like he's finding it hard to project what this guy is about.I haven't finished the film yet as 2 hours of this is way too indulgent and I there are a lot of needless scenes with everyone looking a little bored.It's nice to see a 6 foot white guy save brown people though. He's so pretty and good at his job and the browns are so goddam ugly and corrupt ;-)They should have employed some big name Bollywood stars to make this a proper international production and got someone better to write snappy fun dialogue and who knows it might not have gone straight to Netflix.7 stars for that car chase alone though.

Do people realise that movies are fiction, like a book, moaning about accents and geography. They'll never make another movie bar the jungle book in India again. As good as say the fugitive or U. S Marshals with a hint of city of god and the division 2 thrown in.

Everything is good, except this first person view film shooting. I agree it gives more of an in-game feeling, as if you are more there, but people can get a bit nauseated from it. I turned it off after a bit in the early fight scenes.
It's a good movie, especially if you're looking for an action/guns movie.

I've seen some people comparing this piece of garbage to John Wick, because of the fight choreography.
John Wick was interesting, because it explores a whole new world of secret assassins, and is done masterfully, without taking itself too seriously. The character is mysterious and yet interesting, well built.
This thing is garbage. Presents itself as a serious movie, but we get no real idea of who is who, why people do stuff, who wants to kill the kid and who wants to save it.
I had to skip a lot, it's unbearable, so I'm gonna wrap this up.
If you want to see good action scenes - watch John Wick (1) and save yourself the time.

Entertained till the last minute.By any means is the movie a masterpiece(no offense) but what it does offer is nonstop,well choreographed and well executed action.The movie lacks in the story telling department(mainly the plot which is simple enough for action junkies) and characterization.We get glimpses of chris Hemsworth's character's backstory but is never fully fleshed out.

reviews.review_title: Chris Hemsworth needs more roles like this!
reviews.content: Extraction (2020) really is just one of those movies. Violent, thrilling, and a hell of a time while watching! Chris Hemsworth may play Thor, but he is the ultimate action star and needs more roles in such movies. He is the perfect embodiment of BADASS! The overall story was compelling and intriguing as we follow Tyler Rake on a rescue mission.

This movie plays like some rounds of Counter Strike, interesting at first but falls flat quickly. I thought Rambo Last Blood was plotless but compared to Extraction Rambo suddenly feels like a B+ movie that actually stirs some human emotions.Of course if you are into high body count type of movie this is great, just don't expect anything of substance from it.
Pure action movie. Fist to meat, smooth movement and editing, a good action movie

reviews.review_title: Do not waste your time watching this!!!!
reviews.content: If you wanted some Chris action, rather watch an Avenger movie. This is just not worth any one's time.

A solid action flick that succeeds at being just that, an action flick, however sprinkled with some heart. I was very bias for what seemed to be another modern day action feature; however director Sam Hargrave provided an Australian John Wick instead! The action was incredible, choreography was jaw droppingly flawless. The connections after being shot, punched and thrown against a hard object felt authentic and added to the somewhat realistic fighting style; camera movements were gorgeous, not too shaky to bring disorientation yet not too smooth to take you out of the extremity. The cinematography was adequate, and at times would tell a story in itself which was surprising. The one shot takes were perfect for the moments presented and although cuts weren't well hidden to an experienced viewer, could easily fool a naked eye. Hemsworth's character, although a stereotypical Australian cliche, was enjoyable to watch. In all, the Australian stereotype was smart as it contributed a mateship sentiment to the story. Hemsworth brought an absorbing performance, being unpretentious yet grandiose in action sequences yet considerate and gentle in tender moments. And I appreciated the inner turmoil his character carried, making this more than a shoot, kill, shoot movie. The dialogue was stale but got it's point across. However, the sporadicity in language variations was questionable as to why characters would switch between two languages. The story was as long as it needed to be, little to nothing felt overstayed or unwelcomed other than the subplot of the Bangladesh boy. The ending is touching yet extremely lazy in terms of tying loose ends. And the 'resurrection' of Hemsworth's character was not needed as it destroyed the meaning of his sacrifice. Overall, an exceptional action picture that I'd suggest watching if you're in need of one.

reviews.review_title: Watch it for Helmsworth and THAT action scene!

Extraction hardly survived only because of stunning action-packed scenes and Chris Hemsworth. My Rating 2.5/5.Extraction is an action, thriller movie made for tv, By Netflix. Extraction is a story of a fearless assassin who is on a mission to rescue the kidnapped son of an imprisoned international crime lord.Sam Hargrave First-time directed, known for Stunt coordinator films like avengers endgame, Thor Ragnarok, The winter soldier, and many. Cast- Chris Hemsworth in this instead of his hammer he holds firearms. Randeep Hooda and Rudrakash Jaiswal.Pros - Director Sam Hargrave knows what he whats when coming to action scenes, For a car chase scene he chose to tie himself to the hood of the car to record the scene, all his hard work paid off, All stunts, close combat, shooting, all the action scenes are incredible, well-choreographed. With this film, Chris Hemsworth proved, not only hammer he is also good with guns did a great job.Cons - First if I want to spoil the movie for you I can't because there is nothing to say. For most people, Even though it has a great action sequence with a week plot movie seemed aimless didn't grasp the interest.Poor characterization we don't know the motive of the kidnapper, what's the deal of kid ya there are scenes with a kid but that doesn't add up anything to the story.
And what's with red-yellowish filter, although it spends 65 million dollars the production doesn't look like that.-In Dhaka, Bangladesh every one listens to Bollywood songs? Do cars look like that? the accent is like that? NoooooVerdict - Despite the negative, the good thing that is Extraction doesn't drag at all its only 100 min, if it's for theater it's hard to recommend gladly it's not. if you only want to see Chris Hemsworth in action flying bullets Extraction doesn't disappoint you, if not better to watch John wick, The raid, again.Thanks for Reading

However, if you want a classic action packed movie, this is the one. The action is top notch, and i really enjoyed it. Don't watch this movie if you are looking for something very new and surprising. This is a really good movie that works well within its genre. I recommend it, because i love some good action scenes -also, Chris Hemsworth does a very good job! Great acting

reviews.review_title: Like watching the cutscenes from a B-rated game
reviews.content: The whole movie seems like a spectacle of badassery, with little in thought spared for realism.Though there are some great action scenes within the movie, some of it just mocks you with the how superhuman it is (from people getting shot and continuing without issues, to people getting hit by cars/trucks and walking it off). It game me the vibe of a JCVD Saturday afternoon movie from the 90's, in HD.I have to give it up to some of the great camera work, but that's mostly due to state-of-the-art stabilizers, so ... well done technology.The whole plot seems like it was written on toilet paper during bathroom breaks from the action scene filming. Even the ending seems to have no point, leaving the watcher to figure out what happens next, but the movie does little to set that up.I would give this movie 3/10, bur some great action scenes and quite decent acting saved it.
Don't search for a story here, this movie is all about actions and which is great!

Definitely one of the best action movies of the year.

In this movie the director represented Bangladesh like some war affected nation or like some poor African countries while Bangladesh is one of leading countries of South Asia and it has the highest GDP growth rate of South Asia!

reviews.review_title: Needed more research before releasing the movie.
reviews.content:
Thanks to the developer for making the Extraction movie in the South Asia Region. The movie is based on saving a hostage from Bangladesh. A boy called Ove, who was kidnaped by the most significant drug Diller Amir Asif in Bangladesh and India. The main character was Chris Harmsworth. The base of operation was held in Australia. The movie has extreme violence and lots of action which I liked most. The sound and combat seem realistic. I notice that the filer looks like gloomy according to Bangladeshi culture. They should have added a better filter for a better look; in the movie mercenary Tyler Rake (Chris Harmsworth) as known as an Agent who visits Puran-Dhaka, Bangladesh. The Landmarks, Environment, culture, people everything was realistic. A stranger came with a van and they said to him, 'welcome to Dhaka'. Those people kidnap him and he knew that he has lots of money. But they didn't know that he was a secret agent. He got an escape from the mafia. That action of the agent was so aggressive and enjoyable. But I that time I saw that children with Asselt Rifle and they acting like a terrorist. That was so annoying to see this too me. In the middle of escape with Ove, that was massive action. From the operation base, they were asking Tyler Rake for the drive location. The Police were chasing their car and keep shooting their vehicle. The car crashes were fantastic. Then he entire a building elite team was searching that place. The stealth kill was so perfect in that place. The 12 minutes of this action was so interested in me. The entire sequence consists of a car chase, then a pursuit up some stairs, a fight in a building, a jump from one rooftop to another rooftop, a tumble off an awning, a flight in the street, a fight in the road, and one final of car chase which amounts to about 36 different segments attached together, creating an I, pressure 12 minutes seemingly continuously scene. One thing I notice that Police with badge written Army soldiers again wearing RAB's dress. This is really weird to me. The forces showed that they were bots (Unskilled). But the developer should have research more before making this movie.
The accent was not a regional language. Those accents seem like from the west bangle. As a Bangladeshi fan, the Bengali wasn't mush infested. Children speak about toxic behavior. A maximum vehicle like trucks, old model cars are from India. The lighting was low than editing. But overall, the movie has massive actions and also like the camera angle. Hope, If Netflix announces Extraction 2 in Bangladesh, then again welcome to our country. Overall, Impressive action scenes, a talented cast, fabulous direction from Sam Hargrave, and a brilliant screenplay from Joe Russo all these add up to the awesomeness of Extraction. Even though the plot was a bit confusing and the ending was predictable, Extraction is indeed good enough to put a smile on your face.
Worth Movie .. great action scenes ... but zero Story
Great action but that's the only great part. Pankaj Tripathi is not for even 5 minutes.

reviews.review_title: Action great. Dialogue not so much.
reviews.content: I really wanted to like this film. The action sequences are great. The premise is a good one. My issue with the film was that we just couldn't understand the dialogue. Hemsworth often grumbled his lines and the Indian actors spoke with such soft voices (coupled with thick accents) that we spent a lot of the film asking what was said. Post production could have fixed a lot of these issues.

reviews.review_title: I don't care how it represents or paints bangladesh
reviews.content:
I know bangladesh is not so different from India in terms of culture and a lot of other things. The two were the same country before this and were divided only on the basis of religion. That's okay, its a different country with a wonderful PM and they are marching ahead. Good for them. But that doesn't mean they should give bad reviews for this movie.
This is a movie that deals with gangsters and mobsters. Those criminals are the same whether they are in India or America or Bangladesh or anywhere else. They do crime, they pull in children in the early age and make them experienced criminals. It happens everywhere in the world, including India. Actually that's the point of the whole movie : I wasn't pissed because Bangladesh was shown like that, but that's reality everywhere.
I simply don't care how it represents Dhaka because I have never been to Dhaka and simply don't care if it is true or not. Regarding Bengali, it doesn't really matter to a person who doesn't speak Bengali, or for that matter any Indian language (especially with those hindi songs in background - it was weird for me too because I wanted to hear bangladeshi songs too, would've been much more realistic), but who watches action movies for realism.
Action movies with realism looks like boxing movies without the SFX to back them up.
The One BIG plot hole of the movie, how come a crime lord gets access to a militiary commander and a whole bunch of army platoons. Its ridiculous. If we keep that aside, rest of the movie is really good. It makes us think how hard it for children, either mob bosses or not to get into it - like how the Urv gets into making his first kill and similar with the other guy who kills Chris.

Ok Netflix, you tried (again and again...). Chris did well in this mediocre movie, but overall after 20 minutes I found myself getting bored. If you enjoy mind-numbing street shooting and no clear or reasonable plot, then you will enjoy this.

Apparently this needs to be repeated. This is an action film. It appears that some were sorely disappointed that it was not a rom-com, a period drama or an "important film". However, as an action movie, it is far better than average. In terms of intensity, originality, and production value, this is often on par with John Wick. True the plot is not particularly intricate and the character development is minimal, but much is done with little. There is no sense that any of the actors are phoning in the performance because on paper they aren't given much of an opportunity to show other dimensions. The movie covers events over a short period of time and the characters are focused on the issues at hand. There are a few breathers but we aren't sidetracked into forced "lets talk about us" scenes in the middle of life or death struggle. With the superhero genre beaten to death, a straight-forward fast-paced entertaining film is an increasingly rare gem and well worth the watch.

reviews.review_title: All 6 stars for the action and Chris's Acting

Other than that; the script missed on the plot which has to be the most important. The plot is totally unrealistic and doesn't have a strong foundation. Like seriously locking down an entire city to extract a kid! Sepia/Yellow Color Grade on the movie may seem intense and engaging at first suiting the mood but slowly feels redundant and overdone. After all this said; it's a one time watch for the fast paced action, and the acting of Thor himself and the protagonist child!

So, back to the movie...

The barely believable turning point in the main character's behavior (from merciless mercenary to empathetic "father") drags downa bit the whole movie towards the end. On the other hand, we've seen this rather inexplicable motive already in the "Equalizer" and "Safe", where the main protagonists "turn soft" and show their human side.
At the end, I like seing Hemsworth going Rambo utilizing John Wick's combat style! Impressive!

reviews.review_title: It has just started, More to come

3. reviews.review_title: A good action movie but there was two wrongs...

and second i am not bangali but i knew that movie has sabotaged its presentation.. I mean dirtier road, whole army aiding a gangster, it could not get more WORSE..
