reviews.review_title: Very Good Action With No Plot
reviews.content:
We see a Bangladeshi drug lord kidnap an Indian crime lord's son and Tyler is unleashed to extract him from Dhaka. But why the big names of the subcontinental criminal underworld came to this rivalry, why these desperate measures are unclear.
Another problematic thing is the portrayal of Bangladesh's law enforcement agencies. Every agency including the police, a fictional force named "Elite" which looked like Bangladesh's Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), and even the Bangladeshi military were portrayed to the worldwide audience that they were controlled and bribed by Dhaka based international drug cartels which is fictional but still problematic.
It paints a picture to the world that Dhaka is like Medellin in Colombia during the Pablo Escobar era which is far from true.
The screenplay could have supported some residents or law enforcement officers who were not criminals or involved in drug rings to balance this but every scene of Dhaka felt very wrongly portrayed.
Then comes the main issue of the whole film, the Indian actors who played Bangladeshi roles. Not a single one of them was talking Bangla in a "Dhakaite" accent or even a Bangladeshi one. Some Indian actors were completely butchering the language and most Dhaka based characters in the film sounded like they had a West Bengal based accent and pronunciation. Bangladeshi netizens were quick to respond to this error and complained that the producers of the film did not give attention to the language at all and how no one in Dhaka speaks like the way these characters in this film do.
The creators of the project should have kept in mind that Bangla language is the quintessential element of Bengali identity and they are the only nation who had given their lives for their mother tongue. So a faulty dialect of this language will become a sensitive issue for the Netflix users of this country.
Another huge issue was the acting of the kidnapped kid Ovi, played by Indian actor Rudraksh Jaiswal. As one of the lead characters of the film and having a huge screen time his acting weakness bores the viewers. Most of his dialogue deliveries are typical Bollywood melodrama and in some scenes beside Hemsworth he seems redundant and ridiculous.
The Bangla language and Bangladeshi people, more accurately Dhaka's residents, were not accurately portrayed in Extraction. Yet it marks the beginning of an era where the stories of the capital of this small nation are being told by the Hollywood infrastructure to the whole world for the very first time on this scale. Events like these are important for Bangladesh and its filmmakers to create the urge in them to craft such stories on a massive scale for the global audience; stories which will be the accurate representations of the rich history, heritage and diversity of our beloved Dhaka.
I was expecting more, but is the kind of action movie you've seen hundreds times.
Good action and actors, but In general, just another Netflix garbage movie. Storyline and secondary roles are very poor.

reviews.review_title: I want to review some other people reviews.
reviews.content:
First of all, I want to start with the movie. This movie was fantastic. It delievers exactly what the creators of the movie were thinking of delievering. People are complaining about lack of story, lack of character development etc etc. But that's the risk the creators take on purpose.
Do you really think the people wouldn't have thought of these things, I think we should judge the movies based on what they want us to see not based on what we actually want from them.This movie keeps you on toe for more than 50% of the time. The fight sequence choregraphy lies in on level of some of hollywood Blockbusters. People rating this movie 1 - 2 are really nuts. As a movie lover i feel bad when people do this to some movies, because it has impact on larger audience reading those reviews.A lot of hardwork has been put into the movies and we should atleast give the credit for what the creater and the team behind these project deserve rather than follishly nitpicking.What i absolutely love about the movie.
CameraworkFight SequencesDirectors dedication to stick to the Raid style action flick.What could have been improved.
Few less fillers and more depth should have been given to the sequences about past of characters of Chris and Randeep Hudda.I am not conflicting about what i have said above about asking for other take on the movie. But the time which was already allocated for sequences where Randeep Hooda calls his family and the interaction between Chris and Kid at night.
I think those scenes could have been more better with better writing.Bur overall, this is a great movie. I loved it from Beginning to End.
Expectation was so high.hope next time it will be a great. Good try.

reviews.review_title: Honest review of Extraction: Russo Brothers do everything right except the Bangla
reviews.content:
Extraction.Some Indian actors completely butchered the language and most Dhaka based characters in the film sounded like they are from West Bengal
As Covid-19 lockdown continues in Bangladesh, every film lovers' eyes were on Netflix this Friday as they dropped their latest original film Extraction starring Hollywood superstar Chris Hemsworth. The whole country was eagerly waiting for the action-packed film since the Thor famed actor shared images from the shoot on the set of the film on his official Facebook page in November, 2018.The backdropAmerican action thriller Extraction, previously titled Dhaka, was greenlit back in 2017 by Netflix and is the directorial debut of famous Hollywood stunt coordinator Sam Hargrave. His titles include Hunger Games and several action films in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.The screenplay was written by Joe Russo, based on the comic book Cuidad by Ande Parks, Joe Russo, Anthony Russo, Fernando Leon Gonzalez, and Eric Skillman.The film is a co-production between Avengers: Infinity War (2018) directors Joe Russo and Anthony Russo's (commonly known as Russo brothers) independent production company AGBO and Netflix. The lead cast Hemsworth is also one of the producers in the project.The film was mainly shot in India's Ahmedabad and Mumbai in November 2018 and some shots were taken in Thailand and Dhaka, Bangladesh.The film's production began in Ahmedabad and Mumbai in November 2018.The plotTyler Rake, played by Chris Hemsworth, is a fearless black-market mercenary who is hired to rescue Ovi, played by Rudraksh Jaiswal, the kidnapped son of an imprisoned Indian crime lord. The kidnapping was done by a Dhaka based international drug lord which pushes Tyler into a deadly and almost impossible mission to Dhaka to save Ovi from the drug lord and his massive force of goons and bribed law enforcement members.The rightsExtraction takes its audience from Dhaka to Mumbai to Australia and back, giving us a picture of the interconnected drug traffic ring in South Asia. The two-hour-long film is dark and raw from start to end and every action film lover's dream.Not even a single action sequence of the film was ever exactly shot in Bangladesh except some plate shots for establishment, including the iconic action sequence at Sultana Kamal bridge near Demra.Chris Hemsworth never set foot in Dhaka yet the audience felt he was blazing his guns around Old Dhaka. All of the shots were taken in Ahmedabad and Mumbai.Hats off to the production design team behind the project who had done an excellent job of recreating Old Dhaka in Ahmedabad with such attention to details from the vehicles, to posters in streets, to every single sign board of each shop in each sequence.Russo brothers and Hargrave visited Dhaka couple of times but as Dhaka is not a very production friendly city, they just shot some establishment shots.As the director and producers of the project are the masterminds behind the Avengers franchise, not a single action sequence will let the audience down.
The long yet fast paced follow shots during the action sequences are a treat to experience.Hemsworth gave his absolute best playing the role of a hired black-market mercenary.The wrongsExcept for the smartly handled production design choices, action packed fight sequences, and Hemsworth's Asgardian god like charms nothing else really works in the movie. The screenplay is poorly written and lacks emotion. Though this is a spoiler free review yet there is really nothing more to the story line. The film feels like a two hour long fight sequence with some bandage breaks like a PUBG match on your phone.We see a Bangladeshi drug lord kidnap an Indian crime lord's son and Tyler is unleashed to extract him from Dhaka. But why the big names of the subcontinental criminal underworld came to this rivalry, why these desperate measures are unclear.Another problematic thing is the portrayal of Bangladesh's law enforcement agencies. Every agency including the police, a fictional force named "Elite" which looked like Bangladesh's Rapid Action Battalion (RAB), and even the Bangladeshi military were portrayed to the worldwide audience that they were controlled and bribed by Dhaka based international drug cartels which is fictional but still problematic.It paints a picture to the world that Dhaka is like Medellin in Colombia during the Pablo Escobar era which is far from true.The screenplay could have supported some residents or law enforcement officers who were not criminals or involved in drug rings to balance this but every scene of Dhaka felt very wrongly portrayed.Then comes the main issue of the whole film, the Indian actors who played Bangladeshi roles. Not a single one of them was talking Bangla in a "Dhakaite" accent or even a Bangladeshi one. Some Indian actors were completely butchering the language and most Dhaka based characters in the film sounded like they had a West Bengal based accent and pronunciation. Bangladeshi netizens were quick to respond to this error and complained that the producers of the film did not give attention to the language at all and how no one in Dhaka speaks like the way these characters in this film do.The creators of the project should have kept in mind that Bangla language is the quintessential element of Bengali identity and they are the only nation who had given their lives for their mother tongue. So a faulty dialect of this language will become a sensitive issue for the Netflix users of this country.Another huge issue was the acting of the kidnapped kid Ovi, played by Indian actor Rudraksh Jaiswal. As one of the lead characters of the film and having a huge screen time his acting weakness bores the viewers. Most of his dialogue deliveries are typical Bollywood melodrama and in some scenes beside Hemsworth he seems redundant and ridiculous.ConclusionThe Bangla language and Bangladeshi people, more accurately Dhaka's residents, were not accurately portrayed in Extraction. Yet it marks the beginning of an era where the stories of the capital of this small nation are being told by the Hollywood infrastructure to the whole world for the very first time on this scale. Events like these are important for Bangladesh and its filmmakers to create the urge in them to craft such stories on a massive scale for the global audience; stories which will be the accurate representations of the rich history, heritage and diversity of our beloved Dhaka.
Courtesy:
Siam Raihan,
Dhaka Tribune.

reviews.review_title: Very disappointing from Netflix, gross misrepresentation of Dhaka
reviews.content: Netflix's extraction is by far the worst movie I've seen this year. Not that I had high expectations from this movie but I wanted to see how the city I grew up in is portrayed in a commercial Hollywood movie.Honestly, the movie got multiple things wrong. Here are some of the few things I found annoying and at times, offensive.Horrible Casting: The supposedly Bangladeshi characters of the movie suspiciously talk in a Kolkata accent, 2-3 other characters including the guy that plays the mafia boss speaks with a north Indian accent. Not only the accent was annoying to listen to, the words and phrases they used are never used by real Bangladeshis in such contexts. This makes me wonder; why Netflix with it's multi-million dollar budget could not afford 5-6 actual Bangladeshi actors to play those Bangladeshi characters.Unrealistic paramilitary force: They showed a group of paramilitary force in black uniforms as Bangladesh's main law enforcement agency in this movie. This agency I guess is meant to be a fictionalized version of RAB( a local paramilitary force). The unlimited arsenal and firepower they are showed to have, it would make even the US military envious. This included police chase cars, helicopter, bazookas and other sophisticated military weapons, which I, living in all those years in Bangladesh have never seen.Mafia controls everything: The antagonist in the in the movie, Asif Amir, who is a mafia boss/Narcos style drug kingpin seem to control everything in Dhaka. The army, police, and 'Elite' - everything seems to be in his pockets. While Bangladesh is a highly corrupted country, it is factually incorrect to show that a druglord runs the city.The filmmakers used the Mexico style Druglord-kidnap-Corrupt cop formula on this movie. They totally missed the point that the politics in Latin America and the Indian Subcontinent are very different. Using the same formula would only make for a horrible movie such as this. Very disappointing job from Netflix. Hope next time they do better research before making a based on a culture they don't know much about.

If not for better writing and a continual need for Netflix to improve their CGI this could've been a very good film. However Netflix always seems to fall short on the most important part of any film, the plot. Not that the concept isn't interesting but on execution, as with all Netflix films, there is more that could've been done.The films main failure for me was the CGI, it really took me out of the film at points, the main example when the truck flips and is engulfed in flame. The phyiscs simulation is off and the fire effects are lacking quality, also at other points in the film with smoke being used to signal where things are taking place, there is a blatant lack of blending with environment so it just sticks out against a very yellow colour palette.Not to say this film isn't enjoyable, there are some amusing moments where the film takes a step back from the seriousness it tries to convey and allows a chuckle here and there.I will conclude by saying there were also some cool camera transitions but something more couldve been done in the edit trying to hide some cuts as they were fairly blatant even on a first watch.

reviews.review_title: 1 star for the action and Chris Hemsworth
reviews.content: Where to begin - the movie got it all wrong. Starting from a lack of character building to absolutely missing the mark when it comes to Dhaka's portrayal, Extraction seriously disappointed after all the hype it generated. Would definitely not recommend, unless you really want to waste 2 hrs of your life.

reviews.review_title: A weak waste of a Hemsworth
reviews.content:
On the positive side there is some good action here, but just as they have made some weak Bond films by trying to make them Bourne movies, this falls down by trying to be John Wick.
Chris Hemsworth is a charming lead, but is mired in sad, obvious clichés - you'll never guess! He lost his wife and child, and so he takes his pain medication with whiskey! So hard-core...
Hopefully, the sequel will be more fun, this lacks the wit within the action that John Wick has, which makes the huge kill count in those films bearable. By the end of this, the complete inability of the police and soldiers to hit anything was reaching A-Team levels of ridiculousness.
Mr Hemsworth needs to start showing more care in the projects he chooses outside of the MCU.

reviews.review_title: It's like Call of Duty, The Last of Us, John Wick and Jason Bourne rolled in to one!
reviews.content:
This movie has AWESOME action scenes. There are lots of intense shoot outs and chase scenes which are directed perfectly and the fight choreography is sometimes impressive. The camera follows a lot of the carnage close up which makes the action feel tight and claustrophobic, However it never uses bad editing or the annoying shaky cam effect. Chris Hemsworth is badass as the main character but he is just a pretty generic action hero that you've seen a hundred times before. The rest of the cast do a good job and there are a few surprisingly good characters. The story is pretty straight forward but it has a few unexpected moments which adds more tension to the film.
Overall if you've seen the trailer and are looking for edge of your seat action you won't be disappointed but you won't be blown away by the story either. It's a really good Netflix film and if it comes out on Blu-Ray I would definitely add it to my collection.

Bangladesh is NOT a violent country but a peace loving country. They don't have that kind of crime lords in that country and there is no violence over there as shown in the movie. I understand it's Hollywood but you can't misrepresent a country like that. It's NOT a fictional country like " Wakanda ". You can't hurt peoples emotion and love for their country. You have to remember, Bangladesh is one of the biggest contributor of United Nations peacekeeping mission for a long time.Ohh... I forgot... The movie... No... Not worth watching. No story, average action. If you like Steven Seagal or his movies ( i don't know if anybody does ) then you might like it. Just like Steven Seagal's movies, there's a lot of camera movement but not much of actual acting or action happening there. They just tried to make the scenes epic by moving their cameras like crazy instead of letting the actors actually act.
Overall, if you are looking for a good or maybe OK movies, it's not a movie you want to watch.

I am a Bangladeshi. When this movie announced to be made, our social media was full in gossip. Even before the realise date people were subscribing to netflix to watch.Now you show us that there was no trace of Bangladesh or Dhaka. Shameful enough. Wrong culture, Fake voice, Insulting Bangla language (for god sake we fought for our mother language and search for international mother language day)Generalizing, categorizing like Drug maxican, Killer black people (no offence, we just watch movies) , terrorist Bangladesh ( Alas! It was not even made in Dhaka, so why use the name)Giving you 5 is just a curtsey which you Didn't give our country. Just 1 star should have given as you play with a nations emotion and their pride to being a Bangali.

reviews.review_title: Weak storyline, misappropriation of Bangladeshi culture & language
reviews.content: This entire movie did extreme injustice to the Bangladeshi community & their heritage. Indian actors, specially Priyanshu Painyuli (as Amir Asif), was pathetic with delivering his Bangla dialogues. It was not only a torture for ears, but also an injustice to the language itself that Bangladeshis gave blood for in 1952 language movement. Did not expect this kind of performance from someone who did exceptional in 'Upstarts'! There are countless factual errors in the movie i.e. there's no jungle at anywhere near the river. Dhaka is completely a different place than how it's been showcased in the movie!
For a story, it is acceptable. But for the movie itself too much of a killing by the hero. He gets thousands and thousands of bullets!!!. Yet he manage to shoot them all.

This isn't right!You can't picture my country, country's military, elite forces and police in such a way! We aren't a damn terrorist country.Do you know our military serve UN as a leading UN forces? Do you even know our peoples? Our culture? Our history?Who are you to tell the world that our country's law enforcement agencies are run by so called drug lords?! How can you imagine that such children carry arms in our streets!Bangladesh is just full of peace loving country and our boys are here keep light shining day & nights. They are not run by such terrorists!Its a shame Netflix!!#ShameOnNetflix

reviews.review_title: Solid action, weak plot - one time watch
reviews.content:
Extraction is a strictly one time watch Action-packed film with a lot of entertainment quotient like Hand to Hand combat scenes, Gun fight sequences, Chasing sequences to give you a much required good time in this Lockdown Season. However, the plot of the film is very basic and remains one - dimentional throughout its duration but the film still manages to hold your attention quite well.
The story of the film revolves around the son of India's biggest drug dealer who has been abducted by the gang of the drug lord of Bangladesh as they are not on good terms. A mercenary named Tyler(@Chris Hemsworth) has been hired to safely bring him back home. Beside the basic plot, there is hardly anything which gives the depth or twist to the story. Also @JoeRusso's writing has some flaws as the film gives less space for character development. Film has some loose ends and a very outdated portrayal of Bangladesh by showing weak Military, inexpert Special Forces and child terrorism to justify action sequences.
The screenplay is full of hardcore & mindblowing action sequences and you can see lots of violence happening throughout the movie. The combat scenes are brilliantly choreographed and the climax sequence is a major takeaway.
@ChrisHemsworth is in his top form and delivers with such an ease. @RandeepHooda as Saju is equally good and it's a delight to watch him in a never seen before avatar performing such high octane action sequences and all other starcasts have also delivered decent performances.
Background music works well. The cinematography is amazing. The camera work, one-take-shots are seriously fantastic.
You can definitely give it a watch. Thankyou
Excellent movie I love this. I suggested for to watch this project.
On the surface extraction is another empty Netflix film; however what the film doesn't make up for in the plot it makes up for in its exciting action sequences and great performances.

1) Dhaka should have been filmed as Location.

4) Kids in Bangladesh do not run with big guns.
5) Bangladesh police or Army do not cover their face with mask.
6) Drug lord commanding army and putting roadblock every where to stop city people is beyond joke.Everything apart from Chris H's acting and the little boys acting rest of the movie is way below standard.Anyway, people who never been to Bangladesh and visit after watching this movie they will be surprised because Dhaka is many times better than the way it was portrayed in the movie.Finally, giving three star 1 for Chris, 1 for the boy and 1 for the lady who killed drug lord in the toilet.

reviews.review_title: Poor Story, Good Action, Weak Representation of Dhaka and Bangla Language
reviews.content: When was the last time you saw Dhaka in a Hollywood film? Probably never. Chris Hemsworth was amazing as usual, loved the scenes of Old Dhaka shot by the Bangladeshi team, perfectly done. The Cinematography in this movie was top notch. They almost replicated the entire Old Town perfectly in Ahmedabad, India. However, I personally didn't like the Bangla dialogues used in the movie, seemed very weak. And the Bengali accent used in the movie was West Bengal's one, would have been much more better if they replicated Old Dhaka or atleast Bangladesh's Bangla accent properly. The Indian cast was a bit weak in the acting part, but they tried. The story lacked details of the timeline and many other things too. Loved the action scenes. Enjoyed the movie, I would recommend you to watch it, but Dhaka looks much more gorgeous in real life. Chris Hemsworth was a treat to watch. Really want to see Bangladeshi Cast and more of Bangladesh in Hollywood Films in the future.

reviews.review_title: Weak story line, Very less research on Dhaka
reviews.content: The main reason of disliking is the weakness of story line. Why would Mumbai based gang lord Mahajan's son will be kidnapped by a gang lord in Dhaka? Geographically the distance is so far. It could be like in the war of Mumbai and Maharashtra based gang started with a conspiracy involving a very fierce third party gang lord Asif in deal. But this movie is like forcing into a clash for nothing.Second of all, very weak research on the city named Dhaka. Though it was all filmed in Kolkata but the every it represented Dirty Kolkata, Traffics are mainly indian car/cng covered with Dhaka painting. Dhaka is far clean & modern than Kolkata. In an action scene, every household showed listening Hindi Songs which is not even real in Kolkata. Finally, the Elite force copying RAB and portraying Bangladesh Army uniform is so offensive whereas our Armed Force is known in this world for its Peace Keeping Mission throughout the World which is well endorsed by United Nations.Keeping emotion aside, Chris acted very well and he deserves all the credits if anything left in this movie.

reviews.review_title: Poor storyline.. Poor acting.. Just an hour full of bloodshed, killing & hearing wrong local accents.
reviews.content: Very poor storyline. Poor acting. The movie was based on Dhaka (capital of Bangladesh), but mostly shot in Kolkata (located in India), which led to a very poor representation of the surrounding it was supposed to show. Everyone who spoke Bangla (language) or acted as Bangladeshi doesn't even speak proper Bangladeshi Bangla (they were speaking in indian Bangla accent). Started watching with a good expectation but ended up in a nightmare. The director could have studied about the country & It's culture before shooting the movie. The story is extremely weak. Actors were expressionless. Only action scenes of Chris was worth watching. Sometimes it looked like he was playing call of duty though. Not recommended at all.

reviews.review_title: When a stuntman stands behind camera ends up with a blunder
reviews.content:
A moviemaker is just not a money maker. He has some responsibilities. These increases when he goes for an international product. Apart from something which makes a movie a complete entertaining package, My heading says many issues which are as follows:
1. Bangladesh (BD) is country of 16 crore +...So, you understand how much it will be in terms of movie viewers number. The movie portrayed BD like Syria, Afghanistan or a war wrecked State which is disgrace for us. Because BD is not such.The stuntman (Director) should have some background studies which hadn't. Because he is a stuntman!
2. He couldn't portrayed our law agencies properly and made whatever just he liked.
3. He could not portrayed Dhaka. Because he tried to do it from Ahmedabad, India.
4. There is distinct difference between the Bengali language of BD & India as it's between US & UK English language in terms of pronunciation. Someone apart from Bengalis may not understand it. The stuntman tried to establish Indian Bengali language as BD Bengali language with lot of spelling mistakes of Bengali language which made the background as unrealistic one.
5. It's obvious that the Stuntman took idea from Someothers not from BD to portray BD as he didn't come here. This made the blunder and has defamed my country.
6. You will need a microscope to find out a man having 4 wives in BD. It may be possible in Middle East. But it's reflected in the movies.This is how he tried to defame BD muslim culture.Thereby I am grading this movie 1/10.
No story, no plot just action for no reason No logic at all.

I am from Bangladesh. I have been living in Dhaka City ( the real one) for last 36 years. After watching the movie, I think i should speak for my city.1. Movie casting was very good. Chris Hemsworth, Randeep Hooda , the kid everyone showed their skills while the director completely lacks his. It is not DHAKA AT ALL. I really doubt if they have seen the city even by google.
2. " Sultana Kamal Bridge" is way ahead from Dhaka city.
3.The accent heard in background seems absolutely wrong- I have never ever heard of this accent enywhere in Bangladesh for the last 36 years - I am also wondering how it occured.
4. Bollywood songs in background (which is also pretty old, like 90's) might confuse the viewer as well. We have our own music.
5. Children were shown in the street carrying guns and using foul languages- really? Which Dhaka is it?
6. Finer detail- the city environment, bakcground activity, vehicle models used for the movie- nothing matches Bangladesh even- let alone " Dhaka City".Bottom liine-
The movie lacks its context completely. Dhaka is a peaceful city.
Overcrowded ? - yes.
Heavy Traffic ?- yes
Air Pollution ? - yes
Noisey? - yes
But it is vibrant in its own way- much safer than many cities of the world. We can find child begger in the street - but definitely not terrorist.I suggest anyone related to this movie should type " Dhaka" in Google or Wikipedia. They have more information - especially authentic one.I sincerely apologise for my comments above if it hurts anyone. Any city shown in any movie should reflect its own character - imagination shall be there for sure- but definitely not out of context .

reviews.review_title: A Jam packed Action Thriller with some flaws
reviews.content:
Good Things About the film:1. Direction is just flawless. The American Stuntman turned Director Sam Hargrave just nailed it. He knows how to do action scenes without disrespecting Newton. He made the Pace fast where needed and slowed up where it called for one simple conversation between characters. Just incredible.
2. Performances of most of the characters. Chris Hemsworth AKA Thor didn't let us down and delivered An impeccable performance. His sense of every emotion is just amazing. He makes you feel every time he goes through some emotion. And when he pronounces "Proman dao" so flawless you'll just feel that One is dubbed but no. He Said it. But he said "teka" instead of "taka" but it seemed that he learned bengali from a Bangladeshi instead. Overall a "Worth it" performance.
3. Shataf Figar as Bangladeshi Army Colonel was just on point. He didn't mispronounced a single bangla word wrong. And his presence and personality was just extraordinary. He did look like a real colonel.
4. An extraordinary performance came from Suraj Rikame as Farhad. Though his role was very short but very very important. He was the finding of this film. His "on point" expressions and greatly pronounced bangla makes his performance a great one. He has a Bright future.Bad things about the film:1. I didn't like particularly just disliked the performance of One character is of Rudraksh Jaiswal as Ovi Mahajan in this film. His expressions were Same at every scene. He just disgraced Chris's performance. May be he was baffled a little bit in front of "Thor". But in comparison Suraj Rikame just stole the show as an teenage antagonist. Only one dialogue that strikes was "You drown not by falling into the river, but staying submerged in it." but it was only the dialogue, Not the way he delivered it.
2. Particularly didn't like the pronunciation of bangla words by Priyanshu Painyuli as Amir Asif. He was just a typical north Indian speaking bengali after few classes. I mean seriously? In that level you can't do that he should have been replaced by an bengali actor from Bengal or Bangladesh either. Very disappointed with that as a bengali.
3. Story line was predictable after the first half.
4. Pankaj Tripathi was used only in one scene. They couldn't capitalize on his master class.
5. The Director seriously needed More homework about the music taste of Bangladeshi people obviously. Because, you can hear only Bollywood songs (Most of them are SRK songs from 90's and 2000's and From Gully Boy too) playing in households while a chasing scene. I mean seriously? You could have added a "Khairon lo tor lomba mathar kesh, Chirol daanter hasi diya pagol korli desh" instead. They did add a bangla rap in a car scene though (Not "Ripon Miyar Bangladesh" though).(Quick facts: All the Dhaka scenes were shoot in India only. Australia scenes were shoot in Thailand. AND THERE IS NO MANOJ TIWARY IN THE CAST. GOOGLE SHOWS IT WRONG WHEN YOU SEARCH FOR "EXTRACTION CAST".)Should You Watch It Or Not?
Absolutely. You should watch it. It is a great portrayal of South Asian Under world and also a Gunman's emotion weaknesses about his Son and the consequences of that you would Not expect. Oops! Spoiler. So, if you have enough money in this lock down period and going to subscribe to Netflix for this film, then go ahead. I mean, Umm.... I prefer Torrent. though.

reviews.review_title: Action Packed but Completely missed the Environment of Dhaka
reviews.content:
The premise of the movie was supposed to set in Dhaka, a city of 10+ million people in Bangladesh. Unfortunately, they completely missed mark making the set in Dhaka.To start with, the accent of the locals are wrong, they are speaking in an accent that's commonly used in West Bengal, India. Dhaka and People in Bangladesh, in General, have a completely different accent. Throughout the movie, Hindi songs are heard in the background, where everyone is watching tv during midday. People go to work here, Dhaka is the capital, nobody sits on their asses watching TV midday. Bangladesh has its own music industry, although the movie had some issues acquiring copyright for some of the songs to play in the background.The environment is wrong. Sure Dhaka has slums and dirty places, but most of the city is developed enough with an actual nice road system. If they set the scene somewhere else in Bangladesh, it would've been more convincing. The roads are basically dirt roads in this movie where Dhaka has one of the best road systems in the Country. Dhaka doesn't have that kinda dense jungle anywhere near the city, certainly not near the Buriganga river.The criminal class in Bangladesh is completely different. This isn't Africa, people don't employ child soldiers here. And certainly carry Ak-47 in hand and in the open.The Police uniform and looks are completely misjudged. They are trying to portray the elite force of Bangladesh, Known as Rapid Action Battalion. They are not regular police. The deal with counter-terrorism and similar stuff. It should've been the police that deals with criminal or action in the street. Police vehicles are wrong.Don't get me wrong, the entire movie is brilliantly shot and exceptionally action-packed. But this provides a complete misrepresentation of Bangladesh, as well as the city of Dhaka. People who don't have an idea about Bangladesh will get a false sense for a beautiful country by the misrepresented set of this movie.

reviews.review_title: John Wick-esque action scenes with a Bollywood Film Plot
reviews.content:
I had high hopes for this one because of the star studded cast. Not only they dropped the ball on recreating Dhaka city, somewhere in India, the plot also has major conveniences. In a movie where you have the titular stars like Chris Hemsworth, David Harbour and critically acclaimed actors like Randeep Hooda and Pankaj Tripathi ( I would call it a cameo), a little more research on the place where most of the story takes place would have been more appreciated. Indonesia sure knows how to make a badass action flick with lesser known cast and half the budget. I would rather prefer The Night Comes For Us among Netflix's action packed offerings.
This movie is only watchable as a one time pop corn flick as it does not have too many redeeming qualities.

I love the plot and the stunts are out of today's films productions, which means must watch; specially during this time of crisis in the whole world you got experience a movie which give you enough time to get your mood out of the box!!! Please do watch and further share your opinions. I give 10 of 10 because of the actions and the actor's----

reviews.review_title: Lack of research; Poor story & Misrepresentation of a country.
reviews.content:
As the whole movie is based on stunt and action scene one cannot complain about those that is for sure but when the cons take over the cons then the rating goes down.Pros:
Impressive action scene.(3 stars for that)Acting abilities of all characters were good enough.(1 stars for that)Cons:
Lack of research, Poor Story plot & Misrepresentation(- 2 stars for each so -6 stars in total)* A movie portraying recent time should be portraying the recent scenario of the city portrayed. There comes the whole disappointment. Not as a Bangladeshi but as movie freak I am saying this. If you are showing a part of city it is okay to portray as however one wants but if the whole city is portrayed it should be taken into consideration how it should be portrayed. In this movie whole Dhaka is shown as slam/dirty area with narrow lanes which is definitely funny and ridiculous. Yes it is over populated but the whole city is not based on old buildings and narrow lanes or smelly sewer. Only the part of old town has old buildings with narrow lanes.* Dhaka is not a post war country and children do not run with guns in open streets, they dont even carry guns in a hidden manner and they are not part of gangs for sure.* Even if it is considered the whole armed forces are corrupt in a country but what about the background story for that one? I don't know, they might have plan to produce another movie for the past story.
In movie there is no local showed to help the character Tyler or Saju which is actually a serious negative side according to me. For Saju how he entered inside Dhaka without help form someone how he crossed border with arms and without security people knowing that is a mystery.* We all know the difference of English accent between UK and USA, what if a movie story is based on USA and the actors portraying USA locals are using UK accent, how horrible does that sound?
Same has happened in this movie (Except these two character: Dhaka Elite force Commander and Farhad), even the character portraying Dhaka Drag Lord, Amir Asif cannot speak proper Bangla, how funny is that?) The other actors portraying Dhaka goons are using West Bengal accent (Part of india, Bangla is their mother tongue too) which is too much different than the actual accent of Bangladeshi one.*Then comes background songs used in the scene.
All the songs played on background are Hindi (Might have been copyright issues but there are too many West Bengal produced Bangla Music?)
Seriously? this is the research of a movie team!!!!
Watched it yesterday was expecting something extraordinary but other than some action scenes it was quet mediocre

reviews.review_title: Know what you're signing up for, and you won't be disappointed
reviews.content:
I see 80% of the reviews here are from natives of Bangladesh, who seem to be very unhappy about the way their capital (Dhaka) and their country have been represented in this movie. Well, I don't give a rat's eye about that, neither do I bother about any emotional core or a crackerjack of a story, because hey, anyone who has seen the trailer SHOULD KNOW that this movie ain't about any of that. At no point in time have those associated in the making of this movie given the impression that this will be anything more than an out-and-out action movie, and I assure you that it surely delivers on that front.
The action choreography is brilliant! Raw, visceral, brutal and realistically shot with real world stakes. The centrepiece action sequence, a one-take shot that moves from a car chase to a building shootout to a knife fight to finally a truck chase, is a marvel! Chris Hemsworth excels and so does Randeep Hooda and Rudraksh Jaiswal.
BOTTOMLINE : If you're a fan of action movies in the same vein as of John Wick, Raid or Atomic Blonde, do give this movie a chance. I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

reviews.review_title: Good action movie but poor script writing
reviews.content: The action scenes looked quite real and impressive. However, the emotional sense that I believe the director was going for...never really blossomed.

Just watched the Netflix special "Extraction" starring Chris Hemsworth. I am extremely disappointed with the HORRIBLE misrepresentation of Dhaka. Dhaka AND its law enforcers deserve a MUCH better portrayal in front of the world. Reasons below1. Children don't carry rifles on the streets of Dhaka in broad daylight. It's a horrible misrepresentation shown in the movie. If I didn't live in Dhaka myself, I would be mistaken into thinking child terrorism is normal in Dhaka.2. Law enforcers in Dhaka - whether it be DMP, RAB or any of the defense organizations - are NOT incompetent and incapable of stopping two random guys flying in from outside the country. They do their job well, which is why we can go out, visit places, hang out with friends and more without worrying about random shootings (like they show in the movie).3. Dhaka's streets are NOT violent and it's NOT normal for people to fight in public with guns and swords. The movie made it seem like the people are used to things like these happening and somehow it's the norm here.4. An entire movie set to be in Dhaka and not a SINGLE major Bangladeshi character played by someone who SPEAKS the language and dialect that we do in Bangladesh? Are you for real, Netflix? All the major characters spoke Bengali like they do in West Bengal / Kolkata - NOT how we speak in Bangladesh - although they were representing characters in Bangladesh. Why?Overall, it's a horrible misrepresentation of the country in front of the world by a cast which isn't even 1% Bangladeshi. People abroad don't know a whole lot about Dhaka, but after they watch this movie, they might get the wrong impression that Dhaka lacks law enforcement and is filled with violence.This is not my Dhaka, this is not any Dhaka.PS: This is my opinion on the movie, as someone who was actually born and brought up in Dhaka. I was offended by how they represented my city, and I want an apology from Netflix.
At least a Dhakaiya street boy killed Chris Hemsworth (and drowned him into Buriganga) which Thanos couldn't. 🤣💪
Trying to establish Dhaka as negetive. Dhaka is far more better than the show. Meanwhile worst vfx.

I thoroughly enjoyed the first 30 mins of this movie. Chris Hemsworth does a wonderful job of portraying a battle-hardened mercenary who has hit rock bottom due to a personal tragedy.
The plot is set up well and gets you emotionally invested in the characters. The indian actors are great in their roles, especially Rudhraksh Jaiswal who plays the abducted child and after the first action sequence I thought "Wow, this is gonna be fun".
However what ensues is an ongoing shootout in which our main protagonist mows down countless members of the local police. The justification of that being that their commander is corrupt and in the pockets of a drug lord.
And that just throws me completely out of this story. Since when has it become a heroic act to slaughter public servants? I just can't get behind that and it makes the redemption story of Tyler Rake pointless in my opinion.

They speaking like Calcutta people. and Bangladeshis do not use slang language like Indians, at least not our Police or Army.

reviews.review_title: ABSOLUTE TRASH - both Inaccurate and terrible to watch
reviews.content: ABSOLUTE TRASH AND A WASTE OF TIME. This movie is a complete inaccurate, misrepresentation of the setting it takes place in - Bangladesh. If you decide to spend so much time portraying a country and its people negatively, pick issues that actually exist. The substantial majority of this film does not actually take place in Bangladesh (those Bengali flyers you see were placed in other countries and filmed there). NONE of the actors/actresses are Bangladeshi, and the Bengali spoken in the movie is not even the accurate dialect used in Bangladesh. Most importantly, this movie makes it seem like there is a large drug cartel movement and lavish drug lords that ARE NOT EVEN A REAL THING in BANGLADESH. Do your research before you falsify and slander a country over issues that don't really exist there. Finally, why is there such a focus and motive of fake "drug cartel of Bangladesh" being the bad guys when literally the Indian drug cartel is just as evil? PS the plot is just as GARBAGE as the lies this movie tells.
Totally wrong way to represent Dhaka and language of Bangla.

reviews.review_title: A Action Thriller movie which make you enjoyable during this lockdown period
reviews.content:
An Action Thriller movie which makes you enjoy during this serious time
Well, It is an Action Thriller film which officially released on Netflix.
Director: Sam Hargrave
Writers: Joe Russo ... (screenplay)
Ande Parks ... (based on the graphic novel "Ciudad" by)
Ande Parks ... (from story by) &
Joe Russo ... (from story by) &
Anthony Russo ... (from story by)
Fernando León González ... (with illustrations by) (as Fernando Leon Gonzalez)Stars: Chris Hemsworth, Bryon Lerum, Ryder Lerum and etc...StoryLine:-In an underworld of weapons dealers and traffickers, a young boy becomes the pawn in a war between notorious drug lords. Trapped by kidnappers inside one of the world's most impenetrable cities, his rescue beckons the unparalleled skill of a mercenary named Tyler Rake, but a Rake is a broken man with nothing to lose, harboring a death wish that makes an already deadly mission near impossible.Chris Hemsworth was perfect for this role. this movie is full of action sequences that's why He doesn't have to do a lot of speaking. The stunts were awesome and not very easy.The acting of every starcast was perfect which makes me feel good. As this was an action thriller movie you see guns, bombs, shots every time so keep away children from this film. Otherwise, I enjoy a lot to watch this film. I rate this 8 out of 10.I remove one point for its location and another one as the film does get a little tedious towards the end. I recommend you giving this one a watch.

The desi contingent does get a look-in: Hooda as the not-quite-sure-which-side-he's-on is watchable as always, Jaiswal as the terrified companion-on-the-run settles into his groove after an initial fumble or two, Tripathi comes in for a flash. Painyuli, as the baddie with a penchant for chopped fingers, gets a couple of stand-out scenes, with his young slumdog-in-training, the interestingly-scarred Rikame. These two turn on real menace between them.

reviews.review_title: Bangladesh as a Battleground in Film

EXTRACTION means to completely destroy something by forced.Truth be told, his only mission seems to be playing PUBG(
The director chosen Bangladesh as the battlefield) only with real people.THEME:-But in this movie view of the theme, the film is bound by the affection of children and the unspoken equation of father and son.STORY:- Ovi (Rudhraksh Jaiswal), the teenage son of an Indian drug lord, played by Pankaj Tripathi, is kidnapped and kept in Dhaka on the orders of Bangladesh's own 'Pablo Escobar' Asif (Priyanshu Painyuli). Saju (Randeep Hooda), under pressure from Ovi's father, decides to seek help from a foreign mercenary Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth), but the rescue mission is tougher than what he imagined initially.***In this time Netflix is a platform that every Bengali Should be proud of where half of the Bengali Language(ex-Proman Dao) has been used in films like EXTRACTION.

reviews.review_title: White man kills lots of brown people but it's all good because he's sad.
reviews.content: Let's do a little thought experiment. Let's say someone made a movie where a Nigerian mercenary came to New York because a gang there had kidnapped a Mexican kingpin's son. And let's say after dispatching the bad guys in a variety of creative ways, that Nigerian mercenary and his team get betrayed and he's stuck on the run in Manhattan and it turns out that there's high-up cops and pentagon officials in the gang-leader's pocket, and they mobilise the NYPD and the marines to stop him.Now of course the NYPD and the marine grunts are just following orders, having been told they need to apprehend a bad guy, but our Nigerian mercenary just goes right ahead and slaughters them all without a second thought. Do you think that would play well with American audiences? Seeing New York's finest, their wive's and kid's world about to implode with grief, mowed down by some African foreigner rescuing a Mexican druglord's kid? Do you think these American audiences would be cheering for the Nigerian because in one scene he reveals why he's sad and the Mexican druglord's kid tells him he's very brave?Please.Sure you can say get over it it's just a movie, but haven't we got past the point where it's ok for a protagonist to just slaughter people undeserving of slaughter while we still have the film-maker ask us to sympathise with the so-called hero? It's just lazy, it's an easy way to throw cannon-fodder for more explosions and bursts of gunfire. Maybe some people can see past that and just enjoy the spectacle, but frankly it left me cold. Didn't finish it.Hard pass.

reviews.review_title: Hemsworth creating his own lane in the action genre
reviews.content: During self-quarantine I'm sure many of you like myself have been abusing the time watching content on the many streaming services available to us. I've been lucky enough to dedicate this time to catching up on some of the latest releases on Netflix.If you're looking for a good action film to enjoy on late night then you'll be satisfied with Chris Hemsworth's latest project - Extraction. The film is based around the character Tyler Rake, an ex pay for hire mercenary, who takes up one last job; to rescue an Indian mob leader's kidnapped son from a rival mobster and the largest drug dealer in Bangladesh. Expect spectacular fighting sequences, explosions and exhilarating car chases as director Sam Hargrave takes us on the whirlwind mission in his debut film.Given Hargrave's stunt background (famously known as Captain America's stunt double), there was a lot of potential for the action sequences to bring this film to life. We see glimpses of Hargraves talents shine, in particular, during a fight scene that takes place once Rake attempts to recover mob leader's son Ovi. The close combat flights are captured well, we feel the intensity of the fight through the shoes of Rake. The director wants us to feel every punch and kick which engages us as the audience. Hargraves stunt background definitely adds an edge to this film, he is able to satisfy us the audience through the intense fighting and excessive violence, similar to that used in the Asian action films such as the Raid.With the majority of the film being shot in Dhaka Bangladesh, one of the most densely populated cities in the world; Rakes task seems even more unrealistic as he is one man in foreign country against an entire mob. Hargraves does well at using this location to create chaos. In particular, during the car chase we feel overwhelmed and on the edge of our seats as there's people everywhere and often a lot of near misses. However, what stood out to me during this scene and the fight scene was the camera. Hargraves repeatedly uses a one shot, similar to that used in 1917. This shot is effective as Hargraves is able to make us feel like we're following Rake through the chaos.Although, this film doesn't stand out from its competition in the action genre. It feels like Hemsworth is attempting to solidify himself as a solo lead by creating a lane for himself. perhaps for when he decides to hang his boots as the role of Thor within the marvel cinematic.

reviews.review_title: Average action flick - no logic though
reviews.content: Chris hemsworth plays his character well, action sequences are great but it's very hard to believe some of the logic in this film.One thing that really bothered me was painting the main character as a hero due to his bravery and attachedment to the kid he is meant to protect yet he openly guns down Indian Army and Police to protect him...where is the logic in this?The only reference we get is a quick line early on to say "the cops are in on it" as a way to completely scapegoat some of these bizarre action sequences.Ultimately I was excited this was a film based in India but if this was the other way around and our favourite hero Chris Hemsworth was gunning down US Police , Military there would be an uproar and this wouldn't even get 4/10 on IMDB.But because India is supposedly some war torn country it's ok for the action hero to do this.In summary, good action sequences and if you can skip past some major logic problems of the film it's a ok action film but could of been so much better.Script issue rather then acting for me, Chris delivered his character suberbly.

I gave the title a solid 5 because of the action sequences and the acting of Chris. Other than that the film is full of bad choices. First is the language, if you want to make a film a a countries background you can't show all the native people talking in some other accent. Here in this film all the supposed Dhaka residents always talking in an accent that is of West Bengal, India, not anywhere near Dhaka. Then the roads, houses and songs! yes you heard right, songs. Roads are dhaka are not like shown in the film, dart roads, so when you watch the film you will feel this is not dhaka at all. The houses are not like dhaka. In the film you can hear hindi film songs from 90's in almost every house. Sadly the film is not set in 90's background but today. And in Dhaka you will not hear 90's hindi song in souses or cafes. So altogether this film does not give a single bit of felling that it's in Dhaka, then why using the name anyway? I understand that being a fantasy film this does not require to be accurate but you can't get all wrong. I feel like the director never did much study on Dhaka before making this movie, otherwise why a Director debut with a film which can be called, "The Action of Errors"But having said that, If you love solid breathtaking nonstop action and Chris Hemsworth then this movie is enjoyable none the less. After all, how many of us remember a city from a movie after several months?

reviews.review_title: Nonsensical plot and clearly sends out the wrong message
reviews.content: Let me sum up the theme of this movie in a few words: a drug lord's son gets kidnapped by another drug lord and a mercenary is sent to rescue this kid. The kidnapper apparently controls the entire army, elite forces and police of a nation. If that is not ridiculous enough, the mercenary shoots these trained soldiers down like flies (probably around 100 of them single-handedly). Yep we are supposed to believe these trained individuals cannot shoot straight and are no match for a mercenary. Apparently a nation's defense forces are the villains and we are supposed to sympathise with a mercenary and a drug lord's son!Morale of the story: you can be a hero if you are a mercenary or drug lord's son, no need to sign up for the armed forces because they are just inept. reviews.review_title: The movie is excellent but incorrectly presented Dhaka.
reviews.content: Action Packed but Completely missed the Environment of DhakaThe premise of the movie was supposed to set in Dhaka, a city of 10+ million people in Bangladesh. Unfortunately, they completely missed mark making the set in Dhaka.To start with, the accent of the locals are wrong, they are speaking in an accent that's commonly used in West Bengal, India. Dhaka and People in Bangladesh, in General, have a completely different accent. Throughout the movie, Hindi songs are heard in the background, where everyone is watching tv during midday. People go to work here, Dhaka is the capital, nobody sits on their asses watching TV midday. Bangladesh has its own music industry, although the movie had some issues acquiring copyright for some of the songs to play in the background.The environment is wrong. Sure Dhaka has slums and dirty places, but most of the city is developed enough with an actual nice road system. If they set the scene somewhere else in Bangladesh, it would've been more convincing. The roads are basically dirt roads in this movie where Dhaka has one of the best road systems in the Country. Dhaka doesn't have that kinda dense jungle anywhere near the city, certainly not near the Buriganga river.The criminal class in Bangladesh is completely different.This isn't Africa, people don't employ child soldiers here.And certainly carry Ak-47 in hand and in the open.The Police uniform and looks are completely misjudged.They are trying to portray the elite force of Bangladesh, Known as Rapid Action Battalion. They are not regular police. The deal with counter-terrorism and similar stuff.It should've been the police that deals with criminal or action in the street. Police vehicles are wrong.Don't get me wrong, the entire movie is brilliantly shot and exceptionally action-packed. But this provides a complete misrepresentation of Bangladesh, as well as the city of Dhaka. People who don't have an idea about Bangladesh will get a false sense for a beautiful country by the misrepresented set of this movie.

Hi.I am originally from bd.Inspite of being living in bd i love this movie,the concept was awesome.But it is a matter of sorrow that Bangladesh is not a terrorist country as the show in this movie.Make sure next time about this.and everything was fine for me

It's better to not use a city if you can't show it properly.

reviews.review_title: Do not judge Bangladesh and Dhaka by this Movie
reviews.content:
Considering action and the story with fictional areas, this movie will score definitely 6 or 7 max.
But here it is.1. The language spoken was not native. Not even close to Bengali. People really laughed. Bangladesh is the only nation in the world who fought for the language to establish. So it really matters for Bangladeshis.2.There is no such drug lord. Movie shows that the drug lord has huge power to order POLICE and ARMY. But here is the fault. No where we have seen a small cadre, soldier for drug lord himself. Drug lord should have a trained staff to fight with Chris.3. Under aged people have been used by Drug Lords. Oh! The story had a chance to utilize those under aged in beautiful way.4. Such Drug Lord does not exist. It should be well known to the educated people in the world that South-East Asian (Bangladesh, India and Pakistan) cannot be drug lord because of their environment, history. This sub-continent had been dominated by Afghan, Iranian, Tatar, European.5. The dress is not appropriate. Police, Army, Background color, Transport.6. Words are written incorrectly. 'Army/Police Force' was spelled/written in the arm badge as 'Army/Police Fose'.7. One Indian songs was used well. But others are not appropriate. Because it is drug/action/thriller movie, it does not mean that only hip-hop songs will be used. Sometimes, a slow music creates a rhythm. It is just like the scene where Chris jump from the hill/mountain after relaxation. It was beautiful and enjoyable.8. Where is Bangladeshi Actor? Come On! You have no idea how good they are. Because you do not know any actors does not mean there are no actors. You are going to make a movie in Bangladesh, find the right person.9. Netflix!!!!! Poor choice. If I had to spend such amount, I would have used properly. You have released this movie by doing same manner the Bangladeshi producer does. The producers spend 10% time before making movie, 10% after making movie, 50% in making movie, and remaining time they enjoy their movie-making news in media.All the best.

reviews.review_title: As far as action movies go, Extraction is pretty good.
reviews.content: Extraction is an action movie. It's supposed to have exaggerated close combats, gunfights, explosions etc. The movie is receiving a lot of hate from many reviews, claiming that it does not represent the true culture of Bangladesh. As a Bangladeshi, I beg to differ. As a action story mostly set in Dhaka, the movie accurately portrayed the setting in Dhaka. There's a few minor mistakes however. For example, the Bengali spoken is most that from West Bengal. Bangladeshi spoken Bengali is quite different. There's also a sequence in a jungle near the outskirts of Dhaka, but Dhaka is an urban area and is surrounded by other urban areas.As for the story, there are some plot holes. There's no clear motive that establishes why the kid was kidnapped. It's also ambiguous as to why the kid decided to start Chris Helmsworth's character blindly. There's also some awkward camera angles, but that could be forgiven as a directorial debut. The production design, stunt coordiation and visual effects were superb. Hope to see more movies set in Bangladesh in the future!

Where the hero's violently determined nemesis becomes his sworn to death protector after little more than a nod a handshake? Where the boy falls in love with the hero because he grunts occasionally in his direction & kills many times? It's a list of lazy 13 years olds wet dream cliches wrapped in a smoke haze of action with many other faceless people dying. No humour, no subtext, no subtlety, no surprises. reviews.review_title: Fully Packed with Action , zero story , Misrepresentation of Dhaka/Bangladesh
reviews.content:
The movie has great action scenes inclined to close combat fighting. However, the plot was very much predictable. Only good thing about the movie is Chris Hemsworth.Dhaka and law enforcement agencies(LEA) are not portrayed correctly. Following points will surely misguide the people who doesn't have any idea of Bangladesh:
1. There is no Drug lord in Bangladesh other than a few petty drug dealers. They do not have such authority over the Police, Elite units and military.
2. Police of Bangladesh is a bit corrupted but military is not. Defence forces of Bangladesh may not have nukes but they are highly professional and maintains honesty and integrity.
3. The Bengali accent portrayed in the movie is not correct and does not commensurate with Bangladeshi people.
4. There is no child soldier in Bangladesh the way it is shown in the movie. Bangladesh was shown here like Afghanistan or some war-torn African country.However, the movie is pure entertainment.

reviews.review_title: Good action film that lacks a strong plot

But the movie seemed like it was not only shot in India, but also about India. We don't have anything against our neighbor country - we are just surprised that if the name Dhaka is being used as the plot location, why not representing it properly? There are many popular landmarks in Dhaka but none of them was shown. Honestly I couldn't recognise the city. I felt it lacked dedication and research. On the contrary, even though it missed a strong plot, I enjoyed the action sequences. A good movie if not taken seriously.

reviews.review_title: Toss logic into the bin if you have to watch it.
reviews.content: The Film starts off as a grim suspense. Unsurprisingly, the action sequences are nerve wrecking and at it's finest as that's what Sam Hargrave is known for best. It is his Directorial Debut and it shows. Acting wise, the only one noteworthy according to me is Randeep Hooda. The Film is based on a Graphic Novel 'Cuidad' by Andre Parks which is originally set in Paraguay. Wondering who thought it was a good idea to send a literal 6"3' inches Avenger in the streets of Bangladesh where his only job is to blend in to survive. Like the film falls apart at how shallow the writing is. It goes all over the place. New characters pop up for as long as a minute and then they vanish. I think Extraction is blindly trying a 'Bad Man turned Good Man but with a kid to save' troupe Terminator 2(1991) and Logan(2017) and failing at it. Characters are one dimensional while being projected as being intense which comes off as extremely insincere and pretentious.
Intentionally cretisise a nation,a,city,a culture,a language. I just want to forget that film.

Their could be enough aged people or teenage with knife or at most some hand gun could be fit but not the Heavy weapons. And then the lockdown things could be more dramatic. Like a corrupted army or police guy trying misleading the authority to help a drug lord. But this movie shows that the drug lord is a king of that nation. That was un realistic and ridiculous.I think the director needs more research about the story. But all the others things in this movie must deserve a clap.

The movie was good though the concept was weak. it look it's kind of 2nd grade Indian movie where the team completely ruined Bangladesh and its environment. Bangladesh is not that how the movie represented. The language, the environment, The language accent, the Bengali fonts, song indoor every flatroom was hindi was not same exactly the way the movie shown up. We play indian song its true but not all time. You guys should have studied about Bangladesh and should have made a Bengali team before filming the movie to make more real. This movie is looking like that the hollywood representing only Indian lifestyle where a major part based on this movie in Bangladesh. I know there were most scenes filmed in Ahmedabd, India but it would not be problem to us if you manage the Bengali environment same exactly Bangladesh exists.
You guys absolutely ruined Bangladesh in this movie, it's hurt everyone in Bangladesh.
However, we Bangladeshi's wish to be careful these logical issues next time when you shoot in Bangladesh in other movies.
I was really impressed with the film.it had great movement style, and also kept moving at a speed that wasn't too fast or too slow.enjoyed it . Worth a watch.

A PURE ACTION SEQUENCE
Extraction has a very short story which can be expressed in a line: a young boy is kidnapped; a mercenary is sent out to rescue him.
That boy is Ovi Mahajan (Rudhraksh Jaiswal), the son of a jailed Indian drug lord (Pankaj Tripathi). The one-man rescue operation is Tyler Rake (Chris Hemsworth).Ovi was kidnapped by Amir Asif (Priyanshu Painyuli), Bangladesh's biggest drug lord, who also controls the country's police and military,in Dhaka. Ovi, who lives in Mumbai with his father's underling, Saju (Randeep Hooda) who was in Indian Special Forces before,who knows a team that can bring the boy back to India.Tyler reaches the kidnapper's den: we get a longish violent showdown. Ovi and Tyler manage to escape: we get an even longer action set piece. The climax is expectedly more violent, where all the characters converge with an assortment of weapons.In the worst sceniario when things get complicated,all the world want Tyler to leave Ovi in Dhaka to save himself,he ensures Ovi that he will leave Dhaka only with Ovi though he will not get the money as he does not want to loss another child's life after losing his own child who was died by cancer.From then it was purely action sequence like car chasing in congested areas of Dhaka,fighting with cops,escaping from the guards etc with very limited story line.Based upon rural areas of Dhaka,it shows the effective power of Drug lord on the country's Security forces,Child labour including training them with varieties of heavy weapons from very young age to be extremist.From here on,someone attacks, someone counterattacks, someone monitors and plans.Screenplay by Joe Russo was good though the shots were too yellowish to show the impact of the rurality of Dhaka.When it comes to individual performances,Chris Hemsworth was outstanding at action sequences,dialogue delivering(specially those Bengali word "Proman Dao").The boy(Rudhrash) was equally good in screen but Randep Hooda as Saju was exceptional,his dedication towards the whole screenplay was fabulous,he hardly has left any fault to criticize.However for a pure entertainment and Action sequence adventure,You can surely give it a watch.

reviews.review_title: Poor plot but really good action
reviews.content: Having Indian actors to represent Bangladeshi people in the movie is like having Nigerians or people from some African countries to represent African-American. Come on! First of all, the movie was not shot in Dhaka, Bangladesh. And then, a Bangladeshi army general obeying the command of a drug lord is something that never happened and will never happen. It's alright to show Chris killing a bunch of soldiers in the movie, but an army general in Bangladesh never obeys a drug lord since the army and the government is stable (not like what is portrayed in some Hollywood movies with plots in African countries). It was funny listening to the Indian actors talking in Bangla with Indian/Kolkatan accent. And old hindi songs playing in the alleys is what you'll see in India, not in Bangladesh. Dhaka is the center of the country with a large military base and the prime minister and all government officials residing there. So, Chris carrying out his mission in the center and the heart of the country is unimaginable. Also, crossing the bridge to hand over the kidnapped child seemed to be the main task at the end. It's hilarious that the army could only attack from one end of the bridge, and the other end is open in the center of the city. Stupid plot, but great action.

Firstly, I found no taste of Bangladesh. Then comes the accent. Bangladeshi accent and Indian accent aren't the same. Wrong showcase of police, Bangladesh doesn't have any Elite team, they have RAB which is Rapid Action Battalion. After that Dhaka is densely populated. So when there is a fight in the road in Dhaka city, there should be a big gathering. And Bengali's don't listen to hindi songs in the day, they have works to do. And finally children aren't given Rifles, Shotguns or Pistols in Bangladesh. They mostly got knives with them. In this case you guys should have the casting to some adults who is 17-18+. After all directing and story was good.. I am really disappointed in the Dhaka, Bangladesh fact

Firstly... the accent....It's not ours... This accent is frequently used in west bengal, not in DHAKA, let alone BANGLADESH... we speak in totally different accent... And also...
The movie makers have no idea about the criminals....
Bangladesh is not like Africa... More over.. Child soldiers..! No way.... Not also possible to carry Ak-47 publicly....Also..
Elite forces don't work like this which was shown in the movie...
This movie is a complete mispresentation of BANGLADESH...
If you are looking for action...that's ok...
But the plot was very weak... I can't give more than 4...
IF YOU ARE A BELIEVER OF FIRST COMMENTS. HERE IS ONE. WORST. MOVIE. EVER!

Such violence, corrupt forces, mafia gang and surroundings never go with Bangladesh. It's a small peace-loving beautiful country. What the film is trying to do is spreading negative message and propaganda about Bangladesh.

reviews.review_title: Outstanding performance of Chris Hempsworth and Randeeo Hooda
reviews.content: Great Movie . Hope to have a Sequel... can't wait to watch it again , again and again

I was really hyped about this movie as I knew the movie is about Bangladesh, my country. But after watching the movie, I felt so disappointed. The movie lacks logic. Seriously there is no storyline, no twist. Also, this movie wasn't been able to present the true Dhaka City in front of the world. No one did talk Bengali properly. But I liked Chris Hemsworth's act. He did a great job. Except this, watching this movie is a total waste of time, just like watching a shooting game on YouTube. I'm totally disappointed 😔
